description:
This place is in the heart of Union Square. It's in a great location in San Francisco and there is lots of shopping nearby and things to do. We stopped here for lunch, were greeted as soon as we came in, and were provided menus. The staff were friendly and attentive. I love that all of the items had pictures next to them on the menu so you know exactly what you are ordering. The menu had a large selection of entrees to choose from. We ordered the vegetable noodle soup and the chicken pad thai. 

The food came out quickly and was hot. The portion size of the meals were generous and the food was good. I also like that they have chopped nuts and thai chili's on each table in case you want to add them to your dish.
author: Katrina G.

description:
Oh man...I came here last night and this place is terrible! Dreadful to say the least.

I ordered the pad see ew and in less than 5 minutes, it came to the table. How's that even possible...unless it was already made for someone else. When it arrived on the table, it smelled a bit too charred & burnt. And if you look at the flat rice noodles, it's all chopped up. Looks like the chef gave me all the burnt bits and ends of everybody's cooking pan or something. And the most funny thing thing was they gave me a fork on the plate but I could barely even scoop anything because the noodles were that chopped up. 

I also ordered the pad thai and that dish was good. That dish was piping hot...which leads me to believe the pad see ew was microwaved or something because it was lukewarm. Super unhappy with this place and wouldn't recommend.
author: Victor L.

description:
I should've known not to visit when I saw 3.5 stars, but too frequently little Asian outlets get points docked off for service or cleanliness and so I thought I'd give it a shot anyway since there were also a good number of 4 and 5 star ratings.

It was sadly pretty bad! We had the papaya salad, pad see ew with seafood, and green curry with chicken. 

Papaya salad was alright, but honestly a little too salty, and even though we asked for spicy, it was really mild. The heaviness on the salt and fish sauce took away from the freshness you expect from a cold papaya salad. It was meh.

The pad see ew was reaaaally kind of fishy smelling. I know we asked for seafood but it was a kind of un-fresh seafood stench. I had to turn my face away to spit out a piece of squid because it tasted quite foul. I then went for the fishcake slices because usually those are just from packaged fish cakes, but even those smelled more foul than usual. I picked at it here and there constantly in the hope that it'd taste better but it just got more and more foul.

Finally, green curry, ok! Quite lacking in the signature classic basil-y flavor, I think an instant sauce mix from Whole Foods or Trader Joe's would've been better (I've tried one such option and it was indeed better). Meh meh meh. Not coming back :( 

In contrast, Service was alright though!
author: Su Lin Y.

description:
I am actually really surprised at the lower rating of this place. It's nothing super special but definitely not bad. Maybe I've just been lucky in ordering the right dishes. 
I really enjoy the Pad See Ew, the larb and the tom yum. The curries (yellow and panang) are tasty but the portions aren't super generous, and the quality of the meat in it can be a little touch and go. 
I love that there are chopped peanuts on the condiment tray. I smother everything in them. 
The price isn't bad for the area and the service is perfectly pleasant and VERY quick. Probably not the place for a romantic date or dinner with your boss, but I'm a fan.
author: Poppy C.

description: Good place warm food. Friendly staff. I went looking for hot and sour soup but they didn't have any. I normally use to get fried chicken over fried rice. But I was feeling under the weather.
author: Rey B.

description: When you pass by a hole in the wall with the words "Best Pad See Ew in the USA" painted on the window, you have to stop right?  Well I have to say it was worth the stop. Now who am I to say it is the very best, but I will say it was damn good!  I got it with beef and it was thinly sliced and lean. The flavor was great with the right amount of savory and sweet. I had an accompanying Thai Ice Tea to wash it down which was nice as well. There was a guy sitting next to me that got duck breast over rice that smelled amazing as well. Service was not super but it was extremely fast which is great for a quick lunch break. I'd come here again for sure.
author: Marcus K.

description:
Came in Thursday evening ... pretty busy but quick turn around service .. also tons of menu options.. I asked the server for a recommendation and he said the number 4. 

So YES. Order the combo beef noodle soup. PHENOMENAL ..amazing noodle soup, delicious broth and large portion... almost sharable if you're not too hungry. I was starving so i devoured it! 

Quick, in and out spot. Soooo good, highly recommend.
author: Rebeca M.

description:
King of Thai Noodle isn't much of a king. Not authentic! I had the beef noodle soup, usually called "boat noodle" (#1 on their menu). I suppose that should be what I expected - beef noodles and not the authentic Thai flavors I'm use to. It tasted like a fusion of pho and boat noodle. It didn't taste bad and the service wasn't terrible like the other reviews warned.

Overall, I'm definitely okay with the experience. The price was a little high ($13, compared to $8-$9 at other restaurants for the same thing). A little more noodle than other places, but wouldn't recommend unless I'm in a pinch.
author: Thomas K.

description:
I'm actually giving this place 3.5 stars.

We came here one time as we wanted to grab a quick lunch before we do what we're supposed to do for the day and it served us well. Prices were decent and portions were pretty generous.

I ordered yellow curry with beef while my bf ordered chicken breast over fried rice. Both were good. I didn't, however, like the consistency of the yellow curry as it was watery. It was still tasty though. My order came with papaya salad and that too was delicious.

Customer service was good. They brought our food out very quickly and the staff were also friendly. They hovered around though while we ate so that was pretty uncomfortable. 

Location is pretty convenient as it's adjacent to Union Square/Macy's. Ambiance is loud as it gets pretty busy during the day and the place can feel tight. I do, however, like the wall art of San Francisco and Bay Area teams on their wall so make sure to check that out.

King of Thai Noodle House is one of my boyfriend's favorite hole in the wall in the city and with the decent experience we had during our last visit and despite the 3.5 stars only, I wouldn't mind coming back here for a quick Thai food goodness.
author: Celina A.

description:
I was somewhat hesitant to eat here, considering some of the reviews raised some red flags. But after having a late lunch here with a couple folks, I'll definitely come back.

Service was fast and friendly. The staff were also accommodating of my stroller.

What we ordered:
- Chicken panang curry: There was more than I expected, and the meal came with white rice. The flavor was good, although I wished it had been spicier.
- Fried chicken with rice: Came as expected. 
- Chicken with green beans: Requested extra spicy and got it!
- Beef jerky appetizer: Deliciously seasoned, and the dip provided also had good flavor
- Red wine: As expected
- Thai iced tea: Great flavor, and the perfect amount. Some restaurants add a lot of ice, resulting in not a lot of tea, but it was just the right mix here.

I would definitely come back and try more items on the menu! I'm looking forward to the spicy beef noodle soup :)
author: PaHoua L.

description:
Love-hate restaurant. King of Thai used to be a pretty cheap and enjoyable restaurant that serves your everyday Thai cuisine, but definitely has fallen in taste over the years. It's a great place for a quick Thai food fix, but other than that, nothing too memorable. 

On this particular experience, we ordered Pad Sew Ew (w/ shrimp) and Pad Thai for delivery. Pad Thai was pretty plain in taste and Pad Sew Ew tasted super burnt and dry. No type of flavoring or sauce whatsoever! 

Don't recommend! You can go to other downtown Thai restaurants that are way better.
author: Michelle L.

description:
I have a love hate relationship with King of Thai.  I love it because they carry my favorite soup, but I hate it cause its sooo overpriced and I have a hard time finding it in the city.  Darn you supply and demand.

Pork noodle soup- fav with the thick noods
Papaya salad- no complaints

The rest of the menu looks promising, but I don't steer away from my go to meals.  The restaurant always looks busy, but there's never too long of a wait.  Service is quick.
author: Lyn C.

description: It's been a while since I've been to a King of Thai, but I was so disappointed with the takeout of Pad Kee Mai this time, I'm not sure when I'll return. The noodles were hard, oily, bland. I only finished 1/3 of the $15 dish, and I was hungry. Sadly, KoT isn't the go-to place it used to be.
author: Maggie G.

description:
My boyfriend and I were strolling the streets of SF when we step upon this little Thai restaurant. Restaurant was pretty roomy compared to most restaurants nearby and it was full of staff running around to cater to the customers. There's a bar table area and multiple tables. We were instantly seated as there were tables ready. 

We ordered pad thai and the pineapple fried rice under the chef's special menu. The pad thai was more on the saucier side but wasn't as good as Thai Lover's pad thai from San Jose which is one if my go-to Thai restaurants. If you wanted something more authentic, I wouldn't recommend coming here. As for the pineapple fried rice, I would just skip out on this dish next time. It was close to flavorless and there weren't that many chicken pieces. On the bright side, our food came pretty quick. 

Not sure if this is a fusion restaurant, but the menu included many chinese dishes. Food was mediocre, staff was nice. Probably won't be coming back.
author: Quynh L.

description:
The place to be if you don't care about service quality and just want to get some fast Asian food. 

My go-to's here are the hoi jor, pad Thai, kao gra prow, or the crab fried rice. I used to enjoy the salmon curry until they gave me an order with bones in the fish.
author: Mary R.

description:
Open until 3am that cured our drunken Thai food search last night - so glad we found this place! $13 for each soup, #4 combo beef noodle soup (broth is amazing) and the seafood noodle soup. We both got flat rice noodles. The papaya salad is great and the spicy went well with our soups. (They'll warn you it's really spicy haha) I like that they have a jar of peanuts on the side with other condiments. 

The service is fast and efficient, the food is satisfying and big portions. I would skip the $3.95 Thai iced tea though!
author: Jennifer K.

description:
TL;DR perfect if you want Thai food in DT SF 

I love getting the Pad Thai at King of Thai. It's the same every time, hits the spot, even though it's not the best. They have everything a Pad Thai should have, but there is no wow factor. This KoT is located in DT SF, perfect for a lunch or dinner break from shopping or work. The prices at this KoT is way higher than other Kots. The space is huge, and they can even combine their tables for a large party.
author: Sophia L.

description:
Didn't know what to eat in Chrismas day so a friend recommended me here.

Got here about 2 pm and pretty busy but we didn't wait too long for seats. 

I ordered Pad See Ew with chicken. It was a bit too sweet for me. 
The chicken tasted like overcooked.

Service was quite quick.
Price for dishes is $12-13 each. 

Overall, expensive cost for the Pad See Ew with quality like this. 
Would try other Thai restaurants in town.
author: Naiyun W.

description:
The place has constant traffic. People never stop coming in. We sat down at around 9:15 pm and people were coming in in droves. 

The Thai food came quite rapidly and was rather tasty. If you have a craving for Thai near Union Square, this is the place.
author: Richard L.

description:
We have come here for years since we visit San Francisco once a year.  It's a small place located in Union Square.  We love their duck noodle soup.  It's a rich soup with mild heat so you don't have to fear the spice.  Their other dishes can be somewhat spicy but you can certainly ask them to tone down the heat.  Their rice dishes and curry are flavorful.  We usually get those in medium heat.  

I read some other Yelp reviewers had slow service but we experienced prompt friendly service on a weeknight.  The food came faster than expected.  It felt like we had placed the order only a few minutes earlier when the food arrived.  It's a busy crowded spot without many tables but the night we went I didn't see anyone waiting for service.  The prices are comparable to other restaurants that serve similar fare.
author: Dani S.

description:
Look.  It's SF and you're in Union Square.  You want something fast and moderately priced?  You want take out?  You want Thai noodles or some delicious soup?  

King of Thai is your place.  

There's also some delicious garlic chicken wings on the menu.  One order of that some white rice and I was set.  Oh yeah I got 12 wings in one order.
author: Ray A.

description:
When I'm craving Thai, this is my go to place.

Located in the heart of Downtown SFO near Union Square, this hidden gem has consistent Thai food. This is true whole in the Wall goodness. 

No matter what time of day, this places is usually packed, for good reason. Don't let that keep you away. They know how to get you in and out while still holding to consistency and quality. 

My go to meals are Larb Salad (Your choice of ground chicken, ground pork or ground beef cooked with red or green onions, mint leaves, ground roasted rice, chili and lime dressing served with sliced cabbage.)and Tom Kha Gai (spicy Thai style hot and sour soup with chicken, coconut milk, mushroom, galanga and lemongrass). There Pad Thai Noodle is on key and another on of my favorites.

Pro Tip: you can order half soups, great when you want soup with another meal.
author: Brandon L.

description: This is my absolute favorite place to get Roasted Duck Noodle Soup--- the soup is light but very flavorful. I ran into here by chance after waiting awhile at a restaurant nearby. We weren't expecting much so when we had a bite of their recommended duck noodles, we were truly taken aback. Highly recommend coming here for their noodle soup dishes in combination with the delicious crunchy complementary side jalapenos and peanuts on the table.
author: Connie T.

description: Tired and hungry, we were searching for some noodle houses in San Francisco on a Saturday night.  When we would show up to our destinations we found no parking spots and lines out the door.  We found this gem open late with zero lines and a parking structure nearby.  My friend and I got the Beef combo noodle bowl with thin noodles and we were saved.  A huge steaming bowl of savory broth was brought to our table and we gladly slurped it up.  It's not a fancy restaurant but we were provided fast and attentive service.
author: Nancy T.

description:
I love coming here anytime I'm around Union Square. This place is so consistent with their food, I don't think I ever had a mistake. My favorite thing to order here is their Duck Fried Rice and it's absolutely amazing.

They're very quick and efficient when it comes to ordering and getting our food out. Overall, great place to eat if you're looking for somewhere to grab a quick bite.
author: Robbie P.

description: This was a place my mom and I went to in search of a place that could serve us right away as we were both hungry. It's a busy place but the service was fast and we were seated and served food right away. We ordered a delicious fried rice and pad see ew, which was both enough for the two of us. The waitress always checked up and refilled the water we needed, and the prices were on the high side but the food was worth it.
author: Maricar D.

description:
Horrible Thai food! Not sure if the cooks know what Thai food is. I would give it 0 stars if I could!

The tomyum soup has no spices at all and tastes like chili flavored water. For $12, it has measly slices of rock hard chicken slices and dried mushroom

The pad Thai is edible

Do yourselves a favor and avoid this joint
author: Shi Loong Y.

description: Says open till 2am.  Ubered out here at 1am.  Closing up.   Asked them about their hours, got very rude responses.
author: Marcus T.

description:
Let me set the scene for you. Beautiful day at Dolores celebrating 4/20's lesser known and underappreciated sister holiday, 4/21. After a peace-filled 4 hours we set out on a trek for foos with one goal in mind...Cheesecake Factory. One person in my group wants to show another person (who's visiting from Los Angeles) the view of Union Square from the balcony  and I don't blame him. So we get there and they tell us hour and fifteen minute wait and we're like, "...nah", so we walk over to the nearest place that looks decent on Yelp and thus, King of Thai Noodle House!
We sit, order some pad see ew, fried chicken fried rice, yellow curry (holy crap so good). 
"Shit s mad srumptious"
-my friend, about 50% through our meal.
This place is excellent and convenient in that its near Union Squre but not super pricy and quick to seat. Our servers were perfectly curteous. Listen, you know what you're getting when you walk into this place, and this place even surprises a bit past that, enjoy!
author: Andrew P.

description:
An average place, but bonus star for its clutch location and late night hours.

When its a Friday, what else is there to do but drink with friends? And when its been a long week (which it was), you want to get started on that asap. In these situations, something tends to get lost in translation-- namely, food.

So that's how I ended up, at midnight, hungry af. Since I was staying at the Mark Hopkins, and my friend lived in SoMa, we opted to take the BART back to Powell and then look for food. Hence, the clutch location.

Arriving, it seemed we were at the tail end of the late night diners. We were promptly seated and opted to order the crab fried rice and rad na. Even in my inebriated state, the rad na was nothing to write home about. However, the crab fried rice was dope-- you can actually taste the crab in the dish.

The restaurant itself is nothing special and to be honest, a little run down. However, fancy places don't matter if they're far away and closed, so King of Thai Noodle House, I'll be forever grateful.
author: Angela C.

description:
Is there anything lower than one star? 
I ordered from UberEats. There was A LONG BLACK HAIR in the pineapple rice. It wasnt even on top, it was weaved in the middle!! I have blonde hair and my boyfriends is short black. I was so disgusted and disappointed. Never buying food from there.
author: Blanca J.

description:
I was in the city for day this week. Was craving Thai noodles while walking around market and 5th. Found this place.. 

The good:
even though it was busy I got my food right away. I ordered Drunken Noodles. And a beer. My food was excellent. The flavor, the texture, it was spicy with out melting my mouth.. the beer was cold.. nice and cold.. the price was not bad for bing so delicious. $13.99 for a plate of noodles. 

The Bad:
The staff hovers.. like stands next to me looking up or off to the other side of the restaurant, but as soon as the last bite of food was transferred from the fork to my mouth my plate was picked up and the check was laid in front of me. Kinda felt rushed. I had asked for peanut sauce after I got my food and I was informed it would be $4.50 for a small side of peanut sauce. That is way way way too much $ for a little plastic cup of peanut sauce, it normally is free.. also the bathroom was filthy. 

But I did not go here to eat peanut sauce and use the bathroom. I ate here to get some noodles! And they were good.
author: Steven S.

description: Impressed: This place was pretty good. There was a non-stop flow of people coming in and going out even after 9:30 pm.  Walking up to the front door, lines of people waiting, it looked like your average hole-in-the-wall that was going to offer great food at a really reasonable price.  The prices were a bit more than I would expect, but the flavors were so worth it! Each dish was u pique as one should expect.  The papa salad was good.  The Beef Noodle soup had some nice layers of flavor too. The staff was fast and friendly.  Not the most attentive to checking in on how my meal was, but they were quick, so that made it worth it!
author: Kevin H.

description:
First of all, I ordered my takeout to have two cokes and a Thai iced tea which they did not remember to give me. They all me money for because never got them.

Second of all, I asked for chicken with my pad Thai and they gave me shrimp instead. I'm allergic to shellfish and it's not like I can simply pick off the shrimp and continue to eat it.

Third of all they forgot to give me any of the orange sauce whatsoever with my fried chicken.

Fourth of all they didn't give me any napkins or silverware. I had to get my own out of the kitchen.

And lastly, now they're not answering the phone when I call them. It goes straight to a dead line.

This place feels like it's run by a bunch of monkeys. If the owner of this restaurant is reading this right now, do yourself a favor and fire your night shift manager clearly they are running a shit show. You are going to lose mine and my friends business permanently because because clearly you are not running a business, you are running a monkey business.
author: Miguel M.

description:
The three of us ordered a papaya salad, pad thai with shrimp, pad kee mao with chicken, and pad see ew with calamari. 

The papaya salad was very refreshing and the dressing was well balanced between sweet and tangy. 

Pad thai was the best of the three noodle dishes. The noodles were thinner than those in other Thai restaurants but had a nice texture. They didn't go too heavy on the tamarind sauce so it was light but very flavorful. 

Kee mao and see ew were both decent but the noodles weren't as fresh as they were in my previous visits. 

Service got off to a slow start, although after we placed the order, the food came out quickly. Wait staff was not super attentive so it took some time getting water refill and the check.
author: Mark D.

description: Love stopping here when I'm in town. Today I ordered the beef Thai rice, & Gaelic chicken (off menu) with veggies. The rice was made extra Thai spicy just like I asked. It was exquisite !! I loved that they did as I asked and put no soy sauce on my rice yet it was still very tasty. Also not soggy. Overall will definitely return again, & again. Lol.
author: Nelys'ia B.

description: I love this place.Whether you want a quick lunch or your with your friends, I would recommend this place. It does get busy during lunch time, so be patient, but there is a reason for that. Quite a lot of options. The service is quick. I'm a fan of pretty much everything. Love it!
author: Olive R.

description:
I grew up seeing long lines out the door for King of Thai Noodle House.  However, after trying it for the first time this week, I'm not as impressed with the dishes.  

I ordered the Chicken Pumpkin curry, with already lower expectations compared to other Thai restaurants in the area.  It was super soupy!  I definitely think they skim on the coconut milk or whatever is needed to make the curry with actual curry consistency.  Meh.  The curry also comes with bell peppers, which if I had known that was going to be there, I wouldn't have ordered this dish!  Menu isn't so clear for take-out, so I would stick with general American thai favorites if this is your first time eating here.

I've heard people do like the pad see ew, and while it does look tasty, I still think prices are steeper for what they provide.  I think cleanliness in a restaurant is really important, especially after reading some reviews of people getting food poisoning.  And to clear the air, I did not get any food poisoning but would still feel more at ease if the restaurant wasn't so grungy!
author: Jana L.

description:
This is a great place to go when you are visiting union square. It's right next to Macy's. The prices have gone up a bit and now they are completive to the surrounding restaurants. Soon as you walk in someone is there to greet you and seat you. It can be busy at time, but they have plenty of bar seats and in back. The noodle soup dishes are the best deal. There is plenty to share too. I've been here twice and it's been busy, but not packed both times. It beats trying to squeeze the Cheese Cake Factory. There the wait is hours long. 

This is a good alternative if you aren't looking for a view and all you want is a quick and easy meal.
author: Melissa S.

description: Fast, but burnt. Came in late at 1am. Take out only, that's okay. Took less than 5 min to serve. Came back to hotel room to find the chicken and eggs were visibly charcoalized. Everything from the vegetables to noodles tasted horribly burnt. Had to decide between staying hungry and eating burnt food. Terrible experience
author: Chang W.

description:
My hotel was a 5 minute walk from this restaurant so after a long day of sightseeing, my family and I decided to have dinner nearby our hotel and this was one of the recommendations! My mom specifically wanted noodle soup and luckily King of Thai provides this along with many other signature thai dishes. 

It was getting crowded at the time we came and luckily there was a table available for us. The price is around $10 to $15 per dish which was amazing! My mom and brother each got noodle soups while I ordered my go to thai dish (chicken pad see ew, yeah!) and roasted duck rice plate for my boyfriend. The food came out very quick and we were all munching down within seconds of receiving it. I had my fair share of pad see ew from many Thai restaurants and after devouring my dish, I am not exaggerating when I say it has to be one of the best pad see ew dishes I ever had. Everyone else is also satisfied with their food and from my perspective, all the portions are the perfect size for each person. I highly recommend stopping by!
author: Heather L.

description:
Stop by for lunch. I got Panang curry chicken. It was bad. Curry has no flavor. It was like curry past and water mixed with chicken. 
Do not expect good service here. Server only came to take order and put the check in the table. #ThaiFastFood
author: Yo Yo Y.

description: Stumbled across this place....underwhelmed. The Pad Thai was just OK (very mushy). The papaya salad was not sweet at all, but rather only spicy hot. The chicken coconut soup was basically 90% broth, a few mushrooms and small pieces of chicken. The food came out within ~5 minutes of ordering, which might sound amazing but worried us a little when at a restaurant and not a fast food place! The papaya salad was ordered as an app but arrived with our meals.
author: Rob M.

description:
I've been here a few times when staying down town and wanting a quick bite.  I find the food rather average Thai.  My pad see ew needed more flavor and chicken.  For $14 it shouldn't be nearly all noodles.  My wife also had undercooked chicken in her dish previously. I've yet to try something here that deserves to be recognized.

It's clean and nice inside the restaurant and staff is attentive.
author: Evan G.

description: This place was good! Ordered the pad see ew, which was decent. The place Was easy to find and convenient. The service is really fast, so it's good for a quick bite.
author: Sarah P.

description:
It is my third time visit King of That noodle, I was there exactly a year ago. And nothing has changed, same nice staffs and menu items.
                  Customer services: I have no complaint, they always have nice smile and friendly attitudes. Last time I brought two of my cousins both less than 7 years old, the first great impression that they gave me was their staffs' thoughtfulness, it was a busy lunch time but they noticeded it then served me ice waters with Togo cup covered and straws, extra utensils that for kids.
                   Food: We ordered Crab fried rice, Shrimp Pad keep Mao stir fried flat rice noodle, Combination beef noodle soup, and pumkim curry. All of them are pretty good and we finished completely!  But if you are not into spicy food please make sure to ask if it's possibler to non spicy or not. Because one of my friend she ordered the pumkim curry but didn't know it is spicy so she ended up drinking a big bottle of ice waters, haha.
                   Parking spot are extremely limited, we literally just walked there and parked the car freaking far away instead.
author: Weng C.

description: I went in without seeing the Yelp review. I had a pad Thai and a curry rice and it was really on point. Got the veggie options on both and the tofu was really well done.
author: Alok M.

description:
I miss Bangkok Thai. I only started coming here because the hole in the wall across from Uniqlo closed.  Everything here is... okay.  I find the prices really high for what it is. Entrees and noodle dishes are $12-13 each. Even though it's downtown SF, there are places around that's cheaper that serves the same quality of food. 

There's a number of seating inside. Tables are fairly small and there's generally a crowd outside the door waiting for a table. I usually get the Pad Thai or duck fried rice and a Thai iced tea. Their Thai tea isn't overly sweet which is nice. It's alright for Thai food near Union Square but it's nothing to write home about.
author: Judy H.

description: It's Ok at best. The Panang Curry was not good. A little like watered down peanut butter with a bit of coconut milk. The Tom Yum Gai soup was goodish... service was good though...
author: T N.

description: Great place to eat after watching a Musical!! Open late and the clear broth soup is better than the Beef broth ones.  Our whole group agreed but that's our opinion. Otherwise the soup is very flavorful and good serving size, perfect for cold nights.  Thai Ice Tea was delicious. Fast service.
author: Diane L.

description:
When it comes to Thai food, San Francisco (and the entire Bay Area has you covered). And when I saw that "King Of Thai Noodle House" had well over 1,000 reviews, I knew this place had been covered by a ton of Yelpers, both from the area and those who are just visiting the city. To be honest, I was somewhat skeptical that many of my Yelp friends gave this place 3-stars. That, and this was in the heart of Union Square (aka a tourist trap).

Located directly on the corner of O'Farrell St. & Powell St., "King of Thai Noodle House" has to be in one of (if not) the most busiest areas of San Francisco. It surrounds a ton of major retailers, food establishments, and hotels. Parking here is virtually non-existent. However, there are numerous ways to get here via-public transportation including Muni, Bart, taxi, Uber, Lyft, bicycle, or by foot.

I came here on a whim with my lovely lady on a rainy Sunday afternoon in mid-April around 12:30pm. Reason being is that the brunch spot I went to prior to coming here didn't completely fill me up and I was still hungry. Fortunately with as busy as it was, we were both seated immediately. Keep in mind, this place does get packed! The inside is very no-frills so if you're expecting a fine dining Thai experience, I would recommend looking elsewhere. The entire restaurant has dark wooded pub-styled chairs as well as a back area for overflow seating. 

Once seated, we were given menus and two iced waters. Since my lady was still full from eating brunch, I was the only one that ordered food here. I went with one of my favorite Thai dishes, their "Pad-See Ew" (which was around $11.50). This dish offers stir fried flat rice noodles with eggs, and Chinese broccoli in sweet black soy sauce. I chose chicken as my meat of choice.

As I mentioned, this place was very busy. Surprisingly, my entree was brought out to me in just under 10 minutes. My Pad-See Ew was delivered piping hot and the portion itself was very generous. Taste wise, I was very impressed with the overall flavor. Not too sweet and not too salty. They also didn't skimp on the seasoned chicken as this meal was so huge, my lady helped me finish eating the entire plate.

Its hard to give a true honest rating considering I only ate one item off their menu. But as I glanced at some of the neighboring tables as well as photos that many of my Yelp buddies posted, this food (for it being in a touristy area) was pretty decent. Service was above average, prices were very fair for this place being in Union Square, and the overall quality of the food itself met my expectations. My overall rating for "King of Thai Noodle House", a solid four stars.
author: Donovan H.

description: Late night deliciousness. I had the BBQ fried rice. My husband had the buck noodle soup. Wow what flavor.
author: Charina C.

description:
This place is perfect for 1) Late night: After some moderate alcohol consumption, a bowl of beef noodles can't go wrong! 2) Shopping around Union Square: The place is located near the back side of Macy's and if no more walking can be done, One can stop by here to get rejuvenated. 

The service is pretty fast for both dine in and takeout. The reason this place is getting a 3-star is purely based on how many Thai restaurants this neighborhood has. If you don't mind walking around a bit more, there are other choices available. 

My go-tos are either Combination Beef Noodle Soup or Pad See Ew. My friend ordered Tom Kha Gai (Coconut/ lemongrass soup with noodles), which I tried and was pretty good. The menu has a large selection of dishes that should satisfy everyone.
author: Alice L.

description:
Right when we checked-in to our hotel, I was starving.  This place was close by to where we were staying and it was open late.

Everything was starting out great.  We were seated right away and our initial waitress was very helpful to us when we had questions in regards to their menu.

Hoi Jor: I liked this but it might have been the hunger talking.  Nice and crispy bean curd wrapping around a bundle of meat.  
Pad Thai: I don't know what the hell was going on but I ordered this dish before a bunch of other people came in sat down and people who recently placed their to-go orders and they still got their damn food before me!  My bf got this curry dish 15 minutes before I even got my dish.  We complained to another waitress but she didn't seemed like she cared.  She said she would check on it but I didn't see her do that.  Liar.  The dish itself wasn't great.  Barely any flavor.  Noodles were very soft and mushy.
Pad See Ewe:  This dish is the reason I didn't give this place 1 star.  Right ratio of meat and noodles.  Noodles were cooked beautifully.  Sauce was delicious and salty.  

You really do take a gamble with the services here.  Our first waitress that we encountered was good but the one I complained about not having my pad thai was rude.  I can't justify coming back here unless it's a to-go order but it was very convenient that it opens late.
author: Jackie N.

description:
Vegetarian noodle soup and egg rolls. Meh.  I was happy that they had veggie egg rolls but they were a little mushy.  The noodle soup had no interesting flavor. And I'm not 100% convinced there wasnt some sort of fish oil/flavor in it.  

It wasn't the cleanest place.  Spoons and chopsticks are left on the table for all to touch.  The first spoon I picked up had some serious residue. 

The service was good though.  She was attentive and smiling. 

Location is the real thing this place has going for it.  And late night!  Open until 3am.
author: Heather B.

description:
my go-to thai takeout place when staying in union square. you can order online, so it's convenient. and literally just a block down and around the corner from the main square.

i always get the pad kee mao with chicken. occasionally i'll decide to be adventurous and switch it up to pork or shrimp. but each time it's consistently decent - satisfies my thai cravings, but nothing to write home about either. provides some spice, but when choosing "very spicy" it leaves something to be desired.

there's actually a whole bunch of amazing thai restaurants west of union square - about a 10 min walk away (uphill), deeper in the tendernob area. but for lazy people (like me) or busy people (also like me), the proximity and convenience of king of thai noodle house can't be beat!
author: Yiwen S.

description:
Ambience: It's ok. Not super good. 
Order and quantity: we ordered Vegetarian. Basil fried rice, drunken noodles, tofu red curry. And the quantity was good. Plenty for one person. If you get two dishes you can share with 3 ppl. 
Service: flash speed. 
Location: in SF. Opposite to ofarrel parking garage. Easy to find. 
Parking: street or paid building parking. 
Price: nominal. 
Restroom: not clean, found bugs  and all. 

Over all food tasted great.
author: Sayed A.

description: This place used to have exceptional food, for cheap, and be fast. The food really did not taste good this time. They changed the recipes or something because all of the sauces are soupy and have very little flavor. The vegetables used were not too hot either. We will not be back.
author: Andrew C.

description:
5 star because of their thai seafood fried rice!! This is my second time coming back here... the first time im with my co
Worker and my second time last two days ago im with my husband and he loves what i recommend for our dinner  might coming back next month
author: Vanessa D.

description: After a night out my friends and I were craving Thai food (bit of an odd craving) so when we found out these guys were open till 3am we were over the moon. When we got here it was a bit dead but as soon as the bars nearby started to close, they were packed. I ordered the Thai green chicken curry - it was good. Not amazing but decent food for so late at night - I'll be back.
author: Mira B.

description: The BBQ'd pork in the soup was old...grey in the middle and smelled bad. This is the first time I have had bad food here. I'll change my review to one star if I end up getting sick. Not worth ever going back.
author: C T.

description: If I could give this place ZERO stars, I would! First & last time coming here, I heard about how good the food was and decided to give it a try. I ordered the Pad See Ew, tasted like it was drenched in nothing but sweet soy sauce & HAIR. Yes, I said HAIR! Will not be coming back & I will not recommend this place to anyone!
author: Jan P.

description: Loved the roasted duck noodle soup. Flavorful and tastes unique. Definitely cannot find a similar taste near home. Roasted duck over rice was not as great, but the duck is consistently good here.  Food came out quickly. Soup not quite hot, but still loved it. Would definitely come back!
author: Linda T.

description:
"Meh" 
Vegetarian pad thai and the vegetarian soup were served hot with good portions, no complaints! BUT if you are looking for that amazing Thai spice and peanut sauce flavor goodness, it just wasn't there. 

We would go again, fun spot, people watching etc but not amazing flavors at all.
author: Stylishshopper ..

description:
Was just watching a comedian talk about us Yelpers.  His monolog was about how we should be able to just get over one bad meal and move on.  Umm, sorry, can't do it I'm a Yelper.

Won't return to King of Thai Noodle House.  Was a fail in all categories, food, service, apparent cleanliness.  

Was seated right away.  My server came in about five minutes and took my order for an Anchor Steam beer, chicken larb and an order of fried spring rolls.  Good, so far.

That was the last I ever saw my server in a useful capacity.  I saw her wandering around and messing with her mobile but not working.  After about 30 minutes I flagged down another server who checked on my order and I finally ended up with food about 10 minutes later.

The fried spring rolls were tasty.  The dipping sauce was likely from a bottle but added a nice sweetness.

The chicken larb had some complex flavors but a definite undertone of 'off' chicken, argh!  Only took a couple of bites.  When the new server cleared my plate she didn't comment at all about the fact my dish was virtually untouched.  That was a wasted $13.00.  

I visited the restroom on the way out and there were small bugs hanging out with me during my visit.  The general cleanliness of the restroom wasn't great.  No plans to return to this restaurant.  Too bad since it's a super location.
author: Jeanne T.

description:
I'm 8months pregnant! Coming today for lunch at 11:57am. I was by myself after my Doctor. The hostess direct me to sit at the high top table and I told hostess that I'm pregnant (My leg didn't feel well from the fall a week prior) so I asked if it's okay I sit at a regular table. There was still six tables left at that time. She gave me a very mean glance and sat me down at a table. Was planning to leave but I was craving for it for a while so I decided not to let her ruin my lunch. I kinda regret tho! 
Around 12:05 I flagged down a waiter to take my order cause I kinda felt they might be getting busy so if I finish fast maybe they can give my table to another party. 
Food came fast. Got my food at 12:10pm During my meal, the hostess just put the water down without any words, then during towards end of the meal she was all smiling asking the table next to mine if everything was good but completely ignore me. 
I finished my meal at 12:20pm and trying to get a check. Again, the hostess came to me and just grabbed the check without saying thank you nor anything. Yet she was all smiling again towards others with nice attitude. 
First, I didn't give her any attitude but just request nicely if it's okay if I could get a regular table since I'm 8m pregnant. Second, it only took me ten minutes to finish my meal, or I'll have to say I try to rush myself to finish my meal so they can get more business. This is ridiculous how the hostess are treating single person customer compare to larger group of customers. 
 
I work as server myself too. I could totally understand how frustrating it is when it's lunch time and trying to get more turnover on the table. It took me less than half an hour to stay at the restaurant and when I leave they still had two same size table left. It doesn't make any excuse for the attitude she provides.

Food overall I'll still have to say I love it so I gave one star just for the quality of food.
author: TTrraaccYY H.

description: Solid Thai food for the price. I tried their fried rice and pad see ew. The fried rice was amazing. Not too oily. But the pad see ew was a bit too sweet for me. It's right in downtown which is pretty convenient. Also there was no wait :)
author: Amanda F.

description:
Expensive.  1 rice dish and 1 Thai Iced Tea and I'm dishing out over $20.
That being said they are consistent with the quality of food they bring, and the dishes they make, and since they also stay open late at night, you can understand why this place is almost an institution in San Francisco.  My favorite dish is the garlic and pepper chicken with cilantro over rice.
author: Maus M.

description:
Not worth it!! Just went there last weekend. Omg! I won't go back there for sure. Well, my fiancé and I had been walking and shopping on that street, so we thought just gave that Thai restaurant a try since we never went there before. I opened the door, well! smell nice, however, the hostess though her face didn't give you a friendly sign of welcoming. She was kinda "I work hard" and no time to smile or even say hello to you. I didn't mean to be unkind here, but that was I experienced it. 

I thought okay I would sit down and check out the menu before I would make a further decision. We sat down and looked at the menu discussing what should we order then some people that came after us sat down next to our table, but they got asked to order first, at that point I thought why they didn't ask us, so we're trying to make eye contact, both my fiancé and I, but nobody was looking at us just walked by. I looked around and other people that trying to make eye contact with them as well. We waited and waited until we made a decision that we will walk out and we're sure we would never go back there. 

Overall, unfriendly staff--specially an elder woman hostess! It's so wrong to have an unfriendly person to welcome customers in--never a good idea! Obviously, I didn't know the tastes of their food, but there are million of Thai restaurants out there around SF. Anyway, I ended up went to Zen Yai Thai Restaurant instead and it was delicious. People there were super friendly and great food. They came to you and ask, you never have to look for them--this was a great restaurant, not this one!
author: Rattikarn W.

description: Fake Thai dishes. I went there with my Thai friend, she was very disappointed. It is overpriced and the taste is not that good.
author: Nam N.

description:
If you're a tourist, pass on this place. There's more "SF unique" restaurants to try during your stay :) If you work around the area, I think it's a decent Thai option.

The workers are sweet, albeit a bit disorganized. Otherwise very straightforward and quick dine-in or togo experience.

I've had King of Thai multiple times over my last 4 years here. It's a reliable option for most dishes, especially their curries and stir fried noodle dishes (all the classics like pad thai and pad see ew are great, and will feed 2 or serve as multiple meals). 

Unfortunately, I advise against the soups. We ordered a Tom Kha Gai ($13) and it was a huge disappointment. If I paid $5 tops, it would have been fine. Lackluster broth, barely any chicken, and old white mushrooms.

Other locations, such as the Richmond are better than this one.
author: Jacquelyn T.

description:
TL;DR: Okay Thai food in Union Square. Prices are about $5 more than normal Thai places outside of the city.

Not knowing what to eat on our last night in San Francisco we decided to try out some Thai food. King of Thai Noodle House happened to be close to our hotel, and in a central location in Union Square. The shop itself is pretty small and you could easily pass by and not even know that it is there.

Inside you will find that they have many tables and workers. They seemed to be buzzing around trying to get everyone's orders, refills and checks. Like usual, the wife ordered the Pad Thai and I went with Pad See Ew. The food was brought out quick, and hot. My Pad See Ew was above average, but had a weird sweetness to it that I was not able to get my mind around. Overall, not bad, I've had way worst Pad See Ew's. The wife's Pad Thai could be summarized in the same way as the Pad See Ew.

It will not wow you. Parking is probably horrible to find.
author: Johnny M.

description: Not much interaction with the staff but the food is amazing. I had the pad see eew and tried the duck fried rice which was absolutely flavorful. There wasn't much of a wait and we got our food very quickly. I want to go back to try their fried banana and ice cream. The look of the place is modern and nice looking. And my stomach didn't hurt after eating here haha. I want to come back to try different dishes.
author: Justin T.

description:
This place has really gone down hill. I remember coming here a few years ago after shopping and it was a quick but decent bite and it was pretty cheap. 

I went last week and it was like $14 for a horrible pad Thai. The friend that I went with ordered a pad Thai that they put way too much sugar in and nothing else there wasn't enough sauce and they used to put shrimp in there and now it's like 2 pieces of rubbery chicken. 

I would rather go to Chabaa or literally anywhere else for a quick sit down place downtown. Am definitely not coming back here.
author: Crystal C.

description: Went there to have lunch after a nice morning in the Union Square. Small, quick and clean place just a short walk from the Union Sq. Ordered vegetarian dishes that was pretty yummy and full of flavor. Budget friendly - was under $30 for 2 people. Recommended
author: Deven S.

description:
workers were very nice. we were party of six and seat right away.

four of us ordered the beef noodle soup, thai version call it boat noodles. though the broth looked flavorful i felt it taste more of an herb broth (ex tea) instead of a beef bone broth. we all did not finish it. ordered the fried eggrolls and it wasnt much flavor either.
author: Lisa V.

description:
I would say that this is the same Thai tastes as noodles that you will get from Thailand. 

it comes with big portions especially noodles, so for small stomach probably can have 2 people share together.
author: Seth L.

description: This place saved my family and myself from hunger, lol.  The food was great, no complain about it.  We were there for late lunch and we were seated in about 2 minutes.  They do not validate parking at the Union Square.
author: Open S.

description:
Pros: This should be your go to dining spot if you're super hungry and tired after a long day of shopping. The service is attentive with seating you quickly and food arrives ridiculously fast. I've been here twice and got seated upstairs for a large party and the service is fine. They have a person up there to keep watch if you need anything. Portion size and price is pretty decent considering it is located in the heart of downtown toursity shopping area. 

Cons: Don't expect to find street parking around the area but plenty of parking garages nearby. Don't expect anything fancy here, just a basic addition to the restaurant chain.

Ordered: Shrimp Pad Thai ($10), Pad See Ew ($9.50)

Would I recommend: Yes, easy and fast place to go to if you're tired from a long day of shopping and want a quick hot good quality meal. Not a must try if you're a tourist.
author: Terry N.

description:
If you're looking for authentic Thai food or even great tasting Thai food this isn't the place. The food
isn't as fresh and tasty as Thai food should be. The waitresses could be nice or mean depending on the day and their mood. The only good thing about this place is that it's open late night.
author: Imani M.

description: We ordered our standard items : beef pad see ew and green papaya salad. Both were very tasty. Service was fast. I'd eat here again. We walked over from SFMOMA
author: Betty M.

description:
I visited the restaurant on NYE for lunch with a group of 8. Luckily, we arrived right after a large group and got seated very quickly. 

I ordered a spicy egg plant with beef. This was really tasty, and I wished I had a bit more basil.

Other plates ordered - fried chicken fried rice, bbq pork fried rice, pad Thai with chicken, pad kee mao with chicken, and wonton noodle soup. 

All the dishes were delicious and well-portioned!
author: Jenny N.

description:
Company of 2 visited on 12/27/2018 during lunch hour. Apparently, they were out of several vegetables (for example: tomatoes, cucumber, galangal, etc). Worse is, the waitress never told us this when we were ordering so we thought our dishes would come with all ingredients per the menu. I had to ask twice to finally get some vegetables on my plate (it was supposed to have cucumber). Chicken was dry and the Tom Kha soup was not very good as a consequence of half of the ingredients missing.

Poor service and expensive. I am not coming back.
author: Erik E.

description:
I Pho NOT.  $13 Union Sq #4 sadness, $14.11w/tax. 

No Basil & Dirty Dark Muddy Broth -- tastes very different compared to all other Pho I've had, though in OR, they are authentic recipes from Vietnamese family restaurants. No fresh basil, lime, jalapenos, or sprouts to add.  Instead a single wire thin piece of chinese bok choy (or Morning Glory? Waitress couldn't explain that either) and chopped stems akin to celery??!! The beansprouts are of course already cooked in your broth. Absent of 5-spice clearer broth I craved.

Boiled meat--normally piled in bowl where hot broth cooks the meat.  This comes pre-boiled with all flavor and tenderness shriveled away. 3 flavorless Meatballs subjected to I guess another long boil.  Stewed beef is exactly that minus the flavor.

Noodles--tons of your preferred rice noodle hit the bowl -- thick, thin, vermicelli, but what's the point with the nasty mud bath.

Staff are young and nice, and my waitress got by in English and provided good service.

More than disappointing on a chilly, breezy 9pm evening in July, in search of a hot comforting bowl...a losing ticket here, take your earned $ elsewhere!
author: Lu L.

description: Can't ever go wrong with this restaurant. I've been coming here for as long as I can remember. The pad see ew is something I always used to order. Really good. I also love the rad nar. It's kind of similar to the pad see ew but more saucey and wet. But I'm sure anything you order here will be good.
author: Annie H.

description:
This place had pretty tasty food. Quite a big menu to select from. It's definitely more of a casual spot. 

For a yummy, quick and/or late night bite to eat, this place will certainly do the trick!
author: Ashleigh F.

description: IF I CAN GIVE A 0 TO THIS RESTAURANT, I WILL. I called to order for pickup and the server who picked up the phone was very very rude. She immediately accused me of something I never did. She told me, and i quote, "i remember you, you once ordered and never picked up." I NEVER EVEN ORDERED FROM THIS RESTAURANT BEFORE. Very offensive. Very rude. You just lost a customer. I would never order from this restaurant ever.
author: Carina W.

description:
My colleagues were raving about this place and while i usually try my hardest to avoid the tourist traps of Union Square I went along for lunch. 

Clean and open seating with minimal decor. Don't take someone here that you are trying to impress. I ordered the stir fried veggies and tofu in bail sauce - very tasty. I loved it!! 

The crispy chicken and duck were subpar especially for those two being their most famous dishes. Chicken was  overcooked and dry while duck was not crispy. 

Would stick to the rice plates, noodles, and soups!

The fried banana dessert was not worth it at all. It tasted like leftovers from a carnival stand! Would avoid that dish but the coconut ice cream was great. 

I wold go back again if i was in the area, i did enjoy my meal but for the price I could choose so many other Thai restaurants in San Francisco with better food and ambiance. Lots of hype for this place but I personally wouldn't say it's a must try.
author: Samyutha R.

description:
Staying at the Hilton on this trip to San Francisco and was craving for Pad Thai. This place was one of the ones with the most reviews in our area so I decided to go for it and ordered a vegetarian pad Thai for takeaway. 

I can't really say that it was bad, nor can I say that it was good. Hence the three stars. Service was good nevertheless and they didn't skimp on the good stuff (veggies, tofu, egg.) All of that for $11.00 + 2.00 for the bag.
author: Jordan K.

description: Solid food, very surprised how good it was. Also, came 2 minutes before closing and they were happy to have me. Recommend.
author: Luke W.

description: Pad Thai is my favorite , but this restaurant pad Thai just so so ,but the Thai seafood fried rice is very delicious.
author: Bella S.

description:
I ordered noodle soup with a variety of beef cuts n slices. So affordable (at $13) yet so flavorful.
Plus, they open late.
author: Jay V.

description: I came here a little more than a week ago and was quite pleased with the quickness of the service. We came in a group of about 12 and only had to wait about 20 mins before we were seated. Having no reservation before, this was great for us! I ended up ordering the panang curry with chicken and chicken satay which I split with another friend. Special shoutout to the chicken satay as the meat was very juicy and tender - would definitely order again! The panang curry was also flavorful and the taste was just right. I would definitely go back here for Thai food again!
author: Prasiddha H.

description: Came in to order take out and the service was really quick! My order was ready in 10 minutes! I ordered pad see ew with tofu and it had a pretty nice flavor. The tofu had a nice chewy texture and it wasn't overly spicy. If you're looking for a place to eat on Taraval that is reasonably priced (especially for the Bay Area), I'd check this place out!
author: Gina V.

description: Chill, unassuming vibe. Very attentive service. Great food (the tom ka gai - wonderful!). Highly recommend for great food with no pomp or circumstance.
author: Rick D.

description: Soooooooo bomb! Everything we ordered was so delicious!  Quick service, will def be back for more!
author: Bee A.

description:
I'd say this spot is good for 2 things, late night after drinking grub and for the shopping hunger pains. Service was decent and what you'd expect at 2:15 AM. Placed order, got the water/food within 5 minutes and got the bill. 

The beef noodle soup had a good broth and decent portion but not a lot of stewed beef for $11.50. Most of the pieces were fatty tendon. But it does the job. 

There isn't much else that I can say about it. But it wouldn't be my first choice for Thai food in the area.
author: James H.

description:
This restaurant has been here for years! My default place to eat whenver I go shopping in Union Square. Prices has increased over the years but this chain restaurant in SF is still good. Located next to Macy's and it makes for a convenient locations to just relax and eat.

My recommendations are the Fried Chicken over Fried Rice and Pad See Ew.
author: Winnie T.

description:
I have been to this place zillion times and they have a full range menu from phos to Rice and noodles to standard Thai dishes .. Everything! 

I love their Pad-see-ew, garlic chicken and rice from specials , fried rice , pho GA. But most of their items are good.

The service is quick and food is tasty and prices are cheap, what else do you want. It's not a fancy place but definitely something you should try if you like thai food and you are in the city. 

This place is open till late, so go on , party hard and on your way back , stop at this place for dinner , you will not be disappointed..not at all!
author: Ramyata M.

description:
Not one of the better KOTN locations

Food here is pretty meh.

 My fried chicken was as tough as my Nike soles.

 Service was okay..my waitress/waiter had a deeper voice than me...but prompt service was good.

Pass.
author: David G.

description: The redeeming factor of this location is that it's open late at night which was a lifesaver when I arrived in San Francisco late at night. One of the things that I look forward to when going to a Thai restaurant is the meat, generally slices of juicy chicken or beef. But all of the noodle dishes at this location are served with ground meat which was not even that good! The noodles tasted pretty good though so I would still come here as it is comfort food but only if there weren't any other options.
author: Michael Y.

description: I love ur Spicy Foods. I'm from a Country that Love, love anything hot Spicy.  Everytime I go there the first thing comes to my mind is ur #15 plus ur Chopped Thai Chili with Fish sauce and Mixed them together.  I do it all the time and since I love it too much I ate them all. But now couples times already one of ur Employee ( she always in the front greetings people kinda on her Middle aged ) took the chilli fish sauce inside. Move it out of the way where I can't use it. How disappointing service of her. And to top it off she talked bad about it . And I was there too.. Really !!. I know she knows me pretty well because I Always eat there and I am ur Regular. I am the girl that Happens to love ur foods and ur chopped chili fish sauce. I told her I could pay extra for it but she just left. Ignoring Me as ur Loyal, Regular Customer.  I work next door @ Macy's.  So please let her know.. thanks
author: Liliana S.

description:
Very good! Great flavor. Affordable, fast, good service.
One of the best Thai dishes I have tasted!!!!
author: Chris G.

description:
I was visiting San Francisco and King of Thai was close to my hotel. Because I was a party of 1, I was able to sit right away in the bar area against the wall. The prices are reasonable and the food came out quickly. The wait staff was friendly although they forgot to bring me my tea until much later. There was also some issue with the bill but it got sorted out immediately. Again, the waiter and host was very friendly and the service was quick. 

I ordered the Pad See Ew which was super tasty and the vegetable spring rolls were delicious too. Great experience overall.
author: Isabelle L.

description: I got the boat noodle soup for around $12. The broth was so bland that I performed surgery on my noodles by adding more flavoring to it.... Sadly, it didn't get any better that I did that but I was super sad to have spent that money on something that tasted so bad. Maybe it was the dish that I chose?
author: Monica L.

description:
Not recommended at all....you're not gonna impress your date here.  They should change their name to "Peasant of Thai Noodles". Calling this "King" would be an insult to all that's awesome about Thai noodles...sorry.

There used to be a Thai noodle shop called "Bangkok Noodles" just around the corner... a solid B to B+ place for the price.

This place is far worse and I won't be going back again.  Broth is watered down with little flavor.  Servers don't understand you well--my order was not gotten right.

For a late night emergency stop only if you really have to get your fix...
author: Straight N.

description:
At 2am, our options were limited so we decided to give this Thai place a try. I want to give them 2.5 stars, but I guess I'll round up :-)

Ambience - nope. It's a cold, not super clean restaurant with lots of tables and chairs. Perhaps this is normal for a late night SF restaurant. 

Service - also, mediocre. Not really much checking up on or conversation about what we should try out. The water wasn't good either. 

Food - I'd give it a 4 stars. The pad Thai was ordinarily good, but needed extra peanut sauce which was $4.50! Rip off. 
I loved their stir fried basil eggplant with tofu. Spicy and flavorful. Yum!  

Would I eat here again? Only if it's the only place open with Veg options.
author: Katia K.

description: First time eating Thai beef noodle soup. The broth is more on the sweeter side but it's quite unique. The beef is very tender. Good portion too. The duck fried rice, papaya salad, fried banana with ice cream were also good. Service was good.
author: Crystal H.

description:
Legit Thai food. Had one of the best pad see ew in a while. Also had the combination beef noodle soup that tasted like pho with richer broth. 

Best part is that the food came out in under 2 mins!
author: James N.

description:
Our hotel is around the corner from King of Thai Restaurant. Based on yelp reviewers 50/50 experience and photos the food looked yummy. So my husband and I wanted to try this place.

FYI: I love thai noodle soups especially beef base like Thai Boat Noodle soup, aka Combination Beef Noodle Soup. Where ever there's thai boat, I've tried it.

We ordered Beef noodle soup and Roasted Duck fried rice. Presentation of food 4/5 looks good, but did it taste and smell as it looks?

Well....Sad to say both dishes were plain, no taste of any kind. For better taste, I had to add a few tablespoons of condiments that was on the table. 

I do not recommend this spot for first timers.

Staffers are friendly and place always busy.
author: Marietta M.

description: Horrible experience... We ordered 5 bowls of the roasted duck noodle soup and only received 3 bowls. We kept waiting and waiting until we realized that they probably forgot the rest of our order. When we finally received our soup on the last two bowls it was bad.  When I say bad the duck was slimy, greenish blue sheen to the duck meat, soup smelled off, and it was bubbly.  We told the waitress and she offered to get us new bowls.  At that point, we waited way too long and the others had already finished there food. Since two bowls were of bad quality we opted not to either because what other spoiled dishes are they serving their customers.  We came on a busy weekend and not on an off weekday either.
author: Diem N.

description:
Disappointing, not even worth the $$. I got the Tom Yum Koong, and the presentation was poor, the soup was really more sour than hot. You goggle Tom Yum Koong and get a total different image. As you can see the soup could have been colorful, see greens, see a basil in my broth something. There menu also says prawns and you expect what you read but instead got baby Shrimp!

The image is exactly what they served! As is.
author: Ruthie V.

description: Great vegetarian noodle soup! It was great they accommodated my vegan needs! And delicious to boot! Good service, decent price for the location, and super fast! Definitely recommend!
author: Danielle H.

description:
I was visiting SF for the weekend and had a big craving for Thai boat noodle. I came upon this restaurant on Yelp and decided to give it a shot.

I ordered the #4 combination noodle bowl - it wasn't spicy as advertised. It was actually too sweet for my liking. I ended up adding three teaspoons of powder peppers. Guess I'll have to wait to get some legit Thai noodle in LA. 

Good service though! But not worth the parking price.
author: Chariya S.

description: Honestly dont order the tom kha gai. The chicken was blahh and so was the flavor. It was definitely missing something.
author: Eileen M.

description: We went to have dinner at this restaurant. When we arrived it was a packed house. The owner or manager who was seating people made us wait about 20 minutes prior to telling us they were only serving soups and Curries. We heard them tell another couple as we were walking out, google THAI Restauraunt's I'm sure you'll find another. We picked this place because of the yelp reviews but what a horrible first impression. We left and went to another THAI Restauraunt that I'll shortly be reviewing which was a great experience !!! He clearly must not need the business if he is turning people away like that. Our visit was 09/01 around 9:30pm.
author: Larry G.

description: It was late at night and I was sick and in serious need of a hot soup to soothe my sore throat. King of Thai was nearby and convenient so we came in and ordered BBQ Pork noodle soup with egg noodles. Although I was battling a cold at the time, I could still taste, and unfortunately this broth had no flavor. Before I start putting extra fixin's in my soups I always taste the plain broth first to check the flavor. Sadly this was tasted more like water than anything, so I loaded the soup up with extras to get it down. The price of the noodle soups were pretty outrageous for what they were too. Due to my very mediocre experience here I won't be back.
author: Sara P.

description: If I could give 0 stars I would. I am completely angry at the rude server in the blonde braided hair. I came here twice. First time when I asked her for ice in my water, she gave me a really dirty look, death stare, no smile, and rolling of the eyes. Throughout my whole first time experience she just gave me dirty disgusted look as if I killed her family member. I tipped a decent amount the first time because I had another server also who served me. I wanted to give all the tip to the other server. Second time I came back and again the rude server in blonde braided hair gave me the same dirty look and I felt so unwelcomed. I accidentally dropped the napkin on the floor. She proceeded to gossip with the servers about the dropped napkin and they all gave me dirty looks and they acted like they did not want to serve me. She made me pick it up myself and throw it in the trash can in their kitchen. I was fuming at the treatment I was getting here. The other employee asked me "is everything ok?" I told her "No" and explained the horrible two experiences I had due to the rude server. The rude server denied everything and denied ever seeing me or knowing about me. She is a complete liar and her service is way below par. I am completely upset about this. The other server gave me a 10% discount to try and render the issue but the rude server had completely ruined my whole experience here. All the other servers seems to be okay but I will be taking my money elsewhere to another thai restaurant with at least an okay experience. I will never come back here again.
author: J H.

description:
Went to this restaurant on a last minute late night trying to find something that was open late and this place fit those needs.

Ordered the #10 Won Ton Soup with Egg Noodles which was not too bad and kind of hit the spot with what I was looking for. 

Also ordered the #32 BBQ Pork Fried Rice which I could of passed on, if the kids did not care for it then it does not get our approval. It was more like a salty fried rice than what we were expecting, was not bad just different than what I was expecting. 

#31 Roast Duck over Rice was a simple rice plate, roast Duck was good but did not stand out to me.

Overall was good, but for San Francisco standards was subpar.
author: Dwayne O.

description: My fav to go place in SF for a quick hearty lunch. Love the food here. Very good options for vegetarians as well. Love the chef specials and the roasted duck is good. And it's open till 3am- so that's great! Very reasonably priced even for the budget traveler.
author: Naveen B.

description: This is a really bad service place. Only tourists come here. If you want authentic Thai food go somewhere else. Slowest service in the world. We got in and they seated us right away cos they like to give the impression that they are busy being in downtown area. Then the seating turned out inside in a dingy back alley kinda place upstairs. They forgot to get us the menu and we kept waiting for anyone to show up for 20 mins! Then we ran down to ask the one server for menu. The server just walked right past us! Save your money, Modern Thai is right next door. Eat there!
author: Rahul T.

description: Ordered the chicken penang curry and didn't like it at all. I've had much better penang curries before this so definitely not ordering from here again. I think the curry had peanut sauce which is unusual. The chicken was overcooked and not enjoyable. There are many more Thai places in this area, so I would recommend avoiding this and going elsewhere.
author: Akshat G.

description:
Arrived late at night in San Francisco and you can count on this place for a decent meal.

I got the crab fried rice and the . I was pleasantly surprised with how much crab meat was added to the rice. On the other hand, the Pad Kee Mao was so-so, not really a big fan. 


Disclaimer: I only ordered takeout through Yelp and do not have any input on the quality of service there.
author: Max V.

description: We tried the wonton noodle soup and roasted duck fried rice in this restaurant yesterday. But in the wonton noodle we got the leg of cockroach in that soup. I was blessed that I didn't get the vomiting there in the restaurant . When I complained, they didn't charged for us. So that here I attached the photo, so u can clearly see the leg of this cockroach.Be sure guys there is not a cockroach while eating the food
author: Surendra K.

description:
Ordered a chicken noodle soup. There want any chicken favor on the soup, . A kind of pricy for a 13.00 for a no favor noodle soup. 

There was no ppl waiting online, but the waitress just give the bill and my tip right away. ( that means u have to leave if u finished.) that is it. Won't come back .
author: ZHUOmei w.

description:
A cozy place to eat Asian food. Ordered wanton soup noodles which we're filling but nothing fantastic. Paid about 16 dollars for it. 

Service was acceptable even though staff seemed extremely busy. 

Would go back again for the sake of convenience as it opens till 2am daily.
author: Merritt J.

description: Great option in the city for a quick service and a huge menu. Get the roast duck on rice. The other dishes are also good like pad sew yew and a variety of Thai fried rice. Really impressed with the quick service and friendly staff.
author: Ray K.

description: Absolutely horrible. Drove all the way from Soma because it said they are open till 2am. And to my surprise they were closed. I called the number and someone picked up, I told the lady on the phone that I would like to place an order for pickup, she said sorry we closed at midnight. I reminded her that on yelp it says they are open till 2am. She said sorry they are closed and it's been like this for 6-7 months. I am extremely upset and rightfully so because they are basically false advertising to get more business. Yelp should fix the timings.
author: Shanzay H.

description:
Where's the shrimp?
I paid $15 for Pad Thai Noodle that had 2 shrimp in it. Skimpy rip off.
author: Hilary D.

description: Small place open late serving good thai food. The beef soup was very good and matched well with a cold Singha. Staff were friendly and menu was large but focused. Being one who avoids msg they were honest and accommodating, appreciate that. Overall the place could be a little cleaner but food was tasty.
author: Ed V.

description: For a late night 1 am meal in San Francisco I couldn't have asked for a better place. As a Thai resident, this was on point authenticity and greatly priced.
author: Aaina P.

description: Haven't been here for quite some time but this was my go to spot when I would be in town for business. I love their panang curry with chicken. They are fast but not super friendly. Location is close to the Marriott.
author: Vanessa Z.

description: i loved this place before today! (10.8.18) i called in my order clearly said no onions and received my order with onions!!! i am highly allergic to onions! i stressed that over the phone the receipt even said no onions but my crab fried rice was full of them!!! i ate some of the rice assuming there was no onions!!! i spent basically $20 bucks on some food i couldn't eat!!! do you know how angry that makes me? that means the person over the phone heard no onions but the stupid "chef" didnt care!!! i am currently having an allergic reaction to the food thank the lord it isnt the type of reaction that is fatal!!! the customer service is okay... i personally would like for them to have a chef who can read other than that it would be 5 stars!!!
author: Racquell C.

description:
I came back and was instantly disappointed. This place tastes horrible! I'm taking my initial 5 stars back. We ordered their signature pad Thai, it tastes like someone amateur made it.


2 stars because it's semi quick, otherwise I won't be back.
author: Nance H.

description:
Having come here before an evening show at Golden Gate theater, this place did its job.  Food got in my belly and it was reasonably tasty.  

It didn't seem horribly upscale so if you're looking for that, pass.  But it was reasonable Thai food (in my book at least) so unless you _need_ fancy napkins, don't overlook this place.  

My order of larb looked like a pile of goodness with some cabbage leaves to make wraps with. The larb itself had mint and red onions amongst the other goodness, but I still helped it out with some chili sauces to liven it up a little. 

Also ordered the Thai iced tea.  Was decent, but for only one fill, a bit pricey.  Looks like this is a good after hours stop...maybe next time.
author: David B.

description:
Awesome location, pretty good prices, fast service, open late, great location, and most importantly outstanding food. Oh, unlike the one on Clement, this one takes card!

I've been to the one on clement a bunch because it's near my house and open late. Pad thai is one of my mainstays there because it's so savory and good, and this location follows suit.

We also tried pineapple fried rice which might be my new favorite menu item. So savory and good and amazingly flavorful for what can sometimes be a bland dish. Lastly the panang curry - I've seldom met a panang curry I didn't like, and this one was no exception. But, it's not the star of the place, because you can get a lot of solid panang in SF. This pad thai and pineapple fried rice is pretty exceptional, though. 

Prices are unfortunately noticeably higher than the one on clement :(. But it's in a prime area, and the food is good enough that I still didn't ding it a star. And, I'm sure I'll be back sometime after visiting one of the bars in the area.
author: Chris S.

description:
The location is great.  However the food on the other hand was a bit underwhelming.  We stopped by here before going to pride and I was really in the mood for soup since I had a bit too much to drink the night before.  I wanted their combo beef boat noodles, number 4, with flat noodles. When it arrived I was a bit disappointed with the lack of noodles I received.  My friend ordered the same dish but with rice noodles and he had a much bigger serving.  He gladly gave me some of his.  The broth was well seasoned but it lacked any meet.  They pretty much skimped out on it, and there was no pork blood, which is a main ingredient in Thai boat noodles.  The waiter also handed me my bowl of pho and neglected to tell me to be careful because it was hot.  I mean... If it was hot then why are you handing me the bowl?  You should be sitting it down. 

Also the egg rolls were a let down.  Tasted like the Chinese veggie egg rolls which I do not like, but if it's your cup of tea then you'd like them for sure.  Won't be back since I've had much better Thai elsewhere in the are.
author: Nyla K.

description: We made and later cancelled an order because the restaurant was out of our food, but turns out the restaurant never cancelled it and the charge was still on my card. Had to call customer support to get my money back!
author: 絜心

description:
I ordered fried rice take out . I requested to make spicy but it's not even regular spicy I thought they didn't saw the description may be they are busy . But the fried rice is like shit never had that kind of fried rice in Thai 
My stomach feels also so weird after eating that
author: Karthik R.

description: Ive become a regular here, i come here at least once a week. I absolutely love this place! My go to dishes would be the Pad Thai or the Fried Chicken with Fried Rice. The service is pretty awesome as well, staff is always very helpful
author: Precious R.

description: I really enjoyed this place. I rarely order curry outside of Hawaii, but did so here. The flavor was awesome. Food temperature was perfect. I'm just visiting the area or I would be a regular.
author: Mark A.

description: Great food!  Ordered Pad See-Ew Noodle for pick up and the food was ready within 5 minutes of when they said it was.  Great that the restaurant is open late when most other places are closed!
author: Mike M.
