description: We ordered King of Thai for delivery last night. It was one of the worst Thai food meals I've ever had. The spring rolls were underdone (not crispy, some raw dough). The shrimp in the pad thai was fishy and gross. The tofu tasted like cardboard. The fried rice was bland. Would never order from here again.
author: Carson S.

description: The food is awful. I ordered cashew chicken  via DoorDash and the food was delivered from king of Thai noodle. The chicken was so bad and it appeared to be chicken skin made into meat. Just disgusting. And shame on DoorDash to offer them as one of the restaurants.
author: catgirl n.

description: I love this place. I always get papaya salad and pas Thai - both major yum. It's conveniently located right near Union Square.
author: TheOne L.

description: Good food. Probably the best beef pad see ew I've had. This place knows how to make it not oily and maintain the integrity of the noodle. We also got tom yum soup with chicken. TBH, we could've done without protein. The pieces of chicken were dry and sunk to the bottom. Their service was good and quick. Even though we were squeezed in at the back, they made sure we had the same friendly service as everyone else dining there. I would definitely come by again and try all the other noodle dishes.
author: Lina L.

description:
Oh wow what a surprise! Went there twice after late nights (2am) and for a late night shop they had great food, service and cleanliness. 

The portions are pretty big even for folks who're smashed and want to eat a shit ton. The place is pretty inexpensive. Pretty well lit. 

Table service at 2am? I'll take it!
author: Arjan N.

description:
From the signs on the front door expectations are high... this place has gotten some great reviews over the years and all those stickers on the door are their bragging rights. 

Its a great place to grab some late night eats. Late night doesn't have to be greasy or undignified stuffing your face with some reheated $3 pizza by the slice... you can come here.

Its a nice crowd given the odd late open till 2am hours. There are a bunch of these - or I should say at least a few. It makes it seem a bit less special knowing that - maybe that is just me? 

Tastes great. For the price a good value. Maybe don't go far out of your way to go here but if your in the area at a spot drop by here for your midnight munchies.
author: Stefan T.

description:
Taste is so good, price is reasonable. 
This place became one of my favorite place. :-)
It just the condition of the restaurant wasn't so clean FOR ME (it could be very okay to other people). However, consider of price, I wouldn't expect the fancy condition anyway, as long as the food is tasty which was very good. So I would love to recommend this place :-)
author: Hae-Young K.

description:
I don't even know from where to start....
Let's start with food, 1star even less if possible. Vermicelli with beef had a horrible aspect and terrible taste...there was something bitter that didn't convince  me at all. Unfortunately my hubby said that they were not so bad and edible and... he ended up to spend the all night and part of the day after in the bathroom with vomit and diarrhea. Poor thing...I felt so responsible...I found the place, I wanted Thai food, I ordered the Vermicelli  (that thank God I didn't have!!!) and he got sick! 
Let's move to the service. The 2 dishes ordered didn't come at the same time, so I ate 10 minutes later, when my hubby already finished his plate (that originally it supposed to be mine!) that came first. It was very cold outside, we asked to keep the front door close, they said yes but didn't close it for more than 45 seconds...then, we asked again and again they said yes and didn't close it at all. At that point i was extremely frustrated...I decided to wear again my coat and eat with my coat on!!!! Are you kidding me??? 
Of course, we are not planning to EVER come back.
author: Michelle C.

description:
Conveniently located next to Macy's, this is a quick spot to grab a bite since it is centrally located and open late. There is almost always a wait during peak dining hours. The wait is also quite quick as people do not linger. Service is pretty nonexistent. They hustle to take your order and hustle to get you out. It also gets really noisy, so definitely not my restaurant of choice for hanging out. 

I usually order the Pad Kee Mao. This is quite spicy though very flavorful. I also enjoy their Panang Curry. Decent Thai food overall, but nothing fancy. Pricing is on the higher end due to the area being a huge tourist trap. 

All in all, come if you're really craving Thai food when you're in the area. Otherwise, walk a couple blocks over to Chabaa for tastier and cheaper Thai food!
author: Kristi T.

description:
Best thing about this location is that it's open past midnight for the times I'm craving some food after a night at the bar. I decided to come here for a quick bite around 1am. I decided to order: 

1. Pad Thai: It was a bit more spicy than I expected. I guess the default at this location is spicy and you have to let them know not to add peppers. Overall, it was average. 

2. Pad See Ew: Pretty good. The noodles were cooked well and the sauce was delicious. You can never go wrong with pad see ew. 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Overall, the service was good. The waitresses were very attentive but they did try to rush us. I think they really want customers in and out even though it wasn't crowded at all. They told us the kitchen was closing in 5 mins but people walked in 30 minutes after us and still ordered. The food is pretty average but the price is good (about 8-12 for entrees).
author: Jonathan L.

description:
$12 for a bowl of beef noodle soup? A bit of sticker shock considering it's still $6 on the online menu (which refers to their Grant St location, now closed) and was $8 when I had it last fall at the also-closed Fisherman's Wharf location.

Service was also sketch... a very long wait then they brought the wrong item and quickly replaced it. Keep in mind that there are two excellent "King Thai" places on Clement which have broken off from the mother ship and IMO offer better product/prices.
author: Otis M.

description:
3.5 stars. Surpassingly good for a tourist trap but not up to par with my favorite Thai restaurants in town. Just like any shopkeeper waving you in from the street into their humble shop, the staff members here waste no time getting you seated and served upon arrival. Huge plus, actually. I like the efficiency of this machine.

My friend and I were waiting for four others, so it was awesome that they seated us first and got us started with Heineken. We were REALLY craving mango with sticky rice, so we ordered this first and asked that it get brought out BEFORE our main courses, but the waiter's English wasn't very good, and I think we confused him with our nontraditional request. The dessert was brought at the end of our meal. Boo!!!!

For my main course, I got Pad Thai... Of course. That's how I judge any new Thai restaurant I visit. I was pleasantly surprised at the hefty size of the portion but kinda unsurprised by the lack of flavor. It wasn't horrible, just not amazing. And side note, it's interesting how the peanuts come in a separate container, probably for allergy precaution.

Lastly, the mango sticky rice turned out to be worth the wait. Yum!!! It was a lot to share between two people but fortunately our other friends jumped in to help. Despite my mediocre sounding review, I would actually come back here again if it was suggested. Not my first choice when it comes to quality of Thai food, but it's conveniently located near Powell station and also the nightclub where we were heading next.
author: Stefanie C.

description: Thus place is amazing. The interior is not great but it doesn't matter. You're here to eat fairly cheap but excellent Thai food, who cares about what's on the walls? The food here is simply excellent and the service super fast. I'd totally recommend the pad see ew, one of the best in the city. Regarding what protein to put in your order, chicken is fine, beef is really good, pork is excellent and the duck is simply perfect.
author: Antonio H.

description: This is a place I would not recommend . Customers service was worst I have experienced. Ordered over the phone for pick up , (mind you my hotel is a 8 min walking distance from this location ) they tell me my food would be ready In 5 Mins. ... which already threw off a red flag to me . But I got ready and attempted to pick up my food when u get to the restaurant. They tell me to waiting they are almost finishing my order .... cut to long story short I left there with my money back and was treated as less than human because of my appearance. They told me it was because I was black one of their waitress was being rude and wouldn't respond to me I asked about My other after waiting about 40 Mins ..... trash establishment. Don't recommend for anybody visiting the area or in the area ....
author: Fela R.

description: You get what you pay for. Portions are alright. It's lil messy. It's quick. Don't expect anything amazing.
author: Alan G.

description:
I remember this place being very good after wrapping up a long night of bar hopping. Now that I am sober, it was really just okay.

This place is open late, relatively inexpensive (for SF standards), and food comes out quickly. I think I could have had this quality of food in LA for half the price. 

Ordered the beef larb, which is essentially a ground beef salad mixed with a south east Asian flare. The dish was packed with spices which is how I like it, but it can be a bit overwhelming if you are not use to it. 

I had a little bit of my friends pad see ew, and it was definitely below average. The noodles were soggy and was way too oily. It seems like they just make a big batch of it and serve it to their customers as they order it.
author: Danny L.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE SO MUCH!!! don't know how many times I've bragged about this gem to my friends. 

Food 10/10 PAPAYA SALAD EVERYONE. GET AN ORDER OR MAYBE TWO! And maybe get a third one for to-go. I keep ravin' about it. Oh and Thai Iced Tea too!! 

Noodles - 10/10 PAD THAI. Like seriously, how can you eat here without trying their famous dish? 

Service 10/10 friendly servers

Wait time is around 5-10 minutes, never waited longer than that which is a plus!
author: Maria Mekaela C.

description: King of Thai is our family's favorite spot to come to everytime we're in SF.  The roasted duck fried rice is our favorite! Thanks for never disappointing, King of Thai!
author: Eleonor T.

description:
Eh... after a few round of drinks, the co-workers and I wanted to grab some snacks to eat.  The chicken skewers were underwhelming according to my friends.  I ordered the BBQ Pork and Chinese Sausage "special" - nothing like the picture what so ever.  I think my hopes were set way too high so when I expected a reasonable portion of plump and moist BBQ Pork with Chinese Sausage over rice and was met with what I call dried flacid meat which by the way barely covered one single thin layer over heaps of white rice, I was definitely disappointed at first sight.  I think they could tell and urged me to eat it with the sauce and wouldn't leave until I dipped the jerky into their special sauce.  

I've been to other King of Thai restaurants and this was by far the worst.
author: Celeste I.

description: I had noodle Thai style and it's great .  I did not finish it it is because it was big.  I will be back again
author: Chica I.

description:
A great place for thai food if youre looking for something quick, no frills, and dont mind a hole in the wall gem. 

I ordered the pad thai. Tastes authentic and exactly how I would expect. Be sure to add the little green peppers for a nice kick!

The wait staff is also very attentive.
author: Claire W.

description:
On a super packed day, my group of 12 was seated immediately and provided friendly service. The food all came our super fast and was all very delicious. I ordered Larb Gai and it tasted super authentic. I'm very satisfied with this restaurant and will be bookmarking it to visit here again. 

Thank you!
author: Lina C.

description:
Thai in San Francisco before going home after a week with girlfriends, this restaurant is in the union square area close to out Hilton hotel so I have to admit that this was the main reason for coming here plus they were open for lunch.
Food was good and the prices were reasonable we ordered flat noodles, fried rice the service was good.
author: Mercedes S.

description: Very overpriced... $13 for a fried rice and chicken entree. Didn't taste all that great... especially not $13 good. Terrible customer service. Employees are all very rude, our waitress actually rolled her eyes at us when we asked to look at the menu for another minute. She walked by our table multiple times and saw our water glasses were empty and didn't offer us a refill, we had to ask for one. Dirty chop sticks and soup spoons. Not at all impressed, don't waste your time & money here.
author: Nikki R.

description: This place is right next door to downtown Macy's.  In the past, I used to go here quite often.  However, the price of the food has sky rocketed and the portion of the food is quite less now.  Therefore, I am giving this place 3*'s.  Since the service is still quite fast and attentive, I am adding .5* to a totally of 3.5*
author: Mei W.

description:
King of Thai has been around for years!  Although I usually go to the locations on Clement, I was in downtown and had a hankering for Thai food.  Warning:  This place is always busy.  There is always a line.  But...they turn tables really quickly.

We always eat the same 2 dishes...pad see ew with chicken & fried chicken with fried rice.  They are pretty consistent amongst all the locations.  Service was nothing fancy.  They get you in and out and that's about it.  

 Is it the best Thai food?  Not even close...but it's a quick fix if you're in the mood for something Thai.
author: Jen W.

description:
Let me start off with the good and the okay...The servers here are very nice. The pad see ew was pretty good...

The bad..this place is filthy! I was looking for a place to eat around 9pm, and saw that this place was packed...I noticed right away the place looked dirty. I tried to look for their grade rating outside, and could not find it. I asked one of their workers what the grading was and he didn't seem to understand what I was asking. I then see on yelp, it's a 64/100! Wow, no matter they don't want to post their D sign out front-hella shady! If I had seen the D, I would have ran far away...I felt the filth in the tom yum soup! 

I'm disgusted by the low level of integrity of this place, how are they in business? This place is raking in the money, please spend some of that money cleaning this place up. 

Do not eat here...Im going to say a prayer tonight that I don't get sick from eating here...
author: Kat M.

description: What a terrific lunch!  I had the Pad Thai with a cucumber salad.  Service was fast and friendly.  The dish was full of complex Thai flavors.  I diffidently recommend this spot.
author: Kimba L.

description:
I have 2 stars for the service. The waitress had a nice smile and was very polite.

Bare in mind I have been coming to this location for 11 years about once a year.

Now the food. 
Rice Fried Duck: The rice was soggy and there was pieces of duck skin with mostly fat. I asked for very spicy. It was not spicy at all. The waiter gave me the option to add a powder chili flakes or a chopped up green chili in this salty brine. I tried the green chili in the salty brine. It just made the Rice dish more salty. A little bit spicy, but not very spicy. Wish they had different levels of spicy.

Ground chicken with rice: very little flavor. Needs more basil.

Duck noodle soup: broth was sweet but the noodles were not good at all. Didn't taste fresh. The duck was meaty. Very delicious.

Atmosphere:
This place needs a new paint job, restroom is poorly kept and the tables are old. In this area I expect something with with a little more class.

I will not be back here again. There is no consistency with the food at all and I don't see how they keep this place in business
author: Joshua J.

description: I can't believe I have not reviewed this sooner. This is my go to Thai spot in the city. Come here for the soups and only the soups. They have the best Thai chicken noodle soup in the city. FIVE stars for the soup. The broth is clear and you get your choice of various noodles. I either go with the egg or flat rice noodle. The duck soup is also very good. Today I tried the duck over rice and sadly the skin was not crispy which is a must for me. I also tried the Pad Thai (I'm not a big Pad Thai person but I would say it was your typical Pad Thai) The most popular dish here is the fried chicken over rice and granted it is fried to perfection the chicken was dry on the inside. The desert I ordered was Fried Banana with coconut ice cream. I did not like it. Ice cream was ok.
author: Nicole S.

description: This place was overpriced  And I hate to say but probably the worst Thai food I've ever had in my life minus the ice cream and fried bananas but I don't understand how one could be messed that up. I've never written a bad review so Unfortunately this will be have to be my first.
author: Adriana A.

description: Loooove their pad see ew (sometimes listed as pad siew at other Thai restaurants) here! Being Thai, this is definitely one of my favorite dishes. You're either a pad thai or a pad see ew person, there's no in between, haha! My family and I come to eat here if we're in SF or the Union Square area. The location is super convenient to walk to if you're already hanging out within Union Square. Closest parking garage to this would be the O'Farrell Garage just a block away. They can be busy if you come during rush hour, otherwise, you get seated pretty quick. I've not had a problem with their service all the times I've been here. I sometimes have the fear of catching the workers talk crap in Thai, but I haven't experienced any of that. Apparently, they're open pretty late too, which is convenient if you're out drunk & need a place to eat and sober up or just need a midnight meal like I do sometimes.
author: Kara M.

description: Solid 3.5 stars, open all hours with mix of tourists and locals. Dishes were run of the mill. Lots of sauce on every dish flavors decent. Try it
author: vic f.

description: Hours are wrong. Incredibly average, usually below average, and the only redeeming factor of being open late is wrong. Closes at 11pm even though advertised as 2am.
author: M B.

description: Awesome food and good service. First come, first serve so come with time.  Restaurant has two rooms, so don't be deterred if you have a big group.
author: Helen L.

description: Best roasted duck I've had in America. Service was quick. Communication was simple and effective (standard numbering system for Thai restaurants). Portion size was perfect for me. Highly recommended.
author: Eric F.

description:
When I walked in and saw the menu, and I felt like it wasn't too expensive since it was in the financial district, but when I got my meal, it was a small ass "chow fun" that I can get in chinatown for probably under $5. I think I paid $13 or $14 for that. There was not enough meat and like no noodle. WTF IS THAT?

Now I get why their pricing is not too bad, but their portion size is really bad. I wouldn't eat there again probably.
author: Bob W.

description:
I love the new location. The service isn't always on the ball, but the food was pretty great.

One of the better Tom Yum soups I've had - full of fresh vegetables and delicious flavour. The fish cake looked amazing, and I regretted not ordering it. The chicken satay was as classic as it gets.

The eggplant curry was pretty decent, too!

I'd definitely go back and check it out again.
author: Harley C.

description: This place is very nice. Most of the time busy but the service is fast. Very nice staff, good food servings clean and always welcoming i always bring my frienda here when they want thai food
author: Rv Andrew V.

description:
This USED to be one of my favorite spots in Union Square. Took the family to eat here last night and had sticker shock as we looked through the menu. Seriously... priced doubled from a couple of years ago. Entrees were around $15 each! For $15... I can get a lot more elsewhere. I feel like portion sizes were smaller too. The only saving grace is the food is still good. Pad see ew is always a hit with the kids and so was the beef stew soup. We ordered the Tom Ka soup because we asked the waitress for a curry noodle soup and she recommended that. It was literally a bowl of coconut milk and Tom yum broth that had mushrooms... soooo not worth the price tag. Oh but the employees were nice.

Long story short... as nostalgic as this place makes me, I won't be back.
author: Anna V.

description: Awful. Thats all i can say, terrible food and the prices for SF was just a horrible rip off.  I live here and even for tourist food it was insanely the worst i have had. My 2 stars were for nice staff and speed.
author: Melissa D.

description: Order pad Thai last night to go and didn't have taste of pad Thai at all, it barely tasted like anything, the noodles were too thin and the pad see ew was flavorless as well
author: Gabriela F.

description:
Holy crap, that's a lot of reviews. So, this place has been around for a while and it was very busy the Sunday night that I went. The decor is very simple and straightforward, you really just go, eat and leave, it's not much for chit chatting. I appreciate that the owner and the staff are Thai, I believe the people of the country should represent the restaurant. Overall, I was happy with my meal, was it 100% authentic? Of course not, but the restaurant is not catering to Thai people, the night I visited, it was basically a room full of non Asians in the dining room. The other nice thing about this place is the very affordable pricing and the late night hours.

The food:

Rad Nar- Thai style gravy sauce with Chinese broccoli with choice of meat served over stir fried flat rice noodle. I will admit, I was a skeptic but the flavors totally worked. The flavor does come off a tad sweet but the table side condiments helped balance out the flavor. The pork was standard strips of pork but the noodles had a nice char from the wok. The char adds a nice flavor that a lot of places miss out on.

Kai Gra Prow- sautéed choice of meat with bell pepper, Thai chili and basil served over steamed rice. This is kinda a staple dish in Thailand but the version here was just OK, the sweetness on this one bothered me. I noticed it was too sweet from the very first bite. The fried egg addition was a nice addition.
author: Ben L.

description:
great egg noodle soup.
not cheap for a bowl of noodle soup but it is a very large portion :)
author: Shiro W.

description: This was the most overpriced Thai place I have been to. It would of been fine had the 3 for 10$ eggs rolls didn't taste like potatoes. The dirty water cup should of earned me from the start! It cost about 30$ for two appetizers. We stopped there, half finished appetizers (chicken skewers and egg rolls) and walked across the way to another restaurant for an actual good meal. So disappointed!
author: Katherine M.

description: This little "hole in the wall" was one of the best thai places i had in america. I actually came into the joint right after i got off the plane from Thailand and boy are they similar. I got the beef stew and it was absolutely delicious. the meat was well done but tender. the soup was full of flavor. The best part was they were quick. the atmosphere reminds me of a mom and pop shop. Things get sticky. In my opinion, the food was good, the service was good. I would definitely go back.
author: Angel L.

description:
Looking for food late night? Whether you are a tourist or local, this was the place to be! Super packed on a Saturday night. It was about 10 pm and I wanted food to go to eat in my hotel room. It was about a 7 minute walk for me to get there, I phoned my order just before I left and my food was ready when I arrived. 

I ordered the Thai fried rice with beef and the pad Thai. The pad Thai was really good, and it came with shrimp. The friend rice would have probably been better fresh, but it was in a closed container and by the time I got back it was a bit mushy. Then they could have been more generous with the beef... but I'm not complaining. Not the best Thai food in the world, but this place will definitely do the job when you're hungry and looking for a decent quick bite late night.
author: Brandon F.

description: We were surprised to find such great food and service from a hole in the wall nestled in Macy's side street!! Such a find!! Quick, food food and reasonable for being in Union Square and Thai food. We were in and out with time to relax before our next event!
author: Bon J.

description: Great place with speedy service. Walked in and was pointed to a table to sit. Water and menus were brought to the table. Menu has pictures of the items listed. Ordered the Crab Fried Rice (real crab meat) with hot tea. Dining room shows its age, nothing too bad. Popular place as it was packed around dinner time on a Wednesday Evening.
author: Wong W.

description: It's unfortunate we experience something like this, we came in for dinner and got a seafood noodle. The shrimp was spoiled and it smelled rotten. The servers tried their best to explain why the shrimp smelled the way it did, but fresh seafood should have no smell. I am very disappointed; we come here often and we experience this. The sad part is they didn't even try to solve the issue, they just kept talking about how fresh it was. This is the last time, I'm coming here... very berry disappointing...
author: Martin M.

description: I am sorry to say that I couldn't enjoy my meal today. The Pad See Ew had a funky smell to it when you eat it. The pad thai was dry and over fried as well as the noodles were sticking to each other more than it should. the fried banana and Me and my sister were so disappointed. I was hoping that it would make up for the first part of the meal but sadly when our spoons cut through the dissatisfying mushing of the fried banana was so sad. It was mushy and just sad. How can you mess up a fried banana?!?! Honestly my experience was just sad and disappointing. I recommend going to Manora's Thai Restaurant if you are visiting SF.
author: Tom Theos L.

description:
Warning! Yelp warns you on the mobile app that this place has had some health safety hazards. Think again before you eat here?

Even though there are "health concerns" this place is packed with customers. It's in a prime location close to Union Square. I'm sure they get a lot of tourists wanting to try Thai food. They wait wasn't too long. They have tons of seats inside and there's a 2nd floor so they rotate tables pretty quickly. The service is pretty quickly, almost as if they're rushing you. 

Curry was tasty but the meat was bland. I think they just cook a big pot of the curry and throw in boiled meat. It's fast, but the quality is so so. I'd like to add that we didn't get sick from eating here. Up to you if you want to take your chances.
author: Cindy K.

description: This is a wonderfully authentic Thai restaurant offering fresh and delicious dishes. The staff were friendly, ample room, and very clean. I ordered Ka Pra Krow with ground chicken (spicy level 4) and the shrimp Pad Thai with rice. Yummy for my tummy!!!! I have been impressed with San Francisco's culinary delights that are located within walking distance to my hotel.
author: Alex C.

description: Just left King of Thai Noodles and it was absolutely delicious! I ordered the pad thai and my mom ordered the thai style fried rice with shrimp. Just a few minutes later, we received our dishes and they both looked and tasted like they were made with fresh ingredients. I would definitely come back and recommend to others.
author: Leslie C.

description:
Overall, the food is okay. It's a decent place to try if you're in the area and craving Thai and don't have time to wait a long time. They're bigger than the nearby Thai places so they have more seating, but the food is not as good. 

Food:
-Pad see ew: noodles were kind of mushy and the chicken really didn't taste like much. 
-Yellow curry: chicken was okay, the curry was mediocre. It came with a large portion of rice which is nice since a lot of places charge for rice. A small cucumber salad came on the side that added a nice crunch and something fresh to the meal. 

Atmosphere: overall felt like it could use a good cleaning but wasn't horrible. 

Service: a woman stood at the front on the phone for a long time before acknowledging us. Many people made eye contact from the back of the restaurant and walked by us serving other tables workout saying a thing. Eventually we were seated and from there service was better. We ordered and didn't see the waitress again. Towards the end of the meal a few young servers came by to fill our water and bring us to-go boxes. 

**There's a tip guide on the bottom of the receipts. The first bill came and calculated the suggested tip off of the subtotal. The second receipt that came back with my credit card calculated the tip with the taxes and fees. It's an issue with their system, not them trying to be shady. Even so, double check that you're tipping on the correct amount.
author: Susan G.

description: Every time I live in union square for a few months I obsess over their chicken fried rice. It is really the only thing I ever order, not to say their other stuff isn't amazing but just their Thai chicken fried rice is just that much better that I don't bother. Best in the city by far! And they are always super fast with their takeout, almost too fast where I have to hurry to get the food because it's ready before I'm ready.
author: Jessika R.

description: One problem with always ordering the same dish at the same restaurant is consistency. Having an expectation that the dish you like will always be made the way you like it. I order the number 17 with Tofu and usually its very good, but my last experience was negative, the noodles and vegetables were overcooked, the sauce was off and I am pretty sure the dish is supposed to have Basil in it, instead some kale was sprinkled in to try and fool me. My disappointment was sufficient to cause me to look elsewhere, though their location is incredibly convenient.
author: Iliel M.

description:
The perfect late night meal after drinking....one beer.

Pad See Ew - My go to dish when dining at Thai restaurants. Huge portion, great flavor

We were seated upstairs in a smaller, secluded area which sounds horrible but it really wasn't.  They were playing music videos from the 90's throwing it back to BSB, Usher, and Savage Garden days.  Each song that came on made me want to stay longer. 

Friendly staff
author: Linda N.

description: King of Thai has a nice menu for Thai food. I have been to two other locations. This one is kind of cramped. I sat upstairs. I got the green curry with chicken and rice. I liked it. The presentation was not as nice as Osha Thai per se.
author: Denise C.

description: The place was ok! I have been to many Thai places in Chicago and this place was ok! Nothing bad, but nothing to rave about! I would go back and try something different, but I wouldn't go out of my way to do so.
author: Terence W.

description:
Solid place for a quick lunch. Fast service, sizeable portions and pretty tasty to boot. I ordered the crab fried rice with chicken satay and a Thai iced tea on the side and was certainly satisfied, although the satay left a bit to be desired. 

The restaurant interior is definitely interesting, with its pink/purple walls and ceiling, as well as the large San Francisco mural they have painted along one wall.

Overall an alright place to eat
author: Nicholas G.

description: this place used to be so good but not anymore the best thing about it is the location.. was here couple days ago and ordered beef panang curry the curry didnt have no flavor at all it tasted like water with food color.. tried the fried chicken over fried rice as well i could tell that the chicken was sitting in the kitchen for a while except the fried rice of course.. missin the old days when it was actually good. the staff is wonderful the food not so much..
author: Michael F.

description:
So for our honest review, I'll explain our entire experience. We arrive (six of us, only five of us are eating, remember this) and I accidentally knock over one of the cups of water they serve us, and the waitress sees this and instead of offering to help, moves off quickly as if to avoid any problems for herself. 
We get to order our food and only four of us order. So we get our food, and there is a hair in my friends soup, gross. The food itself is decent. There are better back alley Thai places that'll charge 2/3 the price this place did with better portions and food as well. So we finish our food, and we wait for our check. We get the check and they charge us the automatic tip, since they "served" 6 of us. Only four of us ate, so yeah, they scammed us, nice. So we're wrapping up and seeing what to do next and they ask us to leave for other customers. It's been around two minutes since we got our receipt, but apparently they don't value their customers that much. Find another Thai place, this ones overrated and we won't be returning.
author: Eric L.

description:
We were introduced to this place a few years back by a local friend, we always thought the service was bad but the food ok, and the location convenient to where we normally stay when we visit SF. Last night we decided to go there for dinner and the experience was really disappointing from the "smiling here is forbidden" servers who provided very poor service, where you had to ask for extra bowls because we are sharing the soup, to asking for utensils, to asking for plates to share the noodle dish. 
We ordered 2 glasses of wine and were served sub par wine with mis matched glasses, we ordered the Tom kha gai soup that came with chicken which tasted like it was tossed in last minute so it had 0 flavor, we also ordered  their pad kee mao noodles and requested it to be medium spicy (we like spicy food) but the only flavor we experienced was the heat of the chilis, we had to add soy sauce to get some flavor. Restaurants have 2 things to offer to customers to keep them coming back, descent food and descent service, if you can't manage these 2 components then why are you this business. Definitely not coming back.
author: Rafi S.

description: Came here around 1 a.m. after a night out with friends. Ordered the #1 Beef Spoup and #24 Larb with Pork and Sticky Rice medium spicyness. Food came out  fast and portions were good. Server was attentive, checked in on us, and refill our waters. Food was flavorful and overall service great.
author: Allen L.

description:
Stopped for a late lunch and found this place packed with locals which is always a good sign. The hostess promptly greeted and found me a seat at the counter along the wall. A quick look at the menu confirmed my fav Pad See Ew was available here. Moments later my order was placed and drink served. 

Seemed to take longer than I thought it should but my dish showed up and proved to be worth the wait however imperceptibly long or not the actual wait was. First impressions were the massive portion and the use of all parts of the broccoli plant in the dish. Had I not been staying at a hotel, I would of easily been able to eat half, feel full and take the rest home for another meal. Maybe I have not been around enough but I have always seen this dish served with primarily the florets of broccoli but this rendition had mostly stems and leaves. Either way is fine by me and just an observation.

Mostly importantly the flavors in this dish were phenomenal. All the ingredients had a freshness and lightness to it that contributed to the overall experience. There was also a hint of sweetness in the sauce I have not noticed in the other Pad See Ew I have tried over the years. I liked it!
author: Michael K.

description: Hot damn best place we ate at while in SF. We always get the same thi food so we have a fair understanding of good pad thi and yellow curry. First note we got it right was how busy the place was at 4 on a Sunday. The pad thi is some of the best I've had, just a little on the sweet side but just right. The curry had a little kick but perfect for me. The prices are cheap and the service was good. Easily a 5+ especially considering we where in the most expensive part of SF. Go there!!
author: Doug J.

description: King Of Thai Noodle House knows how to keep its hungry and loyal customers satisfied. Great experience - fresh cuisine and authentic Thai flavors that keep diners coming back for more. Yep, they totally lived up to their name, "King". I ordered noodles with chicken (#15). The chicken was perfectly tender, and the noodles plenty flavorful. My only wish is that the serving was slightly bigger - ya'll know a brotha like to eat! LOL But still, so yummy! Will definitely order again. :-)
author: Nick S.

description: This Thai restaurant is delicious! We loved all of our food. Also, the waiters were so kind. The food did not take long but it tasted superb! I definitely recommend this restaurant!
author: Alex T.

description:
Food was average and acceptable. Fulfilled its duty of putting something in my stomach. Ordered papaya, beef larb, pho seafood, plus a cup of water.

Papaya could be less salty. Beef larb/laab could be improved,too salty.  Pho seafood is just warm salt water. Ya'll so salty. There are room for improvement.  The waitstaff circled the tip percentage, I understand you want a big tip but I just bought $40 worth of salt and my blood pressure is about to go haywire on union square. Gave  8% tip, Saved 2% for some water at Walgreens.

Take care of business and business will take care of you.

Peace out.
author: Ben S.

description:
Above average Thai place, but hit-or-miss depending on what you order.

The hoi jor is always on point, which is great because I've found that not many Thai restaurants offer hoi jor.  The pad Thai here is pretty good, but nothing mind blowing.  Can't go wrong with pad see-ew, ever.  (Though I personally find it a reliable but boring dish.)

Their fried rice is a bit on the bland side.  Needs a side order of curry to make it work.  Speaking of curry, I've tried their yellow and red curries.  Both are pretty good, though the red curry is better.

Oh, and a MAJOR plus -- this place is open late night, AND they deliver well into the early hours.  I've had deliveries at 2:30am before!  In a city like San Francisco that shuts down so early, that makes this restaurant a valuable mainstay.  So they get a star for that.

However, they don't set out peanut sauce on the table.  Unacceptable.  Peanut sauce is everything!

All in all, decent Thai place when it's late night and your options are limited.  If it's during regular business hours, there are many Thai places around that are way better.
author: Tee B.

description: We really were looking forward to some authentic Thai or Asian food while in SF and this place did not disappoint. Had the Combination Beef Bowl, not too spicy but very flavorful. Huge serving.
author: Kristin H.

description:
Pros: very friendly service; very quick service.
Cons: ugly decor. Looks like the inside of a parking garage. Mediocre food. I ordered green curry with chicken. Very average at best. No taste.

Overall, I'll be kind and give the place 3 stars. I won't be going back.
author: Al F.

description: Ordered shrimp fried rice with fried chicken breast and Pad Thai. The Pad Thai and Shrimp fried rice was good, chicken could have been better.
author: Julia M.

description:
I'm usually an easy customer to please but man... I was irritated with my order. 

I was in the area and decided to grab dinner. It was between Chipotle, my one true love, or King of Thai. I decided to take a chance and try out this place because why not #yolo. 

Walked in, was seated at a bar situation since I was eating alone, and decided on the Pad Kee Mao with tofu and vegetables since I am vegan (remember this). Before walking into this joint, I checked out the reviews on yelp and saw there were a number of negative ones. I didn't want to let those reviews cloud my impression of the place so I remained optimistic about my experience here. When my food came, I was pleasantly surprised by the large portion of my dish. I happily dug in and realized it was seriously lacking flavor-- not to fret because I had some chili sauce on deck. 

So I'm making my way through this dish because I'm ravenous, and then I take a bite of chicken. NOOO. I'm assuming most of the dishes are cooked with a huge wok and ingredients are tossed in without much regard of what was left in the wok from before. This is a mistake that could have easily been avoided, and it goes to show how little attention the chefs pay to their dishes. 

I really wanted to leave a positive review to balance out all of the negative ones, but sorry King of Thai, y'all did me wrong.

I do want to note that the service was very fast and pleasant! There are some redeeming qualities to this joint!
author: Nicole A.

description:
King of Thai is a decent spot for after-hours dining in Union Square.  My friend and I came here after watching a movie at the Metreon since it was close by and still open.

I pretty much ordered my usual Thai fave dish which was Pad Gra Praw.  I was was curious to try their Fish Cakes Appetizer though since it looked interesting on their menu.

Fish Cakes Appetizer -- http://bit.ly/1JgiaXr
Deep-fried marinated fish cakes with Thai curry paste and chopped green bean. Served with sweet and sour cucumber sauce.
Well, this was okay.  The fish cakes were deep fried, but almost to the point where they were almost dry.

Pad Gra Praw with Ground Pork --  http://bit.ly/1CvbOu8
Sautéed choice of ground meat with bell peppers, Thai chili, and basil.'
They did a good job with this dish which shouldn't be too hard to mess up anyways.  The ground pork had a nice spicy kick as it should.  I was definitely satisfied and full after this.

Overall, the food was decent, came out fast, and service was good.  I think next time if I drop by here again, I'm gonna try more of their noodle dishes since they're what they seem to be known for.
author: Rodney H.

description:
Well... Kin Khao down the street ruined my reservation for 8 so our dinner group was forced to march down the street and eat here.

What I love about the King of Thai Noodle is that it doesn't pretend to be what it's not. It's reasonably priced Thai food that's pretty tasty. No bullsh*t. No fancy pants wall scrolls or elephant statues. Just good food at good prices.
author: Doug R.

description:
Apparently they had a poor food safety score and I didn't notice it till after :/ 
We ordered the Thai iced tea. The server was so careless. She dropped a little on the floor and didn't bother apologizing or wiping it off. The iced tea was not all that great. I ordered the roast duck soup. The soup was pretty bland. There was really no flavor to it. I added red peppers to it but it still didn't taste good. Needless to say, when I got back to my room, I had an upset stomach.
author: Pri D.

description: Tried the chicken noodle soup for takeout here and really enjoyed it. Our delivery order was missing half the amount we ordered though. Open pretty late for people looking for delicious food after a night out.
author: Chelsea W.

description:
Decent noodle place. I'd rate it 8/10. They don't have rice for some reason, but I think they make all their noodles by hand, which turn out to be texturally delicious.

I got the master green & tofu noodle soup since I don't like the taste of meat. It came with a big helping of what I believe to be kale. I added a few spoonfuls of their spicy sauce to it, as I have a preference for the tongue dancers. Unfortunately, it didn't come with much more than kale, noodles, and tofu. What I got was yummy, however, I would have enjoyed an addition of mushrooms.

Decent decor and friendly service. Good tea too!
author: April A.

description: This branch is my go-to lunch spot when I am running errands in Union Square. They have an extensive menu but the outstanding dishes are the roast duck over rice and roast duck noodle soup. I order the latter with egg noodles, which are slender and al dente. The broth is a revelation: rich and infused with star anise. The duck for both the rice and noodle dishes is deboned and perfectly glazed. A few pieces of broccoli gives a nod to healthy eating.
author: Priscilla O.

description: Ordered take out, but never got our food after 30 minutes. The food is outstanding, but the service can definitely be improved.
author: Wilson L.

description: One would think if the restaurant name has the words king, Thai and noodle that they would know how to make a good Thai noodle dish. A classic pad see ew - surely the chef could make a good one with his eyes closed. Nope, how wrong was I...I almost couldn't believe how bad it was. This is how I imagine the chef made it; heat a wok up to medium heat, add some vege oil, put some veggies in, stir it for 30 seconds, add some fresh rice noodles. Stir it for another 30 seconds and then put it in a take out box. That's must have been how it was made because there was no flavor, no sign of soy sauce, no wok effort and just some uninspiring tofu pieces. Holy moly I actually used to like this place. Might give it another chance in a few months, maybe the chef was off sick today and got the cashier to help? I hope so. God dam I hope so because no person with tastebuds could possibly like how they make the pad see ew.
author: Jimmy D.

description: Went on a lunch day date with my mom, who was also paying for our meal. My mom wanted Thai food, so what better place than King of Thai. From the start I knew my mom did not like the atmosphere. I should've suggested another place then. To order we have to wave a waitress down, to get our drinks we have to wave a waitress down, even to pay... Again we waved a waitress down. I'm pretty laid back and easy going, but even I couldn't help be be annoyed with the service. When we get our check, we are give 1 piece of candy, which I thought was hilarious, but realized it was a courtesy. Even though the table of three across from us got a handful of candy, but I digress. My mom felt it was a courtesy they could've kept. My mom decides she's not going to leave a tip and pay the exact price of our meal and here's is when the drama began...the hostess, I'm assuming she was WOULD NOT except our payment. It caused a HUGE seen. Since we were seated by the door, the cash flew to the floor. She told my mom, she wasn't going to take it unless there was a tip included. There was nothing special about lack of service we received... NOTHING! Mortified, I took $2 out of my wallet and left if in the table to we could leave. NO ONE should be expected to leave a tip on CRAPPY service! My mom PAID the cost of our meals, the only expectation. I could've really done without the embarrassment. I wish there was a way to leave negative stars on here.
author: Shante W.

description: Still the best in town..but the chinese lady that worked there is a real pain in the ass. She doesnt answer if you speak English, what the fork ????
author: Tn N.

description: Nothing fancy here, just solid, excellent Thai food.  The Tom Kha Gai soup and the green curry is some of the best I've ever had.  I'm a regular here on layovers, and King of Thai never disappoints.
author: Allen W.

description:
Prices and portions are pretty good, although not the cheapest or biggest ever. I had the pad see-ew, and it was solid - tasty with good portions of meat.

Service was super fast. We went on a weekday at around 7:30 PM, and were seated immediately. We placed our orders, and in the time it took us to switch tables (we were right next to the door which wouldn't close, and it was getting cold), our food had already started arriving. 

The place isn't super flashy (we walked past it at first, then had to backtrack a bit before we found it), and the interior could definitely using a sprucing up, but nothing horrendously wrong.

Overall, it's a pretty nice place to get some delicious, comforting Thai food for a price that won't make you wince.
author: James L.

description: OMG!!! This place was amazing and they got our soups in 2 minutes. Yes, 2 minutes after we ordered our food was done. So good!!!!!
author: Roman N.

description:
I'll start by saying I've been coming here for a long time, whether it is hiding out for some "me" time during lunch, or coming in for a late night hangover cure.  Sure this is not OSHA Thai, but the food quality, portions and sizes are appropriate for the price. 

Recently, I noticed a not-so-favorable trend, and that is different customers were receiving awkwardly different portion sizes of the same dish.  Last night, this trend was in-your-face obvious to me as my Pad Kee Mao, and Pad Thai dish portions were barely larger than an appetizers plate, while our neighbors got near medium-sized pizza portions (14"+ sizes) of similar dish groups.  

I'm not sure if the wait staff were trying hussle certain customers for more tips, or if our group appeared to be clueless Asian tourists who weren't going to be vocal about anything.  Whatever it is, please don't play this game anymore. You are much better than this.
author: Michael C.

description:
YIKES. Came here starving and completely misguided by all the raving reviews. Only reason I'm not giving 1 star is because of the nice staff. Food was terribly disappointing and tea glasses were visibly dirty. 

Ordered beef combo noodles, fried chicken over rice, duck/Chinese sausage, chicken larb salad, and  spicy shrimp pad see ew. 
-Noodle broth was too sweet 
-Fried chicken was 80/20 breading/meat
-Duck was too fatty
-Chicken larb was prob 4X my daily sodium intake 
-Spicy pad see ew came with 4 small shrimp and zero spice

Someone tell me what the hype is about.
author: Em L.

description:
It's hard to be enthusiastic about a restaurant when the service was so poor.  We had high hopes for a nice lunch...the place was packed but we were greeted right away and taken upstairs for a very tiny very cramped table.  That in itself wasn't so bad even with the table of 4 next to us being sooooo loud.  The bad part is that the server apparently lost our order and our waitress was clueless as to how to get it to the kitchen.  I flagged down another server who went to the back and was able to make the order.  While we had a nice time chatting it was quite disappointing that the service was so poor.  They offered a 10 % discount which I said fine as i just wanted to get the heck out of there at this point.  I should have insisted on a comp for my wife's meal but oh well!  

So for the food, we had the Pad Kee Mao with chicken and noodle soup.  Both meals were fine and maybe on their own I would have the desire to write more but it's not happening this time.  I was too hungry to stop to take a picture of our meal.

Perhaps we'll give it a try next time in SF.... but I think my wife may be through with this place.
author: Russ V.

description:
King of Thai is definitely a decent chained thai restaurant in the bay, especially mosty of them close past midnight. Sometimes when you're drunk you appreciate anything that's available.

I have had better Thai food, but I again I think King of Thai is decent too. I like their food and service. Their food is never too salty, its always a good amount of seasoning. Though, mind you that most of their dishes are rather on the sweeter side than salty. I personally dont mind it.

And service was quick too, they take your order and food comes about 10-15 minutes later even if the restaurant is busy.

My favorite and recommended dishes are:
* Pinapple Fried Ride $9
* Rad Na (fried flat noodles with thick broth) $9

Prices are a considered cheap for it is located in downtown. But i think for Thai food, it is slightly more pricey than usual.

Seatings are very packed! Hard to walk around the room, so i suggest you stay seated and let the waiters assist you. This location has two kitchens, one downstairs and one upstairs, so i think this is the reason why their service is so quick. 

Watch out for their food safety ratings, it was low the last time I went there.

Cheers!
author: Inge C.

description: I visited here once.  The quality of the food was decent especially for the price.  I was seated immediately, and the food was ready in less than seven minutes from ordering which is slightly concerning.  It's not really a restaurant per se; think of it as a Takeaway that has a few seats that you can occupy for a while.  Solid place.
author: Ian M.

description: I came around 5pm on a Sunday and the place wasn't very crowded. I ordered a pad Thai which cost $13, kinda pricey compared to other Thai restaurants. It's  understandable since it's located in downtown and right next to Macy's. I ordered a pad Thai which was a total disappointment. They added black pepper and hot sauce, usually you don't find that in your noodles. I guess that's their style of  flavoring but I wouldn't order it again
author: Melanie N.

description:
I'm so disappointed in this location. I just ordered from door dash & the delivery time was awesome. It arrived when it was supposed to. As far as the things they were supposed to arrive with like a side of chili paste or chilis ... they totally disregarded our request and didn't even call me.

I also ordered the pineapple fried rice .. came with 2 dinky pieces of shrimp ..

& I'm almost certain a fly flew out when I opened my food.... gross !
author: Miss V.

description: I tried the crab fried rice and it was SO good. The crab meat was very fresh!! I was a little disappointed that they didn't have wonton soup without the dumplings. (I really just wanted the broth and veggies) But it was all delicious nonetheless!
author: Daijah R.

description: Best thai restaurant recommended by locals in the area. We stopped by after a day of shopping. This place was packed. All the seats upstairs and main floor were taken. Luckily we were seated right in the front. We ordered the duck soup with clear noodles and beef pad see ew. Both were delicious. The duck soup had the strong broth that was not too salty. Pad see ew had the nice peanut sauce and not too greasy. I would recommend this place for the affordable pricing, strong flavors and good food. But the service here needs some work. I saw a lot of carry out folks upset with long and incorrect orders. It took 25 minutes to get our 2nd entree. With the amount of waitresses I would think people would be served quickly, but expect an extra 20-30 minute wait to your order.
author: Khoi N.

description:
King of Thai offers lightning speed service despite a packed restaurant and a decent product, but I was underwhelmed with my actual food on a recent visit.

Rather than go for something standard like pad thai, I ordered the one noodle dish I didn't see on other typical Thai noodle menus: Guay Tiaw Lord. It had sauteed shrimp, ground chicken, calamari, tofu, bean sprouts, dried shrimp, and black mushroom in sweet soy sauce, all served over steamed rice noodles. I asked if it was exclusive to King of Thai and they said yes. My dish was on the too-salty side. Also, it's my pet peeve when the noodles in Thai rice noodle dishes are broken or have fallen apart during the cooking process. 

Still, you can't beat the fast service and price, with items under $10, especially in touristy Union Square.
author: Peijean T.

description: The #35 with chicken is one of the best Thai dishes I've ever had. This is my second day this week eating it. Quick efficient service. This place is amazing, will be coming here a lot.
author: Nik K.

description:
Duck noodle soup is 7.5/10 
Pad Thai 8/10
Thai tea 9/10
These are a few things I order when I come. Food is good but you can easily tell it wasn't made very cleanly. Place is not that clean either.
author: Potatoe Q.

description: I live next to the King of Thai Noodle in Taraval, highly recommend that one, but not this one. The dishes are half the size for a price that is 30% more.
author: Justin P.

description:
I am writing here to warn potential customers about charges that they may not see on their bill (at a quick glance, I did not notice these charges)...

THE PEOPLE RUNNING THIS PLACE ARE SCHEMESTERS!!! 

First they charge gratuity in very small fine print on the receipt then they charge you tax ON TOP OF THE FORCED GRATUITY (comes out to 10.1% of your bill INSTEAD OF 8.75%!!!)

Then they give you a receipt with something called "BASE" as the total value... This is surprising because this already includes gratuity. Finally, this receipt has suggested tip values of 15/18/20% which TRICKS you into thinking that your bill doesn't include tip. If gratuity is already included, it should be specifically mentioned or more clearly specified on the receipt.

When another member of my party brought up the bill was wrong, instead of explaining the charges to us, she smugly threw down the receipt to prove us wrong.

We will not be returning because of the way this place is run (forced gratuity on smaller parties, the fact that they ask for tip after charging gratuity, and charging tax on gratuity).
author: Joseph O.

description:
King of Thai has definitely gone down throughout the years but probably more so for this specific location. The place was dirty with food on the floor and no one bothered to clean it up. Food was mediocre and unauthentic.

We ordered the slice beef noodle soup, pad kee mao, and Tom yum soup. While the noodles was decent, the soup was way too salty and seemed like they had just used one of the noodle broths and added additional spices. This place can probably fool all the tourists shopping around in the area but to those who grew up eating thai food regularly, it was NOTHING close to what a tom yum soup should be like. 

The only good thing would probably be the huge portions but I definitely won't be coming back. There are way better places than this.
author: Denise J.

description:
This is a great restaurant to eat for late night. My friends and I went here after watching Alicia Keys and luckily, we were seated immediately. This restaurant is bigger than we thought. They also have an upstairs here.

We waited about 15 minutes until we ordered. I got the fried chicken over fried rice and took about another 15 minutes. It took a while for the fried chicken to get to my table.

The reason why I'm giving this place a 2-star was because the breaking on fried chicken was very loose and it would come off every time I try to eat. The rice portion was a lot which I appreciated. If you get the fried chicken, pour the sweet and sour sauce all over it - it definitely boosts the flavor.

Would I come back here? Maybe.
author: Aj C.

description: I read someone else's review that the Shrimp Pad Thai was their favorite and that was exactly what I wanted to read. I tried it for myself and, amazing! Very friendly service. Also, I ordered my plate and it was ready before 5 minutes! Not to mention the serving was very generous, much bigger than a place I went to for Pad Thai last week.  Definitely recommend.
author: Bella C.

description: Hungry while shopping downtown? Check this place out! Don't be fooled by the boring interior and small space. Easily one of the best ROAST DUCK FRIED RICE I've had anywhere. Quick service and friendly staff. Great spot for a quick and tasty meal in the city! Will definitely be back! A++
author: Marco U.

description:
When your looking for Thai restaurant something that will not kick your pocket like most restaurants in San Francisco this is the SPOT food is delicious 
Served right away the servers doing a magnificent job as soon as you are done the dish disappears very friendly 
So button line great restaurant :)
author: Aviad B.

description: The shrimp was uncooked, the server never checked on us to see if the food was ok. They tried it because this literally made my stomach turn & ill never be coming back !
author: Naji Y.

description: My gf really wanted tot ry their green curry, which we got with mix of tofu and chicken, though we had some problems communicating this with the waitress, who was confused that we wanted to get both tofu and chicken in the same curry, I mean, is that not a thing? Do people not usually get 2 proteins in the same dish? Maybe not, though I'm tryin to bulk up my gym routine and it's hard to build muscle without protein, but anyway, the curry was pretty good, especially because we got it mild and not too spicy. They put a killer amount of bean sprouts in it, which you know for the protein amount alone, has my vote. Their tea wasn't all that great, kinda watered down, but my gf liked it. We also got their mixed veggies which was surprisingly good, because when it first came to the table, it didn't look like it had a lot going on for it, but it surprised both of us.
author: Mack L.

description: Mediocre Thai food, as sauces, meats & veggies in most dishes are the same. Kind of pricey although quantities are good. Homogenized recipes, just like American fast food. Service relatively quick but kind of rude & impatient. Staff always demands tips regardless of service; that too on total plus sales tax (which is unethical)
author: Avid Y.

description:
*This review is written by a visitor, not a local. 

I was at the bar across the street late into the night and happened to make my way in after a recommendation from friends. They cooked the chicken Pad Thai in 10 minutes flat and it was hot and delicious. The portion was good for a single serving. Was it the best Pad Thai I've had in my life? Let's just say it was the best Pad Thai I've had in my life approaching 2am, but on that note it was still pretty friggin' good. 

PROS:
Price point, my dish came to $10.90
Open until 2am
They speak Thai in house (growing up, my mom would use this as a testament to their authenticity- I'll leave this here for anyone who follows suit)
Food was beautifully presented and delicious
Cashier made sure I had plenty of napkins and silverware to enjoy my meal

CONS:
Not open 24/7 (hey, girl's gotta eat)
author: River H.

description: The food was very very mediocre. I ordered takeout, not only did they get my order wrong.. The food was also pretty bland. San Francisco is known for their amazing Asian restaurants. I could not imagine going back to this restaurant to order anything. Try something else!
author: Marie T.

description:
Stopped in here for a low-key inexpensive meal with friends and that's what we got.  We came in about 7 PM-ish on a Saturday night and were seated right away upstairs.

Give them credit for this, with a full restaurant it didn't take them very long to get our food out.  I would say maybe 10 minutes at most before our dishes started coming.

The food was just fine.  Not bad, not great.  In my particular case I got kra pow and I would have liked a more assertive Thai basil flavor throughout, but the portion was fine and it was otherwise good.

In any case, super quick, friendly, and attentive service and food in solid portions for relatively inexpensive prices - I wouldn't mind coming back.
author: Brent T.

description:
We were a regular until everything here went from 9.50 to now 14.00
Ridiculous!!!
We stop supporting their business.
Our friends, coworkers, family members stopped going to this place.
author: Chef C.

description: Barely average in a city with great Thai food and obviously no shortage of other options. Watery curry. Watered down Thai ice tea. Subpar presentation.
author: J K.

description:
Okay spot for a quick meal, but the food itself is average at best. Being by Union Square, the place was busy even right smack in the middle of the afternoon at 3:30pm. Service is fast though so there's a pretty quick turnaround.

Tried the GREEN CURRY ($10.50), which had bell pepper, bamboo shoots and green beans, and got it with chicken. Their medium spicy was pretty mild for me. The curry itself was very average and the chicken was tough and overcooked.

Overall, not very impressed and I probably wouldn't return. There's definitely better options (Thai or not) in the area.
author: Jessie L.

description: They were friendly and fast with service, was in and out myself and the food was delicious although the pad Thai was a little funny tasting compared to other Thai places
author: Melanie P.

description:
Nice place, staff are great 
We came here on Friday night it was really crowded but we were seated fast, food served fast 
We ordered #15 and #16 and we really enjoyed it
author: Maaz S.

description:
I've eaten a few meals here, both dinner and lunch. Each time was happy with the food & service.

Pad Thai = Great

Pad Kee Mow (Thai chow fun) w/ Beef = Great

Servers are fast & efficient (but not so cheerful).
author: Matsuo U.

description:
I came here with my bf and his friends. I got the Lord noodle. Great food, fresh ingredient, portion is on the smaller side. Loved the peanuts there. Parking lot across the street for a good price. There's long lines but plenty of staff. If trying to get take out, call ahead of time to order and then pick up- usually ready in 10-15 min. 

The pad-see-ew is also great and really fresh!! You can select chicken, beef, pork or shrimp.
author: Amy Y.

description: Prices here leave something to be desired, but not as much as the taste. Save your time and money and go somewhere else.
author: Omar A.

description:
The only reason why this place is still in business is probably because of its convenient location/hours and proximity to a revolving door of tourists. 

I was hungry and cold when my dad was visiting the area so we stopped here for some noodle soup. I'm not sure if this was a bad choice but their store has the word noodle in it so it should've been a better experience.

The beef noodle soup was ok, very bland tasting soup. Menu says it had spinach but there were just tiny pieces of greens in the dish... Meh

The chicken noodle soup was awful. When it came out I was like "why does this look like noodles + water!?" Then I tasted it and it really was just chicken + noodles + bland soup water. I guess they expect people to have very turnt down tastebuds when visiting SF but I was so disappointed in this.... Never returning.
author: Hana S.

description:
The power of Yelping. I checked reviews a few months back and Yelp gave this place a warning about food sanitation.  After a long day of shopping Hubby really wanted to eat here. The mgt posted a sign on the wall near the doorway talking about it and if there are grievances to bring it to their attention.  
The place looks the same. Dated, old furniture, quick turn overs, intermittent waits, an occasional pair of cops dining.  
We ordered the usual.  The fried chicken over fried rice for Hubby.  The rice was good but the crust on the bone free chicken breast was falling off before it got to the table. It was OK. 
My shrimp pad Thai came with only 2 small shrimp. Cheapskates. They use the thin noodles now to cook faster. May as well have spaghetti. The problem with thin noodles is they cook too fast and then you cook again in the wok. The result is clumpy, overcooked noodles. Should've had fried rice with veggies instead.  For $25 for 2 and mediocre food, it's not worth it.
author: Ry T.

description:
Lol...  
The price here is over-expensive and their portion is small!  More like an appetizer than real lunch/dinner food.  
Quality has seriously gone down here...  
And seriously?  $4.30 w/tax for a dam THAI TEA???  Talk about inflation.. I rather go over to "boba guys" to get a better quality Thai tea with boba..  
If you expect the portion to be big,  you are wrong.  Most of their food are made with msg,  which taste so good..  And it'll make you yern for water!  Overall,  there are better authentic places,  and cheaper to enjoy Thai food.  
this location have extremely poor Health Safety Score :57. Be careful if you go home with a stomach flu or food poisoning.  
Their pricing seriously had gone up but food quality had gone down. 
Will look for another Thai Food place than this..
author: Anney T.

description:
Food is excellent! 

Ya'll know how I do it. I don't mess around, I say it how it is. I had the garlic chicken with white rice, but it's called some kind of authentic Thai name here that I cannot produce. Sunni had a soup and $23 bucks later we were moving on to explore Union Square. What a surprise how many folks we out onm thanksgiving ! Amazing truly in this sanctuary city that so many are without family lol. We came to get away for a few days, cause we don't eat turkey and frankly should become vegetarians after the Carl's Jr we had while in traffic coming here from L.A.

That said, this is a walk in place with single file waiting in line lol before you're seated. Everybody is really nice and definitely authentic when it comes to the Thai experience. I know my Thai food and this place is excellent. I'm happy the girl at our fancy hotel suggested this joint. 

Btw, parking ? Don't try your luck. Just walk the hills and lose some weight. Our hotel has $52 bucks per night plus 14% tax.....trust me I will write a review on that on our last evening here to ensure they don't scratch up my Phantom.
author: Daniel C.

description: Nice, authentic food, late night hours, and central downtown location.  My Thai wife really likes this place - me too!
author: TeeJay D.

description: I always recommend my friends to go to King of Thai noodle if they are hungry at night time,  because this restaurant is close to my place , very convenient and tasted so good.   But ！！！probably I have to change my mind right now ! I brought  my friends  to King of Thai noodle after on Friday night.  I was so disappointed ! We ordered pad Thai , Dong ying gong,Guay tiaw lord .  We tried Dong Ying Gong  which is my favorite soup, it made my so sad , it tasted like water, no sour , no salt ! Guay tiaw lord, same tasted , only few pieces of rice noodles had  tiny bit sauce.  The quality is going down a lot ! I won't go back again !
author: Sophia L.

description: This place is AMAZING!!! The pad Thai with chicken is perfection and the mango sticky rice will never let you down. This would be my go to Thai place if I lived in SF!
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
This place is run by liars. I ordered from them via ubereats. I ordered the fried chicken and pad see ew. They gave me two orders of pad see ew instead. I called uber to let them know and they called the restaurant. The restaurant accused me of lying and insist they gave me the right order. This was just 10 minutes ago. Pictures of my duplicate order is attached. 

Also the food is not good at all. Do not eat here.
author: Scott T.

description: This place is really awesome. I came here with a group of four and we were seated immediately. We ordered the red and yellow curries and the vegetarian of Thai was amazing. The portions were also very generous and pretty affordable compared to other Thai places I have been. Definitely would recommend this place!
author: Lindsey R.

description: Showed up win a group of 9 people and were seated and served promptly, we only waited 5 minutes even though it was super busy! The pad see ew was great and the Tom khan soup were delicious. The plates were big and not pricy. The staff was great, we had like 4 waiters. 10/10 would pad see ew again.
author: Manie B.

description:
They're open late, they deliver, and they deliver FAST, but when the end product tastes like what mine tasted like, it's hard to find appreciation in the aforementioned luxuries. 

I ordered the Tom Yum soup with tofu and the Pad See Ew because I was hoping to get the perfectly-cooked, wavy egg noodles that I'd been craving, but what came looked like a pile of semi-congealed brown and grey unmentionables and it tasted like ashes. I wish I could say nicer things, and given how hungry I was, I was expecting it to taste like the best thing ever, but that was far from the case. 

Again, I'll give them mad props on being open late, delivering and delivering so fast that when they knocked on my hotel room door, I had to stall for more time to put a real bra on with my pajamas. It might have been 7 minutes from the time I hung up the phone to when they knocked at the door. 

In the end, I basically paid $20 for food that I had a really hard time choking down. The Tom Yum was downright inedible and the Pad See Ew wasn't much better.
author: Candice G.

description:
I've been here quite a few times primarily out of convenience. On those days that you're shopping near Powell street and you don't want to eat at the overproduce restaurants in the area - this is a great option for cheap, quick, yet satisfying food.

I usually get the Thai boat noodles if I don't do family style. Pretty big portions and very satisfying.

The other night I came and ordered the pork pad kee mao, pineapple fried rice and the dinner size green curry.

Green curry was just decent (2.75/5) - very oily and it is pretty spicy! Not my favorite because of how watery and oily it is. 

Pork pad kee mao (3.5/5) had great flavor but instead of sliced pork pieces they use minced pork. The minced pork is hard to pick up with the noodles and it's not as cohesive with the dish.

Pineapple fried rice (4/5) with chicken was my favorite. Great flavor, lots of meat and shrimp, and good portion. Would definitely recommend to share this one!
author: Isabella L.

description: Good location for before or after shopping, but the quality and quantity of food has gone down significantly. I ordered the fried chicken with fried rice which is a classic dish at King of Thai. It was sooo disappointing. I got a small slab of fried chicken cut in about 4 pieces and a really small amount of fried rice. It was like they didnt have enough rice and just gave me what was leftover from their frying pan. SO DISAPPOINTED. The fried chicken had no flavor either. Rice was drenched in oil on top of that. I will not be coming back here, good service doesnt matter if your quality of food is poor and portion size is small. Oh yeah, it was $13.00. Paid $35.00 for 2 sad meals. There were also flies all over the place. GROSS. DO NOT COME HERE!
author: SF N.

description: The food was delicious ! I ordered some tea and the spicy cashew chicken plate. Was not disappointed at all! They stay open really late which is good. The place looks clean, customers can see their food being prepared and it's clear that the cooks take their time to properly prepare the meals; they're clean about it as well. Would love to come back to this place on my next visit to SF !
author: Stars S.

description:
Back in college, I used to frequent King of Thai Noodle post drinking at the wee hours in the morning. Without fail, I always left a little less drunk with a solid Thai meal to help soak up all of the alcohol the next day. With that said, King of thai Noodle holds a lot of nostalgic memories for me.

I recently came back to visit the city with my sister and just because, we had a fourth meal here on a rainy, Friday night. For nostalgia's sake, I ordered their ever popular fried chicken over fried rice. This dish includes a deep-fried boneless chicken breast over fried rice with egg, onions, and tomatoes. It served with hearty cucumber slices and a sweet and sour sauce. Lemme tell you, that fried chicken is still solid. The chicken is nice and crispy on the outside and juicy and moist on the inside. That, along the fried rice was just as good as I remembered it to be.

My sister ordered the combination beef noodle soup. The soup comes with sliced beef, meatballs, beef stew, spinach and bean sprouts. She opted for rice noodles. This dish on the other hand was rather bland. After dumping in generous spoonfuls of chili sauce, the broth was infinitely better with that extra seasoning. It was okay. Good, not great and I probably wouldn't order this again.

If you find yourself a little drunk and hankering for a good bite to eat in this part of the city, stop by King of Thai Noodle for their fried chicken fried rice dish. The place stays open ridiculously late (3-4am) and offers a good late night eating option.
author: Trung N.

description:
I've been here many times. The food has been average. The price/quantity ratio is not actually favorable. What has really gotten on my nerves is the filth level of this place. As much money as this place makes, Anaek Chaichana really should be working harder to keep his restaurant clean and presentable. There is not one single clean area in this place. From the front door to the restroom...you'll find that it litterally needs a powerwash. 
King Of Thai Noodle House

January 28, 2016 Routine 9 64
author: scott l.

description:
Quick service, mediocre food. 

I've been here a couple times, nothing memorable. Go a few blocks down and get some better Thai food. Maybe it's the items I ordered, but the last experience really left a bad taste in my mouth...pun intended! 

Ordered: Chicken Noodle Soup $9.95
For $10, you get clear chicken broth, bits of white meat chicken, noodles, and bean sprouts. Flavorless. 

I wasn't feeling well and didn't bother walking a few blocks to a pho place and it just wasn't what I expected. Very bland broth and chicken was over-cooked and rough. Not to mention it was a 20 minute wait for a take out...for SOUP! Everyone dining in was in and out FAST. I saw two tables, who sat down AFTER I ordered, get their food first. Huh?! 

Will I be back after so many choices around here? No.
author: Michelle C.

description:
Pretty much your standard fast service Thai joint. There's several of them around town, but the food is overall pretty good. I have noticed there's a Poor Safety Score warning on the Yelp page, so it does make you a little uneasy when you're eating. However, I didn't feel sick after eating my meal so dine at your own risk!

I ordered the Duck Noodle Soup which was surprisingly very tasty. Duck is one of my favorite things to order especially at Thai restaurants, and this one pretty much lived up to my standards. Also got an order of their thai tea, which was pretty basic, but be warned it's pretty caffeinated so you'll be pretty wired after drinking it.

I probably won't be back until their health score goes up, but give one of the other locations a try if you're in the mood for some decent Thai food.
author: Jaymie S.

description: I like that they're open late! Perfect for when you're out drinking and you get hungry. Roast duck noodle soup with rice noodles is my go to!
author: Stephanie L.

description: I was introduced by this place from a family friend and my first visit was extremely busy! This is the first Thai food place I ever had in San Francisco. I give this place a 9.5/10.
