Food taste great, portion is perfect, the menu needs a little cleaning or a menu upgrade, opens late, and could use a better service in organizing table availability but other than that I am a returning customer!
author: Sheryl H.

description: Recommended to us by our hotel staff, this was our first spot we stopped once arriving from the airport. We asked for the house special and we were not disappointed. Number 17 under the noodle dishes was phenomenal, a great start to our weekend. Caution To those who can't not handle spicy. We ordered medium on the spicy scale and it was defiantly spicy.
author: Anthony J.

description: Great place for cheap, fast eats. The place isn't the cleanest of places, and don't expect ANY customer service. Servers here were a bit rude, but it is an Asian restaurant/cafe. I ordered their Wonton Soup W/ BBQ Pork and added some noodles. It was pretty good. Overall, great place to stop by if you're doing some shopping and are hungry, but wouldn't make the effort to eat at this place if I had other choices in SF.
author: Debra T.

description: Late night order lived up to the hype of the reviews.  Yum yum.  It was so good I would go back and dine in during the day when I'm in San Francisco again.
author: Sarah E.

description: TRY THE GUAY TIAW LORD! Sooooo tasty. It's thick white & wide noodles topped with tofu, shrimp, minced pork, eggs, soy sauce, coriander, peppers, etc. and it's very filling and delicious! Very attentive and friendly service, even at 3AM!! Much better than just a drunk food fix. Thanks, King of Thai!
author: Andy L.

description:
Ordered on Postmates. They cancelled the order 10 minutes after ordering saying they are too busy for to-go orders. 

Why would you be on postmates then?
author: David P.

description: The portion size is embarassing. $13 (plus tax). I would say I got half of a small chinese takeout container of actual food and a scoop of white rice. Food is solid, but not significantly better than the Thai food restaurant in the Westfield food court and about double the cost. That's where I will go next time.
author: Damon L.

description: This is probably my favorite place in SF. They open a bit later than other restaurants in downtown area
author: Hoang L.

description: Excellent food. Good service. Portion other than rice was less than I am used to. Informal.  Does a good business even mid afternoon. A good sign.
author: Joseph F.

description: I've been coming here since I was in high school. There's usually a line, but I've never waited longer than 8 minutes. It's a great place to go with friends as the serving sizes are great to share.  PSA to all Curry lovers I would recommend the yellow curry! sooo good
author: Justice A.

description: I've had food poisoning for 2 days from this place and found that they have an 81 heath code score for things like inadequate hand washing facilities and inadequately sanitized food contact surfaces. THAT'S GROSS. Very disappointing because the food here tastes good. Also disappointing because they've gotten violations for the same issues in the past and have even been shut down. Now that I've gotten sick, it's just not worth the risk for me to eat here ever again. Especially since there are so many other Thai restaurants in SF.
author: Regina M.

description:
I started coming to this establishment in 2011, and since then, the quality of both their customer service and food have both went down tremendously. Last night was the worst. I came here with my coworkers because we wanted to have dinner and do our secret Santa exchange.

We are aware that we had a big party, but they don't take reservations? Luckily, one of the hostesses was willing to accommodate a large group like us, despite always being really busy. We appreciated that she seated us anyway, and waited for the last few members of our party to arrive. 

Before seating us, the staff merged two tables together, and had 10 seats arranged. As we went to our table, I picked a chair located in the middle and pulled it out. As I was going to sit down, the exact same hostess yells at me and says I shouldn't steal a chair from another table, as she gestures to a table behind us that was missing a chair. 

How are you going to yell at me for picking a seat that your staff prepared for us? How dare I do not properly calculate the ratio of chairs to tables that do not pertain to our party, right? 

All of my coworkers ordered their food. As for myself, I was only going to get two dishes for two of our coworkers that couldn't make it because they had to close our store. I didn't want a dish for myself since I don't think their food is as good as before.

When ordering, I requested that the pad see-ew and chicken curry be on a separate check from everyone else's joint tab, and that my two items be to-go. I thought the waitress understood, because she repeated back everything exactly. Also, please note that this isn't my first time making a request like this. I've done that before in the past quite a few times, and they've done it with no problem. They usually bring it out towards the end with the other bill.

Except this time, they brought out the two dishes I ordered for here. Since these dishes aren't intended for me, I'm not going to eat them. If they were for me, I wouldn't have a problem with the mix-up. So I told the person who brought the food that it was supposed to be to-go. They didn't apologize; they just took the dishes back to pack up. 

Once the waitress brings back the to-go items, I hand her my card right away since I didn't want the food to become too cold. When she hands me my card back, I take off with food to bring to my coworkers. I found it odd that the total was $30-ish, but I took it as inflation from half a year ago. I leave with the two dishes to bring to my co-workers. 

When I return to the restaurant, the coworker sitting next to me says she never received her chicken curry, while everyone else got their plates and was almost finished.

We told one of the workers to just take her chicken curry off the tab since she never received it and she doesn't want it anymore.

When they received the bill, I was sitting there chilling since I thought I already paid my share, so that's their task to divvy up the bill accordingly. Their bill still 
had the chicken curry we requested to take off. 

The staff insisted they already took off the chicken curry. But obviously not, right? Since there's a chicken curry still on our tab. The waitress takes the bill back to deliberate with the other workers. PLOT TWIST: IT'S MY CHICKEN CURRY? 

I told the waitress that I already paid for my two items. The merchant copy is still on the table, with my signature and the 15% tip I left. She insisted I ordered a chicken curry for here. I explained that I ordered two dishes to go, but they came as for here, so I had them pack it to-go and I paid for everything. Nothing else.

Nope. She insisted I ordered a third dish. The $33 I dropped was for two items and I still owe an extra $12, right? 

So my coworkers try to intervene and tell the waitress the chicken curry is a dish that we never ordered or received. She goes back, and another staff member comes and claims the to-go bag I took off with was holding 3 items. I think I should know how much I'm carrying... 

So my other coworker intervenes and reasons with the staff with this logic:
1. If I really ordered 3 items all to-go, why would one item reflect on the tab with everyone else's, and keep two items on my to-go tab? 
2. If I intended to order 2 items and I was charged 3, why should I have to pay extra? Or pay for a dish I didn't want and they messed up by giving an extra one? 

It took 20 min to get them to take off the chicken curry off our tab. They asked us for a name, number, and CA ID#, which I thought was ridiculous. They want to check surveillance to see where the miscommunication occurred. No apologies whatsoever. Horrible communication between their staff, and I'm not doing anything considerate for my coworkers anymore. They can get their own damn chicken curry and pad see ew; I'm done.

(My coworker also proceeded to cross out the 15% tip I intended on leaving).
author: Rachel M.

description:
Since moving to the city, my bf and I have probably eaten at this restaurant the most # of times. Service is quick, portions are large, and food is good. It's more of a 3.5 stars, but I'm rounding up since they also open late. It's been a savior for us during those late nights after clubbing or being out. 

My favorite here is the pad thai and my bf really likes the lord noodles. We've also tried their eggplant chicken rice dish and seafood noodle soup. I think the stir fried noodles still taste better. 

The most surprising things I recently discovered is that they have an upstairs dining space, so the wait is always not bad even though it's always packed. :)
author: Sophia H.

description: I've been to many Thai food places but this is still number 1. Better than OSHA Thai which is a fancier and more expensive spot.
author: Thomas B.

description: Amazing pad se ew and spring rolls. You must come eat here. This place is very reasonably priced located in downtown San Francisco so if you're looking for a delicious meal at a reasonable price look no further.
author: Kevin S.

description:
Roast duck noodle good
Pineapple fried rice above average
Good service
Could use a remodel
author: Jones T.

description:
This is one of my favorite restaurants in SF! After a day of shopping in Union Square, we just happened to see this spot on the walk home and decided to check it out. 

For starters the service at this place was top notch. I drink a lot of water and my cup was never empty. Furthermore, the time it took from being seated to having our meal was maybe 10 minutes, so there is extremely fast service! 

The food was also amazing. I ordered a pork and fishball noodle soup and it was amazing. The portion was massive! I usually don't get too full from restaurant meals, but this noodle bowl did the trick. I had a really hard time finishing off the last few bites. Also, the soup was really proportional in terms of the meat and noodles. My girlfriend ordered the pad Thai. Unlike me she doesn't eat a whole lot but this place was so delicious that she also finished her meal!

This was an awesome place near Union Square that we will definitely be coming back to!
author: Jimmy C.

description: Pineapple fried rice just.....ok.   Location on Clement is WAY better (I'm referring to the casual one with fluorescent lighting, not the fancier one, which is as meh as this one).  Had chicken satay a few months back which was also just 'ok'.  Yes, it's overpriced here and walls and floor need deep cleaning.  Some servers are great, a few others are a tad strange.
author: Merrick W.

description:
Went here for dinner tonight. It was just alright. #thatrhymed

If you're drunk and want basic "Americanized Thai", go on in!

Otherwise, go to the mission for a one of a kind burrito experience.
author: Rey B.

description:
This use to be my lunch spot during work hours, I've been here so many times; there are many great things about this place with the exception of one thing, their soup bowls. I've tried the seafood soup, and the wonton, they are super bland! I've also tried the Beef combo and it was actually the opposite, and very sweet. 
Despite all that, if you stay away from the soup bowls you will come to realize that this place is well worth the visit. Its fast, its affordable, it stays open late (Great for post happy hour events), but most importantly all their dry platters are actually great!

I normally write lengthy reviews but this time, just take my word for it.
author: HonestOpino N.

description:
If you are a small group of students or tourists (in the touristy Union Square area) that want a quick food fix, in a train-station lobby-hall type of place, even late in the evening, you can go there... it is not very good, and it is not cheap for what it is. It is like you pay for the weight, per grams, as portion are large, but not for the quality. 
At least, it is very often packed (why??? but why??), which can be considered as reassuring with regards to the freshness of the food.

Poor curry items, and I forgot what else I ordered and did not finish neither.
Conclusion: I should never ever follow friends in places, which I can guess from outside would be like that...
author: Christian P.

description:
Our friend recommended the Duck Noodle Soup. So we only got that... this soup was perfect for the morning after a hang over...
You can taste the roasted duck flavor in the soup. I didnt give it 5 stars because it was a bit sweet. Its a huge bowl for 9 bucks.  2 people can share it. We got here right when it open and it filled up quickly. 
The noodles were good and they added chinese broccoli in it too and topped off with cilantro.
I recommend this place. Yum!
author: Grace L.

description: Probably didn't have much choices to choose from seeing how it was 2a.m on a saturday night and we were walking around union square. My girlfriend and i stumbled upon this restaurant; it was filled with all the post clubbing scene(we can tell by their dress attire). We were seated quickly and ordered the thai tea and hot tea with the beef soup. The prices here are about 11-13$ for any entree even the appetizers, but it's probably because of the location. The thai tea was just alright but the noodles tasted like the instant noodles just with fat noodles instead. They get an A for effort though and convenience!
author: Pu B.

description: LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!  My parents, husband and I stayed at Union Square earlier this month, and saw this place walking around.  We made note because it is soup season!  One night we popped in for dinner, and it was much more than we had expected!  I LOVE that you can make your own soup, essentially!  You pick the noodle, toppings, wow, what a concept!  I also have never seen chow fun noodles in soup, and LOVED it with roasted duck!  My dad loved his green curry dish.  I wish there was a place like this in Los Angeles!  The only drawback was the seating...it isn't the most comfortable atmosphere, cramped, crowded (understandably since the food is so fabulous), and the a bit understaffed.  The gentleman taking our order was terrific and "on it", however, his helper who was to bring our drinks and cutlery was slow.  We had to ask numerous times for our beverages and wooden chopsticks.  The food, though is wonderful and the people are very nice.  I would recommend this restaurant any day!
author: M Y.

description:
I like their duck noodle soup.

Yes it's fatty. Yes it's salty. But there's something addicting about it.

Maybe that's why horses like salt licks.  

I like how you can choose your noodles. 

I like the fast service.

I like how it's a decent portion for the price.

If I was a tourist I would love this place.

Since I'm not a tourist I simply like this place.
author: Jack R.

description:
Craving some pho, but not being able to find any viet places open at the late hour of 3 am, we thought we would just sub it in for a different type of asian food. so my friends and I came to King of Thai. 
Low ish ratings, but we we're hungry.

Service: like many asian places, it was poor. One of my friends' dishes was taken away when she wasn't done, and asked that she pack it up, and the server returned the dish to her with everyone else's utensils still piled on. awkward. We had to ask multiple times for water and the bill when we were ready to leave.

Food: Verrrry O.K. I poured some spices into my duck soup (13.20, came with a sketch duck leg) to make it better, but another friend ordered the chicken noodle soup, and just got white chicken breast and noodles in hot water. No flavor to the soup whatsoever. 

If you have that asian night craving near union/market area, then this place is ok. Otherwise, I am sure there are other quality options for the same price.
author: Grace P.

description:
It's a good place to eat .. The food is good and it's really cheap 
the stuff there are really friendly and nice 

But it's really hot there.. It was freezing outside and we were sweating inside :)
author: Maha M.

description: Relatively reasonably priced, fast, tasty food. As an SF resident, I definitely would recommend to other residents to check this place out after a long tiring day of shopping around downtown. Not a "must-see" if you are a tourist though. You get seated immediately and the service is very attentive and swift. There most likely will not be parking around the area though, I mean, it is Union Square. Would probably check out again if I am in the area.
author: Priyanka P.

description:
Come here couple weeks ago and even though it was a warm night, my mom wanted to eat something with soup after couple hours of shopping in downtown so we decided to come here since my mom remember about this place. And i havent been here for many years. We thought we had to wait cause there was people standing outside the door and it was a friday, but when we went inside, we seated right away since it was only two of us. The only seats available for us where the upstair level. 

Decided to get the pork noodle soup since thats what caught my eyes and it cost about $8.50. Decent price for the size of the bowl. After my mom and i order our food, we Got the food right away (less than 5 minutes after we order our food). The restaurant was busy on the day that we went but i didn't expect the food would come out fast. My mom assume that they premade the soup and everything and just have to put the broth over the noodle and meat. They had decent amount if noodle and meat and the broth has a lot of flavor. This noodle soup can get you full.
author: Julie N.

description: To the 2 server ladies who really EFFED up our experience and will never come back, thank you for turning us away immediately right when we got to the door. How rude is it to try to have us seated, then take it away quickly and tell us that we have to wait 30 minutes when more than half the room is empty? RIDICULOUS.
author: Jia Qi F.

description: I stopped in on recommendation from my acupunturist.  I got the duck noodle soup, with added wonton.  I like that you can select the noodle you prefer (i got rice).  The broth was very flavorful and was just perfect for a rainy cloudy day.  it really warms the soul.
author: Suzy Q.

description: Good food but the service was terrible, we waited at least 15 minutes to just order drinks. The waitress never returned until it was time to pay our bill.
author: Edward W.

description: Really good pad Thai and duck broth noodle soup! Great stop after a day of shopping. The service was not amazing - constantly felt rushed but to their credit, it was busy.
author: Jenny K.

description: when I saw the soup they brought me, I was like What is this!!! A bow of mushrooms with five small prawns? Really not the Tom Yam Gong I was looking for!!!
author: Mer Z.

description: Came in today to get fast food! And quick. It was slow so I can get my food fast! But the service suck suck wait 10 mins to get my order. When other days they do it quick. My food took more then 35 min . When they give you the food and bring the bill right away! I ask for the manager they said there's no manager on Sunday.  So I ask who is taking in the place ! The lady was me! I explain that I wasn't happy with my service.  She just say after she was just employee when she told was the supervisor.  The services suck.  People go to other place to eat
author: Magaly M.

description:
Came in alone today during the afternoon. I got seated quickly; i knew what i was going to order so i didn't bother to open the menu. When the waiter came over, i told her i wanted Pad Kee Mao, she even repeated after me. 
The food took about 15-20mins to come out. I noticed something different, no bell pepper or basil. I took a bite and noticed that it wasn't spicy so i had to add a lit of hot sauce. For a moment i was wondering if they changed their chef or something so i didn't bother to complain since i was really hungry. When i was paying for the bill, i noticed on the receipt, they put down Pad See Ew instead of Pad Kee Mao... That's horrible. Wrong order and i still tipped.
author: Jessica W.

description:
My all time favorite "combination beef noodle soup" and "pad thai with minced beef" and also " yen ta fo (no.9) spicy" is unbeatable!.

Tips : don't order Tom yum koong because you think it's the only thai dish you've ever known. This place is not for tom yum koong.  Go for something else and you'll love it like i do!
author: Waraporn T.

description: Great place to go to if you are looking for cheap eats in union square. I like the red bean broth seafood soup with egg noodles. The wonton soup was also tasty
author: O K.

description:
King of Thai Noodle is a great place for quick, delicious, inexpensive Thai Food. The chefs cooking in the kitchen are middle-aged Thai women: [meaning the food will be good!] 

Favorites:
* Fried Chicken over Fried Rice: Crunchy, savory, & delicious. I love the fried rice...the rice they use is fragrant. HUGE PORTIONS!
* Tom Kha Gai: The perfect blend of flavors from the lemongrass, galangal, & coconut milk. Very satisfying on a cold night!
* Pad See Ew: The ultimate comfort food!
* Pad Thai: One of my favorites!

Cons:
* Service can be a hit or miss. You have to chase them a couple times to bring you extra plates, bowls, & utensils for soup and what not.
* Seafood Salad: Very tart. The seafood also tastes old. Get the larb instead.

Overall it's a good place. Of course, not the best place for Thai Food but still pretty good in my opinion.
author: Ralph N.

description:
We used to love to come to King of Thai at this location.  What happened???
We had a duck noodle soup which had such a little amount of noodles and the ducks tasted bad as if it had been in freezer for a long long time.  
My favorite items to eat there are Hoi Jor and Crab meat fried rice.  Hoi Jor was missing water chestnuts and overall flavor was off.  Crab fried rice was ok just not great like before.
I hear the one on Clement has gotten bad too so I'll have to see if the one on Taraval is ok.  

So sad...
author: Spoon K.

description: They fucking forced me to fucking tip. I am a tipper and a big tipper at that. But forcing someone to tip is unacceptable. You fucking gave me a  wrong order and you demand money?
author: Leslie M.

description: Came here with my mom one time and will never come back. The food here is so terrible and the service matches it. We found a hair in the chicken we got right after tasting it and finding it super hard like they over cooked it we were so disgusted and not only that the server actually wanted us to pay for it as we were leaving! No way! So many other great Thai places in the city and this is definitely not one of them
author: Rita A.

description: Very average Thai food. I ordered the Pad See Ew, a classic Thai dish I had tried at several other restaurants, I rank this one among the poorest. Left unimpressed, wouldn't return.
author: Kyle N.

description: Ordered the Beef Combination Soup with vermicelli on a chilly July evening for hubby who caught a cold after a bay cruise. It was 11:30 pm & having this place open was a godsend.  I have always had the pad see ew on previous visits, but I was pleasantly surprised with the beef soup.  It hit the spot!
author: Crissy F.

description: Cheap, fast and delicious.  Had the bbq pork and won ton noodle soup. It was very yum! :) satisfied with the service, they were attentive and friendly. Would come here for affordable and yummy eats!
author: Jun Li Z.

description:
WTF. I think it's pretty much hit or miss over here. They pretty much cater to the tourists who don't really know what they're ordering or the hurried lunch crowd, who probably didn't know what else to eat that day. 

My coconut milk soup was bland as hell. The fish cakes had a metallic taste to it and the egg rolls were just wrappers fried in oil. 

Shame that this place is so different from the one on Clement Street. 

This review of them isn't even worth my finger strength for typing. Yeah, I'm mean like that.
author: Sharon B.

description:
Came here after watching Ninja Turtles because it was one of the only places still open at 9pm hahahaha.

Service was polite and quick. Food came out really fast. Lots of tiny flies in this place. No bueno.

Ordered a Duck Fried Rice. Presentation was lovely. A few small pieces of duck. Although it was very oily, the taste was wonderful. Smells delicious, tastes delicious. I would come back if they they didn't use so much oil in their food. Delicious but not willing to die for it!
author: Benita M.

description:
The good:  
-I had the Chicken Pad See Ew and it was delicious.  Cooked perfectly and awesome flavor.
-Despite the place was packed my food came out in under 10 minutes.

The bad:
-I came to eat here by myself and when I told the man working there "Party of 1" he said "Ok, you need to wait."  He then sat a party of TEN people who were behind me in line, then a party of three people that were behind that group.  Finally he came back up and then pointed to a single chair against the wall and said "Sit over there".  It was rude in my opinion.
author: Kristy R.

description:
This is my SPOT! Undoubtedly my favorite restaurant in all of SF.

 Don't leave without trying the roasted duck soup with golden egg noodles. I always wonder how they make that broth because it is magic in your mouth. I drink that stuff to the last drop. And that duck -how do they caramelized that skin so well! 

Service is so good that it nears becoming a negative. If you hold a menu in your hand there will be (at least) 3 different waiters asking you if you've ordered. They're all so genuinely nice though and really care about you liking the food. 

I came to this city for mind-blowing astronomical experiences and that's exactly what I get each time I come here.

Tl ;Dr:  crazy affordable (rarely over 10 dollars), the BEST tasting noodle shop in SF, excellent service, and open until AM. 

Oh and there's a tv for you soccer fanatics.
author: Quinn N.

description:
I must admit that I was excited to grab a bowl if hot noodles after an awesome Elite event. Conveniently, I spied this hole-in-the-wall on the way to Union Square. The line moved quickly and you'll notice immediately that the place is tiny and cramped.

Undeterred, I ordered the curry noodle soup which was just what I needed on such a windy evening. The noodles were yummy and satisfying, though I'm not sure they sat well with the drinking I did before arriving. However, they're a dish that I'd order again.

My biggest gripe is with the service that I unwillingly had to leave a 20% tip for. Not only was it inattentive, they didn't event return with my change. Being as busy as it was, I opted not to press the issue over a dollar but it left a bad taste in my mouth on the way out. I'll stick with King of Thai Noodles for my future fixes.

Food: 7/10

Service: 3/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 5/10
author: Joe M.

description:
It's 12 a.m.
Friday night/Saturday morning.

I should be doing this: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kfVsfOSbJY0

but I'm jet-lagged.
Most importantly, I'm hungry.
...and I want Thai.

Did I just say I wanted a nice, quiet meal in Downtown? On a WEEKEND NIGHT? Yeah. You know I'm really hungry if I choose food over drinks.

So I walk in, it's nice and uncrowded and looks like a Chinese noodle shop setting. Cool. Waiter passes me the menu, I pass it back to her. "Just a Pad Thai, puhlees."

Get my pad thai. Um, can you say high on bean sprouts? And fresh, scrumptious fried tofu. Good texture but maybe a little overdone with the sauce. 

Service was eh...slow and they never greeted us out. Good pricing and definitely a perfect hungover spot, especially with the bars and clubs around.
author: Sharon T.

description:
We tried to eat here. The waitress came and took our order, promptly enough, and then we never saw her again. There were 4 of us, and each ordered a dish. After about 15 minutes one dish arrives. After another 10, the second one arrives. 10 minutes, 20 minutes, 30 minutes....

I flag down a second waitress, and ask about our food. She goes about her business for a few more minutes, and then finally goes to check. She promises the other two dishes will be out in 2 minutes. 

5 more minutes pass, and I finally walk up to the staging/point of sale area, and ask to speak to the manager. The first person I ask runs off with no comment. I ask a second person. The manager shows up, explains he had only been there since 6pm (it was 6:45 at this point, so I'm still confused as to how this was an excuse), and that they were very busy. I explained to him that half our table had eaten already, and the other half was still waiting. He says the food will be out soon. I go back to my table, where it turns out the manager had been by...not to check on our food or the service, but to tell us to move our bags to make way for other customers. 

5 more minutes, and we've had it. We go back to speak to the manager, telling him we'll pay for the dishes that came, and no more. He promises 50% off what we would have paid. For the two dishes that actually arrived, and two soft drinks we ordered, the total should've been about $25. He asks for $20. At this point, we're desperate to leave. I reach into my wallet, pull out the $15 I have in cash, and tell him this is what I've got, and he accepts. 

I tried my friends' food, and it wasn't even very good. One friend asked for extra spicy curry, and it came out bland as could be. 

I can't remember the last time I've actually walked out of a restaurant like that. The manager's regard for the customers was nonexistent. There's plenty of decent thai food in the city. Find another spot. 

(Oddly enough, this image appears on their yelp page https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/king-of-thai-noodle-house-san-francisco-3?select=LTLnPiqKEk24i3Slnx7sJg)
author: Nate L.

description: We ordered a beef noodle, spring roll, tomyum ghai, green curry and crab fried rice. Beef noodle was great, as well as the green curry. Crab fried rice was okay, but the spring roll and tomyumghai were horrible. The tom yum didn't taste like tom yum, at all.
author: Jared N.

description: We arrived into SF late a night and were walking around our hotel looking for something to eat and we found this gem. If you like Thai food this is a must try. The food, staff, and service are great
author: Salima H.

description: We ate here twice on my 3 day weekend visiting San Francisco. Tasty food and fast service. We were exploring late night and landed here. Place was full at almost 2 am on a Saturday morning. Tried the pad see ew, fried rice, and thom gai coconut soup. Would definitely come back when in town.
author: Angy C.

description:
I rarely write reviews unless I've been serviced beyond expectation and/or the service was undeniably terrible beyond anyone's standards. That said, do not go here unless you want to pay too much for so little. Taking into consideration the high tourist traffic, their customer service is pretty good, but the quality of their food is horrendous. On several occasions, I've ordered a dish priced at $9-12 to only have it come out messy and lacking in quantity. I think it's because of the high traffic that the cooks rush and just throw bits of ingredients into the dish, which results in receiving mostly noodles/rice, sauce and hardly any protein/vegetable. I just left the place, refusing to accept yet, another dish, prepared this way. I won't be coming back.

P.S. Upon completing this review, I was alerted by Yelp that this particular Thai eatery ranks within the 5% of poor scores from the Dept. of Health and Safety. This is another reason to NOT go here! Blah!
author: D L.

description: The worst service ever. If I could rate 0, I would definitely choose 0. If you don't want to come to a restaurant that tells you " go to another restaurant if you don't like our service. " then never go into this Thai restaurant.
author: Taiyue L.

description: Excellent Thai noodle shop close to Union Square. Two people in our party - one had roasted duck soup with egg noodles, the other chose wonton soup with added egg noodles. The soups plus hot tea came to $30. Both meals were extremely filling and delicious. It is very casual there, no lah-di-dah, but you won't go away hungry. Plus the hot soup will warm you to your toes on a chilly night. Highly recommend!
author: msue A.

description: My wife and I both got food poisoning there yesterday. The place looks not very clean and I found a hair in rice, let me not say whether it was a long or a short hair. I ate at not super clean places before without consequence but this place got me knocked out. Staff is nice and food tasted ok, but hygiene is not adequate. Confirming that, Health Inspection scores posted on Yelp over the last 3 years are low. I am never coming back and do not recommend his place.
author: Kramer C.

description:
This restaurant does not have kitchen system. The food doesn't come out in order. My friend's order came out in 5 minutes and iI had to wait for mine for 30 minutes with 4 times following up. The tables left to me also didn't get their order in a timely manner. The table right next to me also had to cancel their order due to long wait. They don't even aplogize or feel sorry; nor try to solve or help with issues. But peoole probably will still come here because of the location.
 
Bad service, bad mood.
author: Sherry C.

description:
firstly I'm a white guy from michigan so what do I know ...

Honestly it wasn't horrible, but based on its location and price I'm not sure how there still in buisness. if I was in South Dakota this thai food would be considered GREAT. two pad thai's, Hoi jor, a Tom kha and 2 Singha beers set me back over 57$ before the tip. my friend and I asked the server for Hot. 

I actually stopped her and said "I want to sweat". the noodles reminded me of spaghetti and the Tamarind sauce tasted almost like tomato. 

the servers were "working very hard" I hope there paid well and live somewhere nice the alternative is on my mind though while I look around they took good care of us quickly and politely but I feared the worst 

Hoi jor was VERY GOOD THANK YOU


Tom kha was basicly coconut milk with chicken in it. 
NOT SPICEY AT ALL  the mushrooms were of the Italian variety, same as you would find on a pizza. I need the wierd Asian looking ones 

 please owners of this establishment, buy better noodles, go to other thai places, shoot maybe even Thailand. check out how to make sauce without corn syrup from a bottle and look into some fresh vegetables. 

you have such a nice location and lots of foot traffic your food should taste better 

I'VE BEEN To the OTHER ONE  with the same name AND IT'S GOOD WHY!!!
author: Benjamin O.

description: We had the #4 and #8 noodle soup upon staff recommendation. The duck noodle soup was actually a little decent with egg noodle.  Service was lacking but im reviewing for the food only. Food was bland. I had better papaya salad. Asked for extra spicy and we got 2/10 spiciness. Would not return...ever
author: Anne T.

description: They just gave me burnt pad kee mao! With the prices hiked up i'd like to think they would up their quality , but nope! I work right next door so i'm always eating here! i took it to go now i cant have it re made because my lunch is only half hour & i have to stay hungry for rest of my shift. last time they gave shrimp instead of chicken i ordered & few other glitches here & there. But this one i had to review instead of complaining to them so that they'll actually work on quality check & not brush off my complains. Until then i have to find another thai place to eat my lunch from on the days i want thai food. Thanks for your service king of thai but this is it. I am giving 2 stars for the staff & for not messing up my food 5 out of 10 times.
author: Pooja S.

description: We are here on vacay from AZ and we love Thai food, we been to many Thai places in different states and this is by far the worst, place was packed and I'm unsure why but probably filled with other tourists. Asked for a clean fork and was actually given another fork.... With dried rice stuck to it, fried rice was ok but pad Thai smelled like straight wet dog food and were dog owners. Save your money
author: Lysa A.

description: Yum! Great food and service. Took off a star as the restaurant is pretty small and thus crowded. So I ended up getting my food to go.
author: Debra M.

description: We live in Vancouver and maybe we're spoiled with our Thai food there.  We ordered the cashew nut chicken and Thai fried rice.  The cashew nut chicken was a major disappointment, the chicken was dry and had little taste.  The fried rice was ok but again the chicken was dry and forgettable.  The restaurant itself is unclean and the food runner literally tossed the plate on the table and left.  I really don't get everyone's reviews of this place.  Fast food Thai at best.  I wouldn't mind waiting 10 minutes for better food.
author: Fiona W.

description:
Since it's located in the middle of Union Square, it's often crowded anytime of the day. They have seating upstairs if there's no more room downstairs. Service is pretty fast and efficient.

The chicken pad see ew was mediocre at best. The wide rice noodles could be more tender, the Chinese broccoli could be more fresh, the chicken could be more juicy, and the eggs could be more abundant. However, they give so much! I wasn't able to finish the plate, so I took a box to go. I ended up filling the box all the way to the top!

The portions are huge here!
author: Vicki L.

description: Very good food here, especially Pad Thai. Fast and friendly service. The only things I don't like it that the place is so small, it's hard to move when the place is packed.
author: Trung H.

description:
My roommate was craving for Thai dishes and we decided to give King of Thai a try...
It was one of the best decision we've made so far!!

She ordered Pad Siuw Beef and I ordered Pad Thai, both came less than 10 mins after we placed our order. The place was packed but the service was fast!! The food was delicious and hot and we wanted more.. Will definitely come back here for a fast and comfort Thai food!!
author: Annisa J.

description:
They food is good very flavorful! I will have to say the service has not been the best. I keep trying to come here and give this place more chances. And I will continue to do so. 
I know someone who works here and they suggest I spot eating the food b/c it's not the cleanest place.
author: Somi S.

description:
Three friends and I were hungry after a night out and stumbled upon this place while walking to the car at 2am. It's not that small of a place but it was still pretty busy an hour before closing. We sat ourselves and our waitress came over to take our drink orders.

When she brought our waters, we order two plates because we didn't want to be there for long and a Thai Tea. I shared a pad see ew with one other person. Unfortunately it was extremely saucy and seemed considerably sweet which I wasn't expecting. The Thai tea was also extremely strong, which isn't bad but not my favorite. The service was okay but our waters were empty until we wanted to leave.

I'm assuming the amazing reviews are from the intoxicated as this place is one of few places open late. As someone who is usually the dd, I don't know if I'd be back again by choice.
author: Kat C.

description: Quickly Seated. Food had great flavor. Great Service!! Out of town guests loved the place. I'll be back .
author: Jennifer S.

description:
This place has the worst customer service ever!!! Who kicks out their customers so they can have more tables.... The waitresses are super rude. This place is not worth it do not come here save your money the manager doesn't care about their customers.

Poor service!
author: Tatiana D.

description: I was hungry and wanted lunch and came upon this place. Some of the best Thai food I've ever eaten. It was lunch but very delicious. I give it five stars for lunch
author: Bill M.

description: The service was ok, the food was good but I had ordered a pad Thai and they literally only gave me 3 shrimps and 4 pieces of tofu, not worth $13
author: Oanh H.

description:
Over priced and not worth the food. 
We got the chicken screwers and fried chicken over fried rice. chicken screwers were dry and tasteless and for 11.20? 
the fried chicken was too fried making it almost impossible to chew on. also the fried rice was so salty we could not eat it. 

I'm not sure how they do math but how does 11.20+ 12+ tax become 29.90??? 

We did not bother looking at the receipt and just placed out cards on it. Only to be surprised when they brought the card receipt with that total. They didn't even give us the receipt with what we ordered! 
My boyfriend was too nice and tipped them on top of it but I really wanted to complain!! 

Anyways not worth the taste or the money!
author: Sarah S.

description:
I love the restaurant experience, but I recently ordered twice from their delivery service.

It's deplorable. The food is entirely different. It may even have been prepared differently. First, the papaya salad was rank. Then the cashew chicken was a soggy, ugly, disgusting mess. On top of that the food was delivered cold. I threw everything away after one bite.

Assuming it was a fluke, I ordered again a few months later -- same thing.

I finally reached out to grub hub, and was offered a $10 gift card. I threw away $35 worth of food. $10 is like spitting in my face.

I rarely leave 1 star reviews, and understand that often they aren't taken seriously, or the restaurant owner doesn't want to own up to their faults, but truthfully -- this food was terrible.

I've worked in the food industry as a server, cook, and as an owner, my opinion is they are using a commissary that makes the food different for delivery.

Hopefully they use this review to improve, because I genuinely love their restaurant food.
author: william k.

description: This place is so disgusting don't come here. First of all, the waitress don't have great service they never say "Thank you." Secondly, as you're eating the they pass by you with the big trash cans. There's flies hovering around you and your food as you're eating. The pad Thai was flavorless. Save yourself the trip and don't come here.
author: Deniece S.

description:
This place always gets busy. We just happened to luck out on one of the off times. 

Order
---
Papaya salad
-large enough salad for two. Could be made spicier to your liking with a simple addition of chili pepper flakes.

Pad Kee Mao
-was pretty good. A wetter version of Pad See Ew so it was a nice change of pace. 

Duck w red curry
-this was ok. Usually fill this spot with some sort of curry. It really didn't stand out.
author: Phillip R.

description:
Stopped in a Saturday night around 10. We were promptly greeted and seated. We had the chicken satay which was ok with the thinner pieces being very dry and chewy. Also had the #30, a breaded chicken over fried rice dish that was very good. 

Considering the intended positioning it was a bit of a stretch for the 4th star.
author: Ed B.

description:
If you're feeling like Thai food for lunch, dinner or late night and you're at Union Square, this place is the go to spot to fix your Thai craving!

I really like how they are consistent with their food flavor and the turnover time for seating!

Their prices are reasonable and service is the standard.  Don't expect fine dining!  It's not made for that!  It's designed for people to dine, eat and go!  It's also conveniently opened late.

I especially do like their Tom Yum Goong! Not only is it full of tasty spazz, they serve it in a big bowl!  It's surely made for 2 people at least!  Their Pad Thai is my traditional favorite dish to order up!  I like my entrees bursting with zesty flavor so I ask for extra lemon or lime wedges and squeeze all the juice onto the Pad Thai!  The resulting zest is amazing.

I don't think you can go wrong with any of their dishes!  It's generally a good Thai restaurant that you can't shake your head at!
author: Tiffany D.

description: Their lard nar and beef noodle soups are delish and full of flavor. I had my doubts based on the location, but I was pleasantly surprised. The staff is friendly and you usually don't have to wait very long, even during the lunchtime rush. Good prices, good value.
author: Selena L.

description: We didn't want burgers and decided to try the King of Thai Noodle House. We were seated immediately and had water in front of us post haste. The service was good and the food was quick, but the two curry dishes we had were a bit watery. I will say however, they were quite tasty and lived up to medium spicy.
author: Uncle S.

description: came here because we wanted something quick and close to our hotel. ordered the pad thai, duck noodle soup and a thai tea. we were not impressed at all. the food was underwhelming. the duck was so tough needed to use a fork and knife to cut up the meat. the pad thai was bland and came with literally 3 tiny shrimps. we paid a bit over $40 for this meal. will definitely not be back.
author: Christine T.

description: Very bad service. They are only want your money and kick you out . Food too much msg and service bad no water refills. Never go back .
author: Luna B.

description:
I wouldn't recommend coming here unless you're just really hungry and have no better option. There is other Thai food out there which is just much better. 

The nice thing that they have here is that they have crushed peanuts that you can add to your meal.
author: Derrick C.

description:
This place is open super late in a neighborhood with a lot of bars (and not many late night restaurants), that's why people have been generous with their ratings. Is the food good? Absolutely not. Is the service good? They're definitely well meaning and efficient, but in their haste they make errors like bringing the wrong dishes to your table or accidentally giving a vegetarian a chicken dish.

Bottom line, if it's not past 11:00 pm, you should go somewhere else. If it's past 11:00 pm and you're slightly inebriated or just need some cheap eats, all bets are off and you've got the green light on King of Thai.
author: Akash K.

description:
Not the cleanest place, nor the most stylized/pretty, but the servers are friendly and the food comes very quickly. 

My friends and I had the duck noodle soup, which was pretty good. It's not a like fancy duck soup, but more like noodle soup + duck. It's like street food. One of my friends got the pineapple fried rice, which was pretty good, but didn't seem to be of meal quality to me (perhaps better as a side). 

The hot Thai tea is quite good, and it's only a buck a cup.
author: Jacob S.

description: It was ok. I ordered the fried rice with pork. It didn't have a lot of flavor and the meat wasn't very tasteful. Ordered egg rolls and the sauce that came with those was very yummy and sweet. So I just asked for more of the sauce and added it to my fried rice.
author: Carey K.

description: Last time we were here food was food. Today we ordered  chicken satay has no taste and worst of all meat was not fresh, fried chicken over fried rice, chicken was fresh, batter slightly thinner than my shoe sole , oak see u was ok. Service is good
author: Don C.

description: I personally really enjoy this place. I get the duck noodle soup. When I venture out (curry, noodles) always disappointed and wish I got the duck noodle soup. Stay there and you will enjoy it. Sometimes the duck pieces are small and that's when it sucks
author: Victor D.

description: The food was ok... a bit greasy which was off putting. One of the servers, (an elderly woman) was fantastic. However the rest of the wait staff were no so friendly. They seemed bothered every time we asked for anything, whether is was a refill on drinks, silverware, napkins. Probably will not be visiting again.
author: madelynn d.

description: Staff was friendly and fast. The pad see ew I had was pretty tasty. Go here if you want something uncomplicated but good!
author: Evert P.

description: The waiters are very nice and the food comes out fast and warm. Both our plates were good.
author: Gonzalo M.

description: this place wasnt fancy but they are good, and great for big parties in the upstairs room. Regular quality and conveniently located near shopping. Very reasonably priced
author: David C.

description: This place has hands down the best Pad Thai I've ever tried - it's really flavorful and a good portion. The other dishes they have I'm not so sure about but I highly recommend trying their Pad Thai if you ever come here. Also I've been here twice and the 2nd time I came we literally ordered and got our food in what felt like just minutes it was crazy fast.
author: Emily Z.

description: This place used to be my fave spot for late night thai food in SF.  Last time I went they rushed me to order saying the kitchen was going to close.  I was like that's weird I thought they were open for like another few hours?  However, I had been drinking so I did what I was told rather than thinking it through and being my mouthy self.  I did as instructed and ordered right away.  The basil chicken is the best and spicy perfection.  The fish cakes though, rubbery and not good sauce as I remember.  Something about this place has changed and not for the better.  I still give them a high 5 on the basil chicken, but I did not like rushing to order and as I was leaving 40 mins later they were still seating.  I think the waitress was trying to leave or something weird like that.
author: Andrea M.

description: I came here with my sister and her friend, and there was a table available in the corner near the entrance. No one came to seat us, so we we decided to seat ourselves at the table. About a min later, the hostess came and asked us who seated us there, and we said ourselves. She then told us that the table was for handicapped people only. Really? I saw no handicap sign. But okay fine, no problem. She told us to go back and wait to be seated, and she pointed to the sign on the door that says "please wait to be seated". We then apologized. A few mins later, she sat us at a table in the front. I looked down on my chair, and saw that there was rice on the seat. Gross. Anyway, I ordered the combination beef noodle soup with egg noodles. It was yummy and full of flavor. The soup would've tasted a lot better if it was actually spicy. As we were leaving, I noticed there were people sitting at the "handicapped" table who weren't even handicapped. Seriously? Goodbye.
author: Tiffany T.

description: It is OK. Food price and portion are reasonable regarding it is located around union square. Service is good as well.
author: Li D.

description:
Living across the street ... it is one of my FAVORITES for quick eats !  I love the duck noodle soup!  The fact that you can choose what type of noodle you want for each dish is great! The place is quite loud and busy busy busy.  They  are not known for "friendliness" but are efficient and also deliver locally!
The food is fresh, wholesome, and very inexpensive.
author: Tricia Y.

description: These are the dishes the restaurant does well: any fried rice dishes, and the roast duck noodle soup is really great. Prices are affordable. Service has always been really nice here.
author: Mary H.

description: The good it's open super late. But food is just mediocre, at least it's reasonably priced for being in the heart of union square
author: Thomas N.

description: Shrimp Pad Thai was pretty good. I liked that they used thin noodles and that it was not too greasy. Duck noodle soup had a dark, flavorful broth and was very filling. I would skip on the duck fried rice, very basic. I didn't like that while we were eating, the workers rolled huge garbage bins 1 inch next to our table multiple times. I get it we're in SF, but there's absolutely no excuse!
author: Briget P.

description: Great food, fast service and reliable consistency. I really love this place and its pad Thai is the best that I have ever had. The pad Thai is flavourful but overwhelmingly sweet. The heat, sourness and sweetness are balanced really well! Highly recommended!
author: Barry L.

description:
Came here only to find out Bangkok Noodle closed down. So i ordered roast duck noodle soup (which is what i order@Bangkok)to go.  
Comparison,  the broth and duck is very fatty/oily, (poor quality)  broth also  lacking flavor.  
Bangkok's version was much flavorful. Broth was more robust and had clarity. As for the duck meaty and the skin even though soaked in broth still had texture 
I hope something good will come out of Bangkok's closure.
author: EmmettsGuRL C.

description:
This place has been a staple for me ever since they first opened up. They are packed for most of the days and they even get long lines outside on certain times. I introduced this place to my girlfriend and she fell in love with it. The location is really nice which is right around the block by Union Square so when you get hungry while shopping, they are right there ready to fill you up. 

The food here are really good. My usual order is the Fried Chicken on Top of Fried Rice. The fried chicken isn't really that special and it tends to be overcooked (to a point it has become too hard) at times but what salvages this meal is the fried rice. Their fried rice is off the hook and it's one of the reason why my girlfriend's favorite meal is BBQ Pork Fried Rice. 

Another meal that is really good here are their soups. They have a wide variety of soups and I came to like their Slice Beef Noodle Soup a lot. The broth on that noodle soup is so hearty with a good amount of spice. It's also a nice go to meal after a good night of drinking. Trust me, my girlfriend and I had tried it already and it works wonders. 

From our previous visits, we've also tried the Pad See-Ew. It is really good and sweet at the same time. The only problem was it was burnt when we ordered it the second time on a different occasion. Other than that, the meal is really good as long as they don't mess up the meal.

They have really nice desserts too. Their Fried Banana with Ice cream (of your choice) is a really good way to finish your meal. You will get 2 fried bananas and two big scoops of ice cream. You also get to choose the ice cream you would want (from coconut, green tea, thai tea, or vanilla) with your dessert. 

Overall, this place is a go to spot for me whenever I'm back in San Franciso and it is a must for me and my girlfriend to stop by this place whenever we are around. Just keep in mind that the meals tend to be not consistent at times and the service isn't really that consistent either (but they are good for most of the time). And also keep in mind that there will always be a lot of people, but the wait is really worth it.
author: Dennis M.

description:
Well I went there and the waitress got the order correctly but the kitchen made a mistake.
My mom can't eat eggs and they put eggs in it and they took back and never bought a new one out and tried to charge me for it. So once we got it straight I paid for soda and what we did eat. 
As I was leaving I man was leaving the Restraunt and heard me telling my mom about the situation and I am going to assume he was the owner.
GREAT guy he refunded me all my money spoke to me very politely and made me understand that my happiness was more important than the money.
Now that's customer service!
I recommend any one to try this place because they do care how you feel.
And I am African American and that's a plus for a Asian place they don't discriminate they are all about service!!
Thumbs up to this place!!
author: Yolanda J.

description: Fast food service that's all. I would definitely check out the other locations such as on Clement or Taraval. Be assured that it will be crowded and chaotic because of it's downtown SF location, right next to Union Square. I know that I should be reviewing for the food, but for the entire experience I feel like I have a duty to talk about the restroom. When I walked in, it was pretty nasty, especially with the urinal. I can't bring myself to talk more about it but that beneath the urinal was a dish tub (the same ones used to collect used dishes, utensils, etc) filled with urine. I hope that "bus tub" is used solely for the restroom and not for dishes. Then again, why is it there and when will the urinal get fixed?
author: John Michael R.

description: I have been coming here for years. Food is always excellent. Food is  served hot and portion sizes are large. Egg Rolls are delicious!  Chicken Noodle Soup with Flat Rice Noodles is piping hot and full of chicken. Pad Thai is rich in flavor. The combination of chicken, egg and peanuts with bean sprouts and tofu always hits the spot.
author: Richard G.

description:
Ok,so today i'd ordered some food frm this place,I've literally no idea wht was tht,but the thing that i wanna share is whn i'd entered in reso. I just fell in love with 1 of the waitress,thn i seen some other waitress and i again fell in love,omg,thn again,every 1 is smiling like this is their wedding,seriously atmosphere of this restaurant is just amazing,and food too,
I will go again but now this time i will eat there so i can settle my heart..
I'd nvr expected this heaven below my hotel room.
for tht cashier....
author: Nikhil P.

description: Food was flavorless but fast. Nice sized portions and great if you wanna get in and get out.
author: Aishani P.

description: Have always been going to this place in the early days but the standard of food has been going down. I ordered green chicken curry with rice the previous occasion and I literally can count the number of chicken strips inside. My latest last ever trip is Thai fried rice as insisted by a fellow colleague. It is pricey compared to another Thai joint. Too salty and can taste the MSG inside. And the Thai milk tea is sure recipe to becoming a diabetic.
author: Jeremy K.

description:
Rude. Basically wouldn't server or acknowledge me. Wanted to give it a chance despite the fact that it was filthy. They have signs up asking folks who use Yelp not to give them a bad rating but they definitely earned one from me.

They also kept locking the door during business hours and screaming at patrons who tried to enter. It was quite strange.
author: James P.

description:
I would say overall this place is just meh. But it's quick for a work lunch meal. Don't expect great service, but it's also not bad either.  The one thing I do like about this place is that they come out with the food fast. 

I ordered the pad sew beef. The beef came out pretty dry. It needed the sauce just to have some flavor.  The sauce was sweet. And you guys know how much I dislike anything too sweet. So this dish isn't for me. 

The next thing I tried was the papaya salad. It wasn't too bad, but beware of the heat.  It does have a strong spicy kick to it. Not even to make me cry, but it does have a lingering spicy taste. 

This is probably one of those places for me to come back only if I needed a quick bite for lunch or its a group lunch. But if I do come back, I'll have to try some of the other dishes.
author: Shirley C.

description: So here's a FIRST.  Ordered delivery from this DUMP and received the WRONG ORDER TWICE!!  Wanted spicy, got bland and tasteless, no tofu and FULL of tofu, extra sauce and not even half a miniature cup (you know the size) full.  Notified delivery company (no easy task) and had the same crap delivered AGAIN!  Threw it all in the trash and ate carrots for dinner.   DO NOT EVEN THINK ABOUT IT!!!
author: Lynne P.

description: This used to be my favorite place but the taste has definitely changed. It has gone from great to mediocre.
author: Robin W.

description: This place is famous for a reason. They have every Thai food you can think of for a very good deal with enormous food portions! The ambiance is not there but if you want to have the best Thai food in San Francisco, this it it! Despite this place looking like an old canteen everything else was top notch! Very happy customer!
author: Ayaka H.

description:
Yummy noodles! Very authentic restaurant. Went here with some Thai friends and they suggested some things that I should order. I got a thin slices pork soup with vermicelli noodles. Super yum. One of my friends got the seafood soup with flat rice noodle and that was incredible! I kind Of with i has gotten that soup. But maybe next time. 

Service was decent. Lots of seating. We got seated in a semiprivate alcove in the back because we had large group. They also have upstairs room. 

Prices were affordable. 

Good rainy day food. Or if you want something tasty and cheap.
author: Laima K.

description: I just went there for get my foods and I ask for extra chilly . The staff look at me and talk to another stuff call me pussy bitch in Thai word . I do understand Thai very well . Holy crap I can't believe this is very crazy .
author: Linda M.

description: Came here on a visit to San Francisco. Our hotel referred this restaurant . I'll make this quick and short the food was good but the place was disgustingly dirty filthy. Couldn't finish my food because of this splatters on the wall
author: Darling Darla R.

description:
Great spot!

Pros - Good location, great tasting food, generous portions, fast service, affordable food & late hours.


Cons - not the biggest selection of vegetarian options, waitress wasn't too proficient in English, temperature cold because doors needed to be kept open for "ventilation".
author: Raj M.

description: I have eaten here before and, while trying to stop eating mall chinese food all the time, decided to come by for lunch. It is pretty full but not crazy busy. The staff aren't rude, per se, but aren't attentive. I order a ground meat with rice dish. The food comes and the server comes by, puts the plate down, then walks away. She isn't running off to another table. She goes and sits down at the entryway. The plate in front of me has a cup of rice and very little meet. I mean the type of portion that you would put on your plate at a family gathering, where you do not want to eat something but know, if you don't take some for show, your mother will put a whole lot more on your plate. I mean, seriously, smaller than shockingly small. So nobody comes around to check on me so I start eating (I should have refused the plate)  but it is essential a flavored mush of rice. The taste was drowned out by the rice. So I stop eating because I have decided I will need to go eat lunch, again, somewhere else anyway. Finally, a server comes with a check and asks if everything is OK. I tell her that there was barely any food on the plate and that I should have refused the meal. I am not trying to be a dick but that was the truth. She walks away. She does not come back. I know I could have been difficult, refused to pay, made a scene. If I did, I may have gotten something else or more for my $18 but I cut my losses and ran. I am not that picky about food, thus the penchant to eat in the mall. When I factor in service, portion size, taste of food and price I see this if ridiculous, also I need to just walk away or send food back, if this happens again. I eat take out often and this was the smallest amount of food ever. Others seem to like it but I will never be back.
author: Michael P.

description:
Disclaimer: I may have been a little (okay.. pretty) drunk when I dined here, but I would like to think that I still have standards when intoxicated!

Wanting to grab a bite in the city before heading back home (East Bay/South Bay), my friends and I stumbled upon King of Thai Noodle House on Yelp. Hallelujah! Surprisingly, the place was half full at 2am. I guess all the drunk people had the same idea. We were seated right away and given ample time to pick what we wanted to eat. 

- Pad Kee Mao: SO GOOD. I thought it was so delicious that I asked my friend if the dish was good cause I was drunk or if it was actually THAT good. He said the latter. I can trust him, right?
- Crab Fried Rice: I only had a couple of bites of this dish, but I thought it was just okay. The crab pieces were flavorful though!

Service was friendly and fast, and our water cups were always filled. This ain't a bad place to get your drunchies late at night!
author: Christine S.

description: Very meh food in a convenient location. The pad see ew was average with a mixture of random vegetables added in. There was only one choice of side/small dish, cucumber salad drenched in sweet and sour sauce. Everything came out quickly though! Tamarind candies with the check at the end were a cute and tasty touch!
author: Angelique A.

description: I wish they would give a bigger portion for their Thai noodles plates variety. I was still not full after eating one order of Pad Thai.  Noodle raw materials don't cost that much, why so stingy?
author: Caroline Y.

description: Delicious home style Thai food. The prices were a bargain. The restaurant is a little dirty on the walls. But you can see the kitchen and that was clean. Great food. Not the best dining atmosphere.
author: Mary C.

description:
We were messing around with cable cars and got hungry.  King of Thai noodles offered food, so we struck an agreement to pad Thai noodles and a bowl of Thai noodle soup.  Hit the spot, but we've had far better Thai food.  The place was crowded from the time we stepped in until we left and we were eating after 1 pm...  it was very warm in the dining room.

I'd come back here, if I were Jonesin for Thai food, but won't make any special trips.
author: Keith K.

description:
Foods great. Take it to go. don't have them sit you in the back, it seems and feels gross. I would rave about this place until they sat us in the back near the restroom... do yourself a favor and take your food to go so you don't start accidentally grossing yourself out by analyzing everything cause of your surroundings. I'm disappointed, cause the foods great!

Dear business, 
Your sanitary sucks. I was a huge fan until then. Good food though!
author: Charmaine M.

description:
Pad Thai-medium portions but lack of flavor. Seeing how busy they are, I would not be surprised if they made one huge wok full of pad thai with minimal ingredients. I have been to many thai restaurants and this pad thai was seriously lacking flavor.

Papaya Salad- asked for a spicy but came back sweet. A good som tom salad I believe should have a sweet, sour, and spicy taste that makes you want to keep eating. However, this one was sweet and sour and was also lacking some serious flavor. 

Beef Combination Noodle Soup- easily my preferred go to dish (been here twice) because it is very savory and flavorful when compared to the other dishes we ordered. The soup did come out warm and not hot, but I understand that this preference is subjective.

Overall, the service was quick and pleasant and this is definitely a "get in eat and get out" thai food joint. It makes sense being located in a very touristy part of town. The food itself was mediocre at best and pretty bland to be honest. I will be exploring other options of thai food in the city.
author: Edward C.

description: Where do I even begin?? Food is sooo yummy!! Open a location in LA pls lol. You bet I'll be back here again on my next SF trip . They also have free delivery with a minimum charge of $20.
author: Rachel A.

description: Five stars for their food because I'm now obsessed with pad see ew which is basically just thick cut noodles with soy sauce. I also ordered pad Thai and I knew that I wouldn't like it but my friend wanted to try it so I thought why not give it another taste. Food came extremely fast under ten minutes since they served us water. The pad Thai was horrible because the smell is just nasty. I'm not saying it doesn't taste good as pad Thai but I just don't like pad Thai in general at all. But the pad see ew is a must try. You get to order your choice of meat which I chose chicken and it was amazing. I love pad see ew and obsessed. Minus two stars cuz of their service. This lady which the short hair(the older one) sat us down into this crowded two seater and I didn't really feel comfortable. Next when I asked for a togo box to put the pad Thai in and she asked if I wanted her to do it and she gave me this look. Like okay I wasn't planning on asking but if she wanted to give good customer service why ask right. Anyways the other lady with the short hair is nicer and she's the younger one. Total I pad $27 for two dishes(tipped $5 because the younger short haired lady is nice). Overall I would come back only when I crave pad see ew. Definitely a must try when coming here.
author: Lisa W.

description: While I can't always depend on getting seated right away due to the long line of customers, I can definitely depend on the yumminess of the Sliced Roast Duck in red curry sauce.   It's comfort food after a day of walking around the City.
author: Leonor R.

description: If you're hungry, and don't want to spend a fortune in Union Square, then this is a great spot. However, the amount of people that are herded through this place will make your head spin. No one is rude about hurrying you along, but your food will come FAST, your water glasses will stay full, but lingering too long to discuss the philosophical depth and irony of your fortune cookie might entice some encouragement to "move along" by the waitstaff.*Evil glares may be awarded by impatient unseated patrons hanging out at at the entrance. This haste makes the experience, cleanliness, and ambiance a little rough around the edges, but hey, I wouldn't strike a star off of five for it. You might...but not me.
author: Andrew W.

description: Blaaaaah.  The word I use when thinking of the meal I ate here.   (The one and only meal ill ever eat here).  A lot of $$ for little flavor.  Tourist trap without any ambiance.  Go ANYWHERE else and you'll be better off.
author: Steve L.

description: Amazing spicy food and noodles, if you are cravings for it!!  My go to place for late night grub.
author: V K.

description: Wow, whoever made my meal did not give a crap.   This was hands down the absolute worst THAI takeout I've ever received.  It was totally inedible and nothing remotely like the photo.  It was slimy and the breading on the chicken slid off all the chicken and turned into mush.   I couldn't believe my eyes when I opened up the container.    I poked at it for a while trying to make sense of it but after one bite I tossed it out.  Never ever again.
author: Matt D.

description: I'll have to say this. This place was crazy packed  when I got in here. I thought to myself, it's right next to Powell, it's the holidays, and it's Thai food. Well that's true for everything. But damn the other locations are just as packed and "line out the doorish". So that has to tell you something about this place. It's pretty damn good. With all of those factors in mind, it's a great spot to eat near the HIGHLY "4 dollar sign" Union Square. Come eat up folks. It won't break your bank!
author: Jonas S.

description: This place used to be the bomb, but it has gone way down hill.  They seated us upstairs and it has dirty stairs and a greasy feeling to it, not to mention hot.  I will be looking for another restaurant.  I got the ground chicken and it is usually awesome, but this time it was not, and I found a chicken bone while eating. Got the wonton soup, and the wontons were nasty with a weird taste.
author: Jon E.

description:
We were walking out of the pub after a few pints and moderately hungry when we were accosted by a few people passing out flyers. Looking at the menu and deciding noodles were a good option (especially since they promised that grandma was back in the kitchen), decided to stop in. 

The menu is pretty typical, nothing really popped as too quirky or different. Decided on a bowl of Tom Yum and a noodle dish. 

The food was solid and the people super nice. Not extra fancy, but a great stop with some family and friends for a bite.
author: Sean M.

description: Found this place looking for something open late...food was mediocre at best. The only positive I can say is that the food came out quick. Other than that service was horrible, there were bugs in the restaurant and then the highlight of the night was them rolling their (FULL) trash cans through the restaurant passed our table. Definitely pass on this place!
author: Mish E.

description: Good location while walking around Chinatown. I had the #17 Five Spices Chicken beef broth bowl. I'm not well-versed on Pho but it was fine. I managed to put too much Sriracha in my bowl so avoid that if you can. They were kind about replacing my broth. I liked the tea!
author: A. D.

description:
One day I was craving for some thai food, and had planned to go to Bangkok near Union Square, but it was open that day, and my friend had told me that not far from where we were, existed the King of Thai Noodle House. It felt like seeing a light house for a hopeless crew.

Two floors = plenty of seats = minimal wait time. We were seated less than 3min during dinner time. I asked the waiter, 'what's good? ', '17' she said, telling me this magic number in a confident way.  So I listened. and it was very good! Was slightly sweeter than I had hoped. 

Reasonably priced for such a touristy location.
author: Cheng C.

description:
Fast (like 5-8 minutes after ordering)
Reasonably priced (~$10-12 entrees)
Solid taste (you get what you pay for)
Wide array of chili options
Classic American thai options (can I get a pad thai or pad see ew?) 

My sister and I stopped by after we spent way too much buying clothes and decided we could offset that with fast and fairly priced thai food. I was oddly craving pad see ew. We dropped in around 6 and although the restaurant was packed we had no wait. It appears they can accommodate large groups and the constant chatter throughout the floor makes it feel like you are in a bustling city center (just like union square). We ordered the seafood pad thai and beef pad see ew. The pad thai for me had the wrong noodles (more cylindrical than flat) and wasn't as sweet as I normally like. The seafood was tender although my sister was mildly disappointed with the lack of imitation crab. The beef pad see ew was great and cooked with the traditional chinese broccoli. Finally the jars of chili varieties is the deal maker for me. Every thai restaurant should have this. It was chili powder, sambal chili paste, peanuts, and pickled green chilis. I like to stick with the powder and the pickled.
author: Tammy T.

description:
This place is decent overall for the price you pay. Its usually not so busy so you get seated quickly. The staff is nice and trys to check on your table, give em a break when they forget...their dealing with worldwide people everyday in the busiest location in the city. 

The food always good and doesnt feel like they under serve or over serve you. Sometimes the food can be a bit greasy, depending on the hour this can increase. 

I tried all different plates in the menu here before from fried rice, noodles, soups and the appetizer. You shouldnt be disappointed and their spicy is spicy which i always like about this place. 

This is why it gets Five star. It meets standard considering all above.
author: Yosof R.

description: This is a very good and reasonably priced option for casual dining near Union Square. Friendly and efficient staff. Good and reasonably-priced food (including the pineapple fried rice). Fairly basic atmosphere, and can be noisy. In colder weather, try to be seated away from the door, since insulation and heat are somewhat lacking.
author: Jethro B.

description: Nice food and very reasonablw price. The best thing is that it is located in the centre. Staff is very kind
author: Sweatha R.

description:
We were looking for a quick dinner, and we found it. Walking Union Square we were craving noodles. Looks can be deceiving. We though this was a hole in the wall when you walk in, but we were led to an upstairs dining section. In actually, this place is pretty big!

Ordered the Thom Kha Soup with Chicken and the Pad See Ew. Decent portions and the flavors were good. They didn't ask for the level of spiciness when we ordered. Needed to add more spice to the entrees. 

Service was OK. We had to wave down some of the servers for help since we ran out of water a few times. Good alternative in the Union Square area if you're craving Thai.
author: Maria C.

description:
Amazing restaurant with amazing food!!!  
Their service is good, they are very nice people. If you come here I highly recommend trying the dish of curry, just amazing !!! 
Everyone can afford to eat there. The dishes come fast and it's not expensive.
author: Kim Z.

description: This place is always super busy & full of people, but somehow that's not a problem at all! They are open super late too so that's great. They are FAST, like...insanely fast. Tried the pumpkin chicken curry & another noodle dish I can't think of the name for. It was the big flat noodles w Chinese broccoli, egg, and chicken. DELICIOUS! Everything was great & they were very attentive.
author: Ruth W.

description: I ordered Kao Gra Prow to-go and their portion of the food is ridiculously small compared to the rice they gave you. I felt like I ordered the rice with a side of minced ground chicken.
author: Sandy C.

description: What I ordered wasn't bad but I've had better, and the waitress wasn't a great listener it was very annoying. But overall its an ok thai place I just don't have the urge to go again.
author: Wendell J.

description: This spot was so good!!! Was open till 3am it was 1am when I went. That first of sold me. Second of all it was still packed at 1am! Great flavors! Good size portions! I will Defiantly be back!
author: Tuna O.

description: After coming across several thau restaurants this  was the only one that was full. Luckily we were seated quickly. After we were seated it started to get more busy.  I ordered my usual, chichen pad Thai and Tom Kha Gai, hot but not Thai hot. Pad Thai was great on spicy level but wasn't on point flavor consistency wise. It wasn't bad, I've had worse but something was definitely missing. The tom Kha Gai was great! Lots of chicken and mushrooms but that was it. Few Bay leaves but no other veggies. Had to add chili flakes to add spicy. One friend ordered seafood soup and also asked for mild and had to add to it as it was flavorless. Other friend ordered garlic chicken it was really good but waiter forgot to put in order.  We felt a bit rushed to finish our meal but despite it all I would return.
author: Rocio A.

description:
There is usually a long line of people in front of this restaurant. When I stumbled upon the restaurant in between meals time with no line, I decided to go in to get a quick bite. Also, I am new to SF and I have been searching for authentic Thai food. The service was fast and solid. The open kitchen gave authentic vibes with a thai lady peeling and shredding green papaya. The food was promising. I had chicken larb salad with a side of sticky rice and Pad see ew.
