Chicken larb was a bit bland--It lacked herbs and spices that I am used to. I may give it a shot again and ask for it to be extra spicy. 

The pad sew ew was good. The ratio of ingredients was slightly off--there were only few pieces of Chinese broccoli in a sea of flat noodles. My partner said the dish was salty--perhaps too much soy sauce?

So far, King Of Thai Noodle House is the most decent Thai food I have had in this area. Next time, I will to try Papaya salad, Pad Kee Mao, and Noodle soup.
author: Ari Y.

description: Just came back from this place for dinner, and it definitely was the last time I will eat here. My noodles came with a long black hair. These things happen, but when I pointed it out to the server, instead of an apology, I got questioned as to whether or not the hair was mine. I pointed to my own short hair, and told her obviously not. The bowl was abruptly taken away without an apology or question to see if I wanted something else. This was not a matter of a language barrier as I'm a native Thai speaker, and I'm also fluent in English. Additionally, the food was meh. Don't let others tell you otherwise.
author: Pongphat K.

description: The food are great but just like a typical fastfoods, the service are not good. I went there but they just gave me the menu and no one gets my order. The next visit i did was i am waiting at the door no one seems to notice i am waiting then suddenly a gentlemen come in amd they assist him first instead of me the same old lady that i encountered before do o went out. Again i went there with my friends they took our order but when they serve they serve it to my friends mine was late 7 mins later and serve a wrong one. again the same old short hair lady whom i encounteer. Bad service,,
author: Niwre T.

description:
I used to work at the Westfield on Market so this place was my go to spot whenever I needed a good bowl of noodles. I'm not a huge fan of Thai food but their soups are soooo good! The place is bigger than it looks although I feel like their upstairs seatings got a bit smaller than the last time I was there. The female servers are very sweet and attentive..the guy that usually greets and seats you never smiles but I think that's just his personality so I don't really care.

I always get their Tom Yum (spicy with egg noodles) and it never disappoints. Their vegetarian fried rolls are delish! Friend enjoyed his duck fried rice although it looked like it was 95% rice and hardly any duck meat. 

The only downside is that they for sure use MSG bc their portions are pretty big and I never end up feeling quite full and sometimes I'll feel a bit dehydrated. But if that doesn't bother you def check it out..they have a pretty extensive menu. If you're a health freak omg I can't stand preservatives GMO blah blah blah, then this ain't your joint
author: Jenn K.

description: My and my son's Favorite eating place in San Francisco, nice staff and original taste of the food
author: Rita S.

description:
Ran in here in a super duper rush to grab some food and it was super duper tasty. I can't speak much to the service or anything other than some noodles, pad thai is what stands out the most - delicious. We originally called in some food to take out, and ended up eating it there (quick change of plans). They didn't offer plates or anything, so we just ate out of our plastic to go containers, with plastic cutlery...

Food and ingredients were fresh. We did order a veggie and meat dish, from what I recall, it was mainly bell peppers, and nothing too special or memorable. Being that the place is called King of Thai Noodle House, maybe that's a sign to stick to the Noodle offerings on the menu, right? Not a bad place for a fast food spin on thai noodles.
author: Nikki R.

description: There are a few king of Thai around the city but this location is by far the most grubby one. I've been here a couple of times and all the times I've been here the costumer service was never great. My friend and I decided to come here for dinner, we first went into the restaurant one of the worker sat us by the door. Mind you last time I came here they didn't not have a table by the door. They added it and let me tell you it is a huge mistake. The area for the table was limited. We barely had enough space. Few years ago, the food was much better. Now, it just taste very bland and seemed like they just mix everything together to form a dish. The portions are smaller every visit. As for my order, I ordered pad see ew and it taste nothing like stir fry, the rice noodles were overcook that made it mushy. While I was trying to take bites of my food there were fruit flies around my table. Then took extra bites and I found a little surprise in my plate. A long coarse curly hair. How pleasant is that. It completely ruined my appetite.I admittedly called the one of the workers over (I think she was the manager) and told her that I found a piece of hair in my food. She act like she didn't understand English so I had to repeat myself again. She then offered to switch out my food for a new plate but I denied so she then offered me a 10% discount. I didn't want to cause too big of scene so I just accepted it. It was just an total unpleasant meal. I will give 0 stars if I can but too bad the lowest on Yelp is a one star. Also, if you want good authentic Thai food this is not the place. Found out on Yelp that the food safety score is low and that probably explain why they didn't put the scorecard on display.
author: Sandra Z.

description: This place is cheap, quick and efficient.  It satisfies the Thai food craving without OSHA Thai prices.  The pad thai is good, larb was ok and the yellow curry was yummy.
author: Chris L.

description: Reasonably priced thai food here for the large portions you get, and always seemingly bustling, even at 930 at night. Their fried rices are pretty good. Biggest downside is that their noodles are definitely on the sweet side (I had the Pad See-Ew most recently), to the point that it gets kind of annoying by the 2/3 mark. I'd ask them to lay off some of the sugar next time if I order noodles.
author: Linus W.

description:
Great restaurant after a bar or a club. I do appreciate the fast service and the tasty food. 

What I didn't like? The waiter asked every 5 minutes if I was done, which is pretty annoying. When I'm eating in a restaurant, I want to take my time, no need to hurry me. Second point, the restrooms are dirty, with a horrible smell.
author: Lino M.

description: Ordered the pad thai for 13 dollars and it only came with 3 shrimps and no lime. It doesn't really taste as authentic as the ones in Thailand. Maybe its modified to suit the local's taste
author: Kyrene T.

description: We were recommended this place upon visiting San Francisco, so we were excited to try it. Upon walking in, it smelled good, food like good. We ordered our food, but was never served. We saw people who were sat after us served. When we brought this to the waitresses attention, and that we were leaving;?they just told us we could leave. No explanation, no compensation, no effort to keep our business. We were there on a random Sunday afternoon; no overly busy time, no holiday weekend. We are very disappointed with this place and will never go back. If I could give 0 stars, I would
author: Noel A.

description: Came in for the Pork Noodle yesterday as a last minute dinner option before heading down to the airport. The broth is very traditional (meaning it is very bland), you need to add Fish Sauce, Chili, Sugar, etc. on your own to really bring out the flavor of the broth. The most important ingredient is definitely the Fish Sauce, it might smell terrible, but it will make your noodles scrumptious. The price is very reasonable and the service was great.
author: Margaret L.

description:
The last time I was In San Francisco I was treated to one of the BEST Thai meals I have had since my visits to Thailand. The food at King of Thai Noodle House always tastes fresh with the proper combination of spices and basil. After eating at this restaurant the first time I made it my mission to take my Thai wife there to get her impression of the food the next time I returned to SF.

This past week I traveled back to SF with my wife in tow and I was determined to fulfill my mission. We returned to King of Thai Noodle House and we were also joined by my buddy Stuart who originally turned me on to this place. We ordered Pumpkin Curry, Kao Gra Prow, Sea with Egg Noodles and Gravy and 3 sides of white rice. The food came out of the kitchen within 15 minutes. The quality and taste were GREAT as I remember. 
As a side bar since I have travelled through Thailand with my wife and have had many different types of rice of all constancies. We felt the quality and consistency of the rice was excellent (it comes to you  on your plate in the shape of a heart) but if they gave patrons the choice of Jasmine rice it would make the dining experience totally superb! If you like Thai food I recommend this place highly. Prices are Moderate, Seating is abundant and it is not a shirt and tie, napkin in your lap type place.

 
If you like Thai food or would like to see more about  Thailand, Food and culture check out our videos at 

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCt8AzSNcTWcKxHpZXxwfd3g


Please leave a comment!
author: Jeff H.

description:
Consistent quality, price, and service.  I can always count on this place to be my back up for those times when Cheesecake Factory's wait is too long or when all the other restaurants in the area are closed.  Although this is not the best Thai food, it is consistently good and undeniably a safe bet that the food will be liked by everyone.  My thoughts on the dishes after coming multiple times:

YES:

Papaya Salad : on the more Vietnamese-y side, with just fish sauce and NO SHRIMP PASTE, which i am completely fine with, just the way I like

Pad See Ew : awesome, like a non-greasy sweeter version of chow fun

Pad Kee Mao : love the basil and the slight addition of spice

Pumpkin Curry : always tasty and with some sweet coconut milk

Pineapple Fried Rice : a safe dish that kids always like

Sticky Rice Mango : they only provide when it's in season, i appreciate the sweet mangos and the salted coconut milk

MAYBE:

Noodle Soups : decent but not the best on the menu, it'd be better at a chinese restaurants

Fried Banana w/ Ice Cream: the batter is a little on the stickier side, but banana + COCONUT ice cream is good (i prefer it over the thai tea and green tea ice cream)

~~
I don't really dislike anything on the menu which makes this place great choice when you are not sure where to take your friends. service is erratic since it's a place that shares tips and gets busy and they sometimes don't provide utensils or water right away. food comes out lightning quick every time, which is awesome if you've got a show to catch or have to make it into the club by a certain time though!

overall, i can definitely count on this restaurant to provide a good quick meal for a decent price
author: Tina A.

description: We ordered one beef noodle and one tom yam gong, the size is generous but the broth is just too salty. We happen to get a bowl of noodle with strong detergent smell, and the server changed that for us. However, that makes us hesitate to go there again.
author: Nikko Y.

description: Food was great. We had the seafood soup with rice noodle, Duck Stew soup with egg noodle and Pad See Ew. All tasty and we finished it all (mostly). Service was okay. Location where we sat was okay but we were tucked in a place that was easily forgotten (in their defense it was very busy when we arrived). Everyone seemed friendly enough but we were checked on maybe once and that was after we ordered and before our food was served. The next time we saw anyone was when we were done and had to pay our bill. The price was comparable to everywhere else. We will definitely come back.
author: Rovi D.

description: Sorry but folks rating this dump much higher than I would.  I love good Asian food but this was not it.  Chicken had no flavor.  Fried rice was good but reat of dish had nothing special.  On Union Square and hardy any English spoken which for tourist is no fun.
author: Sam A.

description: The one star is for the service. The food deserves 0 stars. My sister and I went to this place by accident and SHOULD have read the reviews. We ordered the seafood salad and the pad-see-eww. 5 minutes after ordering our order, the food came out! What?! 5 minutes for a dish to come out during the busy lunch hour - that's not possible unless the dish was pre-made. I now believe they have the noodles in buffet platters in the back and just piled it on a plate because the ingredients DID NOT taste fresh at all! Also, the ground meat was cold but the noodles were hot. It tasted greasy and salty. As for the salad, again, super salty with no other flavors. I am a huge thai food fan and have NEVER been this disappointed in a Thai restaurant in my life. I rarely give yelp reviews but this place should definitely be avoided unless you don't really care about what you're eating. NEVER going back again. I am shock that the place was busy because the food was not good at all. I think it's because location wise, they are next to union square and tourists are not aware of the yucky food being served in that restaurant. I joked to my husband later that the food tasted like a "Do it yourself" Thai Food experiment gone wrong. Next time I want Thai food in SF, I'll go somewhere else. Thanks.
author: Yer Y.

description: Stopped by for a quick dinner. Service was fast and friendly. Tried the seafood noodle soup and pad see-ew, very flavorful and portions were good. Food came very quickly and hot! The restaurant is clean and good for older kids (5+). Give it a try if you're in the area.
author: Veronica E.

description:
Okay if you are expecting a first class restaurant then No. But if you want some good and fast Thai food anytime of the night this is the place. one of our regular go to places when we just need to have something quick and fast and that will fill us up. 

Food is awesome for the price. my favs are the pad see ew, pad thai, #39 the fried chicken on rice, panang curry and thai iced tea. 

its delicious, not the healthiest.
author: Anuj C.

description: My top competitor for SF Best Thai Food. The other one is Chabaa. I like King Thai's Pad Thai, the service was amazingly quick, place is crowded most of the time, the food tasted great, I like the bean sprouts crispy. Will come back for more for sure!!
author: Annisa J.

description:
Duck fried rice. All I gotta say.

Pros:
- Opens late
- Inexpensive

Cons:
- Service is a tad slow

Dishes:
- Duck Fried Rice: yo. I think any of their duck dishes are bomb.
- Panang Curry: not too bad
- Pad See Ew: not too bad
- Tom Kha: not too bad
- Pad Thai: alright. I've had better

Parking could suck but I've never had trouble finding street. This place is definitely worth a try!
author: Emma N.

description: Great food, good quantity for a solid price (by San Francisco standards). Plenty of room for single diners. Food always comes fast, this is especially nice when getting takeout.
author: Amogh K.

description:
Pretty standard Thai fare.  

I got the chicken Pad See Ew and it was just what I wanted, except for the occasional mouthful of white pepper (stir, please, stir!).  

My friend and I wandered here after celebrating Ben & Jerry's Free Cone Day.  It was about 12:30 and while the place was busy, we were able to get seated right away.  The hostess, by the way, made me want to take a detour to Sephora on the way back from work because she was just super, super beautiful and well, years of subscribing to allure-advert city-magazine has made me believe that I wantmustneed to buy pretty at a premium.

As I was saying, we were seated right away, and after perusing the menu for a bit, a waitress came by to take our order.  A few minutes after that, another waiter brought us glasses of water, and then another waiter came by with our food.  Might want to have your next office meeting here so you can see true teamwork in action.  As a former troop in the restaurant trenches, what a customer might see as 1 dining room floor is really a sliced and diced up composite of sections that some servers guard pretty viciously (the struggle for tips is real, y'all).  As I was saying, it was great to see that the top priority of the entire staff was clearly to get customers their orders asap... so that more could come in, of course, but let's enjoy that sweet sentiment for a bit longer.

Decent lunch spot, but I noticed a long line forming when we left at around 1:15.  Pretty unavoidable downtown, though.  Get there early.  :)
author: Iona C.

description: Good food. Combination beef noodle soup is good. The sliced beef was good, beef tender was great, and beef ball was fine. Love the flat rice noodle. The problem is that the noodle soup is quite sweet and so I felt it's greasy after ate half way through. The fried shrimp thing was fine. Deco and cleanness can be better.
author: Anya C.

description:
Disgusting.

It was ridiculously crowded but not as crowded as the other Thai place down the street. Thankfully there was an open table right when we got there and so we sat down immediately.

I had pad thai which I usually love but something was weird about this one. My friend tasted it and said it tasted like they put ketchup in it. I forced myself to eat about half of it but couldn't do it anymore.

The waitress at the end saw that I barely touched it and asked if I wanted a box and I said no and she just gave me a sad face. Didn't even ask what was wrong or if I wanted anything else. Obviously I was unsatisfied with what I was served and she didn't really do anything to compensate.
author: Lauren K.

description:
Thai food cooked by Chinese people. Enough said.

The pad thai had a weird red sauce, the noodles were all stuck together and were literally stinky.
author: Xavier R.

description: Ordered food to go and they didn't put any utensils or napkins in the bag. We're staying at a hotel and it's 12:45 am, how do they expect us to eat this?
author: Lani T.

description:
RANCID. 

Papaya salad was soggy and poorly seasoned: Drenched in oil and fish sauce.  

Chicken in 'lao prik sod' was rancid.   We had one bite and opted out.  Literally rancid.

The place was packed, I can't understand why. This location is nothing like the other locations with the same name (different management?).  We will never go back.
author: A F.

description: I ordered tofu pad Thai, but they don't use the normal wide noodles. The noodles resembled spaghetti... I would of liked this dish much more otherwise.
author: Hoku L.

description: Decided to try this place during a recent trip in the holiday season. Very efficient and quick service. Food tasted a bit different most likely because its actually authentic. This place is worth trying if you are in a hurry and want to try something cost effective right in the heart of SF. Dont worry about the long lines, it actually moves fast.
author: Sunny G.

description:
A great place to go when you have a buzz and it's a little late in the evening. I visited once a couple of years ago at 1am and most recently Thursday evening at 11pm. 

I ordered the roasted duck over white rice served with a dark duck sauce. It was a very healthy portion and given that I had a lot of wine during the afternoon/evening and barely ate much during the day this meal hit the spot. The duck to rice ratio is a bit small. I prefer more rice than the meat but I'm sure most people are the other way around.

There's nothing fancy about this place. It serves its purpose of being open late in the evening and serving up tasty food to fools like me who show up after a day/night full of drinking.
author: Xerxes N.

description: Delicious food & fast service! We usually get things like vegetarian pad see ew, shrimp pad thai, duck noodle soup, or curry. Unlike other thai restaurants, this place is never a hit or miss. Consistently good food everytime!
author: Linda P.

description: I had lunch at this restaurant with my family.  The restaurant was poorly air conditioned, the food was decent (not particularly flavorful), but the service was horrible.  I was particularly appalled that the waitress did not want to give us our change back when we paid our bill with cash because she wanted to decide for herself how much her tip should be.  We complained to the manager about this, and she gave us attitude as well.  I have no problem tipping for good service, but this business practice is beyond unacceptable, not to mention illegal.
author: Dan M.

description: The soup was a full portion that was mostly water, but the panang curry was a 1/2 portion.  VERY disappointed by that, and this is hands down my biggest gripe.  The order was 15 minutes late, and they would not allow grubhup to add a soda to the order even though the order clearly had not left, since it didn't arrive for another half hour from the time I reached out.  Also they gave us soy sauce versus chili sauce (??).  And the pad thai came with 5 shrimp, and 3 were not de-tailed.  On the other hand, there was free rice and the soup was pretty good.  Not bad for a 2 star joint.
author: Cesar G.

description:
Wow I'm literally shocked at how I was treated here.  Came in with my son to have lunch.  The place was pretty full when we walked in.  There was one table left.  I'm thinking for sure we'll get seated there and great that there will be room since we like to over order.  But NO, the lady at the front said wait here. We waited about 4-5 minutes.  Then I asked why can't we sit there?! There was nobody behind us.  She said no, it's only for 4 people.  Bullshit.  There were 3 other 4 seater tables with only 2 people sitting there.  GREEDY GREEDY GREEDY.  
Little did she know that I may look small but can eat a lot.  Ended up going down to the Westfield mall and spent $46 at Coriander Thai at the food court.  Dumb GREEDY lady.  You missed out on a good sale and tipper.  
Awful awful service, won't be coming back.  The food is just barely edible here.  Good thing there's a million other Thai restaurants around hahahaha.
author: Lily M.

description:
Worst King of Thai location, I frequent the one on Clements & 7th but this one just doesn't compare. I was baffled by the cooks and management. I ordered the tom kha kai soup and they brought me the tom yum soup instead- I specified I wanted the one with coconut milk and you know what they did? Brought me back the same damn soup but with added coconut milk. Not only was it not good but so lazy of them.  ITS NOT THE SAME.

Then, a few minutes later my friend found a hair in her pad kee mao, like- intermingled with the noodles NOT fallen on top. Believe me, we were hesitant about saying anything especially after the soup incident, but I'll just say it- it looked like a pube. So we sent it back.

The servers apologized and then actually had the audacity to tell us that none of the cooks had "curly hair" implying it was not their fault. I looked at the server and said, "neither does she!" pointing at my friend's a-symmetrical STRAIGHT bob. Seriously. Minutes passed until they came back asking what we wanted to do about it. Again, seriously? I told them that it was ok-no need to make it again and we just wouldn't pay for it. She made a =[] face then disappeared again. THEY WANTED US TO PAY FOR UNEATEN PUBE NOODLES. I left $10 for my sad soup (also uneaten) and we left. There are plenty of other Thai spots in that area, don't go here.
author: Jessica I.

description:
Just ate panang curry. The rice that accompanied the bowl of curry was dry and cold. The curry was weak. Far from the best I have had at other places.
Food was delivered at different times so guests were watching each other eat their meals.
author: Terri M.

description:
6/19/2016
came with a group of 7 and they messed up on one of our friend's orders so we had to wait an extra 30min.
waitresses were nice about it but the guy working wasn't so friendly
i ordered their pad thai and honestly it was just.. OK
wasn't that good..come here if you're in a rush and just want a quick thai fix
author: Jessica Y.

description: Good location. A lot of delicious food. But I'm not sure that it's true Thai food.. hope so) I'm here second time and both of them I'm ok about service and food. Today I tryed egg roll. It's soooooo good. Highly recommend it. And..boys,don't forget about beautiful girls! I saw them here!!!
author: Vadim R.

description: This place from the outside doesn't seem that attractive but the food is a different story. I had the Pad kee Mao (chicken) and it was delicious. Other Thai restaurants ask you the level of spice and if you don't tell them they can give you a very spicy level. But this place has one level and is not spicy at all. Definitely a spot to check out if you like Thai food.
author: Luis M.

description: Got crab fried rice because my friend kept talking bout it  I usually get mine from osha but I decided to try them out. Late night just getting off not too many options but I was craving Thai .. also ordered a pineapple fried rice  CFR was ok tasting pretty bland but wasn't too bad. Wasn't a big problem till I had the pineapple it tasted pretty similiar to the crab fried rice just had pineapples in it, also had shrimp which I'm not for sure is supposed to still have the tails attached but I bit into one the shells were removed but tails still attached now I only had 3 shrimp inside the platter but 2/3 had tails ... Not for sure who would keep shells on they shrimp in a fried rice dish but beware... Shrimp tasted horrible no taste
author: Coco L.

description: Horrible experience. The place smelled bad, like someone had used a moldy mop to clean up. My favorite Thai dish is massaman curry and they didn't even have it on the menu. Settled for the yellow curry with chicken. It was supposed to have potatoes and onions in it. It had maybe 2 -3 potato pieces in it and probably an entire onion in it.  The third bite I took had me gagging an uneatable piece of chicken into my napkin. Room temperature water was provided with no ice into older looking plastic glasses. Gross. We will never go back to this place.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
This is my second experience at King of Thai Noodle House. the first time I waited 45 minutes for an order to go I was promised within 10. I do not mind waiting, I do mind not being told the truth.

Tonight I ordered a papaya salad, which I asked Thai medium hot. It was Thai below mild, and probably had 2 scoops of sugar. That's a fail, please go back to Thailand and have a refresher course.

Second course was a Pad Thai, which I ordered without peanuts. Again, what a disappointment with the expected dried shrimp flavor. None to be found, but plenty of sugar. 

Did not order the Crab cake since I was warned crab meant pinkish imitation. Please be honest in the menu.

To be fair, I was thrown off by the hostess greeting "How many" when the count is obvious to me. Better manners would be "Table for two" or "Are you expecting someone to join", but I am judging the food, not manners.

True to life, I just killed one of these fruit flies as I was writing this review. Your Majesty King of Thai, may I suggest another place.
author: Lord Lancelot D.

description: This is the worst restaurant along Union Square that my co-workers and I have ever been to. The service is crap to seat you and to take your order. They take forever to bring you your food and when your food shows up it's pretty much hit or miss. Unfortunately it's mostly misses these days. The chicken was over cooked and the breaking didn't even stick to the chicken. The useless manager didn't even offer a solution and charged me for something I ended up having to take to go. The food never comes in order so I can guarantee one meal will show in 5 minutes and the other in 50 minutes. There are far better places to eat at. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. A big thumbs down and no stars from me. Plus the restaurant is dirty and always smells like a clogged wet toilet.
author: Melissa C.

description:
Such a convenient spot close to Union Square and the Cable Car area. This is a GREAT go-to while in the middle of shopping or running around the area. It's great because you can avoid the typical restaurant food of say Daily Grill, Cheesecake Factory and other diner type places. I feel like that food gets so old and so fast! This is obviously a quick-style Thai place.

The staff is super nice and extremely patient as tons of ppl come in looking for space. Although, it's aways super busy I feel like I've never waited more than 10n minutes - even on busy holiday wkds. It's best to go with no more than 4 ppl because it's a tiny place. There's also a bar where 1-2 ppl can sit kinda thing even more quick-style cafe. 

The food is very consistent and for the price and convenience I'd say it's pretty good. Some may say standard but I'd give this an above average rating. It's also fresh and not greasy - which can be the case with Thai food when it's quick dining. I particularly like the Pad See Ew but mainly because that's my Thai guilty pleasure! I've had the spring rolls (great), Pad Thai (great), and the green curry dishes (all great). I'd say for the most part this place is satisfying.

This is my mom's favorite spot and I know it's parent friendly and very cost efficient - two ppl can easily spend under $20 and be more than full! 

A great go-to near the Union Square area! Staff is sweet and service is always with a smile.
author: Priya S.

description:
With its reasonably priced menu and fast service this place had really won me over. 

Not only do they provide amazing but the atmosphere is quirky and neat. 

I honestly never had an interest in tai food but this place won me over.
author: Miguel V.

description:
After a night of bar hopping we wanted food to soak up that alcohol :) 
I just want to say whoever thought of fried chicken over fried rice is an absolute genius! Sooo good!!! We also got the pad se ew and panang curry. There was so much food we thought about inviting people to our table to eat lol. Everything was really good but the star of the show was definitely the Fried rice.
author: Drea C.

description:
I was very wary of this place going in because of the poor health score, but my family member and I were starving after a long day of shopping in Union Square so we decided to go in anyways.
It was pretty busy so we were seated next to the door. We were constantly pestered by people ordering to go shouting at the waitresses due to the loudness of the store.
Service was subpar. Waitress took forever to come to our table to take our orders. When I wanted noodles with my tom yum and ordered some, they took at least 20 minutes to come out of the kitchen. I was half way done with my food by the time it came out. Not only that, but the waitresses ignored us and walked by when we were trying to wave them down for a check. I'm not usually impatient, but we were on a time crunch so I found this annoying.
Food was adequate. You can't really go wrong with Thai food. I got the Shrimp Tom Yum and my family member got the wonton noodle soup with flat rice noodles (looked like chow fun noodles). Flavor was there. The Tom Yum was kind of basic but it still tasted good.
3 stars for the food. I wouldn't expect much coming here and probably wouldn't come back but if you're in a pinch, it'll do!
author: Alexi G.

description:
I came here on a Thursday evening to get a quick dinner before a movie.  This restaurant is perfect for a business district, as they can bring out your food extremely fast.  I didn't have to wait long at long to get my food by the time I ordered it.  I got the Seafood Noodle Soup, which has gone up in price in comparison to the menu prices that are listed here on Yelp.

I thought the portions were on the smaller side and the flavor was somewhat bland.  It wasn't expensive, but I was still expecting a better flavored soup from them for what I paid for it.  I feel that a 3-star review is very adequate for this restaurant.  If you're in a hurry or need to find a restaurant that is open late, this is a decent place to go to.
author: Johnny W.

description:
Kudos for this place opening so late. However customer service sucks. Our waitress didn't speak a lot of English (which is fine), but she kept messing up on our order. There were many instances where we had to repeat stuff several times for her to get our order right. We even pointed to our items.

She charged us for a plate of food we didn't even want...and also charged both credits on different checks (we were splitting one bill.) 

Overall, the food was good and we were seated quickly. I ordered Pad Thai and my friend ordered the duck fried rice. They ran out of mangos for the sticky rice, so we replaced it with fried bananas; which were soggy.
author: Christine C.

description: Really enjoyed the food here. There was no wait for a table, so we were seated immediately.  My wife visited the restaurant back in February and could not wait to return.  We were seated upstairs.  It was a little dark and slightly small but it works.  The wait was minimal.  My wife ordered the Beef Ball soup.  It's a large bowl of soup with vegetables and beef.  Great meal choice if you want to warm up or want something filling to eat. I was able to sample some before my wife spiced it to her liking.  (She's Thai).  I had one of my favorite Thai dishes, Pad-See-Ewe. Nice size portion.  We also had the spring rolls as an appetizer.  Our server kept our drinks filled which was cool.  Will definitely return.
author: Glenn N.

description: . I walked out. Chicken noodle soup. No thanks It tasted like hot dishwater  no flavor just horrible.
author: Shari S.

description: I love this place.  Well worth the wait in line at lunchtime.  Great food and super friendly staff.   I think I could live off the Pad Thai.
author: Kristina W.

description:
This is an average noodle house. My mom ordered one of the stir fried rice noodle dishes (#17) which was very so so. Lots of dark soy and sugar with not much else going on. I ordered the beef noodle soup (#1) which was good. Broth had a nice anise beefy flavor to it but could have done with a bit more spice and veg. 

Service is friendly, albeit slightly spotty. Our dishes came out almost 10 minutes apart!
author: Ada C.

description:
**************************** REVIEW 896 ********************************

        Yummy yum woon sen, roasted duck over rice, fried chicken and garlic rice, pad see ew,  panang curry are all decent here.  Good spot for lunch while shopping, but always overly crowded and people will hit you while walking through the restaurant!
author: Manda Bear B.

description: The restaurant is near Union Square. There are a lot of seats inside. And it is popular. The environment is nice and the waiters are so kind. They offer all kinds of Thai food, such as soup noodles, fried noodles, fried rice, all kinds of curry, appetizers and so on. We ordered pad Thai with shrimp in it. It tastes delicious.
author: Nancy S.

description: We ordered the pad thai, chicken panang curry and papaya salad. Every single dish was stale and luke warm so we'll definitely not be recommending or visiting this place again.
author: Kabir S.

description: We had the egg rolls. They were excellent. The vegetable soup was good. The pad see ew was good, especially with their chili sauce added to it. The pad Thai was great and the tofu was cooked perfectly b
author: Karen R.

description: Only came here once on my last SF trip and it was a spontaneous stop to here while my family members who go here often or at least have tried out this place. I thought it was good but I've had better pad thai's!
author: Annie C.

description: Came to this place for Thai foods during my lunch. I think they got some good deals on sugars because all of the food we ordered were super sweet. Don't get me wrong, I enjoy deserts and sweet but just not on my pad thai and tom tom soup.
author: Master R.

description: I went to this place at 12am on a Friday and it was very difficult to eat the food. I ordered pad thai and I got skinny spaghetti noodles and my dish smelled like wet dog. Honestly worst food I've had in a long time. Will never go back
author: Brandon R.

description:
I came here with a friend because we wanted to grab some quick food before we went shopping.  It is a pretty standard small Thai restaurant.

I got my usual Pad See Ew - I actually thought it was OK, not up to par to what I am used to in Seattle.  The noodles were a little bit dried out I thought.  Also, I was disappointed that there was not broccoli.  There was some weird green that was perhaps Chinese broccoli or a weird bok choy.  It's usually not the vegetable I see in Pad See Ew.

My friend thought my Pad See Ew tasted better than his Pad Thai though strangely enough.  I did notice an unusual amount of bean sprouts covering the plate though.

Prices are standard, about $10/dish.

I would just call this a mediocre Thai place.  There are much better places elsewhere.
author: Danielle C.

description: Gave this place a second chance and that was a huge mistake. The first time I ate here the food gave me a huge stomach ache. This time I ordered the BBQ pork fried rice, Pad Thai and Tom Yum Goong. Within 30 minutes of leaving, I was ill, vomiting and constantly going to the bathroom. Definitely would not recommend this place to anyone touring the city.
author: Jackie S.

description:
I enjoy  eating  at King of Thai. The soups  are magnificent.  Love their noodles  and rice.
The Servers are excellent  people,  they  welcome you with a  pleasant smile  and sincere  welcome. 
Congratulations  to King of Thai  !!!
author: Adrian S.

description:
This restaurant is surprisingly a good Thai restaurant  in the city. It's always crowded but the wait is always fast. 

The #4 Soup & Papaya Salad are my favorite here. 

Their Pad Thai Chicken and Fried Chicken Over Fried Rice are pretty good too but not my favorite at this spot. I prefer Osha Thai better when it comes to these two items. 

Overall. They have great customer service, great location, good food, affordable and fast.

Cons. This place looks dirty but I don't mind because the food is good. I think it's the color of the floor, crammed tables/chairs and the kitchen being wide open.
author: irwin v.

description: Very authentic thai food n vibe, lots of Thai Americans guests. Definitely try their Thai milk tea!
author: Mouyi C.

description:
Excellent place for a nice bowl of hot and flavorful noodle soup at 1:30 in the morning.

Will it be the best you can have?  No.  But the service was really quick, the portion and price very reasonable and everything was nice and fresh.  And the broth was very flavorful with the included condiments.

Gonna be my go to place for late night noodles when staying around the area.
author: Yi S.

description:
After that review ironically I kept coming back here! And everything is always good with great service! Reasonably priced items on the menu. It does get pretty crowded but it depends on what time of day you come here. 

It is around the corner from Union Square- so if you are out shopping and need some grub this is your spot!
author: Marie P.

description: Good food, decent price.  A plate of noodles with veggies and tofu was $12.  Fast service, no frills.  Great place to go when you're starving and want something fast and cheap.
author: Julia B.

description:
I can't remember the last time I was at a restaurant that was so disorganized and chaotic. It was like everyone on staff was just hired for their first job and had limited human contact prior to that night! We were in a rush and figured it would be some quick, good Thai food, so we stuck around... should'a just gone somewhere else and picked up a slice of pizza instead. 

My Pad Kee Mao w/ Beef (2 1/2 stars after 1 star deduction) was supposed to be "Thai spicy", but it was barely spicy at all. At least it tasted pretty good... until I had the weird tasting rubbery ingredient they tried to pass off as ground beef
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/king-of-thai-noodle-house-san-francisco-3?select=Yynvqq4wNCJDZ8YGXe_Rjw#36KwUCXUdE6BrqsEV88BMw

The Shrimp Pad Thai (2 stars) was pretty disappointing...and to it's always annoying to me when a restaurant serves a dish (like noodles) that is meant to be eaten with a fork, or even chopsticks, but leaves the f'in tail on the shrimp
author: Ocee D.

description:
We stopped in here after 11pm since other Thai restaurants in the area were closed. We were seated immediately, which was nice. The decor left much to be desired. The service was mediocre at best; the waitress didn't write down our order, our appetizer came out after our entree, and i didn't receive my side order of white rice.

As for the food, it left much to be desired. My wife ordered a seafood soup, which she enjoyed. My order of Tom Khai Gai curry was bland and full of in-edibles. It was very watery, lacking the creamy, thick texture which I enjoy in traditional Thai.

Also, there is a $30 minimum on credit card orders, so beware on that end.
author: Rudy S.

description:
I work graveyard and I work alone, So I had to call delivery.  Made the wrong decision calling this place. My day is ruined because of the bad work etiquette of the manager.

I just called now (5/24/15 11:30pm), I ordered 2 items Pad si ew and Friend Rice - Enough to cover delivery price. The lady said they're open for delivery, and then she called again, said her manager said because I'm "2 miles" away, they can't deliver.  I am actually located at Grant and Sutter - not even a mile away.  The lady even said sorry, it's ridiculous, but she wants to inform me that it's her manager's decision to refuse to serve me. First time caller and now the last time.
author: Patrick T.

description: The place's ambiance is loud and cafeteria like.  The pad Thai is good, however it only came with 2 shrimps.  We also had the crab fried rice and it was basic but tasty. The food wasn't amazing and memorable,  but it is conveniently located and the food is served fast.  Although everyone  around us was having soup, so that is definitely what we will be having next time on a cold day.
author: Sophie G.

description: Nasty as fuck. Nasty food, they take trash out through the dining area, waiter sneezed on food while receiving food from kitchen. The manager gave horrible attitude and threw a fit in the back like a little child.
author: Junior S.

description: Best noodle house on the West Coast!  Atmosphere and service have some to be desired but food is unbelievable. Highly recommend the beef noodle soup!
author: C N.

description: This is the original King of Thai restaurant. I guess due to it's downtown location they raise the price a few bucks from locations throughout the city. Avg dish price was $8.50. Pretty standard stuff if you have been to any of the other KOT joints. Pretty good flavor and pretty authentic. I think they get a lot of workers direct from Thailand so only the actual servers can help you as the others have limited English. If you are short on time and cash in the area this place is quick although not as cheap as the others. But this is one of the cheaper, decent spots in the Union square area.  You'll get enough to eat but not get overly full. They do take CC where I remember the ones in Richmond and Sunset are cash only so maybe that is why they charge more.
author: Vincent W.

description: Pretty ordinary. Got green curry and papaya salad. Green curry was good but papaya salad wasn't good. I have had better food at the same price
author: Tasha Y.

description:
Out if all the Thai restaurants I've tried, this one is just ok. There are better King of Thai Noodle locations in SF, but this one was conveniently located near union and after shopping I felt like eating spicy noodles.

We were seated next to the restrooms which smelled like urine. Not appetizing. I got up and seated myself by the booth instead. Much better.

Got the boat noodle soup and pad kee mau for my hub. Chicken was almost non existent in the fried noodles, and I had to have them take back the beef noodles to make it the traditional Thai boat noodles. Yes, I spoke Thai to them so they should know I didn't want the Americanized version. It was tasty, but not the best I've had in the city. Not a great value price wise. You can get the same thing in SF for $5-6, not $9. Overall, an ok experience
author: J S.

description: Very fast service, tasty food. I love the convenient location... 1 block from Union Square (behind Macy's). A lone diner facing a blank wall, I sat at the counter like I used to do when I lived in New York. Seated next to fellow diners, everyone respected each other's space, but it was also easy to share a smile or a small conversation. Staff is fun and engaging. I'm looking forward to coming back again.
author: Mark W.

description:
The BF and I were downtown and had a hankering for Thai food. We walked to our favorite spot, Bangkok Thai, and found out they were closed, so we headed over to King of Thai. 

I have to say, nothing can compare to Bangkok Thai for their value and taste, but this is a good alternative. Their dishes are around $2-3 more expensive, but the BF's duck noodle soup had good flavor and plenty of noodles. My pad thai came out piping hot and tasted great with extra peanuts and chili sauce.
author: Irene W.

description:
When you're in a high tourist area...you'll be lucky to find an actually pretty good Thai restaurant. King of Thai Noodle House scores some good eats.

When you walk in, you'll be waiting for a table but not for long. Quick turn around tables, food comes out quickly and there's a ton of wait staffers inside to serve your needs.

The Pad See Ew was pretty good. Don't let the name fool you (NOODLE HOUSE). They have a lot of rice dishes also. Thanks to King for making my special request....Thai fried chicken over garlic rice (Kao Mun Gai Tod). 

I'd pick King over the other Thai restaurant down the street anytime (the other one by the steak place).
author: Ticha B.

description:
Just a few minor points/comments

* More of a lunch place than a dinner place (has a kind of cafeteria-type ambiance)
* Excellent (really, excellent) pad see ew
* AWFUL green curry

good prices.
author: Dave F.

description:
There are better thai restaurants in the area. The food is bland, the place has seen better days, and service was mostly inattentive.

Food quantities are not bad however.
author: Olivier L.

description: I was so excited when I saw some authentic Thai dishes but was so diappointed with the actual food. The Pad See Eww was too salty. They overdid it with the soysauce. The fried chicken with fried rice was also so/so. The fried rice itself was good but the chicken was plain and little dry. The sweet and sour sauce for dipping helped a little but not enough to save the dish. BUT the Thai tea was on point!! Perfect mixture of the tea and the milk.
author: T S.

description:
Went here to eat on a Saturday evening about 4:30. Crowded but not much of a wait, maybe 5 minutes for a table to clear in the back. The staff are always very busy running back and forth but efficient and friendly.
We had noodle soup and egg rolls. I had the beef noodle soup and the wife had the pork noodle soup. About $10.00 per bowl. Along with the egg rolls, a Thai Ice Tea and Singha beer, it ran about $35,00. Food was good, service good but unfortunately they did not have fried bananas for dessert. The later you come, the more crowded it gets with a line of people standing outside when we left. ]
Recommend that you arrive early.
author: jack d.

description:
The best thai food i had ever eaten! 
For the price/quality/amount of food it gets 5 stars!

Super tasty food, nice waiters, food comes fast!

Only negative point was that we sad down next to the window and when the doors open you get a chilled wind in the back:(

Top restaurant!
author: Neil H.

description: The food was too bland. A ordered a vegetarian noodle soup. The portion size was huge but the taste wasn't as great. My friend ordered a TOFU Dish and he was given a squid one. When mentioned, they didn't even apologize. They also asked if he tasted it or not. I hope they did not serve it to someone else.
author: Sailaja B.

description:
I had the duck over rice and my girlfriend had combination beef noodle soup. The duck over rice was not a good deal. You'll pay $9 or $10 for very little duck and little breast meat, more fat. You will get a lot of rice though. My girlfriends noodle soup on the other hand was very delicious. Lots of flavor and overall a great value for the noodle soup.

Although there was a line out the door, we still received very prompt service. I went to the restroom, came back and my food was ready.
author: Sandy Z.

description: Good and dirty. If that's not your thing, don't come here. I recommend the stewed duck noodle soup. Lots of star anise in the broth, and the duck leg is fall-off-the-bone moist, flavorful and hearty. Get it with flat rice noodles and it's a done deal.
author: Gee W.

description: I like the pad thai here. Its not a five star hotel, but for what you pay the food and service are decent!
author: Jackie Y.

description: I always used to come here as a child and eat duck in rice with my mom. It was my favorite dish whenever we'd come to the city to shop.
author: Fernilla S.

description:
Delicious  food!! So authentic. 

The service is friendly and quick, a def must! 

I had the pad Thai with shrimp and it fulfilled all the desired flavors I was looking for.
author: Nayef A.

description: The food came out fast, which was good. BUT is NOT HOT!!! Can't believe that the chicken pumpkin curry is cold when arrived on our table. Disappointed.
author: Mark A.

description:
Overall a pretty good place for a quick dinner that's better than Burger King and cheaper than most other sit down restaurants. 

They're open late, too, which is really nice if you want to come here after shopping or clubbing or whatnot, and the Powell BART station is just a little more than a block away. 

I've tried the duck noodle soup and also the stewed duck leg noodle soup--both were great and the food came really fast (it's almost concerning HOW fast) and portions were pretty big...food coma'ed afterwards but that may have been the MSG haha. Service was decent, all in all nothing to complain about.
author: Michelle L.

description: I had some late night Thai after a night of bar hopping. It was satisfying, did the job, but wasn't anything special. Mainly just convenient and I was hungry.
author: Brianna L.

description: Average Thai. Staff meeting as friendly enough. Tom Kah was ok, nothing too exciting. Thai Fried Rice left a lot to be desired. Why is it so hard to find good Thai Fried Rice?!? Extra star for being open until 2am and filling my belly.
author: James M.

description:
Cheap and IS Thai food . 
A good place to eat in Union square.
author: Sherry F.

description: Has inexpensive food and great service, I ordered the peking duck soup with vermicelli! Tastes so good
author: Marina S.

description:
Probably not one of the best Thai food places I went to. The service was kind of lacking to my standards, since everything seemed so unorganized. Entrees coming out without actual spoons already in the plate to use as service, having to ask for additional plates, when it was kind of obvious my friend and I were eating family style.

The only good thing I have to mention is the duck is not as fatty as many other ducks that I had.
author: Tom T.

description:
I often stop by here after work on the weekdays.  It gets a bit busy with larger groups of people (as I come alone most of the time).  I was offered the table in front of the window and sat down.  They gave me a menu.  As more people started rolling through the doors, I was left alone to find a server who would take my order.  Many of the employees stand in front of the cashier upfront so I don't see how they didn't notice me turning around to try to catch their attention.  I had one hand up at some point; which I avoid doing because it's absolutely rude.  At that point they still didn't notice me so I got up and walked over to one of their servers and asked for my order to be taken.  Walking back to my table with a server, she took my order with a smile and walked away.  

Food has always been great here.  My personal favorite is the Pad See Ew with beef.  Just work on that customer service and you're golden!
author: Melissa T.

description:
You gotta try King of Thai Noodle House. I've been here a bunch of times and I've never been disappointed. I recommend the pad thai or the red curry...also order the Thai iced tea while you're at it. It's all delish!

This place is kinda cramped inside, especially around lunch, but they also have seating upstairs. Service is a tad slow, but the food is SO worth it. 

Just writing this review is making me crave this place! Without a doubt my favorite Thai restaurant in the city.
author: Aman D.

description: worst service ever here.... I don't ever write reviews but they gave us raw chicken sautées and NEVER brought it back and still charged us for it. They also charged us for 2 mango sticky rice when I only ordered 1. This place is trash.
author: Evan C.

description:
I've been coming here for years, both this Downtown location and the one in the Richmond. Love the pan fried wide noodles with basil and chili. Never had a bad lunch here. Also quick and friendly service.  Love it!!

Oh did I mention the walls are purple - awesome.
author: Michael H.

description:
"Ohhhhhh myyyyyyy gooooooddddddd"

Those words escaped my mouth ever so gently, as I take my first bite of crab fried rice. HOLY COW! This has got to be the best damn fried rice I've ever eaten! 

I'm asian... I've had fried rice since the womb yo. But this fried rice... Oh my god....

Every single bite seems to melt in your mouth with crab flavor crystals exploding left and right! 

How do they make this rice soooo damn moist!?!!!? 

Anddddddddd they put REAL crab meat! Like frickin CHUNKS of succulent, juicy, FRESH crab meat. Holy Canoli I'm sitting here stuffed debating whether or not I should take an order to go lol

On other news they have bomb ass yellow curry, and the food comes out quick, like with Olympic speed. A round of applause is in order. 

Best 10 bucks I ever spent! I will come back every chance I get!!!!
author: Norman F.

description:
In my little hometown, this would be five stars.

In LA's Thai Town, maybe three. Pretty standard.

But in the Union Square district, surrounded by meciocre and overpriced food, it deserves some recognition for being 'real' and keeping the prices in check.

Not knocking it out of the park, but props for being above average in a below average foodie neighborhood.
author: Sean B.

description: Service was really slow. Also, found a hair in my pad thai. Not coming back to here. However, they were nice about not charging for my pad thai.
author: Mir H.

description: This is not first time My friends and I went there we went there sometime because it is quite far from us. We are very excited to go this restaurant to have our favorite papaya salad. we order papaya salad with crab and I found out it has hair on the plate!!!! Oh my God. My friend calls the waitress and she apologize and change new one for us. However to be honest even new one I still feel uncomfortable to eat it but we didn't say any thing that time. When I asked for the bill she charge full amount and didn't even offer discount or say any thing else. I was very disappointment about customer service they provide. I work as customer service too and I know how to take care of customer. Probably they think we are tourists from Thailand and nothing serious about it. Unfortunately we live here and we won't return back for sure.
author: Darunee M.

description:
I really like King of Thai Noodle House.  They are all over the SF Bay Area.  I'm not sure how many there are, but this is the second one I've eaten at.  The first was at King of Thai Noodle House #2 on Clement (Inner Richmond).  It's like bringing the Thai street food/fast food concept to the U.S.  All the plates are reasonably priced ($7-9), cooked and served quickly, and taste good.  Why can't Atlanta have one of these?

As the name suggests, they offer many Thai noodle dishes.  And it's not just pad Thai here.  You can get various noodle soups and stews and even yen ta fo (Thai pink seafood noodle soup).  My sister and brother-in-law have eaten at these restaurants many times over the past 10 years and one thing they harp on is King of Thai's consistent quality.

We went to this busy Union Square location for lunch and the restaurant was packed.  This location has a small second floor.  We waited maybe 15 minutes before we could be seated.  I'd like to add that I think the hostess here may be the most beautiful Thai girl I've ever seen.

As for the food, we ordered:
Som tam - papaya salad
Fish cakes
Lad na - wide noodles in thick sauce
Yen ta fo - seafood noodle soup
Roast duck curry
Roast duck noodle soup
Pineapple fried rice

I'm not a big fan of som tam, but my family loves it.  It's a popular Thai appetizer that consists of shredded papaya in a spicy sauce.  It's served cold.  The fish cakes are small circular patties of fish.  Kind of like fish balls (the meat ball version of fish), except flattened into patties.  The fish cakes at King of Thai are thick and juicy and served with a fresh cucumber sauce you can pour on top.  Very good.

Of the food items, my favorites were the roast duck dishes.  The roast duck noodle soup was served in a light broth and the duck was served bone-in.  The noodles were thin and the bowl overall had good light flavor.  The roast duck curry was a special menu item and was exactly how I imagined it - sweet, rich, and creamy.  It was served with a plate of rice and was very good.  The curry had various vegetables and also chunks of pineapple.  Yum.

If you happen to go into the back near the restrooms, you will see a picture of the restaurant owner, Toy, with former Thai Prime Minister Thakin Shinawatra.  Very interesting.  Toy was actually around while we were eating here, so we talked to him for a little bit and asked him about his encounter with Thaksin (the photo was taken in DC).

All the servers wear lavender uniforms.  The restaurant logo is also in lavender.  I'm not sure of the meaning behind it, but it looks good.  This location has an open kitchen where you can see their many cauldrons of soup boiling away.  Good food, good prices, and good service.  King of Thai Noodle House FTW.
author: Daniel B.

description: Wasn't acknowledged by anyone service here sucks they bilittled me when sat down at a table I wasn't even offered a menu just sat there basically to see what they did they never helped me
author: Roxana T.

description: Ask the waitress which noodle to pick to go with noodle. They will recommend the one that fits the one you're going to order.
author: Fritz K.

description:
The service is quick but only because the waiters rush you. When I got sat the waitress immediately asked me if I was ready to order. I laughed and said no I need to look at the menu. Right after she walked off, one minute later another waitress come to me and asked if I was ready. I implied I needed more time. The place wasn't so busy to rush me. But the funny part was that after the waitress walked off the first waitress that asked me if I was ready came back and said ok are you ready now. NO!!! I need time to figure out what I want. 

The food is a 2/5 the Tom Kha is good. Come burning hot and flavor is good BUT the egg rolls are super greasy. 

I received my soup within 3 minutes of ordering, but it took them 10 minutes for the egg rolls.

Overall bad experience
author: Ree G.

description:
Papaya salad was ok..no protein..but it was big..not bad in flavor but not spicy. The other dishes looked the same..15 and 17..really? one has more veggie than the other. Both were fun noodles and smelled the same. A friend ordered extra spicy and there were no spice. 

I do have to give it to them that they are quick to order and for the food to arrive at your table. Zagat rated? I think they got this place mixed up with another place. It's 'hot' because it's in Union Square, not because the taste of the food. I had better, and probably won't be coming back again.
author: Minerva L.

description:
Damn! Good! Noodles! These were some of the best I've ever had.
Awesome service. We were waited on by no less than 4 different waitresses, since the closest one just takes care of your needs as soon as they arise.
They also have good beer and wine prices.
I'm completely Sold on this place!
author: Charles S.

description: Here's a simple one... buyer beware.  After I asked repeatedly whether my take-out dish was spicy, they said no.  I asked two different people, they both said no.  I brought it back to my hotel, and it was fine up until I started drinking the broth, at which point my mouth was on fire.  This wasn't a situation where I was overly sensitive to a little heat... this was burn-my-mouth-spicy for ten minutes.  Getting spice vs no spice right is an easy one.  If you can't execute that correctly, what can you get right?
author: David B.

description:
The best late night Thai Food I've ever had! Actually, even if it wasn't late night food, I'd love this food. I came here after a concert around 1am with a group of friends and was so excited at the quality of the food! 

Panang Curry: the only dish I've tried so far. The curry was one of the best I've tasted. Not too creamy or thin, perfect consistency and FULL of broccoli (my fave) and other veggies and tofu. Most curries have a hard time getting the right veggie to curry ratio right but King of Thai nails it. Also the pricing is great-- you can get most dishes for around $8, which is a steal for such great Thai food. 

Tips:
+ they deliver! but only until around 11 pm I believe, so order early. Otherwise, they are open late so a good place to stop after a night out. 
+ get the panang curry 

I can't wait to go back and try their other dishes!
author: Anu P.

description:
BBQ Pork & Wonton Soup? Check.  Spicy Drunken Noodle with pork? Check.  

King of Thai Noodle House is quick, affordable, convenient and very tasty.  Is it earth shattering Thai?  No, but it more than gets the job done.

I was a big fan of the BBQ soup mentioned above.  Plenty of sliced pork, abundant wontons and chock full of bok choy.  Definitely my kind of Asian style soup.

Service was very quick despite there being a huge crowd inside the restaurant at the early 5pm dinner hour.  

All in all a very solid experience.  Again, it won't blow you away but the menu will find a way to make you happy.
author: Paul P.

description:
FYI, the listed hours on Yelp were wrong and King of Thai dishes out tastiness pretty late into the night (Open until 3 am on Fridays and Saturdays, 2 am on all other days).

Solid fried noodles dishes, and my penchant for pad see ew is more than satiated here. The "wok taste" (some of you know what I'm talking about in terms of high heat plus carmelizing soy and sugars and char) is done well here, and I haven't been disappointed at all. Price point is a tad higher than I'd like, hovering around $9 for most items, but it is tourist trap central, so not bad all things considered.

For soup noodles though, I'd walk down a few blocks and hit up Chabaa Thai for their stewed beef noodle.
author: Kevin L.

description:
This is definitely a popular spot for shoppers around the Union Square area! Me and my friends were debating between this and Cheesecake Factory but decided to come here due to the wait line at Cheesecake Factory. I have been to the King of Thai locations on Clement in Richmond. I thought it would be around the same quality. I was much disappointed. 

We tried the roasted duck fried rice and the papaya salad. The food came within 10 mins of ordering time. Super quick for a thai restaurant. The food was okay. The roasted duck fried rice was nothing compared to the juicy and flavorful ones that you get from a Chinese restaurant. As for the papaya salad, it was nothing special. It just tasted like a bunch of greens with sauce on the plate. I have had much better at the other locations and at other thai restaurants. It was definitely not worth it for the price I paid. $8.50 for a Papaya Salad and $9.50 for the roasted duck fried rice. Other locations are cheaper but considering that this is in the heart of Union Square, you can't really complain.

I probably won't be back if I had a choice. The locations of Grant and Clement are much better.
author: Shanna C.

description:
3-5 stars. 

I'm not really sure how I feel about this place since I only got one thing.

I went late on a night after my friend's F.I.D.M. graduation. The great thing about this place is it is opened until three in the morning (so if you ever need a place to eat, go here).

Convenience: 5 stars 

Service: 4-5 stars

^ The guy who seated us was super nice and came to check up on us. Our waters got refilled like once

It's a two leveled place.

Got the Panang Curry with seafood:
A little different than other places I've eaten at.. 
Too pea-nutty (peanut oil or peanut butter and actual peanuts in here)
Spicy level was not as spicy as other places
Nice amount of shrimp and such
Creamy? It was the right amount or a delicious amount in my opinion

I would've loved it without the overwhelming peanut taste.

I want to try their noodles next time!
author: Lilian L.

description: I hate to give bad feedbacks but  customer service and the food is not as good as before.. We love to eat here but the last time we went here, were unexpected. Sorry but we'll never go back.
author: Kristine R.

description: Good food and good service. Got our order less than 10 mins. Love their roast duck fried rice.
author: Aims B.

description:
This is the only Thai restaurant I've been to that is generous with their curry sauce.  Yeah!!!  

I had the green curry with chicken (apparently one of their most popular dishes) and it was excellent.  The veggies were fresh and it was just the perfect amount of spicy.  

If you are near Union Square or shopping at the Westfield Mall, eat here.  You will leave totally satisfied!
author: AnneMarie W.

description: BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE!! This place is definitely not what it used to be. We ordered the fried chicken with fried rice (asked for no onions), duck with steam Rice, and chicken pad see ew. The chicken was extremely dry and large chunks of onions in the fried rice. The duck arrived cold as well, and wasn't good. The pad see ew, arrived SUPER LATE! We lost track of how many times the server kept saying it would be out in a second. The bill came faster than the plate did and they still expected us to pay for late meal. And they kept checking to see if we were done eating, even if it was their fault we weren't done yet.  HORRIBLE!! What happen to you guys?! Seriously! I hope the one in Irving isn't like this.
author: Joeleen C.

description: Great place to eat late at night. Dishes taste on the sweet side almost in Bangkok. Crowd sometime and will not get good service. They ran out of Thai tea on me last time..... Price is over $10 so is not my regular restaurant, except late at night.
author: Minhnistah M.

description:
My pad see eew obsession follows me at all times, so I dragged some friends here after some strolling around Union Square.

My pad see eew with pork was pretty awesome. Not too sweet, the pork wasn't dry, but they did that thing where they shred the broccoli and annoys me to death...hmm.

Service was quick, and the place was packed, even late at night. But if you want some place that you can linger and just hang out, the waiters didn't bother us at all and kept our water cups plentifully filled.
author: Christina S.

description:
Here for lunch, it's crowded during lunch time. I can smell the high level of MSG used in this place. They serve big parties up stairs. They serve food relatively quick. I ordered thai ice tea  (tasted normal) and panang  beef curry. Thought food was okay just average.

Every bite I could feel peanuts, I ordered mild and it still had a kick to it. I felt like the rice could have been a little softer. Good part was they didn't make it too sweet. But definitely feel like they used ton of MSG here. My acid reflux definitely acted up after eating here.
author: Kevin L.

description:
The GF and I came here at around 9 pm on a Tuesday night.  Street parking was fairly easy to find, for no businesses or shops were open.  We walked in, and the place was packed with both customers, and employees.  We ordered the pad see-ew and the pineapple fried rice.  The pad see-ew had lots of meat and vegetables, but lacked noodles.  The vegetables were bitter and crunchy.  The pineapple fried rice was average tasting.  I did not really care for the raisins mixed in.  In my opinion it was too sweet.  

Service was okay.  Food was average.  I like the Richmond district location better though.
author: Victor L.

description: It was around maybe 2am when my friends and I decided to go grab some food since most of us were hungry. I ended up coming across this restaurant on Yelp since it was walking distance, still open, and cheap. One of my friends has also been here once and said it was pretty good. We got there and got a table right away. It was still pretty packed though. When I walked in, it smelled amazing. I was craving a noodle dish but wanted to try something new so I ordered Guay Tiaw Lord Noodle since I have never heard of it before. It was perfect and I was satisfied! My other friends also seemed to enjoy their dishes. The only thing that would need improvement is that the restaurant could be a little more cleaner. But overall...the food was delicious for the price that we paid.
author: Anna N.

description:
I don't know what it is about San Francisco and Pad Thai, but apparently the two do not have a very harmonious relationship. Prior to visiting King of Thai Noodle, I had tried Pad Thai from 3 different places and hated all of them, and actually ended up going to King of Thai Noodle from a coworker's recommendation.

Unfortunately, the Pad Thai had the same, bland and slightly sour taste that seems to permeate San Francisco Thai cuisine. I don't know if it's a regional difference, because I could eat Pad Thai in Seattle places every single day, but anyway--I was sorely disappointed with King of Thai Noodle.
author: Jenn L.

description:
You know there is nothing as comforting as a heaping plate of Pad See Ew when you just want something satisfying, drizzled with chili oil and crushed peanuts it's sheer heaven. I dream about this place now that we live in San Jose I can't find any place here that compares.
I go to the King of Thai near Union Square but used to go to the one out in the Richmond too. Both are crowded but super fast and well worth the little wait to sit. They'll have you in and out in no time, it's cheap and it's good.
author: J F.

description: Good food and fast service. I just got into town and was looking for something quick.
author: Raymond S.

description: Cashew Chicken was delicious, service is very fast and staff very attentive.  A good place for a good quick lunch and reasonably priced.
author: Alex R.

description: I'm from south east Asia, so I'm familiar with Thai food as well as spicy food. Was feeling like some Tom yum while on vacation in SF so I yelped around my hotel for some good tom yum. Came here for lunch and ordered the Tom yum goong soup and added noodles to it. Boy! Was this a HUGE mistake. I generally have a strong stomach and never get food poisoning eating in my travels, road side food etc. and this bowl of soup totally managed to beat me down. If you want bad diarrhea for 5 days, coupled with stomach discomfort days after eating, this is the place for you. To note, the soup flavour wasn't fantastic (similar to Tom yum packet instant noodles). Eat at your own peril.
author: Wei Ling N.

description: This was the worst meal I've eaten in San Francisco by a considerable margin. The "house specialty" duck over rice was a truly miserable effort. I can't decide if I'm more offended by the incredibly small portion or the fact that it was terrible. Either way, there were precisely zero redeeming qualities about this establishment. Spoiler alert, I won't be back. Ever.
author: Kris H.

description: I ordered the Pad Thai which is number 18. It said it came with shrimp and tofu. I expected there to be a good amount, but there were only three shrimp and a few pieces of tofu. It was basically all noodles. It tasted ok. It could have used some lemon. Customer service was super slow. They took forever to give us our check and then take our check and then give it back. It wasn't even that busy. Ehhh I wouldn't come back.
author: Jah L.

description: Food tastes good. Especially the roasted duck noodle soup. But a little bit too salty (too much MSG?).
author: Carol X.

description: What an amazing find! Speedy service, reasonable price for what you get, and delicious food. I'm only in town for several far, but I will come back!  The beef larb rocks!
author: Dann D.

description:
This place is all right. 

The service is not that great.  It's just subpar. 

The food is pretty good as well.  I usually get pad see ew at thai place, but this one wasn't something to rave about.  If you work around the area, it's just a good place grab a quick lunch, but if you want authentic, really good thai food, this place probably isn't a good choice.  It's pretty americanized.
author: eunnah s.

description: When it's 2am, you're drunk, and you want a lot of filling food, it works. The restaurant in itself is dysfunctional and not the cleanest. But the pad Thai is really good.
author: Sarah C.

description: Never again. Everything else was closed so we didn't have much of a choice. The restaurant was drafty so I kept my jacket on the whole time. My bf and I got the pad thai and it tasted sulfuric. I never do this but I literally couldn't eat my dish, it was so pungent. I had to ask for it to be taken back to the kitchen. I got the pad kee mao instwas, which was burned so I had to pick out the burnt pieces and eventually gave up. My bf ordered thai ice tea which took 45 minutes to get there because they had to go to the store to get milk... they gave it to us for free but still, pretty unprofessional. Will never return!
author: Jane H.

description: Ordered Pad Kee Mao. Great, strong flavor. Beautiful. The Roasted Duck Noodle Soup is also outstanding. The soup is fragrant and very aromatic. I definitely love the Thai tea as well. Strong tea and great flavor. The restaurant also has polite waiters! I must come back...
author: Tim T.

description:
My girlfriends and I came in last night looking for some delicious thai to end our night. Our party was 6 people, but they couldn't seat us right away. They asked us to wait even though we insisted that we didn't mind sitting at a table for 5 and just pulling up an extra chair. They were rude and ignored our request. During this time, a group of loud and drunk friends jumped ahead of us and got seated right away even though they had 5 people. The waitress still refused to seat us when we pointed that out to her. We ended up leaving the restaurant due to the waitress' rudeness to us. Don't come here if you don't want a friendly face welcoming and serving you. 

Note to business: treat all your consumer with respect and fairness. Also, train your staff!!
author: Tram N.

description:
This place should be a mandatory food/rest stop if you decide to do your shopping downtown.  Imagine my surprise I haven't reviewed this place already.  King of Thai Noodle House is open very late and serves you lots of hot, rich food very quickly.

Things That Are Awesome:
+++Noodle soup bowls.  Choose from a vast selection of broths/toppings (I opt for duck or beef combination) and choose your own noodle style.  Perfect for a rainy day or when you are tired from a long day of shopping.
+++Duck rice dishes.  Hard enough finding a good restaurant that serves duck in this part of town.  Duck fried rice?  Now you're just crazy.  It is very rich, though.  I only finished a whole plate once in all the times I have eaten here.

Things That Are Not So Awesome:
---Service.  Either they rush you to get your order (like 3 minutes after you get seated and read the menu) or they don't come to you fast enough.  Usually I'm too tired from my shopping day to care.
---Humid.  Large open space kitchen.  Lots of people going in/out.  Poor ventilation.  Any combination of the three.  Sounds like a busy Asian restaurant to me.
author: Christine L.

description:
Everything was served quickly, but it also tasted like it might sat there for a while because it was all lukewarm.  Larb wasn't as tasty as I've had it at the Taraval location, and the Pad Kee Mao and Pad Thai were just so-so.  But, then again, my standards were properly adjusted for the fact that it was late, late night, so it nonetheless satisfied my hunger.

You decide whether this review is fair since it's based on a visit on Black Friday at 3 a.m.  It was really a 2 star experience, but I bumped it up to 3 stars because it was open at 3 a.m. on Black Friday, and the service was quick and prompt, so we could get our butts back out into the madness.
author: Christina L.

description: Amazing flavors! For me, it's all about the beef noodle soups. Pick the cuts of beef, pick a noodle type and Bam! A bowlful of flavor. Accent it with chili flakes, crush peanuts and sugar. Can't be beat for $8.50. I've also had the papaya salad and the dressing they make is very umami rich. The value for what you get is great!
author: David S.

description:
GOOD:
-   Opens late, until 2-3am
-   Relatively inexpensive? Most entrees were about$10. Fried banana ice cream though, was $6.50 or so.



Not sure if it's GOOD (because it might have been good drunk food?) or BAD:
-   There were a lot of very drunk guests there = people looking like they really partied too hard. If it weren't for the intact dresses, some of them looked like they had been in fights, or... had been "violated"..... 



Great SERVICE - NOT!
-   One woman looked like she was passed out at the table, face down, for a while wasn't moving, and no one offered her any type of assistance, not even just asking if she was ok. Her company did not look a whole lot better. She had to eagerly flag down someone to bring water and let them order food. 

-   I expected to have to wait given we had such a large group. But after they said they had a table for us, they left us standing in between other tables. We couldn't see the table they were going to seat us at, and no one said or gestured for us to follow someone. And when they finally did, they didn't bring us menus. They also couldn't count. One cup of water short. We had to ask 3 people before getting the last cup. 


BAD / REALLY BAD:

-   From the moment I saw the place even from outside, it looked unclean. I only went in because my large party of friends had been walking around looking for a place to grab a bite at 2am.
