I only drank the water because I was quite dehydrated. The menu was dirty. The tables and utensils didn't feel clean at all. Good thing there weren't enough chopsticks on our table, so they brought us all disposable ones. 


-   A number of things on the menu sounded good, but ---- the cashew chicken ($10ish) was 40% white rice, 35% cooked onion, 24.5% mushroom. Nowhere on the menu did it mention mushroom. There were a few pieces of terribly cooked meat (well at least it was cooked right?) and 3-4 pieces of cashew - no kidding!

-   I ordered the pineapple fried rice with no shrimp, no cilantro. I was impressed that they correctly left out what I didn't want, given that some of their staff spoke very little English. In fact, when I asked, "Was this supposed to have pineapple chunks or just pineapple juice?, the gal had to grab another waitress, who asked me if I wanted to order something else -  obviously completely did not understanding my question. I wondered how the waiter knew to serve the dish as pineapple fried rice when there was not one piece of pineapple in it. So they brought me a little bowl of uncooked, canned pineapple chunks. Lovely. It was also more greasy than any average fried rice. It had a puddle of orange-colored oil at the bottom. All in all, the taste of the fried rice itself probably could've earned as many as 4 stars IMO, but all the other problems combine? Um, no.

-   I also woke up in the middle of the night after getting home, feeling soooooo sick and being in soooooo much pain. Not sure if it was food poison or that the greasy just made me that bloated. I thought I was ready to puke a few times, but I didn't. I'd never been that bloated before, so I don't know exactly what that was. I didn't drink last night, so we couldn't blame it on alcohol. 

-   Lastly, I just searched on San Francisco's Department of Public Health, http://www.sfdph.org/dph/eh/food/score/default.asp because Yelp showed this place having a "health score" of 84, which sounded pretty high, in which case, how the hell did they get it? But - the DPH clearly states that score is in the class of:
    "Multiple violations observed"
    "Typically, several high-risk violations"

So, my suspicion was confirmed. I'd recommend getting your late dinner or drunk food somewhere else.
author: Jenn L.

description: My lady friend recommended I visit and order the #17 with beef and a Thai iced tea.  The service was great and the food tasty.  Unfortunately my belly began turning when I laid down last night and I was woken up with the worst nausea.  Was anyone else food poisoned last night or just me?
author: Ryan M.

description: Do not listen to anyone who gives this place poor rating KING OF THAI IS AMAZING I've been going here for forever get the pad see ew, fried chicken over fried rice, cashew nut chicken, chicken satay, yellow curry, and just so many things are delicious. And it's a really good deal considering sf in general is expensive and it's *~~*open late*~~* I luv king of Thai
author: Nicole S.

description:
OMG THE DUCK FRIED RICE IS AMAZING! 

My bf and I ordered take out from here and the food was ready within 10-15 minutes. We got the Duck Fried Rice and Pad Kee Mao. I didn't really eat much of the Pad Kee Mao because I was too busy devouring my fried rice. It was sooo good! The flavor was addicting and the amount of duck was perfect. I ate way more than I expected to because it just tasted that good. Definitely get the duck fried rice if you come here!
author: Sandra N.

description:
It took a long time for food to be served.
Waitress are careless i.e. : charged the food that was not on the table, another problem is I paid 4 to go foods & only got 3 foods ( I only found out @ home) plus I have to pay 10c for the bag
author: Kumala W.

description: This is one of those places a meat eating person like myself wouldn't even think about going to. After about 30 minutes of encouragement from my Asian coworker I decided to put the burrito down & pick up the chopsticks. I could tell this was a clean place right off the back walking through the door. About half of the restaurant was full with customers dining in a little after midnight. Very friendly & respectable worker as well. I let my coworker order my meal since I never have zero experience with Thai food. Pork fried rice & walnut soup was the selection from the menu. Waited about 15 minutes for the food to arrive. The rice & vegetables tasted so fresh. Not greasy like a lot of Asian food places. I was a little skeptical about the soup at first. But after spending $13 it at least had to be tried. It actually turned out to be quite refreshing. A strong taste at first but after a few spoon full's. I was a fan. It actually went well with the main dish. They also serve nice size amounts for the price tag. This is definitely a place I will keep on my radar.
author: Robert F.

description:
Meh. That about sums it up for the food here. My first time here will be my last time here. I ordered the pad thai- a basic staple I believe. Tasteless, flavorless, and 3 tiny ass shrimp. Barely any bean sprouts. I basically got bland flavored noodles. The hostess was extremely friendly, thus being the reason this is not a one star review. 

With a name like "King Of Thai", you have high expectations. What a let down. The location is tourist central so maybe that's why the standards aren't that high but I think even a hungry tourist would be disappointed.
author: Kaliah C.

description: I love the noodle soup here it is the combination beed noodle soup it is so yummy it remind me of the Thai noodle soup in Hong Kong its hella good!!!! But I knock off one star is Bec on their menu they seems to have all these yummy deserts but when we decided to order some they seems to be out of everything but the noodle soup is very very yummy no complain there
author: Clara L.

description:
OK, so maybe stumbling into King of Thai Noodle late one Thursday night was not our proudest moment. But we had just indulged a bit too heavily at Butter and needed something substantial in our tummies before falling into bed and this seemed to be a much better option than Denny's. 

This place offers the perfect assortment of drunk food, including my favorite dish: fried chicken over fried rice. Now usually I'd feel a bit of guilt ordering a dish that has the word 'fried' in it not once but twice. But when you've just had three or so shots of fernet (when you HATE fernet), it sounds like a brilliant plan. I gobbled it right up - I love the big slices of cucumber they put on their fried rice!

The service was patient and friendly and they even took some substitutions that my dining mates placed. Some of our servers were a bit hard to understand, but they were working and trying so hard it's impossible to fault them for it. 

A great late night option!
author: Christina P.

description: I'm writing this review as I sit in this restaurant, stuffed with Pad Thai & Chicken Satay! We ordered #1, which is a beef noodle soup, egg rolls, chicken satay, chicken pad Thai, & some type of beef w/ rice. All were flavorful & good!!!! As for me, I only ate chicken satay & pad Thai. Both were very delicious. I recommend this restaurant if you're feeling like having some great Thai food!!
author: Kody P.

description:
Thai Food? I'm so there! 

Came here on a Friday around 1:00pm, and it was still pretty busy. The lady offered us a table upstairs (which I didn't even know they had). Then they offered us two at the bar area, but we declined because we had our big backpack, so we just waited patiently. 

When we got to our table, the waitress quickly brought two glasses of water for us (+), though she seemed in a rush to take our order (-). In my mind, I'm thinking "We just sat down, I haven't even taken off my backpack." Which can be a (+) if you're a regular and tryna to feed your stomach ASAP. 

Eventually, we agreed on Pad See Eww and a Duck Fried Rice. The dishes are about $8/plate, but they are generous potions. I am surprised they didn't have any lunch specials. (-) 

Duck Fried Rice: Oily, but I think that's duck for you. It was delicious - I recommend. 
Pad See Eww: A little sweet, but still delish! 

I'd come back, but Sala Thai in Fremont is where my allegiance lies.
author: Stephanie W.

description: The beef noodles #1 was a waste of money. They used spinach instead of the traditional morning glory cause it's "seasonal". Never heard of that. The Thai place I go to never uses anything else but morning glory. The noodles felt like they just dropped it in your bowl to cook as they brought it to you. The beef was like rubber, thick and chewy. The broth was not good. There was a strong flowering scent and taste to it, don't quite know what that is. What told me from the start about what's to come was....the water with no ice. Such a pet peeve.  Nothing to bring me back here.
author: Derek F.

description:
Basic Lunch, Duck Fried Rice & eggroll with a thai ice tea. 

The rice plate came out blistering fast. 5 minutes tops! But the rice didn't taste super fresh, not enough egg, and barely any duck meat at all for 10 bucks. meh....

The eggroll was hot and tasty but only 3 pieces, and the tea was just ok. I feel like the king of thai off sloat, and the north beach location are far superior...
author: Benjamin B.

description: Very good Thai food & extremely quick service. We were vacationing & stumbled upon this this TINY little restaurant in the city. SO glad we did. The Spicy Chicken Cashew was excellent. Definitely recommend!
author: L2 A.

description: Food was very good, I love that they are vegetarian friendly. Service is fast and friendly. I would recommend this place if you ate in the mood for good Chinese or thai food. The only thing that bothered me was the lack of cleanliness. The water I got had some strange white food? Floating around in it. Also the chop sticks had dust and spider webs on them maybe from the container where they keep them.
author: Ricardo C.

description:
I really really like Thai food, I had a business trip to San Francisco, walking over Ofarrell st I found THE KING OF THAI, such a lovely place, full of great food, amazing service and gosh that curry is unbelievable 
Highly recommend and for sure I'm coming back to try more dishes 

Trust me I'm super particular with my food and service, that's why I give them 4 starts
author: Francesco G.

description: Good location - near our hotel, great food, speedy service, open late, a little too pricey, but what do you expect?!...it's near Union Square haha. I would definitely recommend this restaurant if you are in the Union Square area and looking to eat some good pho!
author: Maiyiv T.

description: This place sucks. I ordered a pad thai shrimp waited 25 minutes and still wasn't ready, the 2 people next to me literally walked in and sat down 10 minutes after I did and they got their food before I did. When the pad thai finally came, half the plate was noodles and the rest was raw bean sprouts and there were only 3 shrimp for a $10.55 plate! What a disgrace to Thai food. Also during the 25 minute wait a pigeon flew inside and it took 5 staff to get it out...terrible service, terrible food, unsanitary restaurant conditions...if that's what you're looking for this is a place to go.
author: Berna V.

description:
Great food!!! I've been visiting in Thailand few times and the food in this restaurant is even better then in Thailand!!!
The service is very quick! 
Although the place not design as a modern restaurant, this is one of that busiest restaurant I ever seen!!
Highly recommended!
author: Regina L.

description:
My friends and I decided to stop by here last night because the place seemed very popular with their high volume of customers that night. Also because it is one of the nearby places that are opened late in Union Square. 

Cutting to the chase, we got seated fairly quickly after agreeing on taking the seat at the bar. MELTED ice water was brought out to the three of us. So we all ordered actual beverages instead. My friend and I ordered a sprite. We were given a cup of ice and the can of soda. Our ice was already melting away in the cup...Ugh. 

My friends ordered a duck noodle soup and the other ordered a plate of fried rice. The duck noodle was really tasty. I liked the flavorful broth. And The fried rice was equally amazing. 

But as for my pad thai...well, it was a waste of money. Pad Thai is a very popular Thai dish and so I know a lot of people, such as myself, would be very likely to order it. But I just don't feel like you get your money's worth here with that dish. I was given the choice of meat and I chose shrimp because that's the traditional way. They gave me like three shrimps...WOW. C'mon now. It's the bay area. Can we NOT be so stingy with the seafood? WHAT'S UP WITH THAT? Smh. 

I thought that it was nice how they have so many variety of condiments ready on each table. Except that all of ours were just about empty. Oh yes, they do take the time to refill it. By constantly crowding by us while we're eating to try and replace the jars! 

When it was time for dessert, I all of a sudden didn't mind the measly shrimp that made it in my dish. I didn't care about them buzzing around us, reaching for jars of condiments. THE FRIED BANANA ICE CREAM WAS DELICIOUS! They give you a choice of three different ice-cream: green tea, coconut, and thai tea. We got the thai tea flavored one. I didn't even know that there was such thing! It tasted incredible. The inside of the chewy crepe was a piping hot fried banana. And also on the plate of course, is a generous portion of the thai tea ice-crea, topped with whip cream and a drizzle of fudge. We grabbed a condiment jar at the table and threw some peanuts on it.. Really good stuff! 

Everything was reasonably price ranging from ($7-$10) Overall, it was a good experience and I would do it again.
author: Thanh B.

description:
Been to this place a few times. Their food quality has been kept up. My favorite is always the chicken pad se ew. My sister ordered the chicken fried rice. Pad se ew is really tasty while the fried rice is lack of seasoning. We liked the pad se ew more than the fried rice. They provide chili pepper on the table, so we could make our dishes as spicy as we wanted. It's missing salt though. The fried rice really could have used some salt. 
As far as the staff goes, they are all super nice and attentive :) They always asked if we wanted more water and always refilled our water without being asked. 
They also always asked if everything was ok. The place was crowded as always, but the staff was all ready and alert. I really like that. 
For the price, a dish is around 9 bucks. A little pricey for a Thai restaurant, but it's in downtown. We would go back again despite the price :)
author: Ervi L.

description: Some food was bland because I think they're trying to cater to the American market because some food may be too flavorful for since to handle. I had a good experience with the servers because they always took care of us.
author: Okikuni O.

description: Back for my most fav dish , Roast Duck with Rice Noodles. This place is a must stop for me when I am in the bay area. Open late and usually great after hours. Usually busy but they take care of you very quickly. You can basically custom make you own bowl of noodles with the different types of broths available. I went with the waitress recommendation which I don;t regret and now is my favorite every time i am in town.
author: Robert G.

description:
Never again, I say never I will ever go back to this Thai Resturant in downtown ever again. Horrible costumer Service EVER! To bad, Yelp require us to rate 1 star in order to write a review. I would give this place No star.

I ordered a pad Thai with shrimp. When my order came I notice the noodle and shrimp were burnt and it smell. I took a bite of it and it taste burnt. I told one of the waitress that my food is burnt and requested for a new dish. At first, her reaction seem to not want to bring the food back and instead she said, let me go ask the chef. 

Waitress: She brought the food back to me and said, that the chef said the food was ok and that I should eat it. 

Me: (I looked at her in shocked) I told her again, " the food is burnt and I cannot eat it!"

Waitress: her respond was, "oh ok let me go ask again."

Me: ( At this moment I was mad), like are you kidding me?)

Waitress: this is the 3rd time she came back with the burnt food and keep insisting that the food was ok to eat. 

Me: At this moment I was FURIOUS! I looked at her and said, " you got to be kidding me! The food is burnt and you expect me to eat this? You guys can't make me a new dish? 

Waitress: again, she said " food is ok to eat."

Me: I got up from my chair and spoke very loudly so ppl can hear. I said, " you know what? I'm not eating this burnt food and I'm never coming back to this place again. You guys have the most horrible costumer service ever!" After that I stormed out.

How could a Resturant like this treat costumers so bad. Especially in a busy downtown area. You cannot serve a costumer burn food and expect to eat it. The right thing to do is to make a costumer a new dish and they cannot even do that. I would not recommend anyone to eat here until they improve on their costumer service. The owner of this Resturant should learn how to do business. They are lucky that they own this place in downtown because if it was somewhere else they would run out of business so fast.
author: Nin N.

description:
Their restaurant is not very big but they know how to get guest in and out quickly. The food is good and they get your order out to you fast.

I recently noticed if you ask can you order extra, like extra shrimp in the fried rice, the over all order is smaller than just ordering it regular. This happened to me. I wanted an extra order of shrimp in my rice and when the plate hit the table it had less rice than I had on previous visits and the extra shrimp was two shrimp at $1.50. I tried to ask the server and she didn't understand so I then tried to speak to they guy who I think was the owner and he tried to say extra shrimp was $.50 per piece. How could that be when I only got two extra shrimp?

This also happened a while ago when I ordered extra meat in my soup. At that time I thought it was just an accident to get a smaller portion when you order something extra. Lesson learned. I'll still probably eat here, but no extras will be ordered.
author: Chardonnai S.

description: I really like Thai food and wasn't super hungry, so my husband and I split a dish. We had the pad see ew and it was huge. Definitely big enough to split. The ladies working were all very friendly and we received quick service.  It did seem a bit bare bones; the walls were painted purple and it was a bit dirty. Could really do a lot to spruce it up, but the food and prices were good.
author: Ashley P.

description:
My god. 

First off, this place is way too expensive. Yeah, $10-12 a dish in union square I'm saying is too expensive. This is some rich one dollar sign restaurant man. $10 around here gets you Ramen Underground and great Bahn Mi. Hell, $3 more gets you muraccis. 

This place is just bad. The food came out far too quick to be of any quality. And then it was bad. Terrible. They also charge you for the tea... Don't see that much at Asian places. 

I wouldnt even come here drunk. And that's bad.
author: Vic V.

description: The absolute worst thai place ive ever been to. Rude, careless servers. Nothing stocked on tables we had to ask several times for utensils and spices. Bad beef soup with mostly fat and very little beef. Bland seafood soup, had to cancel the rest of the order after waiting 30 min. The only redeeming quality here is that its open late but whats the use if everything else is bad. Never coming back
author: Steven R.

description: I love this place because it delivers a solid experience. It's cheap, easy to get to, open late and they don't charge a corkage fee. It's a great place for going out with friends, especially when you're wanting a restaurant around Union Square that's not overpriced and overrun with tourists. There Chicken Cashew Nut is delicious.
author: Stanley B.

description:
Do you like pad thai? Shut up, of course you do!  Best pad Thai I've had in the Tenderloin neighborhood. 

It's conveniently located on O'Ferrel right across from several hotels (Hilton, Nikko, some shit hole). They deliver so don't even put your pants on. 

This neighborhood is covered in Thai restaurants and this one is always crowded so that's a good sign.
author: Josh S.

description: Every time we visit our friends in Bay Area, I have to have fantastic dinner over here. Very charming place, awesome Thai food and fantastic hospitality.
author: Somsak A.

description:
I got egg rolls and soup. Egg told were $9 for three of them, they were definitely ordered in a big bag frozen and fried. Very oily, a non-authentic egg roll with not fresh cabbage. I'm used to hand wrapped egg rolls with crispy fresh cabbage and beautifully crispy fried roll. 
Soup was good, spicy with heat, not hot. Flavorful even though at first glance I thought just a boring mix of veggies. Good flavors. I'd go back and try some sort of noodles bc it's a noodle place and I didn't have any.
author: Char D.

description:
I like the other locations of King of Thai better.

I got seafood Pad see ew. At other king of thai's, they give you more seafood. I had like 2 shrimps, 4 calamaris, and 2 fish cakes. Sad. AND more expensive

I must say, their hostess was nice, she is very attentative to tables. Even more than servers. She was the one who noticed we were ready to order. 

Big place though. From the outside they look like a small restaurant but they have a small back seating area and an upstairs.
author: Erica L.

description: So the food was ok - I wanted a thicker noodle however it satisfied my desire for noodles
author: Lynnette B.

description:
Came here with a bunch of friends who have been raving about the fried duck rice here. We ordered two plates of fried duck rice, Tom yum soup and duck noodle soup.

I liked the Tom yum soup, a lot better than other places in the Bay Area that I've tried. But it wasn't mindblowing, it was just good Thai food. The fried duck rice was pretty tasty as well, but could definitely use more duck. My boyfriend was also a little sad with the portion of the duck noodle soup. All in all, a very tasty meal but ill probably keep looking for a go to Thai place.

The only reason I'm scoring this place so highly is because of their dessert. We got the fried banana with ice cream - I think the ice cream is homemade, it's so delicious. The fried banana is warm and mushy on the inside and crispy on the outside. Perfect! And the ice cream is just so amazing, we had the green tea and Thai tea and wow I can honestly say I've never had such delicious creamy ice cream in my life. Mmmm it was so good! 

So while I can't vouch for the quality or value of the food you get here, I would definitely recommend this place to everyone for the best dessert and ice cream ever!
author: Sarah T.

description:
Loved everything here....

The service is impeccable- friendly, genuine, fast and efficient which is perfect/convenient when you're on lunch and in a hurry. 

The food is authentically delicious- no need to add any condiments. There are so many veggie n meat options. 
Make sure to ask for a little kick of spice before hand if you are someone like me who puts hot sauce and damn near everything.

Oooooh about the ice tea!!! It's different but sooooo freaking delicioussssssssss!! 


The staff is what makes this spot special to me though!! GRACE IS AMAZING!!!!!!!! 

Will be back!!!!
author: Meryem E.

description: I ordered pork fried rice , didn't take awhile to notice that they increased the price for everything so we hope for a better quality food OR at least the same as it used to be . Instead we got a plate of oily fried rice that barely tastes like anything, and was not filling for one person. I noticed that they cut down on the quality of the meat and amount served but did not cut down on the oil . I believe that I deserve to rate them because I have been going there for over 5 years and noticed all these difference. I used to love them but now I'm just disappointed .
author: Jessica W.

description: By far the best thai food in union square.  The atmosphere isn't great and it's noisy but when it's packed full of Asian Americans you can't go wrong.  Every dish was excellent and the prices way cheap.
author: Carl P.

description: My man and I were looking for a place to eat on our way home and decided to stop here. We forgot what we ordered, but whatever it was gave me food poisoning for about three days. After we complained about the food, the "manager" told us she would give us ten percent off. After one more complaint she gave us a "refund" and we walked out the door.  If I had the choice to give this place 0/5 stars, I would. We were not impressed with the quality of the food. The slices of "beef" were not properly cooked, still filled with blood.
author: Brianne C.

description:
Pretty freaking good.

It's slightly more expensive than the Thai place around the corner on Powell, but I would say it tastes better.  I got the Pad-See-Ew, which was pretty freaking tasty!  I got it with chicken... they definitely do not skimp on the meat!  I ended up only having chicken leftover because there was so much.

We had also ordered some type of yellow curry with duck as an appetizer (I think it is normally an entree).  SO good!!  Wish I had kind of ordered it as an entree.  It was $10, but did not come with a lot of duck.  Veryyy delicious though.

My friend got the Pad Kee-?? with beef.  I tried a little bit of it, and it was better than my Pad See Ew in my opinion.  You could really taste the natural flavor of the green and red bell peppers that came with it!  Definitely did not need to add any chili or other sauces to it!

If I'm nearby, I would definitely come back :)

Their Thai iced tea is reallllly good too!!
author: Jennifer L.

description: Too expensive for Thai food, and they mostly do soups and noodles.  They don't have many stir fry dishes.  Go down Powell street another block and eat there.
author: Michelle R.

description:
Pad See Ew? More like Pad See YUM! 

If you're craving some good Asian food, I highly recommend going to King Of Thai Noodle House and ordering their Pad See Ew. If you have never tried Thai Iced Tea before, I HIGHLY recommend that too because it's a must whenever you go to a Thai restaurant. 

This restaurant has a pretty good selection of menu items, and on average, each dish costs between $9-11, which isn't too bad for the portions they give you. On top of that, the food is made pretty quickly and they have so many workers there, that service is pretty fast. 

A part of my wishes that each dish was a little bit cheaper ($10.50/dish for that kind of restaurant is kind of pushing it), but what else can you expect from a restaurant in a touristy area? 

If you're looking for really good Asian food and/or a quick sit-down meal, King Of Thai Noodle House is the place for you!
author: Mark B.

description: I ordered the Roasted Duck Noodle Soup after reading the reviews about it.  Duck Broth was SUPER good and who doesn't love duck?  The Duck Fried Rice was also very good.  Service is very friendly.  Pad Thai is good, Combo Pan Friend Noodles is good, what else did we order? Anyways, I've never came to this location and to be honest, I didn't even know there was this location until yesterday. I know hella late.  O'Farrell location is smaller so if you're looking for a bigger seating, def. should go to the one off Grant.
author: Joane B.

description:
My classmate and I popped into this restaurant out of sheer convenience after spending some time wandering around shopping. Service was prompt, and we were sat almost immediately. I noticed the location itself seemed a bit narrow and cramped, but it was surprisingly spacious (though the stranger sharing our table may not have agreed).

I ordered the pad see ew and was pretty shocked to see the large portion size, especially given the price. Cheap and plenty of food? This is my kind of place! However I should note that I think I got maybe 3-4 shrimp in my entire serving as the large portioning was almost exclusively due to the noodles and veggies, and the noodles were somewhat on the bland side for what I was expecting. Seeing as I wish I had gotten more shrimp (especially for the extra fee), maybe not completely my kind of place.

I'd give this 3.5 stars if I could, but Yelp doesn't give half stars which is lame.
author: Brandon K.

description: Great service friendly staff.. and reasonable prices.. dont ask for spicy unless you are a match!!
author: johnny w.

description: Location alone should not dictate price/quality.  I say this because this King of Thai is pricey compared to the portion given. While I am happy to pay the price, please give some more to commensurate with what is charged.   My dish was mostly flat noodles, with a bit of pork. Not even one whole string bean - really?  How much cheaper can it get?!  Flavor was decent but I won't be returning to this King of Thai. I go to the other locations and was very disappointed with the value of this one. I won't be returning here... I made a mistake.  SF downtown has a plethora of choices.  Wish I took a picture to show the meager quantity.
author: simone x.

description: Great late night Thai food.  The bf and I arrived in Union Square after a late flight from LAX around 11pm, and this place was still packed.  Luckily the service is speedy and food comes out fast, so we were able to grab a table within 5-10 minutes.  We got a fried rice dish, pad see ew, and tom yum soup.  Everything was delicious and super flavorful.  They have boat noodles which I'm sure is just as good as everything else.  I would definitely return!
author: Eunice J.

description: I like coming here when I feel like having a good meal at an inexpensive price. Check it out! Should not disappoint most taste buds.
author: Amy M.

description:
Love your Basil chicken! It is just awesome.
Overall, prices very reasonable, after the call it usually takes 8-10 min max and the food is ready (I usually order food to go).
Thank you guys!
author: TS P.

description: I must say best service, fast and friendly too.  The dishes are good.  They charge $0.95per cup of tea.  Everything came out very fast. Good food fast service! Go try it once you are in the Union square!
author: Warunee G.

description:
5 stars of course!
I took many of my friends to here, and they always love this place!  They took their parents, bf gf..... to here!  Everyone loves here!
author: Brandy C.

description: My friends and I had lunch at this place on Aug 14. The food was fine, but the service was worse than we expected. A few days later, I gave them a call to request a receipt of the meal, which I needed for reimbursement. They refused to provide the receipt because they thought it put them to trouble. How could a merchant refuse to give a customer a receipt!
author: Bin B.

description:
Great food! Pad kee Mao was off the hook. 
Location is always packed so we usually order for take out.
author: Tone D.

description:
This place is open late which means this is our go to spot after a night of clubbing. I like that they are so nice even when we are intoxicated. The food is decent and the service is really fast. I would definitely recommend coming here if you're in the area and its late and you're hungry!!!

PS. they don't serve alcohol at 2AM?
author: Stephanie W.

description: Ugh. I got the beef stew noodle soup. So not good. There was virtually no beef in it, only gelatinous chunks of fat. They also skimped on the noodles.
author: Jarrod S.

description:
Found this restaurant on Yelp while searching for late night comfort food. Ordered pad thai to go, nice packaging and good hostess service.

Pad thai was very fresh and al dente, large portion given, also received bean sprouts and lime. Noodles were super comforting to eat! Shrimp was okay, on the drier end. Overall, favorite pad thai so far. Will return for future late night food cravings.

1 star off for being on the more expensive end for Thai restaurants, but given how rare decent late night food is in SF, worth the price. Or maybe I don't know enough late night food places, rec some to me?
author: Christy L.

description: Wow I literally sat there as the dumb waitresses came by and refilled their chili powder without acknowledging me for 20 minutes... Talk about incompetence... Avoid this place!
author: Nathan D.

description:
Arrived inSF at 9 pm and needed a quick bite.  So I ordered the standard Pad Thai with Shrimp.  It literally came out in under 5 minutes.  It had, and I'm not exaggerating, THREE small, overcooked shrimp, a small mound of Pad Thai noodles and about a half pound of fresh bean sprouts.  And also about a dozen inedible fried cubes which I assume were tofu, but tasted so foul that I spit the one I tasted out after not quite being able to bite through the thing.  

It tasted ok, but I will forget about it within the next 20 minutes.  Other dishes may be better, but definitely do not get the Shrimp Pad Thai!!!!
author: George T.

description:
The food is delicious. That day I was hungry and I couldn't find the better place near downtown to have a noodle soup because the time almost 11, and I was glad to come there. I ordered one noodle soup, I forgot the name of my food, maybe beef combination soup. I like it so much because it's delicious and it also remind me my countryside. The beef noodle soup is famous in my countryside and the food in kind of Thai noodle is similar with the food in my countryside. In that noodle soup, there is beef ball and beef brisket, and the soup is covered by the beef sauce, so it tastes very good.

The service is good too. There have a fixed girl to bring people to their table. That girl is so friendly and I feel comfortable to eat there. And she is patient even though my friend have many requirements in the busy time. And the other waitresses are nice too, and the food comes quickly.

Even though this place in downtown, I don't think the food it's pricey. The price is suitable for the food you order.

But the down side is that the place is not clean, and the health grade is low.
author: Ella P.

description:
It's pretty crazy how late this place stays open...

This is totally my go to spot if I have no idea where to eat at downtown.  There is a wide variety of selections on the menu as I usually get the #4 with small rice noodle OR Pad Thai OR Duck with Rice.  The food in my opinion is pretty good for a spot like this.  I consider it somewhat of a speedy Thai restaurant.  You will definitely get your food pretty quickly after your order.  Seating usually is not a problem unless you have a big party.  Then you may need to wait a bit.  The pricing is fair for its locale and food portions.  

Try the Thai Iced Tea or Thai Iced Coffee as well.  It's always consistent and good.
author: Bernie C.

description:
This is my default lunch spot when I'm itching for Thai food.  It's conveniently located next to Macys, the food is yumz and the prices are good (for San Francisco standards). 

Things you should try when you dine here...

1) Pad see u
2) Seafood rice noodle soup
3) Yellow curry with rice
4) Fish cakes appetizers

I always try to order something different each time and the outcome is always tasty.  Definitely try this place if your venturing around Union Square.  It gets crowded during peak hours but I think it's worth the wait.
author: Jenny T.

description: The service wasn't excellent, but it's a great spot for a quick but delicious bite to eat. We ordered Thai iced teas which they forgot about, so we ended up getting them to go at the end of the meal. I got the curry noodle soup which was great and my girlfriend got the veggie noodle soup which she said was also really good. I always look for a good vegetarian place when taking her out and she liked the variety of menu options here. You can substitute meat for tofu/veggies on just about any dish which is perfect. Note: it's a cash only place, but they have an ATM right in the restaurant which can come in handy.
author: Melissa M.

description:
Yum! My boyfriend and I visited this King of Thai location on a Friday afternoon at around 6pm. We were seated right away and were stumped because we didn't know what to order. The friendly hostess suggested some items that we would enjoy. We ordered the Yellow Curry with steamed rice, the Pad Thai, and Thai Iced Tea.

Pad Thai - If you like a lot of bean sprouts, then this is the Pad Thai for you! I felt like there were more bean sprouts than noodles which was a bummer. The Pad Thai was very good, not the best, but very good.

Yellow Curry with steamed rice - The Yellow curry was fantastic and had tons of chicken and potatoes cooked into the dish. It's a tad bit spicy, but nothing water can't handle.

Thai Iced Tea - It was pretty much your standard Thai Iced Tea with more tea flavor.

It took about 10 minutes to get our check despite the amount of waiters/waitresses working the floor. Our total came out to $27 for 2 people which is quite pricy in my opinion. The portions are huge, the service is fantastic, and the location is easily accessible.
author: Joyce E.

description:
Bad seating, right in between two doors. The bathroom and the storage closet, so we had to constantly get up so people can open the doors. 

Pad Thai had no flavor whatsoever. 

WILL NOT COME AGAIN.
author: Jenny E.

description: The place was busy so thought the food would be good, but overall our Pad Thai and pineapple fried rice was a little below average. Our beef jerky appetizer was the most appealing dish. The environment feels a little dirty but service was ok. Overall this is a 2 star place, and probably not a place I would visit again.
author: Jerod Y.

description: Its really bad.. Its like they were just inventing food.. Costumer service sucks! Never going back here
author: Christian S.

description:
One of my fave noodle places in the City. Don't let the crummy walls and lack of atmosphere fool you, King Of Thai produces good food at moderate prices and is one of the few late night places found around Union Square.

My personal faves include the Hoi Jor and Fish Cakes for appies and the Beef Pad See Eew and Yellow Curry for mains.

My only complaint is that they are often so busy that they sometimes "lose" an order and you have to remind them about the food you are waiting for.
author: Nathan D.

description: This place is horrible it's a tourist shop for shoppers around the area. You are better off going down to the west field mall to eat lunch are dinner. Also the restaurant is very dirty and not up to part I ask for a fork it was very dirty then I ask for a Thai tea and my glass was dirty too with black things in it I have no idea what it was smh... My mom paid cause we didn't want to cause a scene however it was removed Frm her credit card later. Please do not go here so many more great places 2 eat in SF!
author: LV V.

description: Fairly good Thai on the go. Average price. I got the chicken fried rice for about 10 bucks. Loved that they had different levels of spicy.
author: Ruth M.

description:
I've previously eaten at the one in North Beach.  I assumed the food would be the same.  Not really.  At the one in North Beach I had a fantastic pumpkin curry, so I knew exactly what I wanted to order.

The pumpkin curry here had 2 and a half chunks of pumpkin.  That's it!  If they had run out of it, I wish they would have told me instead of serving me what was apparently left at the bottom of the pot.

I was with about 5 other people; I don't remember what everyone had, but I do remember noticing that nobody cleaned their plate.  So, it was pretty lackluster.
author: Chloe M.

description: Waited for an hour for my food.. When asked they had not even started preparing it.  People who walked in 10 min ago had their families 5 people got theirs served before mine :(
author: Akash Y.

description:
This is mediocre Thai food at best.  

The place is a little dirty.  I sat at the bar along the wall and there were food splashes all over the wall and heavy dust along the beams. I wanted to grab a rag and some vinegar to clean it up a little.  

The wait staff was relatively friendly.  

On to the food. I ordered the pad thai, and was so unimpressed. Probably one of the worst thai foods I have ever had. The noodles were goopy and did not taste fresh at all. Almost like they were sitting out since lunch.

The thai iced tea was probably the only thing I enjoyed in my meal.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
CASH ONLY!!  We ate here for a cheap & quick Thai dinner.  It's close to Powell St Bart only a few block up & on the Right on O'Farrell St, Union Square.  It's very purple in there.

Place was busy at 6pm on Sat night, but they found us a two-top table.

We got:

Seafood noodle soup $7.45- shrimp, calamari, fake crab meat, fish balls, fish cakes, white mushroom & beansprouts, noodles in clear broth.  B. liked it.

Pad kee mao $7.75 - fat rice noodles w/ choice of ground meat, some green beans, bell peppers, thai chili & basil.  Not enough green beans, not spicy at all when I requested it, ground meat average.  Really enough for 2 people since it's large portion.

Thai iced tea $2.50 - good.

Before tip it was $19.40.  Tamarind hard candy given with bill.  CASH ONLY!!
author: Ann L.

description: Delicious and fast, friendly service. Noodle dishes and egg rolls were excellent. Food came to table 6 min after ordering. Highly recommend!
author: Mike M.

description:
I've had better Thai food at cheaper prices...

I got pad thai to-go on a weekday for lunch. The place was packed and it was really hard to get attention. They also seemed to be mixing a bunch of the to-go orders, which were all piled on the table nearest the door. 

My pad thai was cold and all the noodles were stuck together and hard to eat. As my friend mentioned, it is unfair to compare SF prices to Berkeley, but even so, the pad thai was not up to my expectations at all. There were only 2 pieces of shrimp in my whole box...and my meal cost $10 after tax for something that would cost $7 in Berkeley and taste much better.
author: Jenny M.

description: On a rainy day I walked over to the Bangkok Noodles on Powell to discover to my huge disappointed that they've closed!!! Sniffles-Sniffles-Sniffles! I will miss my regular favorite #21 - stir fry mung bean vermicelli noodle with seafood and this sour-y side reddish bean sauce - boo hoo-hoo!!! I know I'll have to go to Berkeley so one of these days days I will drive over. And since I was in a Thai food state of mind I decided to go round the corner and walk over to try the one called King of Thai noodle.Sadly they don't even come close. The fried rice was sweet - like sugared fried rice. The Pad Thai does not sport that tamarind-y taste enough. Sorry - no go.
author: Nancy T.

description: Best And fast service! Food is made for a king! Their curry and pad see ew are awesome! They are well know for their chicken over rice
author: Frances V.

description: My date Angel took me to this place. He asked me if I liked Thai food, and well yes I love Thai food. this place was rockin. We got seats right away even though its located in one of the busiest parts of San Francisco. i have to say I've had Pad Thai at other places but this place, the Pad Thai was screaming with flavor. From the beginning to the very last drop I was savouring each bite slowly. Definitely a place worth returning to.
author: Vilbert A.

description: My girlfriend and I both felt sick as quickly as our walk back fo the car. I ordered the roasted duck over steamed white rice and she got the pad ke mao with ground beef. Never do I complain about speedy service but my dish was put In front of me only 3 minutes after I ordered, that was strange. Her pad ke Mao took an additional 10 minutes. They both ate okay but the aftermath was extremely un pleasant. We had dinner at Cockscomb the night before so anything would have seemed in worthy after that meal, just didn't intend on getting sick that's all
author: Perry S.

description: Food is good and affordable for the downtown area. It's bigger than it seems and the service was great my only regret is not ordering the soup, which seems to be the popular choice.
author: Mike G.

description: The food is really good and you get to pick your noodle with each soup. The only thing I'd suggest is don't let them seat you upstairs (unless you're starving and don't care about ambience). It's not cute up there and you definitely feel like you're in an annex. Otherwise great spot and worth the wait if you like really great soup. (Try the duck stew with egg noodles).
author: Vivadc G.

description:
We went into this place for lunch on a yesterday, and there were 8 of us in our party. This isn't a large place, and didn't seem like somewhere that you could push the tables together. The wait staff informed us of this, and did their best to accommodate us by seating five of us first, then another five when the space opened. Before that happened, the one large table in the back of the restaurant near the kitchen opened up, and they let us sit back there, even though it was probably not meant for 8 people, and we were partially blocking one of their service doors. It was really nice of them.

I ordered what I always order, yellow curry and a Thai iced tea, and I have to say that this did not disappoint. Everyone really seemed to enjoy their food, and unlike some Thai restaurants, the stuff that was supposed to be spicy actually was.

The only complaint I had was the timing that the food was brought out, which bothers some people more than others. One of my friends had ordered three different plates of food; one plate was brought out long before everyone else's, and he being the polite person he is, waited for our food. Needless to say, his food was cold by the time he started eating it. The rest of his food came with everyone else's food, but unfortunately my friend did not receive his food. 

We waited so long that he was getting ready to flag down the waitress to make sure that his order hadn't been missed, when it finally showed up. I understand that these things happen sometimes though, and with such a large party along with a full restaurant it may be difficult to prepare so much food at once.
author: Chris A.

description:
So it's cheap, it's fast and it's extra greasy.

Was excited to be eat here while in the area because I use to live in the Richmond district and loved the King of Thai on Clement there.  

But sometimes, when you gotta have thai and willing to compromise on quality, it's not such a bad place.
author: Amihan M.

description:
Heard of this place a lot and I wanted to give a try!
Out of everything that I've ordered, shrimp Pad Thai was the best!
I've been to many authentic Thai restaurants but this franchised Thai restaurant does a good job on pad thai!
Service was not bad compare to other Thai restaurant. 
However, the parking was a bit hard. I parked at the parking lot across the street, it was packed with cars and I had hard time finding a parking space. But, it is the central city, can't complain for the parking...
author: James P.

description:
My friend and I were in the area and popped in for some cheap Thai. We split an order of pad thai. It was the most bland pad thai. Just a pile of noodles, no spice, no peanuts (we had to add them ourselves from a container on the table), no other veggies aside from bean sprouts, only THREE small shrimp and two pieces of tofu. We were surprised by how boring it is. 

We also had "egg rolls" (which were more spring roll) and they were forgettable. Service was nothing to report but they were friendly and efficient. 

I hate this neighborhood when it comes to eating out and this place was no exception.
author: Sarah S.

description: always my go to Thai food in San Francisco. the one on Clement street location is better but hey food is the same! it's great!
author: Bradley Y.

description:
I've been wanting to eat here for as long as I can remember. But, due to my, "hectic schedule" (a schedule in which I just want to get seated and be done and over with eating). Either way, last night I got lucky since the place was partially packed. We got seated, we got our orders taken, and our food came as fast as it could.

The food? It was good. Why? Because it was. I love how hot and cooked everything was. The fried banana was awesome too. I loved the green tea ice cream that came with it.

So yes, as far as I'm concerned I'm giving this place five stars. :P
author: Dominique S.

description:
Quick service; tasty for what it is...basic fare at an affordable price in the middle of an expensive city :)

Close to shopping so if you are starved and want a hot meal with some spice, this is a good place to go.
author: Teju A.

description: Super fast, super cheap, friendly, tasted great!  Not fancy looking, but who cares?  In a city that is terribly expensive, this is a place that offers good food, fast and cheap.  It looks like a dump, but don't let it fool you.  Good food awaits!
author: Roger P.

description:
The noodle soup tasty., also the duck over rice was perfect. the staff very polite and fast service.
it so many Thai place around there imitate this place but King Of Thai Noodle House was the original one.
author: Chaychan V.

description: This is the worst Thai food I have eaten. The service sucks and the food is worse. We ordered pad Thai and fried rice. Something so simple that you possibly cannot mess up. The quality was extremely poor. I would recommend no one going in. The location is selling the food not the taste.
author: priyanka v.

description:
Running some errands downtown at least once a week and virtually every time eating combination noodles or Pad See-Ew with papaya salad, I can say I am addicted to eating at KTNH.  The generous portion of quite tasty and authentic food at a very reasonable price, given its central location in Union Square, makes it easy to favorably recommend it to all friends in my circle. Their speedy and attentive services also fit with my tight schedule.  At times, I checked out with a happy stomach and refreshed mind bathed with my favorite Thai iced tea within 30 minutes, or less if I eat really fast;-)

I wish the place, especially the restroom, would be renovated soon so that the look and the atmosphere more fairly merit the quality of food and service.  I would gladly pay more for the upgrade.  The food is clean enough because I have never had any problems afterwards.  

I always tell my friends from other states and countries: "If you miss Thailand and Thai food, try KTNH.
author: Pam K.

description:
really friendly and prompt service--although sometimes I do feel a bit rushed when ordering food.

I wanna say everything's great but I honestly only come here for pad see ew or their fried chicken over rice lol--my boyfriend and I are regulars here haha. I've ordered the pad Thai once and I thought it was average. 

this place is conveniently open late, so when the craving for something yummy isn't fixed with greasy burgers, king of thai is there for you!
author: lib c.

description:
Only two stars for this Thai place. Why? Because of many things. Trust me I'm Thai-American I have it a try twice and it couldn't ever ever get any better. This place is just for tourists, not just this  locations, but all of them I could say. When my friend and I walked in to the restaurant. The waitresses looked down on us. Because we are a asian? So they didn't want to service us? 
I ordered yen ta fo. Spicy thai soup. It was alright..not the best. So far from the best. I asked for add veggies instead of rice noodle. They charge me $1! Thought I could substitute them. My friend had Lad Nah. It was so salty she couldn't eat it.
author: Manisa K.

description: I ordered the pad thai and spring rolls. The order was ready in about 5 minutes, which was nice. Huge portion of pad thai--I won't be able to finish it myself. The noodles are slightly thinner than usual pad thai, I think, and they are delicious. Just a few shrimp, few pieces of tofu, no other big pieces of meat that I can see. Very flavorful.
author: Patricia J.

description:
Shared a kee pao with a friend, as well as the pumpkin curry special. Service is ridiculously fast here ! The pumpkin curry was full of flavor. The pumpkin was soft and it was relatively spicy. The kee pao was so and so. It was a bit greasy for my taste.  I ordered it with beef but there was barely any meat it was tiny bits cooked with the noodles. The pumpkin was really good though, it was soft and there were peppers in it to add to the flavor. Overall it was a relatively enjoyable meal for the price paid. 

P.S. the thai ice tea is an eh. I've had better, it didn't have enough tea flavor and it was a little too sweet.
author: Virginia Y.

description: The food was good but the service and the restaurant wasn't that good they had mess every where and our food took way too long to cook but don't get me wrong it yummy but not good enough to make me go every week plus the food after you leave it out tastes like puke
author: Samantha L.

description: Awesome, awesome Thai food, coming from somebody who has had the real thing in Bangkok. The seating in the restaurant is a tight squeeze and can get super packed due to its location, but the servers are all very kind and, as I said, the food is great. Bathroom could definitely use some cleaning, granted I was there at dinnertime on a weekend night. All in all this place and Ploy II on Haight are my picks for the best Thai in SF.
author: Emily A.

description:
The only reason I chose this place is because they delivered in the middle of the day and the reviews stated that the noodles and the pumpkin curry were great. They were wrong. It was mediocre, if that. Delivery took 70 minutes. 

The Pad See Ew noodles were all stuck together and gooey, flavor was bland. Pad Thai was overly fishy tasting, no lime was served with it but I had my own and that helped balance the flavors a little. The Pumpkin Curry was a little thin and bland with only 2 pieces of pumpkin. The Tom Kha soup had so many mushrooms it tasted more like mushroom broth than the sweet sour spicy broth I was craving. 

Will not be going back.
author: Nicole R.

description: Had the Guay Thiew Lord, it was OK compared to King of Thai 2 on Clement (much better location in my opinion) ask for lemon slices and got limes
author: Ratanak K.

description: If you wanna get diarrhea, it is best place to go! I got poisoned from their salmon yesterday!
author: Aytac Y.

description:
It's impossible to order delivery from this place! The noise is always so loud in the background you can't hear the people working. Also the staff won't hesitate to hang up on you if they can't hear you, which makes for a bad combination when you're trying to order food!

I'll just go to Lers Ros, their food is better anyway!
author: Verdi E.

description: I do not recommend this place. Came for dinner and didnt even get all of my ordered good.
author: Ally A C.

description:
I came here to grab dinner with my sister on an early Friday evening. At about 5:30pm, there was no wait and we were immediately seated at a table in the middle. We were served our waters right away and then they took our orders. My sister ordered the pineapple fried rice and I ordered the pumpkin chicken curry. 

On a cold rainy night, the place did get kind of drafty, but it wasn't too bad. The layout is nice, especially for those who dine alone because there's a counter area they can sit at and read their paper or whatever. It's definitely a no-frills place, with all the condiments already on the table, but it's nicely kept up. It's also very purple inside. Haha.

About 10 minutes later, our orders arrived with a few minutes between my sister getting hers and mine arriving. I tried a small bite of the pineapple fried rice and it was quite tasty. It had maybe 4-5 pieces of shrimp, and was perfectly seasoned. My pumpkin chicken curry was also delicious! It definitely hit the spot. It was nice and hot, but not mouth-burning hot. A few hefty chunks of tender pumpkin and slivers of chicken breast. The curry was so good, I had to keep myself from stuffing myself silly with the rice I drowned in the scrumptious sauce. 

The place did get busy as we ate and at one time, a small line formed, but they quickly got people in and out to keep up with the demand. Our bill was pretty reasonable for such delicious food. Additionally, the portion size was pretty good! I definitely wouldn't mind coming back if I'm ever in the area -- especially since Union Square just screams *tourist!*
author: Leana L.

description:
eh....

I guess the food wasn't bad, it was late (11:30p.m.), but c'mon, do you really have to roll the smelly recycling can through the dining room while I am eating??  Really??

Ya feel me?
author: Johnny L.

description:
I was craving thai food after work, and decided to come here and order some takeout before heading home. My previous experience wasn't that great but I decided to give it another chance.

I ordered egg rolls, pad see ew, and roast duck over fried rice (on the menu, it's roast duck over steamed rice but I was able to substitute it with fried rice for $2 extra). The ladies taking my order were very accommodating and patient as me and my coworker were looking through the menu and asking questions despite people coming in waiting to be seated.

I get my food, and immediately I noticed a slightly off smell coming out of the box with the egg rolls. Usually when I order takeout, the smell wafts in my nose, and I can't wait to get home and eat. The smell wasn't very appealing. On the bart ride home, I had to put my food on the other seat, because I couldn't stand the smell. I was thinking maybe I'll change my mind when I actually eat.

Now I'm here at home writing my review, after taking a few bites of the egg roll, it tasted ... old and spoiled. The fried rice I got with my roast duck tasted ... old. The roast duck itself tasted.. old. It's like they had leftovers in the fridge for a week and heated it up in the microwave. It just did not have the freshness quality you usually get at other thai restaurants. The only thing that was ok was the pad see ew noodles, but I had to drown it in siracha sauce. I'm out $34 and I'm still hungry. I wanted to give this place another chance after my experience from before, but now I know I definitely won't be coming back.

1 star for the customers service, not the food. Thanks to the ladies who were patient with me while I ordered.
author: J R.

description: Came here for late lunch around 4. It wasn't that busy at all. More than 10 waiters and waitresses working here but took them 15 minutes to come take our order. We tried flagging down one of them but they all pretended not seeing us. We asked for hot water, they came back with 2 hot water mugs but with cold water. Lots of Thai restaurants nearby. We are never coming back again.
author: Vivie F.

description:
Late nigh, walking around San Francisco, hungry. Not a whole lotta places open. Bumped into King of Thai.

The place is not much but its cool with its purple walls. Plus, to me, the food and service is what counts.

We were immediately seated. Two things I liked from the get go: 1- it was late and the place was packed, 2- must of the people there seamed regulars of the place. 

I browsed their extensive menu and pretty much everything caught my eye. My body was a bit off and tired of all the walking and I thought nothing better to fix that but a soup, so I had the beef soup. My eyes were also peeled to the fried chicken over fried rice so that happened as well. I must say the soup was excellent. Like the Cubans say "it'll wake up the dead". The fried rice was good, nothing to rave about but it was solid, anyways I had chosen that plate for the fried chicken. The fried chicken was very good. Not sure if it was because I was starving or because anything fried tastes better, but it was good. Tender inside, crispy outside and slathered on the red sweet and spicy sauce that it came with, it was perfect.

Once again, the place might not be much but the food is good and the prices are pretty good too. Great spot for a late night meal.
author: Lester M.

description:
Worst. Thai food. Ever. We placed our order through GrubHub, it arrived about 1 hour 15 minutes later. Not only did they forget an item we had ordered, but the Pad Thai was cold, the rice noodles in it were in a shape of a hard brick, there were only 3 shrimp (1 of which we had to spit out because it tasted spoiled), and no peanuts. The chicken in our Tom Kha Gai was very overcooked as well, and we were surprised that this soup didn't have coconut milk, like all other Tom Kha Gai soups we have had. Before calling GrubHub, I called King of Thai Noodle to let them know they left out an item. I also asked how many shrimp are usually in the Pad Thai and was told "a minimum of 5" - as opposed to the 3 we received. The person on the phone was not willing to help me and told me to call GrubHub to resolve the issue of being reimbursed for the item they forgot. After calling GrubHub, they ended up providing great customer service by refunding me my money back for the entire order because they said King of Thai Noodle was not cooperating with them at all either. 

We will never order again from King of Thai Noodle House. Terrible quality and horrible customer service. There are way better places for Thai food all over SF.
author: Marisa M.

description: Thai curry tastes like water and vegetables.. Would not suggest for a quick lunch. Thought it might be good food but, not much flavors or taste
author: K K.

description:
Can I rate this place below one star?? 
As a tipping customer, for a TO GO order, they forget about my order and let me waited for 20min! Until I finally said something. This is an awful service.
I will never go back if it's the only place left in SF to serve thai food.
If you are getting food to go, DON'T TIP! I wasted a $1.50 tip on a $10 To Go order for a shitty service. Instead of getting my food to go fast I tipped to get my food 30min late.
author: Bee S.

description:
I've inexplicably ended up here numerous times and had explicably so-so meals every time. 

The place isn't billing itself as high class dining, but it's easy to find better tasting Thai food nearby at this price point (try Chabaa on Geary!).    

Their noodle dishes are the highlight (as the name would imply), I'd recommend sticking with those. Pad see ew is good and tastes just like you think it will. Pineapple fried rice is also a pretty good choice here. 

The curries are no fun at all - not a lot of flavor and some unpleasant textures. The pumpkin in their signature chicken pumpkin curry (a dish I'm usually all over) tasted especially grainy and undercooked. 

Papaya salad is big but also pretty unsatisfying taste-wise. 

Shrimp Tom Yum is just a giant bowl of broth with some thawing shrimp, a handful of mushrooms and half a tomato in it. No delicate flavors to be had there. 

Again, Chabaa Thai is like 2 blocks from here. Yelp it.
author: Ryan D.

description: DO NOT EAT HERE!!!! Unsafe food prep!!! I just saw a warning that Yelp placed stating this restaurant had poor food safety. They are correct. I was served cold, under cooked food that was mixed in with old food.  Yes, old reused food. Waitress did not wash her hands, even after cough/sneezing. Unsafe to eat here and food was terrible. Do NOT eat here.
author: Jaine D.

description: Dont eat here.. foods not fresh... bad flavors.. did a yelp search on thai places in san francisco and this came up.. i dont even have a high standard.. not sure if how many days old food is.. tried 4 dishes.. 0 out of 4 tastes good.. even thai iced coffee off.. avoid
author: Howard L.

description: WOW this is awesome thai place to eat. It was super busy but they are very fast. service is really good and fast. Tom yum soup was super good. will recommend everybody who loves to eat thai.
author: Gaurav C.

description: We came, we saw, we had the best pad see ew, we got full, paid, and then we left. Pad See Ew is my go-to dish when I eat Thai, but this is honestly the best one I've had since I can remember. We ordered the seafood PSE and the portion was big, the calamari was cooked perfectly, not chewy or rubber-like, the flavor was on point and even the Thai Iced Tea was perfectly balanced. I'm from San Diego, but when I come back I know where I'll be stopping!
author: Kori-ann K.

description:
The place is a bit cramped, but service was fairly quick.  Really quick actually.  We went on a Sunday evening, so I don't know if that made a difference.  

What we ordered...
Crab over fried rice - YUM.  I wasn't the one who ordered it, but I sure did it a lot of it.  AND it did not have any peas (I hate peas).  Anyhoo....YUM.  

Green curry - I ordered it with chicken.  It came with a huge portion of rice.  It was a little runnier than I prefer (does that make sense?  I'm no curry expert), but it was still good.  It had green beans, red bell pepper, bamboo shoots, and baby corn.  I wish it had potatoes (I love potatoes).

I'd go back...I think I'd like to try the fried chicken over fried rice.  And if it's as delicious as it sounds, I won't regret it too much the next day at the gym as I die in spin class wondering why I made such a "horrible" food choice.
author: Yvette S.

description: I get the same thing every time,  pretty much for the last 15 years, pan fried noodles with pork or chicken, basil and chili.  I load this up with some ground peanuts, diced peppers and chili powder and I am good to go. The rest of the items are great also,  I steer clear of the jellyfish though,  I don't like the texture.
author: Nicholas P.

description: Love all the KING OF THAI restaurants in San Francisco.. But they need to step up the service to us asian people..n not just only to other ethnic groups..!!!
author: Crisy G.

description:
Worst seafood salad in the history of seafood salads!! It was way too sour.
Everything else tasted yummy.
author: Cassandra W.

description: I enjoyed a wonderful, well-priced lunch here just a couple days ago. I had the Green  Curry with Chicken and a Thai Iced-Tea. Yummy! The curry was a little spicy, but great. My friend asked for super spicy and she loved hers! The seating is cramped, but makes for a great atmosphere. I like when a restaurant has that background buzz. It means people are happy and enjoying themselves. I'll be back when I visit SF again! Thanks!
author: Julianne B.

description: Great food and fast service! My family loved the Thai Iced Tea. The fried chicken over fried rice was also good. Becareful when ordering the spicy food, they're not joking around.
author: Ramona B.

description:
King of Thai Noodle House is a late-night classic. There's nothing about this place that screams "quality". The bright fluorescent lights, beat up white tile, black tables and purple walls are kind of jarring. The menus are very well worn. The staff is nice but just shy of friendly. It's a busy place the few times I've been there, all after 11pm.

The food quality is "ok". I've had some good dishes here and I've had some "meh" dishes.  What I've had has all seemed to be the same variation of rice noodles and veggies. It's either soup or pan-fried noodles. As far as I can tell, they all taste the same.

There's not much more to say about this place. I wouldn't go here with a date, nor for a business meeting. It's ok for late-night grub, but that's because the options are limited after 11.  It's not that the place is bad, but it's nothing special other than the hours.
author: Damon T.

description:
I love this place! If I lived closer, I'd probably go every day.  I've always been a pad kee mao over pad see ewe girl but man, I can't seem to resist their pad see ewe.  It is so flavorful in every bite!  And their beef noodle soup tastes just like my favorite home made meal growing up.  Every time I'm in SF, I make it a goal to come here.

Sometimes it might look like they're really busy (which they are) and there will be a wait but they have more tables in the back and a second floor so don't worry.  I've never had to wait.
author: Choua W.

description:
The portions are HUMONGOUS!!! So make sure you order one dish between two people if you're not too hungry.

And get Pad See Ew with chicken or shrimp. It is heavenly.

Spicy Level: They have three levels, number two is perfect.
author: Avi H.

description: This location is always busy. Love the noodles with broth.  Love their yellow curry too.
author: Stephanie C.

description: The food is excellent. The dining experience is not. This Thai fast food. Crowded with open kitchen. Not too clean. Prices are excellent. Service is fair. Very busy place near Union Square in San Francisco.
author: Lou V.

description:
Flavorful dishes! Good place to grub a real lunch on the go. Real food not no fast food at decent prices. Service is fast. 
Needing a place in union square to have a quick bite and not sacrifice great taste and good food this place.
author: M G.

description: Worst service ever! If visiting SF, go somewhere else. We were waiting for a friend and they asked us to get up and wait outside after we had already ordered appetizers. Rudest waiter I have ever encountered.
author: Breanna S.

description: Service is terrible two different lady's asked if we were ready 5min in between when we sat down. I had the yellow Thai curry. And got food poisoning since yesterday I was throwing up and diarrhea!!! Terrible still sick !  I left no tip. Do if you want what I have go here and enjoy the sickness afterwards.
author: Keanu V.

description: Open on Christmas (yay!) and it was absolutely fantastic. Everyone working here was super friendly, the food was excellent, and we didn't have to wait forever. We will definitely go back!
author: Sarah F.

description: Usually this place is great,  but unfortunately this time there was an ant in my soup. I took it out with the soup spoon and gave it to the waitress. They still charged us full price for the whole meal. Some kinda compensation would of been nice is all I'm saying... maybe next time I can give them full stars.
author: Bella C.

description: It's aight. Charged me extra 4 dollars for real crab meat in the noodle but I only got a thumb size of it.
author: Chloe L.

description: These guys soups are the best try the chicken one and you won't regret it seriously I usually don't don't like thai food but this place is awesome highly recommended place and don't forget order the chicken soup
author: Cheny C.

description: My fiancé and I always get their noodle soup and a pork fried rice to share. And can I just say, it's never failed us yet!! Always delicious every time. We come to San Fran at least once a year, and always have to make time for at least one meal here. Great food and very reasonably priced!!
author: Nina N.

description:
Because of the location and the fact that they serve Pineapple Shrimp Fried Rice (my personal indicator that the restaurant is not legit) I was very wary. But I was squeezed for time and it was where we were. We got there just after the lunch rush and were seated right away.  The place was clean and service pleasant.  

The menu was quite extensive making it hard to decide, but I decided on the Pad See - stir fried flat rice noodle with a combination meats and seafoods, egg, Chinese broccoli in sweet black soy sauce.  When it came to the table it wasn't what I was expecting.  I thought that the look fun (flat rice noodles) was going to be stir fried together with the other ingredients.  But what I got was the stir fried ingredients on top of plain look fun.  Even though it wasn't what I expecting, it did look and smelled good, I was happy with the dish, I mixed it up, added sambal and all was fine.  My friend who had the Combination Beef Noodle soup was also happy with his food.

This place is not a destination restaurant, but for a quick, decent bite of Thai food, that's convenient and close to all the shopping, King of Thai is a good choice.
author: Jason C.

description: Good food!! You have to try the spicy eggplant  good customer service too!  the cup they use for water needs to be replaced  but other than that everything is great!
author: Riz A.

description: The food is consistently good. Fast, fresh and hot. The waitresses are all super sweet. You can't go wrong.
author: Riley P.

description: Loved how they opened till 3. My bf ordered a #1 of the beef soup and I had the #4 which is the combo beef soup. The broth was good, my bf said he needed more flavor. My bowl could've had more noodles and less veggies. Food was average and ok.
author: Vanessa L.

description: Had the Tom Kha Tofu soup (veggie sweet & sour soup).  Was very good. Medium level of spicy-ness. Their portions are huge. The soup can be shared between two people.
author: Liron A.

description: Great soup! Fast service, good price! What else can you ask for? Definitely a must visit when you are hungry!
author: Karl M.

description: Be careful of the other patrons!! Got almost killed by 4 of them 10/20/15 when I left. The food was ok but over priced. Won't ever be back and tell everyone what happened!!
author: Larry D.

description: Sigh.... I really loved this place. I have been to this place a few times, but they forgot my dish and my friends finish their food. They said they will start makig, but I was so hungry I ate some of my friends food. I really liked the pad kee mao, if only it actually came out... Sigh... My friends like their pineapple fried rice and pad thai.
author: Thien V.

description:
I just come here for the Duck Fried Rice.

WoW ... Simple and Relaxing.  Duck Fried Rice to die for.  I love this place.
This place is one of the reason why I always go to San Francisco.

Hey, lets not forget everything else on the menu are great too.

Now, there could be a long line and wait but thats common with great restaurants.

Now the waiters/waitresses are a different  story.  They are ok but I believe they act like they just work there just to work.  I understand, being in this restaurant service business is not for everyone especially when you see all these people hungry and eating, i can't be a waiter thats for sure.

Nevertheless, its a great place to hang out.  The food are great.  I don't understand all the other people here with complaints about the food but oh well.

Overall, its all about the Duck Fried Rice.  Everything else is just extra.
author: Allan Jay G.

description: Can't call it classy, but it is authentic. My host ordered in Thai, and everything was great! Chicken wings, pad ki mao, and more. Yum yum! And busy too!
author: Erik Y.

description:
I love this King of Thai. So many tourists stop in here for a quick and cheap meal in Union Square. 

Their service is wonderful, the food isn't always consistent but you win some you lose some. 

I'm crazy about ordering pad thai and everything else they have here is pretty good. The place is good for convenience, price and meets minimum expectations.
author: Zu W.

description: Came by this place for a second time during our 4th of July trip to SF. Our first visit was pretty bad, my boys were marking in a negative way when we entered the restaurant by one of the waitresses. I don't want to express it here it was kind of rude for her to do. She even compared Lao girl not so pretty like others. She thought we didn't understand Thai. Afterward we complained to the management and they gave us 20% off. We told them we didn't want the discount and told them next time to treat their customers with respect. On our second visit they place us in front of the door. Service was ok. I gave 2/10. Needs more improvement on customers service. We will be back again to rate 5 stars if...
author: O. B.

description: I ordered through the Eat24 app, card was charged and I received an email saying that my food would be here between 45-60 mins. An hour and 10 minutes go by and like any hungry person would do, is check the restaurant to check on the order. The guy who answers says they didn't have a driver and that they cancelled my order through Eat24. However, when I contact Eat24 through Live Chat they were told by the restaurant employee that the driver was a no show. They are very unprofessional and lack customer service. If I could give them 0 stars I would. Not to mention the food is mediocre.
author: Celina B.

description: This place has pretty good Thai food. But because of it's location off union square, it is always pretty packed and tight. But it is open late which is good. And the good looking staff is always accommodating. They have a great Pad Thai.
author: Peter K.

description:
Edit: I accidentally rated the wrong king of Thai.

I'd have to give this location a downgrade from the one near broadway. Portions are very small, and service was slow. I think the heavy proxy to the tourist area has an unavoidable effect on quality.
author: Christophe C.

description: We seem to end up here whenever we go to Union Square.  This place is always packed and a wait at the door, so not sure why it has less than four stars.  Today, I got the beef stew, which was perfect for a December day in SF.  My wife got the pad see ew, which was also very good.  The place is hopping, and service is quick.  If you like Thai noodles and Thai soup, Thai street style, this is a great spot.
author: Fernando A.

description: I had the chicken soup with flat noodles.  Soup was flavorless; probably in a blind test I would not be able to differentiate it with salted boiled water.  Only plus is that it is the only restaurant around that is open after midnight.
author: Elmo W.

description: King of Thai offers your standard Thai dishes at reasonable prices ($8-10).  The food is not amazing, but it's predictable, open late, and just around the corner from Union Square.  I'd recommend sitting upstairs or near the kitchen, because you'll have customers breathing over your shoulder if you sit near the door.
author: Kristen H.

description: Our go to late nite place. Authentic thai food for the price conscious.
author: Amit T.

description:
Great place for lunch!  This is one of my favorite places in the area.  Service is very fast and the price point is very fair.  

I love the Roasted Duck Noodle.  I am a big roast duck fan so I guess it makes sense for me to think highly of this dish.  The boneless ducks are drenched in perfectly spiced soup base that has a sweet aftertaste.  As you can tell by now, the entire dish is very flavorful.

Tips:

- Definitely try the Roasted Duck Noodle.  But please ask for Small Rice Noodles instead of all the other choices.  I believe small rice noodles are the best for this dish.  

- This is a great place to stop by after an afternoon of shopping or after catching a Giants game at the ball park.


Overall:

- I will definitely come back for more!
author: Johnny G.

description: My brothers and I were extremely hungry after our road trip from Reno and Sacramento. We decided to stop by Union Square to do some window shopping and stumbled upon this place.
