We found an empty table in the front and the hostess walked us over to the second floor for more comfortable seating for our party of five, the menu was simple to read, and the portion of food is great for under $10. I'm not sure of the name of plate I ordered other than 17 and replaced the meat option with fired tofu and added more chili powder to spice it up. I'm definitely going to stop by the next time I'm in the area.
author: Andres A.

description:
Beef Boat Noodles 3/5 stars because they should've provided *more* beef.  The broth was decent (authentic) but I expected more due to the hype presented on this Thai commercial "Raja koey theo rua" which means they are the King of boat noodles:  
http://youtu.be/xSSm-Bn-t_M

Rad Na Moo (Pork Rad Na) 4/5 would've given 5/5 stars but I counted 5 thin slivers of pork in my dish.  The gailan, noodles, and gravy were amazing.

Mango and sticky rice 5/5 stars for excellent selection of mango and superb sticky rice and coconut milk.

Boat Noodles + Rad Na + Mango and Sticky Rice + Thai coffee = $23 and some change!

I can say from what I've sampled and saw served on other tables the restaurant can compete with the above average establishments in Thai Town LA.

Great service and stays open until 1am.
author: T N.

description: Kind of mood off after getting the pad kee mao with ground meat. I always come here and this is the first time they got the order wrong. On the bright side, the roast duck over rice was tasty.
author: Pana P.

description: I ordered a BBQ Pork Noodles. It was OK, but the slices of meat were not well cut and some slices were totally raw. Even though, the flavor of the noodle was good.
author: Thiago T.

description:
Last night, me mum and I gallivanted up and down Market for a spot to eat in the late evening hours. Her knee gave out right when we spotted King of Thai Noodle House with their imperial purple hued sign.

"I can't walk any further Matthew. We are eating here and that's that."

"Yes mom.."

I am a firm believer in fate and the alignment of the celestial heavens. People were flocking here like it was a holy place. We sat down and became surrounded by a undercurrent of purple haze. Think futuristic diner in Thailand.

The Pad Kee Mao, hands down, made me think of watching fireworks for the first time. The sheer essence of the dish had me grinning while I ate. 

Me mum had some shrimp fried rice and didn't care for it too much. She was hecka jealous of my superior choice in menu items. 

It's open pretty late but be mindful of BART schedules if that's your mode of travel. We barely made it back in time: my mom nursing her knee and me my tummy.
author: Matt B.

description:
4 stars. Opens late when nothing else is open. This place is open til 1AM. Came here after Yelp! Unwrapped Holiday Party, because they ran out of food & I was HUNGRY!!!! We circled the area so many times but couldn't find it. I know it is parallel to Market, but didn't know where. I've been here before...but couldn't remember where it was located. We probably passed it 4 times, before we finally found it.

I had #8 duck stew? with vermicelli & BF had pad thai. Both were good & delicious. Many we were really really hungry, but it would have been good even if we weren't. 

My duck noodle soup came out really fast. It was hot & so good http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/udYo3BZ0Y3nR1iOtk58Inw?select=TecZO4sxKtk2ezaG0NQ-Lw There were condiments & one was crushed peanuts. There was about half a container left of peanuts, I finished it off before I started my noodles. I got so full off of it, but were SOOOO GOOOD. Tasted like the Oriental Seafood Restaurant peanuts, they taste like peanut butter, DELICIOUS!!!!! BF's pad thai was good, I think wherever you go, pad thai is never a bad choice http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/udYo3BZ0Y3nR1iOtk58Inw?select=b3bUPRh7GRHBhfgLOB-vQQ

Waiters were attentive, asked if everything was okay (in a very Asian way, up close in your face kind of way), opened doors, greeted us, filled water when it needed to be filled...This place would definitely deserve 5 stars if they accepted credit cards.

The bill comes with plum candy =]

Almost $20 for 2 people, very full & satisfied after.
author: Kylie L.

description:
Came here hungry as hell after going to Ruby Skye with a friend and my boyfriend. We all ordered the same thing: Pad See-Ew. They brought out my friend's dish first, 5 minutes later followed by my boyfriend's. Since they came out at separate times, I thought perhaps they were making mine still. 15 minutes later, we're all wondering where my dish was. I am STARVING watching my boyfriend and friend eat in front of me. I look around. The employees can see I am the only person not eating. Then I peer at the kitchen and it seems like no one is making food. They are closing in 10 minutes, meaning the kitchen is closing. I look over one more time and it looks like they're cleaning up the kitchen. I asked them where my food was and they seemed shocked that I had nothing to eat! They then asked me if I still wanted my food. I felt like I was going to be a burden, so my boyfriend took it upon himself to let me finish the majority of his plate and he'd just eat some leftovers he saved in the car.

The pad see-ew wasn't all that great. The sauce was too thick and salty and after a while it just became really sickening to eat.

Not a bad place to eat if you're not trying to eat greasy fast food for a late dinner. But if other restaurants are open, I'd suggest checking those places out first before you settle for this.
author: Stacey C.

description:
Average thai food. This place is really convenient because of the location, and they stay open until late. Service is usually good and fast.
The food is OK for the price, there are better thai restaurants in the Bay Area but this can still be a good choice, especially if you are in downtown. I like their curry dishes. Based on the time, you might have to wait for a while before being seated.
author: Alessandro B.

description: What I love about this place is that it's discreetly located and mostly locals know about it.  I've been here several times and have only had to wait to be seated once (and it was about 15 minutes).  The servers are friendly and prompt and can easily split a bill for a party of 4.  The food is great!  They use Chinese broccoli for their dishes and have just the right amount of spice in all their dishes.  I highly recommend the Pad See Ew.
author: A J.

description:
Good Thai food for a good price. The food is not bad at all, especially for the price. The place can get busy during lunch/dinner peak hours, so it may take a bit longer to get a server to assist you. 

I usually enjoy their pineapple fried rice, pad-thai, and/or pad-see-yu. Their curries are decent. Their chicken and beef sates are good with the peanut sauce.

Overall I enjoy the food from King of Thai and especially since they open late, its a good place to grab a bite after drinks or hanging out. I wouldn't say they have the best Thai food in comparison to other Thai restaurants in the area, but if you are looking for cheap eats, this is the place to go. 

For those that want to order to-go, I would recommend calling in ahead of time and just pick it up. You can order there too, but just expect a wait if its during peak time.
author: Kevin Y.

description: Delivery was pretty quick, especially considering it was late at night. Chicken satay and pad thai were taste and reasonably priced.
author: Amanda B.

description: This is the spot for Pad See Eew noodles...thick flat noodles...yummy!
author: Rissa K.

description:
We ordered take out at 11pm with delivery - the pad Thai was not impressive. 
The tom yum gai was better though with medium being a good spiciness for medium. 
Delivery time was 25 minutes which was great.
author: Van-Anh N.

description: I've been here several times & generally had good experiences, but went here last week & ordered the chicken noodle soup. It tasted like noodles in hot water w/ one bouillon cube. I would eat here again but would not recommend that soup.
author: Alana R.

description:
I absolutely love tom yum soup. While it may not be for everyone, something about sweet and sour flavors really satisfies my taste buds! Sometimes I have these intense cravings for it but no one else I know likes it. Also, finding a Thai restaurant which serves a decent bowl is not as easy as it seems. At least for me.

I'll soon be moving to SF and I can't wait to eat good Asian food again. And tom yum soup. =P Okay, Hawaii has good Asian food too, but its just not the same!

I've eaten at King of Thai Noodle House a few times over the years and have tried their various dishes, including the curries and pad thai. On my last visit, I came in to eat alone. Sometimes I feel that dining-in by yourself can be an awkward experience, but not this time. The atmosphere is casual and the prices are pretty affordable. Also, the location is so convenient on O'Farrell and Powell. Great lunch stop during a shopping break! ;) While they may try to target the tourists, I still think its a decent Thai restaurant to get a good meal. 

Okay, now I really can't wait to satisfy my tom yum soup craving! =D
author: Mari S.

description:
Don't really remember that much from that night but pretty sure I liked it here. 

1. Still open at 3:00 am. 
2. Didn't mind 5 drunk asses stumbling in right near closing time. 
3. Served us water and took our orders right away. All being super friendly, even though I'm pretty sure we were a bit obnoxious. 
4. Big portions. 
5. Fried chicken over fried rice was just the thing I needed while in an alcohol induced haze.
author: Wendy G.

description:
good food and super quick service. I like the fact that this location is open until late. I always order the Panang Beef with rice. Things I don't like:

1. No brown rice is served (silly but I like the option sometimes)
2.Feels a little rushed sometime

Overall, I like this place. food is good. I just feel there are better Thai places in the area. The soups are super good, but I have only tried them a few times.
author: Elizabeth D.

description: I ordered a pad see ew  to go, I think they messed up my order because the waitress ask me again what I had ordered. I probably waited longer for the food than if I were to eat there. Once I got back home I opened the container, it was so disappointing. The noodle looks like it sat on the pan for so long that the chef forgot about it that there was burnt residue all over it. And the noodle only consist if broccoli which it shouldn't be and chicken. I've been to other king of Thai but never had my dish like this
author: Angela L.

description:
My first time here, but blown away with the first bite. The pad kee Mao and pad see ew uses the same sauces and seasonings, but it has the perfect balance of sweet and salty, with just the right amount of oil and fish sauce. It's also quite fragrant with the spices and vegetables. 
Feels a bit crowded in there but there's more space in the back. Service is quick and food comes out even quicker. Workers are attentive and it's pretty clean. I would love to go back and try the other dishes.
author: PJason K.

description: Man this place is sooooo good! One of my favorite places to eat when spending the day in SF. Their Thai food is of very good quality and if you ask for it to be hot... watch out! I haven't had anything I haven't liked yet! It tends to get packed all the time! So, make time so you aren't starving while waiting! Not a fancy place by any means but a great place for some really yummy food! Just keep in mind that it's in downtown San Francisco amongst the hustle and bustle. EnJoy!
author: Matt C.

description:
Still one of the more inexpensive places to eat downtown.
Came here the other night before seeing a show at the Orpheum and got in and out quick!
Ordered the chicken noodle soup with small rice noodles, the soup and noodles were yummy! Not too salty and a nice sized portion.
Big selection on their menu whether you want rice plates/noodles/soup, etc. Prices are also very reasonable-mainly under $10 per dish.
Service here was also fast and friendly. We got to dine upstairs this time which was a little quieter than down.
Would return again for a quick lunch if I was in the mood for Thai!
author: Miss H K.

description:
Fast, cheap and yummy.
They do take credit cards - at least the wo times I have been here they have. 

I ordered #31-Duck over rice.  It was good what looked like 2 roasted duck breast over two scoops of rice with the sweet duck sauce.  It was good.  Too much rice for me.    Friend ordered the pumpkin curry chicken - she said it was a bit on the spicy side but she isn't too much into spicy food, so it might be ok for someone who is.  She was nice and full after eating it.  We also shared chicken satay.  The peanut sauce was really good - but the chicken was eh.  

Thai Iced Coffee was yummy. 
The water tasted funny.
Service was super fast.
author: Erika G.

description: Been going here for years. I love the Roast duck Pad See Ew. They are always full do to avoid the line call your order in and take it to go.
author: Craig C.

description:
This place is located next to the Macy's in Union Square. It's a pretty average size spot and we sat at the table located right next to the kitchen sort of in the back near the bathrooms and stairs to the next floor. Not an ideal location to be. The staff was plenty nice to us and they had people refilling our waters often. I felt like the place was overstaffed because there were too many people trying to do a task and it took twice as long instead of just one person doing that. Weird for a weekday night to have so many employees scheduled. Losing money right there. 

I ordered the yellow curry with chicken and it was good, pretty standard at most Thai places. My girl got the pad see ew which was also standard as well. The flavors were nice. I just didn't like the fact that all the dishes were brought out one at a time. Like the cooks just made one dish, put it out then began to work on the next dish. Many people sat there looking at their food waiting for everyone to get their food. It was obvious the food already brought out would get cold with the wait we had to endure between everyone's dishes (about 6 people) so they just ate. Sort of defeats the purpose of eating together. 

Place has it's flaws but the food is fine. If you are driving to downtown, not worth the hassle to come here. However, if you work nearby or took public transit to downtown it's a spot worth looking into. The other Thai place is more expensive but it's the same food pretty much.
author: Jeromy G.

description: We had a table of four...everyone got served but me. We could not even wave down a server to ask if it was coming. Fifteen minutes into everyone else eating we finally flagged down a waitress, they had to reorder it...so 30 min into them eating I get served 1/2 or my order. The other half comes when I'm almost done. I sent it back because everyone is done and tell them to take it off...which they didnt. So after we get the wrong check and send it back we had to wait another 10 min to get the right check. Not a fan. Water glasses are gross...never again. Food wasn't that good.
author: Rebecca P.

description: Bad service. that skinny waitress with the eyeglasses has a bad attitude, the $5 tip I gave her was just regretful. This was 10/26/2015 5pm.
author: Nelson B.

description: I came here last night with a group of about nine people. It was about half empty, which was to be expected on a Tuesday night around 8pm. We got seated in the back, where we could see the whole kitchen, and right next to where the staff had their table that they took their breaks at. It was fine because we were a larger group, but not a place where I would normally like to sit. I was mostly disappointed that the dish I got was just bland and pretty unimpressive. I hadn't been there before, so I decided to go with a pretty standard fare of the chicken fried rice dish. Unfortunately all I could taste the most of was onion. I ate about half and decided not to take the rest home as leftovers. Portion size was big, and the price was very cheap, especially for the area of the city it's in. I can see this would be an awesome late-night munchies kind of place.
author: Jess B.

description:
Thai food doesn't get any more basic than this no-frills dive. 

You can find equally good Thai food in any shopping-mall food court -- but for eight bucks in San Fran, c'mon, what were you expecting, Top Chef? 

My chicken satay was well-cooked and accompanied by a rich and tasty sauce. My chicken and garlic sauce was adequate but one-note. Diet Coke served in an unchilled can with a glass of ice.

This is cheap, adequate Thai junk food served fast and with a smile.
author: Michael A.

description:
Was trying Thai for the first time. Confusingly, Ordered fried chicken and fried rice which turned out to yumm. Next time will order some real thai.
Prices are pretty decent here.

Ambience: 3/5
Food: 4/5
author: John W.

description:
Ok Thai food with a really good location.  If you are in Union Sq and want a quick bite to eat, King of Thai is not a bad option.  

The noodles are tasty and they really use the peppers well.  Good amount of heat.  The menu is very typical and the prices are Ok.
author: Scott C.

description:
I ordered online through Yelp at 10:55 pm on Saturday night.  This was one of the only places in the city delivering to my home in SoMa that late at night.  According to the site they stop delivery at 11:00 pm.

My food was delivered within 30 minutes.  I got Pad See Ew and Pad Thai and both were quite good and I thought the portion size was generous.  I would definitely order from them again, especially for late-night delivery.
author: Erin K.

description: When I'm in a new town and looking for ethnic food, my grading system is the ratio of that ethnicity to white people. I had walked by the place several times, walking from my hotel to a conference at the Moscone Center. Every time I passed, there were at least 5 Thai patrons to every white patron. I had the Pad Thai. Loved it, and had I not already had a huge portion, I would have gotten more. I'll be back the next time I'm in San Francisco with a hankering for Thai.
author: Freelin J.

description: Ordered for pickup by phone and was told 15 minutes. I got there 20 minutes later and they made me wait another 15 mins still. Pad see ew was good, fried chicken was dry and had no flavor unless you drenched it in their sweet and sour sauce. Really wanted to like the place especially since it was only 2 blocks away from the Hilton. Go somewhere else.
author: Vince M.

description:
Been to a few King of Thai's and the food varies depending on location. This location however deserves 4 stars. My girls and I were in a rush, so came here. Even though this place is a restaurant, its quickness in serving and making food, is as if it is take out. The quality is better than take out though. 

Got the Duck Fried Rice. It was good! I forgot how good their Thai dishes are. I didn't finish it because it was oily and didn't want to feel like a fat lard after. The only thing I noticed was that there was literally only the skin of the duck, egg, and rice. The two slices of cucumbers and a slice of tomato don't count. Even though there wasn't much in the rice, the prices are relatively cheap so I can see why there is less ingredients in it. 

The food was really fresh. Didn't taste stale or recooked again. Definitely satisfied my Thai craving here.
author: Katrina T.

description:
Sooooo.... I went here yesterday. 
Thai iced tea= SAWEEEEET. 
Thai iced coffee= holy crap that stuff is like crack (not that I know what crack is like.... )

anywho.....

their food is uber cheap but just meh. I ordered special #2. Very bland, actually.... I didn't know you could cook chicken and do it successfully where it has absolutely no flavor to it. So for that regard, great job King of Thai Noodle House! (please note sarcasm).

My sister and her friend ordered #16, I dunno, it was a seafood dish.... that didn't have any seafood in it. Okay, that's exaggerating alittle. My sister had 1 shrimp and a sliver of the imitation crab. My friend's.... his was better. I think he had 2 or 3 shrimp. All I know is that he shared his with her's, so I guess you could say they both had 1 1/2 shrimp each.

The service was good though. Tons of purple people eaters (their uniform is pale purple polo's- I kind of wanted to barf from that actually. Okay not really, but I did notice the excess amount of purple.). They were also super duper busy which I give the staff props for getting to everyone as quick as they did. 

Would I go back? Meh, maybe, ok probably just to give them a second chance. Now, if they were super expensive and this was my experience... then I'd say, "hahahaha hell no!"
author: Mandi W.

description:
Le sigh.

I am generally not a thai food enthusiast and this place doesn't help much.  I've had decent to pretty good thai places before but this was my first time having thai food in a VERY LONG TIME (last time was june 2012) and that's because I got food poisoning. Yikes.  My friend I was out on lunch with loves thai and since we had time to kill before work again, we decided to just go here.  Bad choice.  Service is meh, there's so many people working here but they barely check on you about your food or anything.  What's the point of having that many people? And the food... mmmmm.. let's just say my stomach wasn't happy for the rest of the night at work.  'twas a sad night indeed.. Oh, I got the pineapple fried rice.  It was pretty tasteless and nothing stood out.  VERY disappointed.
author: Lisa L.

description: Food is okay, but the employees need to work on their speed, and multitasking between customers and duties.
author: Ievrin O.

description: Love this place, customer service is great, they are very friendly and accomodating, and food is very good, they are quick serving your order. very unexpensive, its a delight to have your lunch or dinner at this place and the fried banana with ice cream is a must have, yummy!!!!!
author: Brenda C.

description:
Wow this King of Thai is CROWDED. Union square keeps the place busy but i was seated pretty quickly considering. I've never been a huge fan of this small chain in SF and prefer more local and smaller thai restaurants. Nevermind that though because the food is still decent and it's easy on the wallet!

The Chicken Satay comes with 4 skewers and a heavy peanut sauce. A bit too heavy for my taste. The fried egg rolls are so good though! I always order Pad Sew Ew and put a good amount of hot sauce on the plate. It's consistently a satisfying dish but i don't believe King of Thai makes the best i've had. Thai curry has a sweeter flavor and a filling dish when you eat it with the rice.

They're fast, it's good, and so inexpensive!
author: Samantha L.

description: Pad see ew and Thai Iced tea/iced coffee - pretty good afternoon shared snack meal.  Service was good, and there's a lot more seating room than we thought as the restaurant goes way back and there is even more seating upstairs.
author: Maile N.

description:
I heard so many good things about this place that I thought I give it a try. It's located near union square, so automatically, you should know that is quite a busy area. Parking- I will not go into that.

Service. We got seated almost immediately. After they took our orders, they asked us to move to accommodate a much bigger party. We had to get up an wait about a minute for them to clean a much smaller table to our fitting. Hmm...

As for the food, I had the panang chicken curry. It was way too thick and salty. Not what I had intended. My friend's fried chicken fried rice was actually good, considering that it's not really thai food.

The servers were nice, but a bit on the slow side. I feel this place could've done better, so I'm going to have to go back to give it a second chance, but for now, 3 stars
author: Leena N.

description:
Just to be clear, WHITE PRIVILEGE exists, and my friend and I were victims of another customer's privilege during lunch today at this restaurant location.

12:00pm - I sat down at a 2 person table in the middle of the restaurant, put my order in, and waited for a friend.
12:08pm - Just before my friend arrives, a group of 6 white guys, who appear to be construction workers, come in - they seem to know the hostess. I am asked to move to the back of the restaurant to make room for the 6 white guys. FUCK THAT. I refuse and say I'd like to sit here. I was here first why should I move, ask the 6 white guys to move to the back of the restaurant instead!
12:10pm - My friend then arrives, he sits down immediately orders. The 6 white guys also place their orders after my friend.
12:30pm - I get my dish since I order earlier, but then the 6 white guys get their dishes all together after about 15 minutes since the placed their orders. I finish my dish, but my friend is still waiting for his dish. It's about 20 minutes after he placed his order. Unacceptable since, there dishes come out in 20 minutes or less. We made the mistake of giving the order to the hostess who was catering to the needs of the group of 6 white guys. She clearly did not put my friends order into the kitchen, because we had to remind another waitress about my friend's order. 
12:28pm - The had to put the order into the system! My friend has to wait another 20 minutes for his food.
12:50pm - had to ask where the food was, but it was delivered soon after. my friend had to ask for it to go since they were so delayed.

I come here 1-2 times a month. It's not super regular, but enough to keep my face active here. I usually come in here by myself and sit at the bar, but this was just an atrocious and downright discriminatory lunch service. treat all of your customers, with some baseline respect. I don't mind giving meal service preference to more frequent visiting customers, but DON'T BE 20-40 minutes late with another customer's food! and don't ask them to move for the benefit of a group of white customers. I'm not stupid here, that's being racist against your own kind!
author: Michael C.

description: Great noodle place !
author: Ray K.

description:
At the end of the day it's a noodle house that caters to any kind of Thai craving imaginable.  They're open late and although we got their literally 5 minutes before they closed, they still sent us off with an awesome meal.  the service is friendly and fast but not lacking in quality.

I had a pad dish and loved it, along with my thai iced tea which was a bit overrated.  Be sure to check this place out during your next late-night food craving.
author: Kevin J.

description:
We went into San Francisco and parked at Union Square underground parking.  My son knew about this place he had been before  with some Thai friends. The service is super fast. The prices are the best in the area. We had 8 in our party and it cost less than $10 per person. One item did not come out till we were almost done eating. Love the large portions. Only wished they had more veggies on #14 chinese broccoli and noodles. 
Also people kept coming in and it seemed like no one was leaving found out they have more seating upstair!
author: rock t.

description:
King of Thai Noodle House is the staple of Thai food in San Francisco. As far as I can remember, my first Thai restaurant in SF back in college was the King of Thai on Taraval St, so this place holds a dear spot in my heart. I was literally in love with this place, as I had yet to discover other better Thai restaurants. Once my taste for Thai food grew, I noticed that this place was not great, but pretty good, especially for the money. 

The pros include:
- Opened late on a daily basis.
- Pretty reasonable prices.
- Ultra-fast service. (If you blink, your food might appear in front of you)

Cons include:
- Sometimes it's annoying to get a decent table.
- Always crowded at any time of the day. 
- They don't take credit card. 

Overall, it's conveniently located in Union Square and the food is pretty consistent. I still go here when I'm in SF, so that should be a testament of how pretty good this place is. I recommend the Pad Thai, Pad Kee Mow, Red Curry with Duck, Pineapple Fried Rice, and Chicken Noodle Soup (with a shit-load of spices).
author: Phuoc L.

description:
Food was ready incredibly quickly, but it was kind of mediocre. 


I got pad thai and a thai iced tea. The pad thai was kind of excessively greasy and the tofu in it was terrible. The tea was good, but it's also kind of hard to mess up. 

Price for extra meat was very reasonable and overall cost was pretty good :) 

I think if I came back I'd get one of the rice based dishes instead. 

Overall, this is fine for what it is: cheap late night thai food served fast.
author: Elwin M.

description:
A solid 3-star restaurant.  

Good:  Prices are not bad, especially for being in the tourist area of Union Square.  Service is quick and the food comes out quickly, even if they are pretty busy.  The food itself is good, but not knock-your-socks off.  Late hours.

Not so good:  It is chilly in the restaurant, especially if seated near the front (drafty).  Could be cleaner.

Overall - it's a good, quick restaurant to grab some food if you're in the area.
author: Kellan M.

description: We just drove into San Fran from Napa and were craving Thai food. Found this place right around the corner from our hotel...and one block away from Union Square! We opted for 2 noodle dishes Pad See-Ew and Pad Kee Mao. Ordered one beef and one chicken. They were both excellent. The food arrived in under 5 minutes. Was also ordered sticky rice...and with tip. $25. Downtown SF on a Friday at 5pm...Well Worth it!
author: Brent F.

description:
Ok, so it was pouring and this was the day before Thanksgiving, so the streets were crowded, the shopping malls were packed, the store shelves were disorderly, untidy, clothes fallen here, there, everywhere....so after such a night, I just about wanted to sit and eat and be on my way.

Two flies hovering around our table.

Got seated in one tight corner, between the window and the table ahead of us, so no space to push the chair back.

Dirty plate, stained glass

So-so food.

The soup was a wash-out -- lots of liquid and barely there veges (Tom Yum Vege)

So there!
author: Me Iz S.

description:
Upon walking in to get a quick bite because the boyfriend was hungry, it smells like sweaty old men. Horrible horrible smell. Whatever

We sit down, order and get our waters. 
I go to sip my water and there's BRIGHT PINK lipstick stains on my cup. I was so disgusted, immediately thinking they probably don't wash their dishes either. 

We got up right away, cup in hand to show the first employee we saw (the hostess) and told her what happened and that she can cancel our order. Her reply? "Ooo really..?" We just looked at eachother and walked out never to return.
author: Catherine M.

description:
As far as I can tell, everything on the menu is really good here. 

And fast. 

Very SF too. 

Plus open reasonably late too, which is a huge bonus.
author: Zake S.

description: I just came back from the third world, the food and restaurant I have seen much more better than what we see in the U.S. for example this restaurant you feel like you are seating in outside and smell so bad plus the food you don't know what's about!!!! It's San Francisco the capital of junk food!
author: Daniel M.

description: Came here a couple of years ago. The service and food were alright. i Was was with the same group of people hang out, i would come back.
author: Peter N.

description:
Came here after walking around SF with my friend. Thai food sounded super appealing and it was right there. We were seated right away.

Me and my friend ordered chicken satay for starters. I ordered the pad thai, my friend ordered the Thai style fried rice with roast duck.

For some reason the pad thai and rice came before the chicken satay. Weird.

BEST PAD THAI I HAVE EVER HAD. Perfect consistency for noodles, just the right amount of nuts, a lot of shrimp and tofu. They also remembered to omit the bean sprouts like I requested! Yes. My friend said he enjoyed his rice. The peanut sauce that came with the chicken satay was delicious as well.

I'll come back if I'm in SF and craving Thai food.
author: Beatrice C.

description:
there are a few of these in SF, but I still love their fried rice. I don't know what it is about it, but it's got something extra that makes it super flavorful and delicious. Their pad kee mao and pad thai and papaya salad are all tasty as well, but I still crave their fried rice. 

good, quick, inexpensive thai food!
author: Caroline D.

description:
Looking for late night grub in SF, look no further than King of Thai. 

This location is very conveniently located near Union Square and I love that it's open late.

After some fun times at SFMoma and Local Edition, we walked over to King of Thai for some tasty late night grub.

We ended up getting a bunch of items and shared. We got both chicken and duck pad see ew, seafood noodles, grilled salmon with broccoli and shrimp paste fried rice with fried chicken pieces.

It was all tasty and best of all they were quick! Don't expect the food to blow you away or anything but for late night food, thumbs up! Plus it helps make sure I don't get a hangover the next day ;)
author: Nadia L.

description: This was one of the worst experiences I have had ordering Thai. The food was delivered before the estimated time which was appreciated but was missing items and one of the items we ordered (Kao Prik Sod, with Shrimp) had about half the normal amount of food it should've. When I called the restaurant to let them know, they said it wasn't their problem and to call seamless. I will not order from here again. Horrible customer service and did not offer to refund me for the missing items.
author: Ravi C.

description: We made an impromptu trip to the city as a restaurant we were going to go to in Walnut Creek was closed.. And boy we were glad that we went to SF! This place is tucked off to the side but the sign is what caught my attention. We walked over, checked out the Yelp reviews, peeked inside, and decided it was for us. We actually sat upstairs and service was quick. We ordered the duck fried rice and chicken panang. Both were out fairly quick and both were delicious. I'd like to have checked out a soup but since we took BART I wasn't in the mood to have to carry a soup back home! :) Yummy place.
author: Kory R.

description:
I went here because it was close to Union Square and cheap. The service is fast and the food is decent, but I wouldn't go here if I had the option of going somewhere else for food. 

I got the duck egg noodle soup. The duck leg was burnt on the outside, red and raw on the inside. Had to put it off to the side. I love duck too. :( The broth was okay, a little salty. There weren't very many noodles either. My cousin had the yellow curry. Too much chicken, not enough potatoes, but the sauce was good. The cucumber salad that came with it was not great. Just tasted like they threw cucumber in the dressing a few minutes before they served it.  

Also they operate like a Vietnamese pho place so better know what you want quick because they take a while to come back. 

If you are desperate need of thai food, go down the street for another place.
author: Hang T.

description: Everything was tasty. Fast delivery too. Had most of the noodles and rice plates to share, definitely going to try again.
author: Josh D.

description:
One of the few places in downtown San Francisco that is open late night that doesn't require you to enter through a shady alleyway. Plus, they have Thai food! 

There's a bunch of KoTs in the city, some cleaner, some more delicious, but this is definitely the one to go to when you're hungry and too lazy to think of places to go afterwards. It's affordable, fast, and you won't have a lot of room to move around. 

We ordered the roasted duck curry and the pineapple fried rice. The curry was a bit spicier than I expected, and the rice was on the harder side. The pineapple fried rice was more fried rice than pineapple (~4 pieces), but still delicious. Would I come back again? Yes, of course. I've been going to King of Thai since middle school, and even with so many better foodie options in the city, I still can't break the habit of walking through Union Square and into the arms of the purple walls.
author: Tiffaney L.

description: Good noodles! Good attention as well - works for a fast meal. Lots of rice/ noodle options
author: Vivi K.

description:
In many ways, this was a very good choice for a low brow for a late afternoon meal for a bunch of us Yelpers after a museum excursion.

After the Picasso viewing at MOMA, a few of us needed a place to wind down before venturing off to the Goth Night at the Marina. Yikes I say.

Located in the very busy intersections and confusing/crowded sidewalk, we settled upon this place because it was so close to the Hotel room of two members of our group. It looked clean enough and do have a lot of tables opened. It seemed to get busy at all times of the hour with people coming in and going in out. A place that never stops.

Looking at the menu, they have an unusual ordering system for soup with or without noodles. For instance, you can a base of BBQ Pork with Won Ton soup: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/udYo3BZ0Y3nR1iOtk58Inw?select=68JR_TlsW_v0BKxpCLBLQw , if you want noodles on top of that base, it would come in an extra cost. Just like so happen with a different base with noodle would be: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/udYo3BZ0Y3nR1iOtk58Inw?select=67PYxZSkEV_TWyyFFB-Mng . 

What impressed and bring smile to our camp was the fact that they do serve imported and domestic alcoholic beverages at this establishment. After a long afternoon, it is a cool way to wind down and shoot the breeze. Oh we did shoot the breeze.

It is a good place to get some chow at all hours of the afternoon and early evening time. It's not enough to wow you or knock your socks off, but for a decent meal at a decent price, this would do.
author: Mike L.

description:
Authentic Thai in the city as you hear the echos of "Saaaa baaaaiiiii deeeee" when you walk in!

Comforting if not large Thai kitchen to get you away from the hustle and bustle of your shopping excursion in Union Square.  Plenty of tables both downstairs and upstairs. I opted for upstairs so my hair won't smell like an asian invasion.

Can't go wrong with some pad see yew or pad kee mao.  Tempted to try the noodle soup which everyone raves about but that's for another time.  

Cheap eats AND the best kept secret about this place.......DA spice rack! I long for that spice rack when visiting authentic thai places filled with ground chili, jalapenos in vinegar & sweet chili sauce.  They don't have the fresh chili peppers in fish sauce but if you ask the wait staff then they'll be happy to oblige and bring you some from the kitchen.

Just make sure to demurely bow your head and say khob-kun-kaaaaaa as you leave.
author: Lo-an L.

description:
I absolutely love this place. I've never had to wait too long to get a seat, the servers are attentive, portions are large, and the food is REALLY good. So good, I've never strayed from their Pad See Ew (i ask them to make it spicy). I just can't do it. And I'm not the type of person that finds one thing I like at a restaurant and never deviates. I like to switch it up and try different things on a menu. Not here...

I happily walk over from howard and hawthorne with my coworkers whenever the opportunity arises. It's worth it!
author: Rob W.

description:
It lives up to its hype. A couple of friends and I stopped here because we had all heard about it and were dying to try it. I had no idea there was such good food tucked away across from the all women's H&M? 

We were afraid we wouldn't get sets but they took us upstairs past the busy kitchen. I picked the pumpkin curry which was a special, my friend's got duck fried rice and a noodle dish. All were quite tasty. The pumpkin curry had a bit of a kick to it, but overall, I thought it actually delivered the quality.

I will definitely be going here again.
author: Amy J.

description:
I came here yesterday night with my boyfriend for a quick dinner. We were both very disappointed with their service and food. 

Terrible Food
We ordered roasted duck fried rice and yellow curry rice plate. 
- Rice was poorly cooked - cold, no fragrant of Thai rice and very dry.  Potato chunks in yellow curry were sour. Chicken strips in the curry were dry and tasted like boiled chicken. 
- Roasted fried rice was made of unwanted part of the roasted duck. What else can I say?

Poor Service
- There were plenty of tables on the first floor when we walked in, but we were assigned to sit at a small table adjacent to a four-people party. Why would they do that?
- There were seven servers on the first floor, but none of them were attentive. I asked for a cup of hot water and was given a cup of cold water. They got it right the second time.
author: Spicy G.

description: I normally can say very good things about this place: delicious food, reasonable price, and attentive staff. This time around, howver, it was quite the opposite  (but mostly writing a negative review based on the staff and food). At the start of the meal, everything seemed fine, they seated and took orders from me and my guest quickly and efficiently. I ordered the crab fried rice and she ordered the yellow chicken curry. But after 20 minutes, no food came by (and for relativity, it usually takes between 10-15 and the restaurant was maybe 3/4 full). Several waiters and waitresses passed by, kept looking at our table, but nobody bothered to come by and ask if everything was okay.  I asked about the status of the food once, 10 minutes later, the curry came by. I then proceeded to wait even longer, to which at that point, several more waiters and waitresses passed by without saying a single word. I asked a 2nd time about the food, and was told it was on its way. It was not until another 15 minutes later I finally got my crab fried rice. Yes, crab fried rice. Needless to say, this was the worst experience I've had at this place and will probably not come back for a while. I gave them 1 star for delivering my food, and that's the best I think they deserve this round.
author: Mark T.

description:
Cheap, fast, good.  

This is a good place to eat out with some friends. It's also a nice place for a cheap dinner date. The service is great. Pretty casual atmosphere.
author: Kelly H.

description: The won ton soup is amazing! If you want an appetizer, go for the hoi joy (I think that's what it's called... #29) the plum sauce just makes it taste that much better.
author: Micah L.

description:
Food was good. Service was fast and staff attentive. Prices were fair for the area and type of food. 
I am not really sure how sanitary this place is, but maybe that is the point. I saw kitchen staff eating in the food prep areas. Eating your own bowl of food while cooking mine? No thanks. 
There were also small flies that we kept having to sweep away with our hands. That got annoying after a while. We arrived at around 7pm, so maybe because it was fairly busy, it wasn't as clean? The bathrooms could have been cleaner as well. 

We had the pad thai and pineapple fried rice. Both has good portion sizes and good taste. I had to add some pepper to it to make it spicier, but that's not a problem with me. Also had thai iced tea, which I wouldn't recommend. They have a ton of glasses pre-filled with tea, and you get some fresh half and half added to your tea before they bring it out. 

I would order here again if I were staying in town longer, but only for takeout. I think I would get grossed out eating in.
author: Rohan J.

description:
Had great noodle soup, where you can select the type of noodle (flat rice, vermicelli, etc.)  Despite the location, and right around noon, I was able to find seating at the counter.  

There are plenty of staff who are efficient.  There are condiments with chile and sauces at the table, which I wish more Thai places carry.
author: Dan C.

description: Huge menu with TONS of options and incredibly fast service. Some of the dishes are good but some of my favorites like Phad Kee Mao were big misses. I'd say they do a better job on their noodle soup dishes than most of the other options. They also have a few other locations throughout the city.
author: Kathy A.

description:
We stumbled across this place by accident, and absolutely loved it! 
We had chicken satays- amazing! Papaya salad, duck noodle soup and a brocoli and need/chicken stir fry (pas brocoli or something)! Love all of it!
The soup was brilliant- highly recommend
author: Olivia M.

description: Great food! However, ordered the Guay Tiaw Lord Noodle - beware only two shrimp. I also ordered crab fried rice (sooo good).
author: Khadeejah S.

description:
I came late night cuz my friend realllllly wanted Thai.

Mistake.

Soup was salty as fffff******, MSG-laden and lacking in any sort of fresh flavor that Thai food should have.

I already wanted to yack from the alcohol I drank.  This almost did it.  Almost.

Sigh.  I've never been a fan of Thai food and this place made it worse.  I've definitely had better.
author: Darren T.

description: During our fun adventures around union square, we passed by this place and noticed it was Zagat rated so we gave it a shot. So glad we did. The food was fantastic! We ordered the pad see ew, which was very flavorful, and the crab fried rice, and I could taste the crab in every bite. My mom and I shared those two plates along with the shrimp tom yum soup and we were only barely able to finish the soup. Very generous with their portions. The service could be better but hey, there were people constantly getting in line to wait for seating so the staff probably gets overwhelmed. Overall, great food and the prices were not too bad. Would definitely recommend!
author: Brianna A.

description: Planning another trip to San Fran just so I can eat here! This place was awesome...the soup, the service, the ambience. I recommend it to anyone in the area looking for an authentic eating experience.
author: Chuck L.

description:
Best place for late night Thai after going to a bar. Not the best Thai mind you but where else can you get tom yum soup at 2am? 

Got the tom yum soup.. The spiciness was the perfect way to warm up. Lots of mushrooms but chicken was kinda dry. When I got to the bottom of the bowl it got too salty and couldn't finish it. My friend got the duck noodle soup, soup was a little too salty too. Another friend got pad see ew. Not enough flavor for me. 

Not a place I would want to personally go back to but wouldn't complain for another late night eat.
author: Kristine D.

description: went here along time ago, went back yesterday it was pretty good. I had the beef combination noodle bowl .my husband had curry pork with rice on the side he said it was good and we had the pineapple fried rice . which I thought was good . it had shrimp, chicken , raisins, cashews, green onion ,curry and of course pineapple. oh they said they deliver with a minimum of $20 order. will have to keep that in mind.
author: Nellie J.

description:
SO GOOD. 
I was recommended this place by a friend from Thailand who works on a cruise ship that came in every ten days. Every time they docked in SF, he'd come here to eat. I figured if he was from Thailand and says the food is good, I should give it a try. and WOW.

I am obsessed with their Thai Iced Tea. Every time I am in the city I will stop to grab one to-go. They are so good. The only problem is they put too much ice. I want more drink!

Their food there is awesome! I got the Duck Noodle soup. I loved the flavor of the soup. It was not bland, it was something memorable. 
I also ordered once the Pad Thai, very good. 
Their dishes do not lack flavor and the place is pretty cheap. 

It's the best Thai restaurant I have been to.
author: Marsea C.

description:
Combination soup was great ! Sliced beef and beef balls. Everything was delish! 
Service was super friendly and fast.

Place is kinda dirty... only thing that is keeping it from 5 stars.
author: Max N.

description:
Great food, open late, attentive service (though I think it may have been attentive as a couple of the girls had a crush or something on my female friend). 

I tried a couple bites of J's pad thai (http://media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/W8R-b7zdiquiu_TNcN5AFA/l). It was tasty though the noodles were a bit too stringy for me. The pad see ew was better (http://media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/sCB27_2ui2mqVSD6hlimZQ/l). Mmmm chewy noodles, good flavor...everything was right.
author: K W.

description:
I had a terrible experience at this restaurant. I went for dinner and was seated directly in front of the door. This caused me to immediately be off-put by the entire place as I was freezing the whole time I was there.

I ordered some kind of garlic chicken. When it finally came, I was extremely disappointed. In addition to the dish looking unappealing, the taste was mediocre and matched its appearance.

As for the service, it took forever to order, get our meals, and our waters were never refilled. The worst part about this place is the fact that the dishes were blatantly dirty. I will never return to this restaurant again.
author: Kimmie A.

description: Love this place.  Who doesn't love Thai food?  I'm in San Francisco a lot.  THE MOST BEAUTIFUL CITY IN THE WORLD!   Also love to eat!  This place has a great location in Union Square, near Macys.  I just got takeout.  I looked at their menu, and thought I had two items picked out.  I asked the server helping me what she would recommend for noodles and curry.  She asked me if I like it hot.  Yo, hot is my middle name!   She recommended the two items that I had picked, Green Curry Chicken and Pad Kee Mao(stir fried flat rice noodles, green beans, bell peppers, Thai chili, and your choice of meat)!  Both entrees were delicious and nice and hot!
author: Blondie R.

description: I had the pad se ew. Its good! The pad thai is fine (standard).
author: Sofya T.

description: Just stopped by for a quick dinner. Food is good! Service was fast and the price was fair.
author: Kip H.

description: Great place to grab a late night bite after going out, especially if you are feeling some traditional thai dishes.  Very extensive and authentic menu, service has never been a problem, and dishes come out great.  I would recommend the Pad See Eew, Pad Thai, and Duck Fried Rice.  Definitely some great flavors, but a little heavy handed on the sodium.  It will leave you satisfied but you'll be thirsty a few hours later.
author: David C.

description:
This place is very... purple.

They seat and serve really quickly, despite the 20,000 nerdy geophysicists conferencing nearby. Solid Thai food.. got the pad see ew.. came out hot and fresh. There isn't much in terms of ambiance, but I'm happy to trade that for fast and good food.
author: Lisa W.

description:
My wife and I just BARTed in to the city and we were very hungry. We came upon the King of Thai and decided to give it a try. 

The restaurant was pretty small for how many people seemed to love it. The hostess was awesome and seated us immediately and gave us a menu. 

Our server took our order and I ordered the red curry with chicken. I remembered why I don't usually get curry, it is because it is not very good for you with the cream sauce, but I ordered it, and the taste was awesome. 

I added a bunch of red pepper paste to it, and I ordered spicy and my wife gave me some of her stuff too. I really enjoyed the quick service and a solid meal. It was really good. Also, quick service. It is a true in and out eat your food and get out place, but for that kind of place, it was amazing. 

Great people manning the place!
author: Jason K.

description:
Anything opened until 2 am is awesome.
Why? Because they have to deal with drunk people. (Aka, my friend who just got married. Let's give him a generic name... Like Phil). 
Disclaimer: the entire wedding party was partying around town, Phil's wife included. 
Food wise, they have a good selection & your standard mix of sauces. 

Would I go again? Yes, especially when other options are already closed.
author: Tomo M.

description: This is strictly on their customer service would give no stars if I could.  We called in an order for take out and they got our order wrong.  Instead of trying to fix it they argued with me for 5 minutes and also asked to talk to the person that called in the order.  Considering I was on a lunch break, I was getting irritated.  They did say they would fix it but it's still extra time they took away from my lunch.  After they got off the phone, they were arguing with each other before they said they would fix it.  This is just horrible service!  Whirl they were fixing my order, they were giving me dirty looks and talking to either in their own languages, don't make the customer feel like crap when it was a mistake of yours.  No apologies or thank you!  So rude!
author: Jenn H.

description: I feel like the 3.5 star rating is pretty accurate, as the dishes that I get here have fluctuated in taste and flavor. I get the same thing every time (pad kee mao with tofu), so I'm not sure why things change. The first time I had it, the noodles were AMAZING. If I'd reviewed this place then I'd probably give it a 5. But then more recently, the noodles that I've gotten just haven't been the same. Not too happy about the dish getting worse over time, so we'll see what happens in the future.
author: Amaresh S.

description: One of the best Thai places I've ever gone too! The price was reasonable and the portion of the plate was great! I would totally come back!!! It was soooo delicious!!!
author: Karyl Faye B.

description:
Stumbled in here after a day of work followed by an evening of shopping. I ordered the Tom Kha soup (vegetarian). I thought it was totally delicious, but I also suspect that they used fish sauce even though it was in the vegetarian menu. 

Friend ordered the vegetarian noodle soup with vermicelli noodles and loved it.
author: Allison S.

description: Quick, delicious, and spicy! Great for anyone here on a conference and needs something close to their hotel but still a good meal
author: Jessa R.

description: I went there yesterday in the afternoon looking for a chicken noodle soup. When one of the servers brought the soup I've noticed it was very light and clear, like it was just a boiling water with noodles and undercooked chicken strips with bunch of bean sprouts in it. I tasted it, and I was surprised to find it tasting like sweetened boiled water. I asked the server if it is usually like that sweet and she was kind to take my soup to the kitchen back and brought me another one. Unfortunately the new soup tasted exactly like the previous one-sweet! I didn't want to complain and just ended up paying for the soup I barely touched and left. I will never come back.
author: Aya J.

description: This place is a cluster×÷=×. These guys are horrible. EVERY table is missing one food item, and the staff could care less. Its now 45 minutes later and only I have gotten my less than okay noodle soup. AVOID - THIS PLACE.
author: Steve B.

description:
Sooo different from SD, where I'm from. They don't ask spiciness. They give you a whole rack of spices you sprinkle on your food when you receive it.

This place isn't to die for if craving Thai food, but it is pretty cheap and gets the job done of filling you up. 

I would say I've had better Thai food elsewhere. The bf and I ordered shrimp pad thai and cashew chicken, our favorites whenever eating Thai food. However, we were both disappointed. Being that we were so hungry that didn't matter. We just wanted to eat.
author: Christine D.

description: This place is not the best place for thai food but the prices are on point tho! It is super reasonable and I really like how fast the food comes out. That being said, sometimes the service is not so great and the quality isn't the best either. But with the price and the amount you get, I think it is a good restaurant to go to. I love the pad thai and Pad kee mao and duck fried rice! So try it if ya want some cheap thai food!
author: Joanne C.

description:
I got the wonton soup with noodles...the soup needed more wontons. The soup was savory, but I wished there was more wontons stuffed with more meat.

They take credit cards at this location, but not AmEx.
author: Margaret R.

description: Great spot & food. Red curry chicken Spicy!
author: Henry D.

description: I had the seafood noodle soup. It was huge and had lots of seafood. the broth is a light chicken flavor and once you spice it up a bit with condiments it was awsome. I'll  be back soon
author: Dave L.

description:
Got the pad thai and chicken satay and my girlfriend got rad nar.

Overall it was ok. my pad thai tasted pretty decent but smelled like poopy farts.
author: Drawing G.

description:
Hubby has been talking about coming back to King of Thai Noodle House since eating here during our trip last year, so we are back a year later and here we are.  

Last time he got take out, this time we decided to eat in.  The place was packed but we only waited about 5 minutes for a table.  Our order was taken right away after we were seated.

I had Pad Thai and he ordered Guay Thew Lord and egg rolls.  The egg rolls were very good and crispy.  My Pad Thai was very good and plentiful.  As hungry as I was I couldn't finish it all.  Hubby completely devoured his, it had calamari, shrimp, black mushrooms, noodles, etc all the things he loves!

The prices were very reasonable and you get a lot for the money.

Hubby satisfied, now off to see the city once again!
author: Vikki J.

description: Fast and friendly service considering the hustle and bustle going on around there. If only the food were better like the their other less busy branches. Shrimp pad Thai had only 3 shrimp, while the noodles were dry due to lack of sauce. The fried chicken in the fried rice combo was hard, because the chicken may had been an older one.
author: Ron D.

description: The service here is horrible. I first had to wait 5 minutes to get seated when there were plenty of open tables. I then had to wait almost 20 minutes to get a mediocre-at-best bowl of pho. And it's not just this time. I've never had a pleasant experience eating here. It's just unfortunate that it's the only pho place near Powell.
author: Ashley G.

description:
Stumbled in here late friday night after wondering around the streets of San Francisco looking for a decent place to eat that would not put us in the poor house. Service was quick and attentive and the food was awesome!!! At least the food I ate. 

Food:

Pineapple fried rice: AWESOME!!! I love this stuff.... Granted the girlfriend beat me to most of it. :) Of what I did eat, it was all very tasty and yummy yummy in my tummy. Heck... it tasted exactly like the fried rice I used to eat while in Thailand and Laos. GOOD TIMES!

Green curry with chicken: This was another awesome dish and was just the perfect level of spice. If your a fan of traditional super hot and spicy dishes, this was more on the mild side. Granted for those not into spice, this dish is spicy and has enough kick to keep you going. 

Looking forward to my next trip to SF and getting some more pineapple fried rice!
author: Brad T.

description: Pad Thai was really yummy!  Smaller place but didn't have a problem finding a table on a Wednesday night.  Service was good, and food came out super quickly.  Would recommend this place to a friend for sure.
author: Vanessa S.

description: This noodle house has a broad menu and extremely fast service. Although I have been wanting to try other things on their menu, I have stuck with the combination beef noodle soup and their Thai tea rocks.
author: Christian E.

description:
MARNEE THAI!!!!!!!!!!!!! Wait... opps, wrong review. Anyways, nothing can ever top Marnee Thai, but my friend really wanted thai food at around 9:40pm and she wanted to go downtown so we had no choice. I actually never realized how big this place was. It looked SO small but it turns out it has a second floor consisting of about 8 more tables. My crew of 5 got seated immediately which was nice because boy was I hungry. 

Pineapple fried rice: 3.5 stars. Not bad, but I've had better. It's your average fried rice plate fried in thai fish sauce with your choice of chicken, beef, or pork with pineapples, tomato, cucumber, and eggs. I personally like it with chicken and shrimp. 
pad thai: 3 stars. Definitely not as good as Marnee Thai. Very average pad thai that usually is not cooked correctly, hence the rice noodles all cluttering and sitcking together. But for those who have never had this, its basically thin flat rice noodles fried in fish sauce and tamarind sauce with eggs, chicken, beef, or pork, bean sprouts, shrimp, carrots, crushed peanuts and the option of lime to squeeze on top. I personally prefer chicken and shrimp with this dish.
pad see-ew: 3 stars. The thai version of chow fun. It is basically fat flat noodles fried in dark soy sauce, light soy sauce, broccoli, egg, garlic, and your choice of meat. I usually prefer beef with this plate because I think it tastes the best with this dish. 
sweet sticky rice with mango ($5.95): 2.5 stars. Man, I wish I did my research on this dish before ordering it. I read the raving reviews on this dessert and I immediately ordered it expecting it to be uniquely delicious. HOWEVER, it is basically the Vietnamese soy I grew up eating with a couple slices of mangoes. It's soy, mango, some sauce and sesame over the soy. It was nothing special to me. I could make this at home, and it was quite pricey for such a simple dish. 6 bucks for soy and mangoes.... Oh well, not I know what it is. 

Customer service was ok. They accommodated with us and allowed us to get 5 separate checks.The waitress totally called us out saying we forgot to give her one of the receipt back.... but it was just stuck to the one on top of it. But... we weren't mad because it's understandable due to the massive 5 pieces of receipts she handled. 

Overall, a very average thai food place. And I believe it was a bit pricier than other branches since it is downtown. Parking was difficult of course, so we parked about 8 blocks from the restaurant, but its ok, WE HAVE TO EXERCISE AFTER WE EAT! 

I definitely would not go back here again however due to the lack of quality on top of the added prices.
author: Chena N.

description:
Nothing special but something to fill you up after or before getting your drink on.

Service is quick and prices are pretty reasonable for what you are getting.

Plenty of noodles in my dish (Guay Tiaw Lord) however, they seemed a bit under-cooked.

Also, I ordered my Guay Tiaw Lord spicy, it was anything but.

I am also very spoiled when it comes to Thai food  (Linda's Thai Kitchen - Secaucus, NJ) so take this review with a grain of salt.
author: Brian K.

description: in town w wife to visit son. they didn't want to walk up to tenderloin for Thai, so we yelped around union Square.  found this place and were quite pleased.  quick seating at 630 pm on fri night. restaurant almost full. great panang curry w nice heat but not overwhelming. egg roll apps came w meal but pretty quick.  out of wine so wife didn't drink. boy and I had anchor steam. fine meal efficiently served
author: Brad S.

description: Pad Thai was good and the crab fried rice surprisingly had a lot of crab. Both dishes were delish! Gets crowded but service is fast. We will come here again when we come back to SF.
author: Phil O.

description: I love this place, they have one of the best pad Thais and I'm a super picky person when it comes to Pad Thai. Went here with friends and now taking my brother here who ordered the pad see-ew sorry if I butchered the spelling. Lets how that tastes but this place is open till 3 am and always busy. Just love it!
author: Heather S.

description: Inexpensive Thai place with purple Walls and big upstairs, good for a large group up to 20 to take over the upstairs
author: M S.

description: I always get the beef stew noodle soup, with small rice noodle.  Definitely reliable and always satisfies the craving.
author: Cal C.

description: I order mine #30 - Fried Chicken over Fried Rice. Not happy what I got. Half cooked, almost have rice cake inside covering the chicken. Doesn't look or crispy as any other Thai fried chicken on this section of San Francisco.
author: Mark U.

description:
this place is always busy.

been here a few times but ended up bringing my hubs with me on my last visit.
we were seated upstairs where it's too dark.  weird.

food was okay, service was fast.
I used get take outs and they were good too.

not bad for a downtown Thai restaurant.
author: Learnee L.

description: DONT come here!!! They don't speak English! They are very confusing. They tried to tell me I ordered my food but I didn't! I paying for food I didn't order! And thy still have audacity to stare and talk about me! She rudely gives me my bill. The food tasted like cup of noodle which you buy of a dollar(never mind that's insulting cup of noodle) .,
author: IzzyAleena B.

description:
This place is bigger than it looks.  Went there on a Saturday afternoon with the hubby and thought we had to wait as all the tables out front were full.  To our surprise we were seated promptly in the back.  There's a back and a second floor to the restaurant so don't let the crowd deter you from getting a bowl of noodles!

We ordered the fried spring rolls and a bowl of the vegetarian noodles.  Both dishes came out at the same time, literally 2 minutes after we ordered...talk about speedy service!  The spring rolls were served with a sweet and sour dipping sauce.  Crispy on the outside and piping hot on the inside, not bad if you have a spring roll craving but I wouldn't come back for that.  The noodles on the other hand was delish.  I didn't expect a vegetarian noodle broth to have so much flavor and depth...you can pick between egg noodles, rice noodles or vermicelli so there is a little bit of customization to each order.  We had ours with the egg noodles which went really well with the flavorful broth.

Service here is fast, similar to that of Vietnamese pho restaurants.   Food was decent, a nice escape from the food court at the SF shopping center.
author: Shirley C.

description: Fast Thai food! Everything is made fresh and the kitchen has no walls, so you can watch them cook your food. I love their pad kee mao, the veggies and the noodles and sauce goes very well together. What I love most about this place is the serrano peppers in vinegar + crushed peppers + the hot sauce on the table to use, I barely find these at Thai restaruants! Super fast service and the food tastes amazing. I see lots of people eating the soup noodles, I have yet to try them!
author: Rita K.

description:
My friends and I were walking around looking for a good spot for dinner, and saw this place from across the street.  Noodle House? King of Thai Noodle House?  The name sold it. 

The food and the service were pretty good.  Yet, somehow, I can't bring myself to give this place more than 3 stars.  Thinking back on my meal -- I ordered the wonton soup -- it was just okay.  The wonton wasn't blow-your-mind-good, and warmed me up just so.  But! something about it was very bland. 

Perhaps I should have ordered noodles, no?
author: Nellie T.

description: The restaurant is excellent. There is a very good selection and the plates of food have big proportions. There are times when it could be busy, but it is worth the food and wait to enjoy it.
author: Jonathan R.

description:
I have a love/hate relationship with this place. 

I get the same thing every time, yet for some reason the last few times I've gone it tastes different. Not to mention it keeps getting HOTTER. I'm all for spicy food, so the first time it tasted a little spicier, I didn't mind too much.
But the last time I was there it was so spicy I couldn't even finish it. 
Ayi yi yi...

I do like this place a lot, but I think I'm going to start venturing out to different Thai restaurants.
author: Amanda Z.

description: In relative terms, based on price, service and taste, this is a great place to eat in SF. Try their roast duck over rice, it's delicious!
author: Jay D.

description: The food is a tad bit over priced - but this is SF. Customers service is great! Always ready to accommodate. A request. Try #15 with chicken.
author: Lad S.

description:
Ate here the night before a race...we wanted to get our Thai craving satisfied before hitting the hay.   We got there at peak dinner time, and the place was pretty packed, but we lucked out with a table for 6 of us.  Parties behind us didn't seem to have to wait too long either; the establishment seems to be pretty large and can accommodate a lot of patrons, so coming here last minute wouldn't be a problem.

And now...food.  I have to say it was pretty good...I loved the phad see ew and the soup dish I had, I forget what it was at the moment.  So I was glad we came here to eat.  

Service was decent,  the place was pretty busy, so I guess it could've been worse, and the fact that we were able to eat pretty good-priced and good-tasting thai, it wasn't so much of a problem.  Thank you very much King of Thai!
author: Jay B.

description: This food is very good. I been here every single time go to SF. This restaurance is not very big but it is warm enough. Try it if you come SF!
author: Lee L.

description: It was very gross and not worth the price!!! Please dont go!!! Save yourself. The food was poorly made and felt as if they accidently put it together. Worst thai food experience for me.
author: Theresa L.

description: My last review was 2 1/2 years ago.  Things have changed.  Got the green curry with chicken.  Oh, but where's the chicken?  The extremely few tough and dry pieces of chicken (they were so small they could have been something else?) sliced as big as a wooden matchsticks, the curry was watery and underwhelming.  Then the service was like this:  4 people at the table, 1 person gets their order, 5 minutes later the second order shows up, 5 minutes later the third order arrives, then finally after everyone is done with their meals my curry finally gets to the table.   I've been coming here since they opened and it's gone downhill in too many ways so quickly.
author: Rona M.

description: Showed up hungry! The waitress said the wait will be 5 mins. Fast forward a minutes, two ladies show up and are seated immediately! I don't even...
author: Andy C.

description: Fast thai food near union square; fast to get a table for 2. We like the white crab fried rice and usually stick to that.
author: Hanna A.

description:
Big portions. 
Pad see ew - amazing.
Pad Thai - amazing.
Service - eh.. alright.
Space - hole in the wall but not so bad.
author: Zahra C.

description: I stopped in here for lunch during a recent trip to San Francisco, and it was definitely a good choice. I ordered the beef Kao Gra Tiam, and it was flavorful and filling without being too heavy. Definitely a good choice if you want something to keep you going throughout the day without weighing you down. It is worth noting that I was there on a Saturday afternoon and it was quite busy, so plan accordingly.
author: Elizabeth K.

description:
Roasted Duck Fried Rice. All you need to know. All other items are also good; roast duck noodle soup, pad thai, etc but the roast duck fried rice is just something else! :) 
Great service!
author: Michelle Y.

description:
My boyfriend and I were in Union Square last Sunday and decided to try this place out. Bad choice...

We were seated and it took them awhile to take our order. The waitress didn't even seem to know English that well. I had to literally repeat myself 3-4 times for her to get our order right. We waited about 10-15 minutes and we still didn't get our food yet, so I reminded our waitress and she said it's coming. Another 10 minutes later we got our food.. their Pad Thai has got to be the worst I've ever tried. We wanted to order dessert and my boyfriend wanted to try their Mango Sticky Rice. She told us they didn't have any left. So we tried to order their Fried Banana Ice-cream (they only had 2 desserts to choose from), she told us that they only have fried banana, NO ICE-CREAM. So we passed on dessert.

I decided to use their restroom while my boyfriend was taking care of the bill. Now we usually tip 15%-20% whenever we eat at a sit-down restaurant even if the meal wasn't all that great. We decided not to, call us cheap but their service was horrible and the food sucked big time. So I came out and my boyfriend seemed very upset, I asked him and he told me "THEY MADE ME TIP THEM." So I guess the waitress said to him, "Oh you forgot to add tip to your bill." He replied saying, "I don't want to." She says "You have to tip us, we need a tip." She pretty much demanded a tip and wouldn't leave our table until she received one. He just threw a dollar at her so she could go away.

WHO ASKS FOR A TIP!?
author: Cathy C.

description:
The food is excellent here!  The service is ok...   it seems as though there are far too many employees not getting much done...  There are 2 hostesses standing at the door to greet you which I suppose is nice but not necessary.

The location is excellent especially if you are in the city Christmas shopping its just a block from union square and Macys so you can grab a bite and be back out there fighting for furbies in no time!

But if you really want to enjoy your food at King of Thai and perhaps have drinks made and served by beautiful Thai women I suggest you check out the King of Thai in north beach on Grant!
author: Antoine V.

description: Satisfyingly cheap eats near Union Square.  Favorite dish of late?  Crab fried rice.
author: Joanne G.

description:
What do you do when you want to eat well in Union Square but not want to spend a fortune? You come to one of the Thai restaurants! King of Thai made a beautiful impression on me when I visited their North Beach location for their amazing happy hour.

I was with a party of 11 starving students and we just wanted to eat ANYTHING. On a Sunday night at 8pm only few locations were open, and thankfully King of Thai was one of them. I honestly didn't expect to get seating for all of us but we got three separate tables immediately in very close proximity.

The service at the start was not impressive. Once you were ready to make your order you had to flag down the server to order or else you would be left hanging for maybe even more than 10 minutes. This is an Asian restaurant - go forth and make your voice heard.

Our food came out VERY FAST. I don't think it took them more than 10 minutes to make the 5 dishes for our table. The BBQ Pork Fried Rice was pretty good. Very fragrant and flavorful rice with large chunks of Chinese sausage and BBQ pork. The BBQ pork was lacking in flavor but overall the dish did not disappoint, but could have had more meat. On the other hand, the Fried Chicken Over Fried Rice had a LOT of chicken. 
You always have plenty of crushed peanuts and chili on the side to make up for any lack of spice or texture. 

We weren't expecting it but our waitress let us split our check into 11 separate checks, which made paying so much easier. My friends loved the food and we'll be back again!
author: Jason T.

description:
Solid 4 / 5 stars place. 

This is my go to lunch place in SF Union Square. I have never had a bad experience here. The waitress are very efficient and easy on the eyes. They are friendly and fast. The price is cheap and certainly good !!

Here's my recommendation of food to try: 
1) Duck with soy sauce and Steam rice
2) Duck pineapple fried rice
3) Duck with noodle
4) Duck pumpkin curry with steam rice

I don't know if you notice a trend here. 

Their duck certainly isn't the best I've ever tasted. But it is pretty darn good and I go here just for it. So my suggestion: Try the duck. 
I also like their purple walls. I can't remember the name of the restaurant if someone asks me. The only thing I can tell them is: The thai place with purple walls. It can get pretty crowded here, and you will have to share table with other people, but the waiting is really not long. Can't complain. 
:-D
author: Andrew I.

description:
Roasted duck soup with egg noodle hit the spot. I got exactly what I wanted and was not disappointed. I came in with my friend on New Year's Day and I expected to wait at least 30 minutes for a table because I was pretty sure every restaurant at Union Square would be very busy for lunch that day. But we waited 0 min! We were seated immediately. I'm guessing they have more room in the back? But it seemed like everyone who came in were seated within at least 5 minutes. The hostess does her job well. I appreciate that this place was well staffed. 

Although we had to switch tables, I don't mind to make things easier for their hard working staff. 

This restaurant is EXACTLY what I was looking for in a thai place. I haven't had thai food in a while since I moved out of Berkeley, so this restaurant was what I expected. It's not high end, yet it's not a hole in the wall.
author: Arielle C.

description:
I love that this place is open until 1 am!  This place was pretty good, but I was sad that my Pad See Ew was a bit saltier than what I'm used to and they didn't make it spicy even though I had asked.  I guess I've been spoiled by Galanga in Santa Barbara... but nonetheless, it was still delicious.

The Steamed chicken sounds disgusting and looks really plain, but its actually very flavorful.  The rice has garlic in it and the ginger garlic sauce makes everything amazing.
author: Jenn C.

description: This place is awesome. We were in S.F. for two days and we ate there twice. Food was excellent, and prices were as cheap or cheaper compared to prices in the valley.
author: Doug C.

description: Amazing food. Highly recommended.  Open late. Fantastic. While in San Francisco we came here 2 nights in a row. A great place with outstanding service and super fast food preparation.  The egg rolls are a must have.  Clean and authentic.
author: Ali F.

description:
This review is for my take out experience from last night. I have dined here a number of times and really love the cheap and cheerful food. Tasty stuff! However, running short on time, I dropped by for some cheerful food to go. 

Ordered the Roast Duck dinner style, which was explained to me as being more meat and no rice. Perfect for this paleo queen! Didn't have to wait any longer than 10 minutes for my food, which I scooped up and marched up the hill to my house eager to tuck in to my tasty duck. 

There was less duck than with the normal portion and poorly cooked to boot! The weight of the box, which I gleefully hoped was my dinner style meat, was 90% semi-cooked vegetables. My warning is to check the order before you leave as it seems they try to rip off take away orders. I've never had bad service or food dining in, so I'll give them a star for that.
author: Erin O.
