description: This place was dirty--! It reminded me of a really busy high school cafeteria. The waitstaff ignored us forever-- before we had to ask one of them to come over and serve us. The food was mediocre to say the least. We were actually on our way to another better Thai restaurant around the corner and the hotel suggested this place-- why?? Not sure? I think this restaurant is all about the quantity, certainly not the quality!
author: Cassandra E.

description:
Not much to complain about. Love their late hours, and convenient location. With that said, there's not much to craze over about this place. Prices are on the more expensive place of thai food, and it's always so (suffocatingly) crowded.

Try their duck fried rice, pad thai, or pad see ew. All good choices. Worth a try if you're in the mood for thai food!
author: Kevin D.

description:
I came here after work this afternoon and had lunch at this King of Thai location. I've ate at almost every location and have seen this franchise grow in SF since I was in high school. I was accompanied by my mom when I came here to grab some lunch.

My mom already ate lunch earlier that day, with me being the only one having a late lunch close to 4pm. We were promptly seated upon arrival and everything seemed good until.... my order of 2 thai ice teas for both me and my mom along with a chicken thai fried rice for me. The waitress asked what my mom was ordering and I told her that I was the one eating. I ordered the 2nd thai ice tea so that they wouldn't give us any poor treatment or so I thought with these petty Thai waitstaff. 

I waited 10 minutes, still no thai ice teas or my thai fried rice. 5 other parties of 2's got seated after us and they ALL got their food ASAP. After seeing 5 different parties get their thai fried rice left and right, it got me thinking.....am I getting sh*tty treatment because I was the only one eating and not my mom? 

When Thai fried rice starts passing my table and the waitress who took my order was no where to be seen, that is a no bueno. I got ahold of a waitress who walked by and told her about my situation with the 1 order of thai fried rice and 2 thai ice teas and she went to go check up on it for me. 

2 minutes later, one of the wannabe she-man waitstaff came with my order of thai fried rice and straight drops it on the table in front of my mom and not me. I was literally about to walk out when fried rice passes me left and right but I don't get my food.

1-star is for the cheap thai food and the waitress who got my order rolling. -4 stars for the ENTIRE waitstaff (excluding the girl that helped me) along with offending my mom because she didn't order a dish but just had a thai ice tea.

I use to see the owner at one of the closeby KOT locations in the city close to my old workplace. Perhaps it's a VERY good time to pay a visit and have a chat with the boss about the bad waitstaff.
author: Joseph N.

description:
on numerous trips up to san francisco, we always end up eating at king of thai to get our pad see ew fix going on. though it's a heaping portion to share amongst the table (usually a group of 5-7),  we all love the pad see ew (beef) and always get 2 orders-licking them plates clean! the fried rice, larb, pad thai, & tom kha gai are also good as well. 

the place always seems to get packed whenever we're there for lunch, dinner, or late night grub. we've never had to wait more than 5-10 minutes regardless of the size in our party. good thing they have the upstairs seating as well..perfect to accommodate large groups.

service can be hit or miss here..probably because it gets so crowded all the time. plus the prices are great considering how huge their portions can get. so, here's to more future pad see ew cravings!
author: Belle L.

description: Food here is cheap in comparison to most places in Union Square, the food is alright I guess.  One problem I had with my food however was the large amount of egg shells in my pad thai. Friends also had something similarly related, it was okay. I was disappointed that they no longer serve free Thai tea with meals here anymore. Service was fine here too, nothing wrong, friendly staff. Not the kinda place I want to really eat at when I visit the city however.
author: Bryson L.

description:
Very disappointing, I used to love coming here years ago, but as time changed their prices have gone up and service had gone waaaaay down!!  

Ordered food, my friends came out 6mim after ordering, I waited an extra 20 min before asking where my food was.  everyone that sat down after us got their food first. The server just said "it's coming"... Apparently she doesn't know what that means.  Eventually canceled the order because it was getting ridiculous. 

The only time she apologized for the inconvenience was when giving my friend the check for her food. Horrible service!
author: Lara T.

description: Pad Thai was SO good! Waitress was nice but not very attentive!  Water cups were a little dirty!
author: Kiro S.

description: One of my places to go to when I go to San Francisco.  The price is cheap and the portion is very generous.  My favorite thing to order is probably any of the curries that they have, and the Duck Fried Rice which is delicious! Another plus is that the open late, and is right in the middle of Union Square so that you can go shopping right after!
author: michael l.

description: Came here uneasy left here full. This is a place I highly recommend pad Thai and pee see ew can't go wrong here.
author: Jerrod S.

description: Are you walked in San Francisco and I looked for something to eat I saw a very nice Thai place and in the past I didn't have good experience with Thai food so I said let's give it another chance and I have to say it was amazing amazing food in the King off tie the service was superquick and the food was very tasty I highly recommend this place for dinner or just grab something to go!!!! So happy to give to this place five stars!!!!!
author: Rachel S.

description: Good, solid lunch Thai. Their fried bananas with Thai iced tea ice cream dessert is *stellar*!
author: M. Dean J.

description:
This place is disgusting. There was a fly in my cousins sauce and they refused to change our food... ONLY THE SAUCE! Can I just say.. If the sauce that is poured on the plate is contaminated... The whole plate is contaminated right? After talking to three different waitresses that wouldn't  replace our food, not even discount the food, just CHANGE it, we spoke to the manager who also refused to change it and ended up yelling at us and hanging up on us. When my cousin spoke to the waitress in the back he said there were flies landing all over the vegetables. DISGUSTING!!

If you want the poops, please feel free to eat here. If you want to be served by people who are perfectly fine serving you feces and insects over rice and noodles, again feel free to eat here. The grim, pushy waitresses will gladly serve it to you.

1 star, only because I have. Shitty service, shitty food, shitty people and an even shittier owner.
author: Jessica S.

description:
If you want want no nonsense quick service and Thai/Chinese food - you are at the right place.

This place is always, ALWAYS crowded and full. 

The maitre d was very good at knowing (maybe psychic?) which seats were going to be vacated and when. You do feel like cattle being ushered this or that way, but quite efficient.

We ordered won ton soup plus noodles $8.00 and BBQ pork fried rice $8.25.

Not the best of both dishes that we ever had, but it did the trick of warming you up for a moderate price, quickly. 

The won ton noodle soup's broth was tasty and light. Plenty of thin egg noodles (you can pick the type of noodle you want in your soup), about 6 won tons and 7 slices of char siu. Quite tasty.

The fried rice was ok with two slices of cucumber. 

If you keep in mind that this is more like a cafeteria and you get good food at great prices, it's a great place for comfort food.  

Food - 3 Stars
Service - 4 Stars
Ambiance - 3 Stars
author: Cathy S.

description:
Went here for dinner with my husband a few years ago. It was my first Thai experience and probably my best. There is one other place down by our house that is maybe a little bit better but it is a different style.

The resturaunt itself was a bit crowded and hot. But the food  was amazing. A very good introduction to Thai. It made me a fan for sure. Not too spicy, great prices, ok service.
author: Aimee N.

description: Service is not good here. Food is mediocre, fast food, but cheap and it has some flavor. Definitely a eat quick and leave kinda place.
author: Will D.

description:
Visited here with my wife on our 5 day trip to San Francisco last week.  I'm a Thai food connoisseur and know what it should taste like.  I ordered the Tom Yum Gai and wasn't impressed.  Soup was made from paste, no real taste of Kaffir Lime, galanga, lemongrass, etc.  Wife had the Pad Kee Mao and seemed to like it ok.

It bears to mention that we both live in a college town in Indiana that has three Thai restaurants that all serve better, authentic Thai food.  That should leave an impression if you're considering this place.
author: John B.

description: Good Thai noodles and rice plates.  We always stop here for lunch or dinner when we are in San Francisco.  It is pretty busy here and crowded.  If you want great Thai food, definitely stop by.
author: Aileen K.

description:
I can't believe I've never given King of Thai a review until now.

I've eaten at this location a good amount of times since when I started high school near by in 2005. i still go hear every now and again when I'm downtown because their service is just about 99.9% always SUPER fast and friendly. No, seriously, on average, I usually get my food within 5 minutes if not less!

I usually get the Pad See-Ew, sometimes the Crispy Egg Noodles with Gravy Sauce (Also Chinese broccoli, small shrimp, calamari, imitation crab meat, sliced fish cakes) and once or twice I've also gotten the Roasted BBQ Pork & Chinese Sausage with Rice. But the Pad See-Ew and the Crispy Egg Noodles are my top 2.

My hubby usually gets the Thai Fried Rice w/ Chicken or the Crab Fried Rice. Those are pretty delicious, too.

I can't understand the 3.5 star rating. I've been meaning to try out other things on the menu now and then but the Pad See-Ew and Crispy Egg Noodles are so damn irresistible!

I definitely recommend this King of Thai Noodle House to anyone and everyone!
author: Lauren L.

description:
Pros:
This place is legit. This is the first Thai restaurant that I ate at since I've been to SF. You really can't go wrong with Thai food because the flavors are pretty consistent. The pad see ew and the fried chicken over fried rice are my go to dishes here. 

Cons:
The service is inconsistent. Sometimes I get good service and other days I don't. Also, they have seats in the very back right next to bathrooms. I sat there once and it was not a good experience. 

This place gets 4 stars mainly because it popped my cherry for Thai food in SF and because food is above average.
author: Sotheara Y.

description: The First Time I Came Here To Eat, I was concern because I've never eaten Thai food, my friends brought me here after we all go out of work, and I tried their fried chicken over rice, and their Thai iced tea, and It was delicious! I'm very picky and concern on things I haven't tried yet, But hand down! Best Thai food yet! And I keep coming back and brought my family! Great place, and food!  And great location too! I can get some shopping done too!
author: Zoila P.

description: Had the fried chicken fried rice and it was good not great. Food came out very fast. Wife got the panang curry and it was some of the best flavored I've ever tried. We showed up about 5:45pm on a Monday night and were seated Immediately. Within 20 mins this place was a packed house. Prepare for lots of people talking around you. I would come back.
author: Nate D.

description: One of the best eats in San Francisco. Great flavor, great prices. If you like Asian Cuisine, especially Thai, look no further. Trust me you won't regret it.
author: Chris C.

description: I can honestly say that King of Thai Noodle House has the some of the best pad Thai and pad see-Ew noodles I've tried in a long time. They are quite a busy place as well, I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who's looking for some good Thai food in Union Square in San Francisco!
author: Aastha S.

description: One of those places people pass by because it is small but have to say one of the best Thai places. I went hungry and left full. I had drunken noodles and their sausage appetizer which was great. The service was good and the attend to you. Try it out.
author: T M.

description:
There is something strange about this place that keeps me coming back. My friend and I come here on a regular basis and pretty much only get two dishes - their Fried Chicken over Fried Rice, and a curry, either red or green. Fried Chicken over Fried Rice sounds kinda boring, bland, nothing to call home about, right? Nope. Nope. Nope. I can't get enough of this stuff. When it comes to Thai food I usually prefer a saucy dish or noodle dish, but the fried rice is packed with flavor (as far as rice goes), still light, and goes great with the chicken, which is also simple but for what ever reason is wonderful. Their curries are also spectacular. 
Service is friendly and fast. Not the prettiest of places, but hey, its more about the food anyway. I've never gone in and not seen a good number of people inside, which makes me happy for them. 
I only knock down a star because its not SUPER restaurant quality, so that fifth star I reserve for those kinds of joints that really do "as good as it gets" but if any place had to be close, it would be King of Thai.
author: Laurel R.

description: Food tastes really good after a long wait! ;). To be fair it was nice to have some really good and authentic Thai food in San Fran. Ordered the fried chicken over fried rice and stir fried noodles. Both turned out to be quite good. Portions are nice and hefty so makes for a good filling meal. Will try again sometime.
author: Suyash S.

description: After a night of disappointment from our hotel restaurant we came across this spot via Yelp. We ordered delivery and was told it will take about an hour to get our food. In about 45 minutes a young gentleman knocked on our hotel room with a smile and handed us our food. We ordered the pad thai, fried chicken on fried rice and won ton soup. The won ton soup brought back memories to say the least. The soup met my tongue with a sweet garlic and hint of cilantro with fresh bbq char siu sliced pork was the best I have ever had of all the Thai places I have visited. I recommend this restaurant and especially the won ton soup.
author: Mony D.

description:
Great place for lunch! Affordable, fast in service, good food and portions are great! I usually come for lunch time and take togo so I can't speak of the service if you dine in however the girls who take my togo orders are always pleasant and realize the sense of urgency.

I've had their pad thai--great flavor, fish cake-- comes with 4 and isn't small and comes with a great cucumber salad! 

Will definitely be coming back for more; great location too, there are always people waiting in line to dine in.
author: Cb M.

description: Comment from my partner, "this is the best pad see ew that I ever ate. I don't care about [lists other Thai places we have eaten at] THIS IS PERFECT."
author: Joshua C.

description: I have to say I'm a big fan of Thai food and the kingdom of thi has it is very very good food this service is a super quick. I think. It's the quickest service I had in San Francisco and very highly recommend you to eat there definitely five
author: Aviva L.

description: Who knew that by ordering pad thai with shrimp, you would only receive two pieces of shrimp? That was my first and perhaps last experience at this establishment. I'll save my pad thai fixes for other places that will divvy up the appropriate level of protein.
author: Lisa G.

description:
seriously, F*CK this place. waited 45 minutes and watched as other people who came after me finish their food and leave. and my food still isn't out. and a good hour later it comes and to my merry f*cking surprise, they got my order wrong. so I cancelled and left, I wasn't going to wait another hour to eat. So I went down the block to Bangkok Noodle House instead, way better service and the waitresses aren't all complete idiots. 

I used to frequent this place a lot but I will NEVER be back and I suggest you guys don't either unless you have an hour to spare to eat food you DID NOT want.

Pathetic.
author: Lily K.

description:
FOOD:
wonton bbq pork noodle soup = mm..

SERVICE:
Good.

ATMOSPHERE:
Casual kinda like a chain feel, makes use of purple
author: Angela L.

description: This place was very crowded on a Saturday afternoon. The waiter was nice but got two of our orders incorrect. My sister and I split the panang curry and larb salad. I'm not sure what they put on the salad but it made it taste like oyster sauce or something.  We asked them to take it back and got a pad thai instead. Thankfully they didn't charge us for both. Not the best pad thai I've ever had but ask for extra peanut sauce because it's delicious!
author: Miriam M.

description: If you're craving Thai food after a night out, King of Thai is the place to go. It's always a hit or miss with this location, since some of the waitresses are semi air heads. Overall, I like coming here when it's not busy.
author: Sara L.

description:
Since I only come here for lunch/dinner from work, I've only ordered to-go. Their take out service is pretty quick considering that it's pretty packed every time I go there. Usually takes 10-12min for the take out orders to come out. 

I've had their crab fried rice and pad thai, it's pretty decent. I LOVE their thai iced tea!
author: Eden W.

description:
best tasting thai. much better than much pricier thai places i've tried.  quality ingredients, complex flavors (not the Americanized syrupy overly sweet sauce that places like Basil Thai use to mask the ingredients' own flavors)

amazing place.
author: Sandy J.

description: I took the combination beef noodle. The soup was very tasty, and the noodle was really good.
author: Hao Y.

description:
This is my favorite Thai in the downtown/Union Square area...needless to say, I like it.  No frills, but the food is fast and the place seems clean.  Kao Gra Prow ground chicken version is my fave and although I want to explore their other offerings, is the only thing I ever order here since I like it so much.

Crowded at lunch and peak meal times...try to hit it off peak for maximum enjoyment.
author: Roy N.

description:
I'm a Thai food snob to begin with but this place good, not great. Had the Pineapple fried rice, chicken satay and Pad See Ew (being the best dish).

Staff was friendly. Place was busy. Good lunch spot.

Overall: C+
author: Bobby B.

description: I don't usually give bad reviews but the food is pretty poor and the place is filthy.
author: John M.

description:
After having a couple of drinks over at Jasper's corner tap and kitchen for the Yelp event, my friends and I were ready to eat.  Someone recommended King of Thai Noodle House and we all walked over.  Our table of 8 was quickly seated and given menus/water.  My friend and I ordered/shared:

Pineapple fried rice: Only a few pieces of pineapple, but still very tasty overall.  I was craving some fried rice and this hit the spot.  Full of flavor and there were about 4 shrimp in the dish.
Pad Kee Mao noodles: These noodles were pretty decent.  The dish had a little bit of spice to it and had a lot of meat (you get to pick what type of meat is in the dish- we chose pork).  

At about $9/plate, the price is pretty fair, especially for its location downtown. The portions are generous (we didn't finish our meals) and the food comes out pretty quickly.  Some dishes came to the table before others, but that's fine, I guess.  It's a very casual restaurant and the waitresses are friendly/helpful.  They consistently refilled our waters.  

Notes:
-The restaurant is two stories. I had no idea!  The restaurant is actually a lot larger than I imagined it to be, from the outside.
-The bathroom was very clean (for some reason, this kind of surprised me).
author: Samantha L.

description:
Best Pad Thai I had in the city!  This hole-in-the-wall place offers very tasty and cheap Thai food.  You can get much better pad thai for half the price of Osha. 

Also try the beef noodle soups!
author: Rosa L.

description:
I LOVE Thai Food and I love ordering Thai food from King of Thai Noodle House.  

If I were rating this place solely on their customer service and how amazing the food tastes, I would have given this place 5 stars - no doubt!

But the past couple times I have ordered from here, I've been a little disappointed at the portion of food given to me for the price that I pay for (LOL and I know I sound like a total fat ass, but let's be real here).  

Maybe it's because I am ordering to-go?  But I don't think whether or not I am eating in or dining out should determine the portion size.  If I am paying $8.75 for a salad with cabbage, green beans and tomatoes - I'm going to hope that my to go box is filled!  The to-go box is a 4x6 box at 2 1/2 inches high.  And my salad just reaches the half mark of the box! You do the math.....

The food is GREAT - don't get me wrong!  But I would be a lot more happier if I were to get my moneys worth :)
author: Natasha R.

description:
I've never been here before but I have heard of King of Thai, so I had no idea what to expect. 

I'm also not a professor in Thai cuisine therefore I just went with I guess..the typical dish to order? Pad Thai. Haha! 

Honestly it was just okay. All the ingredients were in it though I only got 2 pieces of shrimp. :[ Lame! 

My roommate got #1 which she said was okay too while my boyfriend got the duck fried rice. The flavor of the rice was alright..it just needed more seasoning but the duck meat was visible! 

The service there is okay as well. They greet you, seat you, take your order, bring your check and that's about it. But they are super fast!
author: Joy L.

description: Solid place for some noodle soups. It made my dad happy, so it gets 5 stars for me. Place can get kinda packed so be sure that you're comfortable eating shoulder to shoulder, which can get daunting when using chopsticks and soup spoons.
author: Johnny C.

description:
Tasty thai in the middle of Powell Street shopping. Looks sketch, kinda looks too local. But those are the best. Fresh food, and tastyyyy that even the locals go here. ME BEING A LOCAL. 

Tom Kha
Basil Thai Fried Rice
Pineapple Fried Rice
ALL THE NOODLE DISHES
author: Monalisa M.

description:
Stopped here while Xmas shopping in the city. It looked busy when we first walked by it. We returned two hours later and it was still busy. 
We were seated right away. Had the chicken noodle soup. I ordered the thinner noodles and was given the thicker ones. No problem though because it was deliscious. 
Only wish there was one of these closer to home.
author: Gator R.

description:
Extremely tasty noodle soup base.  Don't get the bland chicken satay... wasn't grilled long enough.
One of the bargains in the union square area.
author: Ken Y.

description:
I came here for lunch yesterday, and I was a bit disappointed. 

We orderd the following:

1. tom kha ga - this is the tom yum soup with coconut milk. I asked them to make it mild, but I guess because of that it made the soup bland and it just tasted like hot coconut milk. We got the soup with egg noodles which would be a good idea if the soup tasted better. Overall the soup was too rich and too filling. 

2. pineapple fried rice - overall it was too greasy and super bland. This fried rice had no flavor whatsoever. Even the flavorful ingredients like the shrimp or pineapples wasn't enough to add to the flavor. The only thing you can taste is the grease from all the oil that they used. 

I would say skip this location. The one in the sunset is better.
author: Ayaka S.

description:
Met a friend up for dinner here last week. Pad thai was decent and I really like the fried chicken over fried rice. Not a fan of the spring rolls which were tiny and unflavorful. 

It gets super busy and they rush you out so eat fast! haha
author: Amy S.

description:
It's all about...the Thai Boat Noodles here.  Hands down the best set of Thai Boat Noodles in town (and they have multiple locations...all pretty consistently good).

The Pad Kee Mao here is also good, along with any of their other spicy stir fries.

Food comes out quick, hot, and tasty.  They really know how to get you seated fast, and eat well on a nice budget.

Best of all, the Julian St. location opens until way late, and you can always get your grub on late at night.
author: Mark M.

description:
This King of Thai location SUCKS, compared to other locations. (Best location is still North Beach given the happy hour deals!) The quality of the food here is horrible. Maybe cause it was a busy day... but that should never be an excuse for a restaurant! 

Ordered two take outs:
1) Pad See Ew
This was SUPER oily. Looking at the bottom of my take out box, I saw my noodles swimming in a big layer of oil. DISGUSTING!! I didn't even want to eat the noodles after looking at it (and I'm definitely not the most health conscious person...) Also, it lacked in flavor and all the noodles were just stuck together. 

2) Pad Kee Mao
Ok, this was basically the Pad See Ew's ugly twin sister, EVEN WORSE. Not only was it oily, but every bite had a burnt aftertaste to it. Absolutely flavorless - where's the spiciness and the fresh basil?? 

Will NOT return to this King of Thai location...............
author: Michelle L.

description:
Since I really don't know San Francisco that well, I'm going to assume that this is the location that's right next to Macy's. That being said, this place has some of the best Thai food that I have ever had the blessing to inhale.

I love their chicken fried rice (I honestly don't remember the actual name of the order, but I think it's menu item #23 or #27) and I order it almost every time I go. Their pad thai and pad see ew (please pardon my mangling of the spelling) is also absolutely amazing. Not to mention their Thai iced tea. Mmmmm, that's to die for.

They seat you quick, get your food to you quick so you are out the door quick to return to the hustle and bustle of downtown San Francisco.

They used to be cash only, but I see on Yelp here that apparently they take credit cards now, too? To play it safe, I would bring cash with me anyway to avoid any mishap. There is an ATM right by their front door, but the ATM fees make it not worth using.
author: Anna W.

description: I got the panang duck and my husband got the pad **** lord. They were both awesome! I don't understand the low ratings because the food was really good and the prices were pretty cheap. You can't expect better decor or ambience at this price point. The service was fast and efficient.
author: C C.

description:
Smallish, crowded, lots of servers moving around making it seem even more crowded, but boy, they are efficient. Food came out fairly quickly (but not microwave quick!), with lots of smiles, and at a nice temperature.
Presentation was very nice. Duck was pretty good, I'd order again - nice meat, no fatty bits, but thats all it is, duck on rice.
Pumpkin curry - winner of the evening...we all wanted to slurp the sauce at the end!
Papaya salad - I usually love this, but in this case, not so much, wouldn't order again but maybe it's just not the style I like.
Fried chicken - I don't know why we ordered this in a thai place...tasted fine, but dry and would not order again. We also had something with brocolli that was really good.
And all cheap.
Four stars for a quicky thai type of meal.
author: Sophie B.

description: Very average. I got chicken pad Thai and it didn't set itself apart from anything I've ever had. Not terrible, but not great. Portion was massive. My uncle got the red curry and it was really good. I wish I would have gotten one of the curry options and maybe my experience would have been better. The service was average. The best part was my shangri beer and the chai tea dessert.
author: Erin W.

description:
What can I say that hasn't been said 500+ times before?

I came here with 3 friends after some drinks in DTSF. This is a popular place for years, and I have been to the location in Alameda. They have a couple of other locations in the City, too. 

My #1 Beef Soup ($6.75) with small rice noodles was good, sweet and beefy flavored. You can pick between 4 different noodle types. This is similar to Viet Pho, but sweeter in taste and browner in broth. 

One friend had Chicken Curry, another had the Beef Pad See Yeu (Thai spell check please!) which is almost exactly like Chinese Beef Chow Fun. 

This is a quick meal place, with about 10 tables for 4 or 6, a wall counter, and an upstairs overflow area. There is an open cooking kitchen in the right rear, in front of the back room for washing and storage. The chairs are simple silver aluminum IKEA types, the decorations, sparse at best. 

What I like best about this place is the sweet staff of workers, who while working their butts off, smile gently to you with every passing if you just say Thank You in Thai the first time you interact.
author: Wanugee N.

description:
For the price of only $10 is all you need for a very good BIG bowl of very good Pho noodle soup. Good selection of different kinds of meats. Their beef is very soft as well.  

If you're hungry and need something to keep you warm - bring $10 and you'll fulfill yourself with the best soup Union Square has to offer. 

The service is fast. Open ti'll 4am.
author: K C.

description: Small restaurant on O'Farrell St. Down the street from Macys. Ordered two entrees, #22 Grapo Beef and #16 Guay Tiaw Lord. Both were fairly salty with soy sauce gravy. Usually very crowded but we got here before noon lunch crowd.
author: Clifford W.

description: The worst Thai food ever. I understand that it's in a tourist area but oh come on!!! Really? I ordered roast duck noodle soup and fried chicken over fried rice. Very disappointed.
author: Jade J.

description:
Pros:
1) cheap Thai food
2) cheap dining option in downtown SF
3) large seating area, they have an upstairs too

Cons:
1) slightly dingy
2) no parking

I really do like the spicy duck curry.  That's what I always order.  But you get what you pay for, and the restaurant itself is not that appealing.  I will mention that the night I went was New Years Eve, and at 9pm, the ONE bathroom they have had puke filled in the sink.  Nobody cleaned it...
author: Suzi F.

description: Too salty, not delicious at all. Venue doesn't look like very clean. I think the supermarket noodle like trader joes taste better than this
author: Cecilia Chen Z.

description:
I don't know what happened to the cooks but when I recently came here to eat I was highly disappointed. I ordered some noodles and it looked like they just covered the noodles with heavy salty and sweet sauce. The real disappointment was when I tried the shrimp. It looks like its cooked, but it tasted like it was raw and nearly spoiled! (by the way the menu said it was supposed to be dried shrimp, no wonder!)
Fish cakes were so so.. and eggrolls were ok. They were just overpriced for such small portions. 

I suggest you go to The King of Thai on Clement! Their pineapple fried rice is the best! (but always a little too oily). Taraval's is fine too.
author: Carmen L.

description:
Wandering down the street after hanging out with friends late at night when hunger struck.  One of the few places that were still open was the King of Thai Noodle House.  The smells pulled me in to the shop for quick take out order.

The pad thai was well made.  The noodles were tender and the sauce was rich with some depth.  The shrimp and vegetables were well cooked and not over done.

Overall the dish was well made and reasonably priced.  The main draw was the late hours and the quick service.
author: Jason N.

description:
Love it!!!!! Quick, Convenient and Consistent :) Have been there twice....love the food, quick service and they are open late and they accept credit cards so no worries about not having cash after you have been bar hopping :)

Definitely give this place a try!
author: Shilpa S.

description:
This is a review for 3 months ago when my cousin (a SF native) took me here along with some other family.  We were showing the family a good time in SF and decided to come here.  It's within walking distance from Union Square and I was immediately stunned by the large amount of seating and number of customers they had.  Definitely better than what I had been expecting given its name and that it is frequented by college students.  This is not an authentic thai restaurant and the decor was sort of something utilitarian, kind of to feed the masses.

Food: Ordered the pad thai which was decent.  My gf had the battered and friend chicken which was a little dry.  Overall the food was good but not great.  Their thai milk tea was really good.  

Cost: Cheap if I recall.

Overall: Food was okay, pricing was good.  Overall it was a decent value.  Good for a quick bite to satisfy your rice/thai food craving.  There's gotta be better options out there but try this place if you got the stomach and time.
author: Jeff N.

description:
Never had a bad food experience here... I typically order the beef noodle with flat noodle or their pad thai.  Great flavors for a great price.

Since it's in Union Square, it can get really crowded during peak times.  It's worth the wait, which isn't too long.  It's a "hole in the wall" feel and you won't get 5 star service.  Just remember, you are coming for great Thai Food.
author: Panda G.

description: I have always been a fan of King of Thai. This location in particular has always had lightning fast service (not sure if that is necessarily an entirely good thing) but the food has always been delicious, so no complaints here on the food. On my most recent visit, I came in to eat by myself. The hostess/waitress asked me "You're eating by yourself?" What happened to the good old fashioned polite way of asking, like "Table for 1?"  During that same visit, I was interrupted mid-bite by a homeless guy asking me if I had any food. Awkwardly, I looked down at my plate with my mouth still half-open and then back up at him, "No." Not more than 15 minutes later did he return to steal some lady's leftovers (after she had finished and left of course), plate and all. Kind of sad.
author: Riza E.

description: Food was very good, and very close to what we had in Thailand. Service was excellent and staff was friendly. My only negative comment was that the spring rolls/egg rolls were oily. The beef noodle soup was delicious.
author: Vince T.

description: First and last time I will ever be here. Hostess AND waitress just yelled at a woman with Down Syndrome who was trying to pay her bill and was super rude to the disabled woman's friend too. What absolutely terrible service!!
author: Lindsey A.

description: Great food and fast service (running/flying waiters!), but expect a very long wait!
author: Kim K.

description:
King of Thai noodle, I love the food, love their hours, and love how there's almost one everywhere in SF.

This is one of those places where I come and get the same thing every time ever since I was a kid.

Pad Thai of course, Tom Yum soup with shrimp, Fish cake appetizer. and if i'm not full, then a pad see yew (spell check).

This particular branch is right by union square. The hostess is always friendly and practically gives everyone a hug when they walk in. They have quick take out orders if you're staying at a hotel nearby. Be sure to call in, they can take a while sometime if it gets busy.

This is definitely my night owl/drunk go-to restaurant of choice. I don't think any thai place in the city gets as authentic cooking yet casual cafe style as this!
author: Trevor L.

description: Solid pad thai. Chicken pumpkin curry and roast duck friend rice are really good too. Service is fast and prices are cheap (most dishes less than $10). There's upstairs seating as well, so don't be deterred if it looks busy looking from the entrance..
author: Will Z.

description:
The place proved to be a great stop on the way home from a CAL game a couple of weeks ago. A group of friends and I had made our way back to the city on Bart, and after getting off at Powel, were searching for food because we were STARVING. And then we found King of Thai Noodle House. 

The service was good, as I would expect it to be at 11pm when we were one of only a few tables seated. The place was large, but I wouldn't exactly say clean or too appealing... but not bad for cheap Thai.

The food was great. I got my normal Thai dish...Pad Khee Mao. My only complaint is that they were out of the large egg noodles, which is my favorite part of the dish. But they gave me a choice of substitutions and I chose the smaller egg noodles, and the dish was still delicious.

The place served up good food, prices were good, and service and cleanliness were all good (or at least sufficient). I'd definitely go back.
author: Krista S.

description: This place stays open pretty late, the waitress are ok, miss the previous managers (dede & Sonia) me and my friends use to come here alot and they recognize us immediately and know what to order as soon as we come in. Food is great and tasty.
author: Wendy Z.

description:
King of Thai is not the best Thai food that I've had but it's not the worst either. It's a good place to grab a quick meal either for lunch, before a movie, etc. However, it wouldn't be my first choice for any meal. The prices are cheap though and it's nice that the place is open late.

I've had a couple of items off the menu and they are all decent. My favorite is the pad gra praw (choice of meat stir-fried with basil). They make it with ground meat which I prefer and the sauce is well-rounded in flavors. Definitely a gem on the menu.
author: Brittany L.

description: My wife and I stopped here for a late dinner because it got good reviews and it was close to our hotel. My first impression was that it was a cramped, dingy hole in the wall. They had very little decor and zero ambiance. We were taken to a table way in the back by the stairs and service station. At the table next to us was a young, female employee cutting peppers. It really bothered me that she was doing food prep in the dining area. We shared the Pad See Ew, which was mediocre. This restaurant could use a good cleaning and some ambiance, a few potted plants and some wall art go a long way.
author: Trent P.

description:
Four years in this city, and I only made it to a King of Thai for the first time last week. This really is kind of outrageous for anyone that a) lives in downtown San Francisco and b) loves Thai food. 

I ordered my favourite, Pad See Ew, and my friend had some... urm... I'm not sure what, some strange named item that's supposed to be super hot (but wasn't that bad this time around). Our food came out at different times, something I really dislike, but it was pretty quick all around.

I've had good and bad Pad See Ew, and this one definitely ranks up there as one of the better ones. Tasty, flavourful, and definitely more than I can eat in one meal, this was well-worth going to for lunch!

I'd be more than happy to go here again and try the Pad Thai or any of the other veggie-friendly dishes.
author: Cassandra J.

description:
My friends and I had lunch here today, and the general consensus of the place was YUM. If you're looking for a FAST and CHEAP eat, this is the place to go. It's a couple of blocks (near H&M) from the general Union Square area, so finding this little spot was easy.

For three people, the total came out to be about $25. I had the chicken fried rice (kao pad), while my friends had pad thai and the vegetarian fried rice. Our order came out quickly and steaming hot.

My dish was just what I needed after skipping breakfast that morning. The rice was fluffy and flavorful, with a good amount of chicken in each bite. The portion sizes was just about enough for one person to finish. The pad thai was delish too, I'll definitely order that the next time I go!

One of the few faults I have with this place is that it is CASH ONLY! I mean, come on... you're in SF! in Union Square! People are shoppin' and swiping that plastic like there's no tomorrow! The service was kind of non-existent, but our food arrived fast, so it wasn't much of a big deal to us. Although our food came to us quickly, we received our dishes separately (within a 3-4 minute interval, I would say).

Other than that, I would definitely come back again. Good food at a good price for us poor college students. :)
author: Theresa T.

description: It was crowded when we went for dinner. Had to wait for about 20-25 mins. Ordered chicken & pork fried rice and Penang curry. It was awesome and definitely worth the wait. Also, one of the cheaper restaurants in union square. Will definitely go there if I ever visit Union square again..
author: Pritam M.

description: Don't know what the big deal is with Thai food.  We had the seafood crispy noodle, the beef with soft noodles and gravy and Thai fried rice.  There was a sparse amount of seafood and the noodles were soggy., a Cantonese version is way better IMO.    Same with the beef noodle dish, as beef chow gun is a superior offering.   A good wok fried Cantonese style fried rice would have been more satisfying as the Thai version didn't have much meat to it.  Maybe the pad thai would have been different.  This was in the heart of SF, and was crowded on a Sat night, but totally not worth it.
author: Helen W.

description: Tasty late night Thai food. Had the pad Thai and it was good. Decent size portions and not too crowded either. Can be depending ok the time of day though. It's a quick fix if your craving Thai and pretty authentic as wells. Go get some!
author: Darryl S.

description:
Ate here after I ran the Nike Women's Marathon -- I wasn't really hungry at the finisher's village, but on the shuttle going back to Union Square I suddenly began to feel ravenous!  We were in this area with a friend the day before and he pointed out King of Thai and suggested we eat there if we got a chance.  It was about 2:30 or 3 pm and I was pretty surprised at how packed it was for a non-popular meal time.  Every single table was seemingly taken on the ground floor and as they asked "are you okay with sitting upstairs", I was thinking with my legs tired from running 26.2 miles that it wasn't going to be in the cards for us to eat here...and then a table miraculously opened up right in front of us!  Hooray.  

The service was really slow.  It took about 5 minutes just to get a menu and another 10 to place our order.  Fortunately, the food came out super fast.  We had egg rolls, lard nar (noodles with gravy) and good old fried rice.  The egg rolls were standard...nothing to brag about but nothing to complain about either.  The lard nar was delicious...loved the savory gravy sauce...yum!  The fried rice though was a big rip off at I think $11 for a mediocre and small plate of chicken fried rice.  Believe me though, I still ate it all up like a rabid dog! :)
author: Susan W.

description: They forgot our order and ignored out table for 20 minutes. As soon as we got up to leave, they decided to come to our table.
author: Isaias A.

description: Good tasting ordered Pad Thai and papaya salad. Taste above average. Serving size pretty good size. Noodles are little over cooked. Worse part ordered extra meat to only find about 2-3 pieces of beef. Service above average.
author: Jovencio B.

description:
I love King of Thai.  

I usually get my food to-go but when I do dine in, it doesn't take too long to be seated or get out.

Whether it's before a concert or to cushion my belly before a drunk night out in the city, this place never disappoints me.  

Chicken fried rice with extra spicy chili sauce to smother all over.. is my favorite.

Pad-see-ew was the first Thai dish I've ever had and however "fast-food-y" this place is, I still love their version.

Their curry is good but def can get better Thai curry elsewhere... I usually stick to my usual...  ~

Quick, friendly, and convenient.  Portions are the ISH, ya'll.  You won't be disappointed.  I'll see you tomorrow night.
author: Kat C.

description: I came here last Sunday with my little family after a day of shopping in Union Square. I'm not a big fan of Thai food but however my husband insist I give it a try and so I did. I was surprised that I actually liked the food. I'm not a big fan of pad thai but it was pretty tastey. And their noodle soups were tastey as well. I've recommened this place to a few friends and they loved it.
author: Tiffanie E.

description: Why is it when I come here, even with family who ARE thai, I get the shittiest service ever. Okay food. Terrible waiters and service.
author: Khanitha N.

description: Food so so, but not so clean and cockroach found on table this time. Not a happy experience. Sad.
author: Eric Y.

description:
Typical noodle house along the lines of a common Vietnamese noodle house.  It is a good place to brunch before or after church on a Sunday, without spending too much.  A large bowl of noodle soup averages about $7.50.  Grilled meat entrees, with rice, averaged about $1 or $2 additional.  

Service was average.  As you may have read about a language barrier in other posts, that is true, try ordering by the number assigned,  next to the entree of your choice, in the menu.  In this way, chances are reduced that you will get frustrated with your server and your server will not have thoughts of you being yet another Western idiot butchering the pronunciation of a Thai dish.

This place works if your looking for the get in, get out meal to proceed with the rest of your day.  Dining area is not kid friendly, as it is a slightly cramped space.
author: Craig J.

description: This is the best Thai I've had!!! Went on my anniversary to San Fran for a week and this was the first restaurant we stopped at. And I'm so so happy we did. I loved it so much!! The Thai iced tea is soooo good. I had the duck broth soup with egg noodles and I can not say enough how much I enjoyed that plate. My husband had pad see ew beef and he also fell in love with the food too. We have been to so many highly rated and popular  restaurants but this has to be one of our favorites. We ended up going a day later because it was just too good to not go once more. Not only was the food on point but the service was so good there. Everyone is polite and very sweet ,the vibe was nice  there. Can't say enough how great this place is. Plan to eat there again soon.
author: M M.

description: Easily one of the best places to get Pad Thai or Pad see ew. I love how it's easy to get seated and the waitresses are very nice. The fact that it's easy to order by phone while at work during lunch is such a big plus. Their duck fried rice is great with their fish cakes. Usually this is one of the many spots I take a friend or family from out of town to try. There are tons of Thai restaurants but I really love this one for their Pad Se Ew. Some will complain about their dishes but I love them. They're fast and they never disappointed me up to now.
author: Markus V.

description: I'm Thai and can say that this is authentic Thai noodle. It's as good as you can have in Thailand (with better beef!). If you want Thai authentic noodle, please try king of noodle house!!
author: Mantana L.

description:
This is a great place for quick lunch!

-Roast duck noodle -  there were plenty of duck meat, with veggie and fried garlic;  The only thing is it was a bit on the salty side
author: Coco L.

description:
If you are in a hurry and don't want fast food, come here! 

King of Thai Noodle House is affordable for the jobless, gives huge portions for the hungry, and is quick for those in a rush.  The menu is quite possibly the most extensive I have ever seen for a Thai restaurant.  It includes noodles, soup, fried rice, and curries.  

For those Pad Thai lovers out there, this place uses a very thin noodle, so if you like the thicker noodles, you may not be pleased with the pad thai.  Also, the noodles, being so thin, kind of clump together making it more difficult to separate mouthfuls.    

But what really grabs me is the fast service.  I have been there twice now and both times, I have gotten my food within 5 minutes of ordering.  it is the quickest turn around ever!  And the food comes out piping hot, so you know the food is fresh.  

Oh and the reason for the missing fifth star - it's cash only.
author: Kristen D.

description: I'm upping my rating to 4 stars based on my second experience at the restaurant. This time, I had noodles (pad see ew with shrimp) and they were really very good. Also, the service was better (no forgotten orders), but still not exactly friendly. (Upstairs is still a windowless cave, though.)
author: David K.

description: I have gotten the crab fried rice here and loved it. Recently visited another Thai establishment and ordered the same dish... The King is king. The rice is not over seasoned so it is still white... Tasty and I will come back.
author: Tri N.

description:
Delicious food! Pad see ew + papaya salad + duck fried rice yumm!!

I never really noticed this place until one night after shopping at Macy's, we got hungry and decided to yelp for restaurants nearby. Every review on yelp was spot on. I definitely want to go back soon.
author: Nancy C.

description:
Last Friday around lunchtime, I went to here with my mommy. From across the street, we saw that this place was super crowded. We were on our quest on looking for Bangkok but we forgot which street it was on so we settled here. 

As I said from across the street, we saw that it was super packed. I was like OMG this will be quite a wait but since we couldn't find any other eateries that was to our interest so we went ahead and crossed the street. To our amazement, we were seated within 3 minutes. They not only have the front for seating but the back and upstairs. 

At first, my mom and I only ordered main entrees, Pad Thai for me and Thai Style Fried Rice with Seafood for mommy. But since we sat in the back, we saw they were brewing pretty dark Thai Tea. So my mom was like you should order a Thai Tea too! Best idea ever! I think I would rate them for all 3 stars just for their Thai Tea. It's really good and for the price of only $2.50, it's pretty good quality. Reminded me of Thai Tea when I went to Thailand 

Food: The Pad Thai and Fried Rice was not the very best. I had better. However, this is coming from someone who had amazing Thai food from Thailand and eat Thai food pretty often, Berkeley student status. The Fried Rice was really soggy. The Pad Thai was a bit saucy in my opinion. I like my Pad Thai dry and it was far from dry. The fish cake that came with Fried Rice was really good though. The fish cake was amazing :) I might come back just to try more of the fish cake. 

Service: Purely amazing. My mom was astonished by the fluency of everyone in Thai. She kept commenting on their cultural roots. The service really made up for the food. They were fast and efficient. 

Price: In my opinion, I think the price is pretty average since it's slightly pricey compared to Berkeley Thai food places. However, since it was located in Union Square, the price is average. Since I paid for lunch, it would have made me happier if the prices were a bit lower. I think 9 bucks for a dish of Pad Thai was a bit pricey :(
author: Diana D.

description:
I went here after the Soundgarden show a few weeks back. I had been to several other King of Thai locations, but this was my first KoT trip in several years. The staff greeted us warmly  and gave us excellent, unrushed service despite our late arrival (I think around ten minutes before their closing time). 

My friend and I got Pad Kee Mao with ground beef. The meat was really spicy and flavorful, while the bell peppers tasted fresh and were well cooked. We also got fried chicken over fried rice, and it was amazing. I know it's probably not what my doctor would recommend, but it was perfectly cooked, with a crispy light batter that wasn't too heavy at all. The only reason I give this place only four stars rather than five is the cold, unappealing dining room and the simplicity of the dishes. All things considered though, I will definitely be coming back.
author: Peter F.

description: Come here allot with my friends. Great pave top get some tasty thai food at an affordable price. Service is great and fast!! I love to bring my friends that are new to trying thai food since its a good starting place to try it out.
author: Cecily H.

description: i don't know about the food or hygiene. but, the service is BAD and the OWNER does NOT have a good manner. You can know what the RUDE is as you come here.  I came earlier than other guys, but the owner has no idea about who came earlier and she is totally NOT interested in it. I waited for more than 40 minutes and she never say sorry or like that. It was one of the most terrible experiences in San francisco.
author: Seungju L.

description:
Hands down, My FAVORITE Thai Joint to eat yettt...

I've tried countless Thai restaraunts in my area and most of them have just been mediocre : the dishes were either overpriced, and overloaded with salt and msg.

After a long day of shopping in DT SF with one of my girlfriends, she recommended to eat at this place. You know a food joint is a good place to eat, when the tables are packed and booming!

She ordered the Pork Larb, with a side of rice and I ordered the Pad Kee Mao : flat noodle combonation . and thai iced teas of course :)   YUMM

Goodness, the hostess, and servers were attentive and gracious and the food came out QUICK. The Larb Pork with the crisp lettuce was an explosion of flavor! and extra spicyyy  . The flat white noodles on the other hand were full of savory goodness and sauce, I had to drown in in chilli paste of course :)

It was defnitely authentic to my opinion, and the pricing was reasonble... but the sf health care tax was odd?!  

a Come back is a must.... just thinking about the entrees and thai iced tea...has got me drooling

( oh how i love the city! )
author: Kimly N.

description: Came here around quarter to eight on a Sunday, place was super busy. Thankfully we were able to get a table and place our orders quickly. Their pad Thai is awesome!! Would go back
author: Katherine D.

description: I thought the sliced beef soup would be more like Pho pictured next to it. But was pretty good anyway. Probably wouldn't be my first choice again.
author: Zoe M.

description: Food was good, but our server had an attitude problem. She mistook our order and tried to blame our pronunciation in Thai of the name of the dish even though I said the number also when I ordered.
author: Tomoco I.

description: Thanks for the little 3 pieces of shrimp on my pad thai that you charge extra for! Not the best pad thai.
author: Desirea O.

description: It's been years since I've been here but from what I can remember, it was alright. The place is tiny and veryyy crowded so it was hard to find a place to sit. But I think I had the pad thai and the pad-see-ew or a similar dish. For a fast food type place, it was good. Nothing special, but not bad either. I would eat here again if I passed it.
author: Kristine L.

description:
If I was hungrier, I might have given it more stars.
Service was no good, the upstairs stench decreased my appetite. 
Dang, I wish I wrote down what I ordered cause I'm not good with recognizing thai (and I think I ordered by number), but here are the entrees that I for sure had:

Pad Ma Kuer (eggplant dish): very oily, which is what's expected when you have eggplants involved, but to the point where it wasn't that appetizing.

Pad Thai: pretty much a staple in a thai restaurant, and if you wanna be safe, you know you can't go wrong with pad thai... but this one just had way too much bean sprouts and not enough noodles.

Kao Pad Sapparos (pineapple fried rice): below adequate, I've had better.

Guray Tiew Ruer Ruam (Pho): not much pho, pretty basic stuff.

I don't know what the rave is about this place.
There are better places back in San Mateo where you don't have to pay so much for parking, have better service, and more delicious thai food.
author: Adorable T.

description:
The BF and I were hunting around for a decently-rated Thai spot around Union Square. This one was the only one without a wait. I think hands-down this place rates as one of the worst Thai places I have been to. The satay was flavorless and had the taste and texture of rubber, but I think the biggest atrocity were the curries (Penang and Green). Both had a stale taste, sort of like if you attempted to make a quick Thai curry at home and forgot to properly mix in the curry paste (and did I forget, you also threw in a disgusting amount of it?). I couldn't even taste the coconut milk over all of that. The chicken thrown into the curry was rubbery, once again, and the veggies practically raw. At one point, I just gave up and started mixing together steamed rice and satay sauce and asked for the check.

Pro's? Let me get back to you on that one.
author: Rahul P.

description:
King of thai, always some cheap and effective pad thai. Always fairly fast and fairly consistent, can't ask for much more!

Plus the thai ice tea is yum yum yum!

My friends and I come to this chian constantly no matter where we are, sunset or chinatown or downtown!
author: Wilson T.

description:
For guys who like decent Thai women, this is the place. 
Food is mediocre but reasonable in price. Service can vary.
author: Anni Y.

description:
I came here about a year ago for lunch with my aunt & uncle while we were shopping our butts off in Union Square. My uncle suggested this place and I do not regret eating here.

We orded:
-some kind of salad (papaya salad w/ shrimp??)
-Pad Thai
and one other dish.

Service : good
Food : great
Location : just right
Clean? It's a SF typical restraunt, what do you expect?
Suggest? YES.

Overall, it was REALLY good. I'd come back anytime, if only I didn't live so far. But i'd stop by whenever i'm in the area. :)
author: Jenny Y.

description:
This place is pretty neat. The bar is colorful and they are open late. They have great Happy Hour drinks and food is $5.00 for most dishes. The servers are attentive.

Food is decent for the price. I ordered a Beef Salad (something that most all Thai Restaurants usually have) that wasn't on the menu and it was pricier, and it didn't taste like most beef salads that I've eaten in orange county. For some reason, up north, they like to put ground roasted rice on it and I'm not a fan. I am use to cucumbers and tomatoes and actual spicy lime dressing in my beef salad but they make it different. The Pad Kee Mao was delicious, especially since I was hungry and their sticky rice with mango was perfect! wish they would have given me more of the sweet rice though!

Overall, cheap eats with good happy hour.
author: Linda N.

description:
Honestly, the best place to eat when you're in the city when you're on shopping off of Market Street and around Union Square. 

They have so many employees, it makes your order come way faster. I love this Thai restaurant. Hands down.
author: Desiree L.

description:
Really solid Thai food.

Overall I've been disappointed with the Thai food I've found in San Francisco, but King of Thai restores my passion for my never-ending search for the perfect yellow curry.

I'll most definitely be back to sample some more items from the massive menu. For the price the quality really can't be beat.
author: Mark F.

description:
I used to like this place a lot but my experience yesterday made me think of NEVER come back to this location of KoT.  My girlfriends and I were there before the lunch rush.  We sat nearby the door and the server gave us the menus right away.  We ordered the food and started to chat.

Food came and we started to dig them.  Papaya salad was good (no peanuts on top?  Maybe because of allergy thing).  Cashew chicken - meh!  Pad see ew - used to be very good, this time around it was waaaaayyy too sweet.  Spicy eggplants - not spicy at all and was still kind of hard.  While we were still eating, our server came by to ask how the food was and if he could clear up some plates.  We were like...food is ok and we were still eating them.  

Less than 5 mins later, another server came by and wanted to take our food away.  Helllloooo..we're still working on it!!  The thing of it is they seemed to rush us out but they didn't even have any customers waiting for a table!!  Third server came and again, almost took our food away.  He picked up a dish plate while we said we were still working on it.  OMG!!!!  You don't understand what "we're still woking on it" means????   Fourth one came by and asked again...everything happened in about 15 mins or so.  One of my friends got so irritated and said, "We'll let you know when we're finished!"  Again, no customers were waiting for a table.  Then a server lady started to pat my shoulder saying that she just wanted to make sure everything is ok.  Lady, first of all I don't know you so get your hands off me!!! Second of all, you guys were so annoying and you made us can't really enjoy the food that already are lacking in taste!!  Geeeez KoT, I am sorry but I think I will NEVER come back to this location!!!
author: taryn h.

description:
Not long ago my hubby and I had a hankering for some Thai food. A friend recommended this place and we were nearby, so we thought we would give it a try. 

We ordered the pineapple curry with shrimp, and a vegetarian pad-Thai, and split both. The curry had a great flavor, and we really liked it. The pad-Thai was boring and kind of bland. 

Also on the recommendation of our friend, we both ordered the Thai iced tea, and we were fans. It was very good, and caffeinated like whoa!

The service was okay -- not overly friendly or attentive, but adequate. 

One thing I didn't like was that they sat us at a four-top, and then sat another couple next to us at the same table. We felt like we were on a date with them. It was hard to have a conversation. I guess I need my space, and wasn't expecting that. 

I read on my happy hour app that they have a good happy hour -- good deals on pitchers, and food specials. That might be worth checking out sometime. 

The Verdict: If I do go back I will stick to curries and Thai tea, and ask for a two-top!
author: Cara S.

description:
Awesome! A friend and I were wandering around craving some kind of Asian noodles for lunch during a conference at Moscone, and the line outside Bangkok Noodles was ridic so we checked out this place... so great! The line was out the door here too but we ended up being seated super quickly. Food also came more quickly and was cheaper than expected (and was also delicious). I don't even remember what kind of noodles I got (probably pad thai because I'm boring and lame...) but we also saw a bunch of people with some kind of huge bowls of soup that looked really delicious.

Also, like the huge awkward slob that I am, I chopsticked my iced coffee right off the table, but the staff was amazing and cleaned it right up and brought me a new one and tried to make me not feel embarrassed (good luck). Definitely recommended for a quick lunch when you're in the area.
author: Rachel P.

description:
Good for a late night fix. Food is just okay. Service was good. Ambiance left a lot to be desired. 

Sticky rice and mango was good. The chicken noodle soup had almost no flavor other than the week old pieces of rubbery chicken on top and I would give it 1.5-2 stars. The papaya salad was okay but did not have a fresh or distinct flavor and was pretty salty. 

The table and condiments were clean which is a major plus for late night Thai noodle joints. Menu had a pretty big selection. There were several full tables and we were seated right away, serviced frequently and well. All in all I would go back if there wasn't much else open and at those hours in that area there really aren't a lot of other options.
author: Jamil S.

description: Service could be better with all the people in the restaurant. Delicious, affordable food. I've only tried the Pad Thai and Pad See Eew so far, but those rocked my socks. I nicked some fried rice from my pa. Love, love, love the thai ice tea. So far, I'm liking King of Thai Noodle House. Will be coming back again for more.
author: Vicky P.

description:
The broth and food were a little too oily for my taste. The pho itself is nothing memorable.

The only good thing is the location since it's a block from Union Square - the place does get pretty crowded throughout the day. If you don't want to feel rushed or want a quiet place to enjoy your meal, you might want to head somewhere else.
author: Emily S.

description:
The food here is pretty good, but nothing special for Thai.  I got the Pad Thai (which is a good was too gauge Thai restaurants) and this one came in a HUGE plate, with plenty of food, but nothing to really excite me.  Plus,. as a special, they're giving one free glass of ice-tea, ice-coffee or one other thing when you order an entree. 

I would probably have given it 4 stars if the service was better.  Yes, we waited a long a long time before ordering because we were waiting for a friend, but that doesn't excuse the way we were treated.  I accidentally spilled my drink on the table, no big deal.  So I picked up my plate and moved it over to the empty table next to us, so that I could wipe up.  A waitress came over so I assumed she would bring me napkins or help me clean up.  Nope, she just told me to move my plate because they needed the table next to us (which they still didn't use until 10 minutes later).  It was obvious that I had ice and ice-tea all over my table, and was using up a bunch of napkins to soak it up, but I was completely ignored.  So yeah, not the best service.
author: Denis S.

description: Kick ass noodles. Very good pricing as well. The thai iced coffee was the best I've ever hard.
author: Ikka S.

description:
Bad News: They stopped the free Thai Tea.... :(

Relatively cheap, great service, delicious, and fast.

I have been going here since I first moved to San Francisco five years ago. The service is always prompt and friendly. The only downside is CASH ONLY.

My favorites:
1. Duck Fried Rice - lots of great pieces of meaty duck. 
2. Crab Fried Rice - real crab
3. Rad Nar (if you are Indonesian, this is just like Kwetiaw Siram)
4. Pineapple Fried Rice - very fragrant and tasty

This is probably the best looking KOT in SF. Also, they have upstairs sitting that's totally hidden. Pretty cool.
author: July N.

description:
I've been here twice and i think the food is just average, nothing much to say about it. The prices are cheap, so that's the up side. 

I came here with my friends because we feel that we were sick of the food court at westfield. I don't remember what I ordered the first time I came here, but the second time, I ordered the Pad See Ew and it was just average. It was a little too salty, so I had to keep drinking water after every few bites. I think it was mostly the water that filled up my stomach, because I was hungry again not too long after. .__.

I would say this place isn't bad for when I'm craving a fast cheap thai meal.
author: Harriet W.

description:
After fasting for over 12 hours (doctors orders), I was prepared to eat almost anything.  Luckily, I found this place!  First off, I have had a love affair with Thai food for quite a while, so chances are this place was going to please.  On the other side of that coin though is deep and bitter disappointment when I find a bad Thai place. Anyway...

We walked into a semi-busy and noisy dinning area.  We were told to pick a seat and were followed by the hostess who delivered our menus.  Water was delivered to the table promptly and I headed to the restroom.

The restroom was in very respectable condition for being so close to Union Square.  

When I got back my order had been places for me.  After a few minutes we received cucumber salads.  The salads have a spicy sweet sauce with onions, carrots and ground peanuts.  It was delicious and a very nice little cool salad on a warm day.

Next we split a large bowl of noodles with beef.  It was huge, filling and yummy.  The price was right, and the service was fast.

Due to the noise level and the quick pace of the place, I'm not sure it's great for kids.  There was a group that had kids at their table and it seemed to be a big pain in the butt for them.

I will definitely stop in at this place again.
author: Nick M.

description:
King of Thai, for me, equates to the words: "late night."

When you're out in SF, and you're craving some Pad See Ewe at midnight, King of Thai is just THAT place in the city where you can go & get some deliciously oily and tasty food... Plus, they have cheap Thai iced tea. I mean, c'mon.

Overall, I probably wouldn't come into King of Thai at any other hour except very late at night. It's a cool place with 3-3.5 star food.

Pad See Ewe - good. The noodles are a little overcooked but the flavors are good and the portion is good enough for two people.

Pad Thai - yummy, HUGE portions, comes with shrimp.

Pad Kee Mao - eh, just okay. A lot of oil and too many weird veggies for my taste.

Duck Fried rice - You probably shouldn't get this unless you're willing to eat giant chunks of duck fat/duck skin and not that much meat or flavor. The rice is kind of bland and the egg didn't add anything good to the dish.

STICK with the pad see ewe and the pad thai. Grab a thai iced tea, take it to-go to save you some $$ with tip, and eat it in the comfort of your hotel room, apartment, etc.

$10 CC minimum.
author: Trang B.

description:
Take every Thai restaurant you've ever eaten at and average them and you get this place. It's the single most mediocre restaurant you can eat at, not necessarily in a bad way. It is exactly what you expect. 

In a convenient location when you're shopping or whatever in union square. It's really fast. But not like I would go out of my way to eat here or bring someone here.
author: Jay Y.

description:
Yeah, I'm gonna have to update my review for this place. Unfortunately eating in is quite different than ordering take out at this restaurant. First of all the waitresses rush the hell out of you from the minute you walk through the door. They ask you if you're ready and come back a minute later. They don't come around again after the food is on your table either. 

I don't know about you but when I eat at a restaurant, I'd like to feel welcomed and wanted. I definitely didn't feel that here. Aside from the service (which knocked down a star for me) I'd still give this place three stars for the following:

1) The Pad Thai. It's so good!
2) The food came out right away. We ordered and within minutes, it was on our table.
3) The prices. It's quite affordable. 

There you have it. Next time I'll request my order TO-GO.
author: AnnaMarie S.

description:
Came here on a Saturday for a light bite and boy was it light. I always get number 8. Duck noodle soup with vermicelli .

The soup doesn't have much flavor as 8 th and Clement. And the portion is very small.

I ended up eating at another restaurant  right after i left. Lol I hungry

The service is cool they have alot of people working and food comes quick.

I prob won't come here again I'll stick to the original king of Thai on 8 and clement .
author: DOM d.

description: Awesome cuisine and reasonable prices - made me feel like I'm in Bangkok again! Fast service and a lot of customers.
author: Maciej M.

description:
3.5 stars, but since I can't give a 1/2 star, I know they don't deserve 4 stars. Call me a hard rater if you want to but that's how it goes.

I ordered the roasted duck fried rice. It was decent, but nothing special. My coworker ordered crab friend rice, but same thing. Decent, but nothing special.

The purple walls are memorable though. I would go back again for lunch, but I wouldn't make a special trip here though. Cool place for convenience and that's about it.
author: Kess C.

description:
Alright where or how should I start from here?..... I'll probably start by telling how I got into coming/liking this place and why. Haha...

Anyways, I think like around 3 years ago, during my summertime. I was meeting up a friend for lunch, so we end up deciding of wanting to come here(not sure how but oh well). Tho I was hoping to get a meal that is similar to the Pho combination, which I usually order; when I go Viet restaurants. 

As where I was saying, there was a meal similar to it that my friend show it or point it to me and I decided to order it. When I ordered it, the noodles, ingredients, soup, and the smell was so damn good and nice. Taste just like Pho regardless of the soup and smell is different. Like I said, the food was great, but my lack of sleep made my diet felt not digesting well. Not saying the food made me sick, NO not at all. I loved the meal!:) so yeah when I'm in my own time again, I usually go here for same dish. Besides the dish, I like the atmosphere too and the environment, which means the brightness inside. 

And since I love coming here, I end up bringing my friend as well. I am hoping to come again as well when I have money again and maybe try order different things to try. All the meals in menu does look good and I sometimes had trouble to try order different ones. Yeah maybe when i do have money again, I will surely try other meals besides same as always. ^^
This is the best Thai place ever!!!!!

Btw, they do serve you right away, without a wait. If your already to ready order, xp.
author: Lorrine L.

description:
3.5 star for food and 4 star for service. 

I normally don't expect much service in Asian restaurants with medium price range, but this shop surprised me with charming service, quiet, but always smiley, quick and attentative.  4 star it is. 

We weren't too hungry, so we ordered pad thai and hoi choy, a deep fried appertizer.  The taste was OK for the hoi choy, crispy tofu skin and meaty inside.  The pad thai, on the other hand, had a different sauce than most other Thai places.  The sauce was rich and abundant, very heavy on fish sauce flavor, and maybe MSG as I chugged down a glass of water afterwards.  The portion however, was not that big compared to other places for the price of $8+.  Hence 3.5 star.  

Total damange for 2 items, $19 bucks before tips.  Dining in SF now has higher cost, besides the 8.25% sales tax, there's also a 3% healthline tax.  Arh....
author: LeeLee C.

description:
The service is quick and the people are friendly.  The food is pretty good!  
Just make sure you don't get seated in the back next to the bathroom and you should be fine.
author: Honest F.

description:
Fast. Cheap. Good. 

I ordered the yellow curry (my thai weakness) with tofu and my husband had the BBQ pork fried rice.  We also ordered egg rolls and the chicken satay.  While everything was good tasting, I have to say that I wanted a little but more zip to the curry.  

Next time, I'll likely order a noodle dish--saw many people in the restaurant getting into their noodles and they looked amazing. 

It was busy on a Sunday night and we were seated & served promptly.  The space appeared clean for the most part but a bit cramped.   Overall, great bang for your buck.
author: Betsy F.

description:
I come here once or twice a year - one of those days being every Black Friday with my family.

The food is always delicious, the prices are always reasonable and the service is pretty good.

It gets very crowded on Black Frida (duh!) but we've never had to wait TOO long because everyone's scrambling to get back to shopping.  

The only warning I have is this - the green papaya salad has little pieces of green bean, and pieces of out-of-this-world-it-literally-hurts-I'm-truly-crying-my-ears-are-ringing-someone-kill-me-now spicy whole green chilis.  They look exactly the same.  So do be careful.
author: Ann L.

description: Great for a quick, easy, and yummy dinner. Pad Kee Mow was superb. Lots of single seating!
author: Kelli H.

description:
I really did enjoy coming here. I was recommended by someone from work. Also I get a discount :)
I had the Pad Kee Mao. It's really good for its price and for the location. I heard there's a second floor?
I will definitely come back during my lunch.
author: Nadav M.

description:
Delicious. Authentic. Affordable. 

I recently traveled to SF and was staying near Union Square. This place was nearby and in the heart of San Francisco. 

You can tell the food is authentic when they serve duck noodle soup. I ordered it and it was YUM! Very plump and juicy pieces of duck....mmmMMM!

There were a lot of servers and I never had to ask to refill my water because they do it automatically. Friendly waitresses. 

Overall, I'd recommend this place to others. Thumbs up!
author: Joanne T.

description:
Mm mmm good...

So far I've tried the crab cakes, shrimp pad thai, beef pad kee mao, beef and tripe soup with rice noodles, and curry soup (I think that's what it's called). So far my favorites are everything I've tried, minus the beef and tripe soup :) I think I expected it to taste like Pho but it was nowhere near that!

The restaurant is super small. I was surprised that there were two levels. The biggest turn off was that there are table right next too the bathroom. Maybe they're trying to accommodate more customers, but that is foul!!!!

On the upside, I love the location and pricing.  It's across the street from H&M. If you plan on doing a lot of city shopping, this place is definitely easy on the pockets.

I plan on returning, but staying away from the bathroom area!
author: Alicia A.

description:
The red curry was good, very spicy. The pad Thai and soups were mediocre. There's better Thai, though you get your bang for your buck here. The service, however, was pretty bad. Our waitress messed up our orders and had to take our food back several times. Even then when she brought it back it wasn't right, but we didn't say anything because we were starving.

Check it out but don't expect something spectacular .
author: Marquis M.

description: I ordered beef noodle soup, while I really do not know how much sugar was added. It tastes so wired, a sweet and greasy noodle soup? I won't come back.
author: Iris L.

description: This is a fairly good Thai restaurant and since I live in the neighborhood I go here occasionally.  The service has always been good and quick if you are in a hurry.  Prices are very reasonable for this area of town.
author: Robert G.

description: This place rocks!!!! It is my favorite thai food in all of SF. They are of course super super busy every day. You will have to wait to be seated (unless you get it to go) and have to wait even longer if you are coming with anyone. Even then you will have to sit in close quarters to the people next to you.
