However it is worth it the food is that good. I enjoy many dishes crab fried rice, pad ke mow, pad thai, and many many more! The thai iced tea and thai iced coffee are great as well. The services has gotten better over the years. This could also be because they recognize me and my wife after coming here for so long. I used to work near by so i used to come here a lot. I still have to go eat here any chance i get. I also like that despite how busy they are and how much of a success they are they still have the feeling of a mom and pop store. I have no idea if it is a chain or not i have never asked quite frankly.
author: Sarmad N.

description: Really great stuff here. I was walking by and needed a quick bite. Was seated right away and ordered the duck soon after. It came fast and was not oily or overcooked. Very good. Very positive visit.
author: Carter M.

description:
Pineapple fried rice: A bit too much yellow curry. Sometimes very oily. Flavor is still great. Pineapples are juicy and sweet,

Deep fried bananas with mango ice cream is an AWESOME dessert!!!
author: Anthony N.

description: I went here with my friends on 11-1-14 8:00pm'sh.  I ordered the pad thai and thai ice tea.  Food is good, decent service.  There was a small glass container of chopped peanuts that I used for my dish.
author: Jer W.

description: Giving this place 3 stars as they didn't have the Roast Duck soup available. I ordered the beef Pad Gra Praw. I was served pretty quickly and the dish arrived piping hot. The dish was slightly sweet which I had not expected but the bell peppers lent a wonderful flavour to the dish. The beef was a little chewey so I think I will order it with chicken next time. Definitely a place to come back - esp. since I want a taste if that Roast Duck soup.
author: Manasi G.

description: Ordered a beef combo noodle and watercress ... But didn't come with beef balls or watercress... Lady rushed to take my order .... Soup was salty.... Would try again
author: Ian K.

description: This thai restaurant is a "must go". Big portion and good food. Serving is very fast. Perhaps a bit crowded an with small tables but this doesn't make the food any worse
author: Marco P.

description: I'm from Cleveland but I was out in San Francisco on business. I had just finished my week and I was exhausted and had caught a cold. The weather was a bit chilly as well so all I wanted was soup. This place caught my eye and it couldn't have been a better choice. It was a little busy and louder than I had wanted but these people know what they were doing with their food and service. I ordered the duck stew noodle bowl and a thai iced tea. It came out super quick and the piping hot soup was like manna from heaven. It came with a huge leg of duck, crispy on the outside tender and juicy on the inside....perfection. I literally find myself moaning out loud due to the deliciousness. Reasonably priced, delicious food. Next time I'm in San Fran I'm totally stopping there again. Completely recommend it.
author: Ann A.

description: I've been to 3 different King of Thai's in the city and I've grown very fond of this location.  The food itself might not be as great as North Beach's location, but it's spacious so you can always get a seat easily.  And really, I can't tell a difference between food quality.  I'd much rather get a seat faster with pretty much same quality food than wait forever at North Beach's location.
author: Jane N.

description:
Warm garbage with peanut sauce. 

Sorry folks, I know some of you like it, and gave it 5 stars.. which is exactly why I came here a second time (after having a terrible first meal) but the second meal was even more disappointing.

The service was very bad. But the food... ai ya ya ya... It just didn't taste good. And I'm not even taking ambiance into consideration. Greasy and not very tasty. Maybe I should give it a third try, I'm not sure how it has 3.5 stars.
author: Anish B.

description:
I don't know if I was just really hungry ... or if the food was just really delicious ... But, I'm going with delicious!

I adore Thai food and honestly have never had a bad Thai meal (knock on pad see ew), but the pumpkin curry I had here was truly one of the best I've had. I couldn't get enough of that coconut-milky-curry sauce! I will surely return for more. Maybe tonight!
author: Rosie M.

description: The food was good, but the service was meh at best. There was no organization at the hostess station and they were seating people out of order. Then they sent us upstairs where there were no available tables so we had to go back down and wait again. They did give us a discount for the inconvenience, but considering the variety of thai in the area I probably won't be going back.
author: Samantha G.

description:
I used to go to King of Thai all the time in high school and order the famously good #31. Things have changed a bit and I guess not all King of Thais are created equal. I'm used to the food at the one on Taravel and for the most part, everything is the same. The fried chicken over fried rice is now #30. One thing that is different is the amount of batter they use to fry  the chicken and also the amount of chicken they give you. You are basically eating a tiny amount of chicken with a ton of fried batter with your rice. They also skimped out on the amount of sweet and sour sauce that they give you. I'm also taking away a star because there was a hair in my water.

This location is right next to Macy's downtown so it's pretty busy and packed all the time. Luckily, they have an upstairs portion that I was unaware of. Next time I will probably stick to Taravel, but if I just so happen to be downtown and I'm craving Thai, I would give this place another shot.
author: Bailey Z.

description:
This place is amazing. 

I do not hold myself to be an expert on Thai food so if you're looking for an evaluation on authenticity, it will not come from me. This is the second time in 2 years that I have been to this Noodle House and have yet to be disappointed with their food. Located right in the middle of the super crowded and bustling Union Square, you would think this place would have tourist prices with tourist-level food quality - NOT the case. Fantastic food, efficient and friendly service and a great atmosphere. 

They have plenty of room to sit (upstairs and downstairs) and even when full, the wait did not seem long - the staff are very efficient in getting people in and out of the restaurant. 

Each dish my guests or I have ordered has been delicious, fresh and all around good. Prices are reasonable and the location can't be beat. 

Lots of noise and people - if you are looking for a quiet place to dine this is not your restaurant!

Overall: A+
author: Mallory P.

description:
Cheap, decent Thai food. I had the Duck Curry. It was alright... nothing spectacular. 

KOTNH -- not in my favorite location, but its affordable for what you'll get in a touristy part of town. If you're craving thai, you probably wont be disappointed. dont expect much out of wait staff or anything else. 

Place is big but kinda a dump.
author: Sofia R.

description: Decent wide variety of asian food on the late night.  For dinner or lunch I would probably go to one of the many other better asian spots in the area.
author: Chris M.

description: Food here is terrible compared to the King of Thai noodles on Clement street (which changed it's name to king's Thai cuisine recently). I only had one bite of my dish and decided to leave for somewhere else.
author: Xing D.

description: always packed in here.  I personally like the duck dishes.  customer service was alright.
author: Dash F.

description:
My first time here tonight, ordered the #17 pad kee mao (SPICY & delicious!)with chicken. Waitress was very nice, friendly. Our food was ready in less than 5 minutes! I wasn't timing them, so I'm not sure exactly, but it may have been closer to 3 minutes. The portion seemed small when it was served, but by the end of the meal i found i couldn't finish it all. The chicken was ground, there were plenty little bits of meat stuck to the noodles.  Also tried the thai iced tea, tasty. My friend ordered Pineapple fried rice (nice sized portion) & spring rolls (6.95!!! for 3 small rolls)but the spicy sweet & sour was YUM!
minus a star for the price of the spring rolls, & the purple walls.
author: J M.

description: We sat between dividers which made the experience claustrophobic. Food good but whoever designed this restaurant needs to learn about Feng Shui. Hope they are around long.
author: Annelene C.

description: Awesome late night spot. The tom kha gai soup was really tasty! Service was friendly and quick.
author: Ashly S.

description: Really? The food is amazing but I had a horrible experience here. I payed my bills by credit card. And someone who works there apparently stole my credit card info and attempted to make big purchase online.  Well, king of thai noodle you might want to pay your employee better to keep them doing stuff like this. He/she even used my card to pay for netflix.(Really bro?)  I'm so pissed off right now. I will not eat here ever again.
author: Danielle C.

description:
Great food, inexpensive and they have soccer on the screens most of the time. 

SCORE!
author: Jose A.

description:
I'm not a huge fan of Thai food. In fact, when a group of us get together ever so rarely the answer to the question, "what should we eat?" will always be "not Thai." But alas, you've finally got me to take the bait King of Thai. A co-worker had a horrible hankering for it and since I was the reason for his missed breakfast, I offered to grab whatever his heart desired. His heart desired Thai food of all things because apparently he was a mind reader and could see my brain waves read, "anything but Thai, anything but Thai, anything but Thai..."

Ah well, it was my fault and I'm the kind of girl to go back on her word so I ran to KOT with absolutely no expectations of anything remotely decent. Other Thai restaurants in the city had ruined Thai for me for months so it wasn't really their fault. I understood they had a large clientele base and there was always a line out the door and around the corner for some reason so I'll admit I was a teeny tiny bit biased.

After studying the menu for a minute and narrowing down the soups, I decided on the wonton soup (to be on the safe side) and Pad Thai for the co-worker. Apparently, college age boys have a four compartmental stomach much like cows and each stomach must be filled with Kraft Jet Puff, granola bars, Gatorade, and Pad Thai or something in peanut form. Must be something about reverting to childhood favorites that keep them going. 

I walked inside and was semi-greeted by the girl at the take-out counter. I say semi-greeted because I wasn't sure if she was saying "hi, how can I help you?" or "how many today?" or "welcome to Yu's dry cleaning" because of her thick accent. I'm horrible with understanding anything that's not spoken in perfect English nowadays (which is ironic indeed) so conversing in any metropolitan city has become the obstacle for me as of late. Anyhow, I pushed on and ordered the entrees, paid, and stood there. And stood...and stood some more. The shame about this place is that they don't have a take-out waiting area to make way for more tables to sit down at. Imagine if it was raining??

Apparently, the take-out girl had the same problem understanding me and I had understanding her because lo and behold, only the soup came out. The only reason for me walking in a Thai place and there was no Pad Thai in my bag. That could have been my fault of course-maybe I didn't speak clearly enough? Maybe I should have counted my change to verify I was charged an amount that seemed reasonable for 2 entrees? In any case, she apologized politely, assured me it would be out quickly since it was only noodles and offered me a seat at the bar single seating area. 

At this point, it was me who was starving. Against etiquette and better judgement, my stomach won out and I dug into the wontons. One by one, I plopped a delectable dumpling in the hot chicken broth, mixed in half a container's worth of hot sauce and found a much better way to pass the time. The broth was hot, full of herbs and tasted like a healthy alternative to chicken noodle soup and the dumplings were my very own two bite interludes.  A server randomly passed by and dropped off a glass of water as I waited which I thought was a lovely touch. And about a 1/4 of the way down the soup container, a pad thai was delivered and I was on my way again. 

I felt guilty it took over 30 minutes to just get noodles out of there but they did make up for it the second time with their quick service and graciousness. It's still not going to make me crave Thai food anytime soon but I won't be kicking and screaming next time someone suggests it.
author: Jessica K.

description:
King of Thai is known for being fast...not this time!

Trying to grab a quick bite to eat before the Yelp Elite party at the Supperclub, Row M. and I head over to King of Thai Noodle House on O'Farrell.  I haven't been to one of these in awhile, so I'm a bit apprehensive.

With a party of two, we are seated at one of those tables just for two.  I ordered the #17 Pad Kee Mao (Stir fried flat rice noodle and your choice of ground meat with green bean, bell pepper, Thai chili and basil) with beef at $6.75.  Row M. ordered #18 Pad Thai (Stir fried small rice noodle, shrimps, dry shrimps, egg, ground peanut, tofu, raw bean sprouts with red paprika and lime juice) at $6.95.  We also requested two plates to share.

As we waited for our order, I watched as our neighboring table got their order of Pad Kee Mao.  (Hmmm, didn't they order after us?)  And then when an order of Pad Thai was headed our way, we thought it was for sure going to us.  Nope, it went next door.  

Row M.: It doesn't usually take this long...
Me: I think that table got our order...

Finally, my order of Pad Kee Mao arrives.  We wait for the Pad Thai...and see it coming our way...only for the waitress to stop at the next table.  She proceeds to look over at the table, realizes they have their order already, and then walks over to us.  She places the Pad Thai down and I have to remind her about the two plates.

Me: Yeah, they got our order.

The Pad Kee Mao was oh-so tasty.  I haven't had it in awhile and it was yummy and full of flavor.  I'm not big on bell peppers, but I was eating these up!  The green beans could have been cooked a little longer as they were overly crunchy.  I would still order this again.  The Pad Thai was decent, standard Pad Thai if anything.  It only came with three pieces of shrimp though.

Overall, the two orders were tasty and we had leftovers to boot!  I love the ground peanuts and green chilies that are left at your table.  I wish the wait staff came around to fill our water glasses though.  I had to get up and help myself to the pitcher of water myself.  (Wait, are we supposed to do that here?)  King of Thai works when you want of taste of Thai without the tablecloth napkins and higher prices.

Side note: On their front door, they have a sign saying they'll refund your money if you are unhappy with your order.  I wonder what happened for them to post this signage up.  Hmmm, I wonder how many people ask for their money back.
author: Teri C.

description:
Decent Thai food. I usually order the noodle dishes. I wouldn't say it's the best thai food I've had, but when you want something different from the fast foods near by, this place is the place to be. 

I usually order the pad see ew which sometimes can be on the sweeter side. And the guay tew lord which is pretty good. Could use more noodles as there is a lot of sauce and not enough noodles to coat the sauce with. 

The servers are always super nice and attentive. 

And I think this is the only place I have been to in SF that charges a health fee. When I asked what the health fee was for, they informed me cheesecake factory also charges it.... Not a very clear answer but I guess?
author: Annie W.

description:
Oh the weather outside is frightful,
But some soup is so delightful!
And since we've no other good place to go,
King of Thai! King of Thai! King of Thai!

It doesn't show signs of slurping,
But I've brought my stomach for popping.
The carbs are turned way down low,
King of Thai! King of Thai! King of Thai!

When we finally kiss goodbye
How you'll hate going out in the cold!
But if you'll try the beef combination noodle soup,
All the way home you'll be warm

The summer is slowly dying
And, my dear, we're still good-bying
But as long as you love soup so
King of Thai! King of Thai! King of Thai!
author: Andrew C.

description:
While on vacation in San Francisco a friend of mine recommended this place he has lived here for about five years so I trust him. After reading other reviews on here, looking at the menu and being hungry at 11:30 at night my boyfriend and I decided to try it. 

I had the roasted duck noodle soup with small noodles and he had the pineapple fried rice. Honestly I could not decide which I liked better they were both amazing. The server was super sweet and to top it off it was one of the cheapest meals we had in the city and by far one of the best. The next time we vacation here I will be looking forward to coming here again!
author: Anthony H.

description:
Authentic Thai cuisine that's delicious and inexpensive.  

It was Sunday around 11pm and I was craving soup, particularly spicy noodles like Pho.  I remembered eating at King of Thai Noodle House once for lunch and knew they were open pretty late.  It wasn't Pho but better!  King of Thai Noodle House hit the spot once again.

Here are a few dishes I've tried:

Tom Yum = 4 stars
Panang Curry w/Beef = 5 stars
Thai Style Fried Rice w/Beef = 4 stars
Combination Beef Noodle Soup = 5 stars
Pad Ma Kua w/Beef and Chicken = 5 stars

* Cash Only
* Conveniently located in the middle of SF's premium shopping district. The Ellis-O'Farrell Garage is across the street
* Small restaurant but the wait is never too long & always worth your time
* Hefty portions
author: Nikki C.

description:
Ordered the seafood noodle soup in clear broth. My bf ordered the ground beef with basil. His dish turned out quite tasty. Mine however was a complete whiff.
The imitation crab was sour and tasted past its expiration date. The broth had  a strong MSG flavor.  

Pros: food came out ASAP. a little surprisingly quick.  Service was prompt and friendly. Location can't be beat.

Cons: food was mediocre. Don't order the seafood soup.
author: GS M.

description:
I love this place! 

Pumpkin Curry and Chicken Pad See Ew with extra Chinese broccoli are my favorite dishes! 

The only reasons this place doesn't get 5 stars is they don't always have the best service. It has improved a LOT in the last couple of years... But it's still not very good.
author: Lauren V.

description: Went shopping and asked where to get a good asian soup, got 2 people to say this plavc and off I went.  Bang on, really fast service, inexpensive, large portion and really flavourful broths, with lots of fixins that are fresh and satisfying.  I got the raw sliced beef and paid a wopping 8 bucks, It's big a winner in my book, and from the sheer volume of turnover service I saw, it's no great secret. Enjoy!
author: Valerie G.

description:
This place deserves five stars for its service alone; the staff is what makes this place run, and you can't help but have a great experience here, or leave without a smile on your face :) 

The only thing I think could be improved on is the variety of mixed vegetables in the noodle dishes. I'm really glad they even have vegetarian options though!

The Thai tea is delicious and a must-have!
author: Julia H.

description: All right yelp peeps. This is the first chat room I've joined except a Honda forum to try and fix my motorcycle for cheap, which worked. These things must work. All though I think the best places to eat and party are where you stumble....This place is somewhere you should try and sit down.  It's not hot shot, it's not glamerous, but it's in union square and it's bomb food for great prices.  After years of occasional visits this place has remained consistently great. Meals under $10 and generous portions. The crew is nice and it's convenient to eat solo for a quick lunch or sit down with a date fora quality bite.  Do it!  Btw, the only reason it only gets 4 stars is because I don't know if I've ever experienced a 5
author: Spencer K.

description:
3.5 stars, but I'll round up to 4. Extra props for being inexpensive!

TIP: Don't worry if the downstairs area is full and you're banished to the upstairs area--they have a separate waitstaff up there so you won't be forgotten. 

TIP #2: They do extra spicy, just be sure to mention it! 

Pretty standard Thai fare in a semi-hidden location. I didn't know about this restaurant until a friend recommended it, and I had been shopping in that area for years! 

All the flavors are spot on. I ordered the papaya salad with extra spiciness, and they definitely delivered. The waitress actually seemed delighted that I wanted extra heat! My friend ordered a noodle dish and the plate was plentiful with hot, yummy noodles. We also ordered a hot and sour soup with mushrooms and chicken to share. The chicken was a bit tough. You know the kitchen is doing something right when you order three separate dishes and all three have very unique flavors. My tastebuds were so happy. 

Come here for a quick, inexpensive bite. Look for this place next time you're shopping! Most dishes were $7-$10 and definitely large enough to share if you're not too hungry.
author: A.L. H.

description:
Another regular spot for us!

We found this by accident one night - we were all dressed up, walking around Union Square trying to figure out where to eat.  We stumbled into this place - way over dressed, but very happy that we did!  We sat at the counter because it was so busy on this Saturday night.  We went back this past weekend and were again very pleased with the food. The price is right, too.  Three of us ate there this weekend for under $40, and it was more than worth it.  The food is very fresh and tasty.... not greasy at all either.
author: Debora G.

description:
BIG FAN FOR KING OF THAI!  

After having a couple of drinks on a Tuesday night, of course the late night ritual is to have something to grub.  And being in the city, as I mentioned in my Old Siam post, we crave Thai food.  Lucky for us, King of Thai is down the street from Nikko Hotel where we were staying.  We ordered our usual, #22 ground pork with friend egg.  DELICIOUS! 

Always a fan for King of Thai for the late night grub! And I've had most of their food, Rad na, Pad thai, chicken and basil, crispy chicken over rice, curries, thai iced tea, and desserts, mango w/sticky rice.
author: Antoinette T.

description: This is the kind of place that everything you order is amazing and everything on the neighboring table makes you want to come back and order it. Food is fresh and flavorful. Must come back.
author: Judi B.

description: Fried duck friend rice was pretty decent, except I had exactly 3 small pieces of the duck in my plate. Other locations of this chain are more generous.
author: Alex C.

description:
Being located near Union Square, how is this place able to charge $6-$7 for a big bowl of noodle soup? 

This place is always crowded and sometimes has a line outside. They have the best bowls of noodle soup in the area. They have at least 10 different bowls of soup and you can customize it by choosing between 4 types of noodles: small rice noodles, thick rice noodles, egg noodles, or clear noodles. 

I've never tried anything other than their noodle soup here but they also have traditional Thai dishes as well.
author: Angelica P.

description: The service was good. We had two noodle dishes. The pad thai with shrimp only came with three shrimp. The thing flat noodle dish with ground chicken was pretty good. If I return, I'm going to try a soup dish.
author: Jeffrey v.

description:
Oh, King of Thai. Always packed, but fast service. Take out is super fast as well. I either get Pad Thai with tofu or Pad See Ew with beef. Both are delicious.

Service is hectic because its always full, but they're efficient enough.

The last time I was there, I got Pad Thai to go. The girl asked my name and how to spell it. She put H-E-A-T-A-G-R omg it was so funny and cute and annoying.

Love it.
author: Heather M.

description:
I really do love noodle soup!  Soup more than the noodles.  But remember CASH ONLY!

I used to go to the location in Richmond all the time after a late night, but I came here after work yesterday for dinner with the girlz.  They were very very quick and nice.  Since we got there at 5:30 pm, it wasn't too busy which I like.  This is a great place to grab a if you're craving Thai food!
author: Elena N.

description:
Heading to the Curran theatre....I was so afraid to eat at any of the tourist death traps!

I took a gamble and enjoyed King of thai so much, that I might make this a spot to revisit when near union square! 

I ordered the Guay Tiaw Lord with an iced tea. It was savory noodles with seafood and a refreshing iced tea for about $12! My order came out in a jiffy making it possible to eat, and head to the show with 15 minutes to spare.
author: Hilda Z.

description: Ordered Pad Kee Mao to go.  The disparity of the portion between take out and eating in was very obvious!  Can we have some consistency???!
author: Jake G.

description:
Decent and casual Thai food, pretty big portions for a good price.  Came here on a late night after watching "The Help" ( great movie btw) the service was fast and friendly and food came out pretty fast too.

I thought the pad see ew we got was a little too salty for my taste, but it definitely hit the spot.  Lots of chicken, always a plus :)
author: Grace L.

description:
Beef soup noodle is amazing. It is a must have in the store.
Stir fried wide noodles with sea food is great!
Papaya Salad is very tasty too!

The portion is pretty big, and the price is very reasonable. So it is a great place to go just for good quick food! Love this place!

Service is usually very great and super efficient! So I love this place a lot!!
author: Angel W.

description:
A very successful chain of thai food in SF. The location is huge and seats many people so rarely do you have to wait more than 10-15min for a spot. 

The tom yum was good, but could use a bit more spicyness. The duck noodle soup is one of my personal favorites but it varies in quality a bit too. Sometimes the duck is too chewy. Otherwise, their pad thai and other noodles are nothing to write home about. 

Good place to grab a quick bite to eat and is inexpensive but doesn't really stand out to me among the hundreds of food spots. 

Their service is (usually) very fast. There are a lot of waitresses working here. They're quick but not really attentive. Fast but not always very nice.
author: Yue Z.

description:
busyyyy on a saturday noon (around 1:40 and still have to wait for 15 mins)

loveee their fried rice. 
curry was just okay.

service is just okayy, not a very clean restaurant if you are looking for a well-served place.
author: Miffy L.

description: I feel bad slamming this place because I spent a lot of time enjoying the one on Taraval. I was back in SF for a conference and staying at a hotel downtown; this was one of the few restaurants open late. They show NBA games here. This one just wasn't as good as the other branches.
author: Karl K.

description:
Loved the food here. Anytime I find an asian restaurant filled with asian people, it's probably a good sign.

Chicken pumpkin curry.
Papaya salad.
roasted duck soup.
bbq pork fried rice.

Everything was delicious.  Kudos for Tiger beer too. 

Really really enjoyed this place.
author: Carrie G.

description: Delicious food, great service and clean. This place is well maintained and offers a great menu at reasonable prices. Always leave feeling full and satisfied. Couldn't recommend it enough!
author: Magdalynn H.

description: Great Thai Ice Tea! And delicious small rice noodle! The price is a little bit expensive than I expected. Nice restaurant though.
author: Yuqiao C.

description:
A really good place to grab a small bite while shopping in union square. If I remember correctly, they also close pretty late! That's always a plus. 

While shopping around, my parents and I got hungry, but it was too early for dinner so we stopped by here for appetizers. We got thai iced teas, hot coconut soup, and imperial rolls. All were really good, and really decent price too!

You would think that since it's smack dab in union square, it'd be a rip off tourist restaurant...but I would recommend coming here if you want a small meal or need a thai fix!
author: Stine H.

description: Thanks a bunch, King of Thai.  You have ruined Thai food for me in San Diego.  This place is awesome and open to 2 am.  I have never eaten so well at 2 am.  It was so good, I hit this place up two more times in the three days I was in town.
author: Jeremy S.

description: Food here are just okay. I heard all good reviews from other people but I feel very disappointed with their food.  My american husband can cook better than them. Not go back for sure.
author: Kelly C.

description:
12.11.10

This KoT is a great alternative to the food courts at the mall.  Relatively inexpensive, it attracts big crowds.  The four of us waited a good 20 minutes before being led to a table upstairs (which, strangely, wasn't packed).

I was feeling a bit sleepy and/or hungover that day, so I go for the signature duck noodle soup with flat rice noodles.  Great cure!
author: Jenny L.

description: I've been to this place several times for lunch. Although they are always packed for lunch, their food is always great. I once got chicken that tasted a little strange so I've ordered vegetarian after that. I love their panang curry, green curry, pad see ew, and tom yum. And extremely decently priced for the area and the amount of food. vegetarian entre averages $8-9
author: Michelle V.

description:
This place is actually pretty descent for being in tourist central.  It is cheap, fast, and tasty.  I can in no way speak to its authenticity since I have eaten at 3 Thai restaurants ever, but all the waitresses only speak Thai, and my receipt was in Thai, so I am pretty sure these people are close to the source, i.e. they know what they are doing.

What I have eaten that is delicious:

Pad Kee Mao (pork)
Pork Larb
Pumpkin Curry

Writing this review makes me want to go here right now....
author: Caitlin H.

description: First impression was great. Our app was not good - roasted duck fried rice. We told the girl and she asked what else we want so we got the eggs rolls which were good. They said they had to charge us for the duck bc it was made. I've never heard of a restaurant doing that. It was a $2.50 difference so that's what we tipped less. Bad customer service. Otherwise the entrees were good.
author: S H.

description:
I ordered the duck pineapple red curry off the special menu. It was ok. There were only a few pieces of duck meat and 3 pieces of pineapple. There were a lot of pieces of fatty duck skin. The curry wasn't too spicy. I wish the dish came with more rice because I ran out of rice before I could finish the curry. I don't think I'll order this dish again. I also got the Thai ice tea but there wasn't anything special about it. Next time I'll stick with their regular menu items. 

The service was kind of slow because it was super busy when I ate there.
author: Alexander L.

description:
Fast, reasonably priced, super-cute & friendly waitresses. 

+ tom kah gai (hot/sour w/coconut milk, chicken, mushrooms...) and chicken soup w/vermicelli noodles were very flavorful and well-seasoned- clean, gamey white meat chicken and lots of flavor without the feeling of msg overdose.

+ roasted duck fried rice was just the right amount of greasy in a good and intentional way (duck is fatty and flavorful, right?)

Solid fast Thai food. Minus 1 star because they forgot my egg rolls and they were my main reason for getting takeout from King of Thai! Sadness :-(.
author: Lindsay M.

description: Pad See Ew was good, but honestly nothing about this place stood out to me which is why my review is so brief. I can hardly remember what the service was like. The place itself is small but there's a secret room upstairs with more seating if you make a party reservation. That's the only cool thing about this restaurant and it isn't even that groundbreaking tbh. Not a bad place to eat though, the prices are reasonable and the food isn't bad at all.
author: Idk A.

description:
Pretty good. 
Affordable and fast service. 
Large portion. 
Conveniently located in Union Square area.
author: Truc N.

description:
I'm keeping the rating the same, but unfortunately this branch of King of Thai now added a three percent surcharge to cover the required health benefits for their workers.  I don't care for it but at then I more blame the former Board of Supervisor Tom Ammiano for this.  The over King of Thai restaurant don't seem to do it but this one is much busier and therefore, have more workers which is likely what pushed them into the provision requirement.

Still I like this location though even though it may cost more, especially here you can order beer which the others do not serve it.
author: H K.

description: The food is decent, although its prices are marked up because of the location. With an open kitchen, this is easily one of the noisiest restaurants I've visited. It didn't help that our server had a tiny voice.
author: Lily T.

description:
I came here w/ my bf for a quick bite to eat. For a Monday night around 9pm, this place was packed! Must be all the tourists around Union Square. Anyway, we ordered the chicken satay, panang curry w/ chicken (me), and combination beef noodle soup (him). The flavor of the curry was good, and for the price, I can't really complain. The only thing that bothered me a little was how oily it was (very noticeably so), and the fact that they had actual peanut pieces in the curry, which I did not expect.

-L.
author: Leeann C.

description: I had the yellow chicken curry, i would rate it ok. The taste of the curry really had a milky taste to it , but plain I was hoping at let some spice to it. Also when i got this order i had so much more rice left over that i had to try finish it by adding whats left of curry, but could'nt enjoy it because i had less meat :( other than that the service was friendly
author: Jon B.

description: Excellent food.  Excellent service. Good size portions.  Very friendly helpful staff.  If you like it hot and spicy, let them know.  They will take care of you heat fix.
author: Frankie V.

description:
I've been coming to this place for a few years now ever since a friend who worked at H&M nearby brought me here.  It is, as he put it, "one of my favorite lunch break spots."

Which is a pretty accurate description.  It's a good place to catch a very informal bite to eat.  Cuisine is not spectacular, but it is tasty, portions are large, and it's cheap.  I wouldn't travel out of my way to come here, but when I'm in the area shopping this is a favorite pit stop if I'm not looking to spend too much or wait too long.  

My favorite is the pad thai.  They make it sweeter here than at other thai places I frequent, but still good and usually I can finish about half before I'm completely stuffed.  There's an eggplant and rice dish that I enjoy a lot, and pineapple fried rice is also yummy.  

It's open fairly late, and I've never seen it too crowded. I think the longest I've found myself waiting for a table was 15 minutes.  My one complaint would be the service...it's on the slow side and while the servers do their job, but they sort of seem to look through you and go about their business indifferently.
author: Vi N.

description: Convenient Thai food in downtown but don't come here unless you're already shopping in that area bc parking is bad. The food is tasty and we usually get the pad Thai, pad see ew, and vegetarian curry.
author: Jennifer J.

description: Standard south east asian lunch spot, very similar to Thai Noodle in Berkeley.  Quick and efficient service.  Food is OK, can be a little greasy.
author: Mike L.

description: Thank you for being open at midnight so I could get something to eat after a delayed flight. However, your Pad Kee Mao noodles were rather bland and not very exciting. I recall your food being better. Also, you didn't bother to give me back my change. Thank you for making me awkwardly ask for it.
author: Minda w.

description: Tasty thai food for a great great price. The portions are generous and it all has just the right amount of spice. I also love that its open late! I love the larb, pad thai, tom yum, green papaya salad, and pad see ew. the chicken satay is not bad too. I love the little cucumber salad that comes on the side with some dishes :) mmm~
author: Natassia S.

description:
I visited here first 5-6 month ago.

Then was pretty good. 

But today, the manager of this restaurant was extremely sucks.

She shout me while I'm choosing the menu.

I tried to another menu rather than what I have eaten.

I ask to little explanation about the option of cuisine what I want to try.

But she shout me about the option with annoying sound.

Usually I've kept gentle and polite to waiter in restaurants.

but today I couldn't put it up with.

She should know that she should always keep polite to customer whom give money to the restaurant.

As long as she still in there, I will never go there.

and the meal was frastrate.
author: S P.

description:
Fried chicken over fried rice. This is the best dish for people who don't want anything too exotic, like the salmon with spicy peanut curry my friend ordered. The fried rice had perfect flavor and their fried chicken wasn't too crispy or soggy.

Overall really good food with a decent level of service. This specific location is somewhat small so it sucks if you comes with groups. Their waiters were somewhat hostile and it was hard to get their attention when we wanted to order, request extra napkins, or even our bill. Maybe we should've dine and dashed...?
author: Felix C.

description:
"You take the good, you take the bad, you take them both and there you have,
The King of Thai, 
The King of Thai..."

The good:  For $20 - veggie egg rolls, hot and sour soup, and veggie noodle soup in minutes, conveniently located near Macy's.

The bad:  Garish purple walls, bare bones service, and mediocre food.
author: Amy C.

description: YUM. I'm vegan & they were helpful trying to find something I could eat. Most of the vegetarian noodles I could eat. I don't remember which I had but I do know it was amazing. It had triangles of perfectly cooked tofu & basil. My sister & her boyfriend (omnivores) love this place. The workers were friendly. Can't wait to go back!!
author: Jess H.

description:
Classmate introduced me to this King of Thai years ago when they were located at Powell. I have not stopped coming here since.

Good portions and fast and friendly service. 

Came here after a late night movie. Shared the crab fried rice (fresh crab!), veggie egg rolls and ended with fried banana served with 2 scoops of ice cream (coconut and green tea), lightly drizzled with chocolate syrup and topped with a cherry. YUMMM!!!

Great option that does not hurt your wallet! 

***Does not accept credit/debit card but ATM available right outside the restaurant.
author: Anna C.

description:
This place is pretty popular with the dinner crowd.  I met up with some friends for dinner on a weekday and the restaurant was pretty full. 

Food comes out amazingly fast- it's so fast it's crazy!

I had the pad khee mao and although it's definitely not the best I've had, it still got the job done.  The hot tea here is super yummy so if you're big on tea I would recommend it.

Inexpensive prices and big portions. 

If you're looking for a convenient, quick Thai food fix, then King of Thai fits the bill.
author: Kim-van T.

description: friendly staff! beefstew brisket and friend banana with thai ice cream is recommended!
author: Jholor S.

description: Fast service.  Reasonable portion.  Relatively cheap compared to the things around the area, but otherwise a tad pricy.  Tastes pretty good.  Javier definitely recommends getting extra fried rice or extra noodles or you won't really be full.
author: Javier G.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE!  BEST THAI FOOD BY FAR!

The staff are really nice and the space is huge when you're inside so there's plenty of eating space.

The veggie egg rolls are delicious and the noodles are super tasty!
author: Yekta A.

description: Best Thai I've ever had in my LIFE.  Food came out SUPER fast.  I think I had Pad See Ew, the seafood one.  It was life changing.  the eggrolls were very good too, but a very small portion, which wound up being fine because the dinner was filling and delicious.  My husband has had some very bad thai experiences, and I think this brought him back to the dark side.  yum!
author: Katie G.

description:
My boyfriend passes this place everyday on his commute to work and never stopped in. So on an SF shopping day, he took me here and I was really excited to try it. 

Upon first impression, I thought we were going to have to wait for a table - it was pretty packed, but surprisingly, we were seated right away... at the same table next to another couple. But, it didn't bother me =). I also noticed the bin of chopsticks next to us... which made the germ-a-phobe in me freak out a little, but I was so hungry, I didn't let it bother me either. 

Since this place is a noodle house, I had to try a noodle soup - which looked soo good while passing other people's tables. I ordered the first item on the list, which was the sliced beef in spicy beef broth with egg noodles... and I hope I go back so I can try #2, #3... and so on. The food came to me so quickly, in a huge bowl, with which I was instantly intimidated thinking I wouldn't make a dent in this thing. The broth was very tasty with the right amount of spice, the noodles had a really good texture and the beef was just right. I was extremely satisfied with my order and ate all the food but didn't dare drink all the soup... And the thai iced tea was really good, too.

I highly recommend for the quick service, portion size and the right price. If freshness of the food is important, I'd question this place on a count of how fast it is... but definitely give it a try. It wouldn't hurt... AT ALL.
author: Jasmin A.

description: Terrifically tasty (I asked for and got very spicy), very fresh vegetables, friendly staff, fast service and very good value to boot.  Note: The soups are big enough to feed three or four as a side dish, and other dishes are generous as well. The fish cakes were the best I have had outside Thailand. Decor is hole-in-the-wall, but that's part of its charm.
author: Lisa K.

description:
I've been coming here for over 8 years before they banned me. Well they didn't directly say that to me but that is what they were insinuating. 

Though the food used to be decent, I will admit that I came here for the cute waitresses. This one waitress use to give me a free cup of tea and hand sanitizing wipes. I don't know if that is good or bad but she was always super friendly to me unlike 99% of the waitresses. 

I used to eat here all the time and put up with their mediocre food and poor service. 


THE NIGHT IN QUESTION
It must have been five minutes sitting at a table waiting for a waitress to hand me a menu when a group of four arrive and they immediately get seated and are given menus. STRIKE ONE

I eventually get my menu, place my order and get served. Not even halfway through my meal, they plop my bill onto the table. STRIKE TWO

An old friend of mine comes in and sits next to me. We are conversing when they take my plate away without asking me if I was still eating. I had maybe 15% food remaining. STRIKE TWO AND A HALF. 

I was done eating but that is not the point.

The group of four eventually finish and asked to pay the bill.

I'm still conversing with my friend when they take my glass of water away. STRIKE THREE.  Drinking vessels should only be cleared after the customer leaves, not while they are still sitting down.

I told the waitress she should go back to Thailand or something similar.
They didn't like what I said so they started yelling at me and said they would call the cops on me.

I should have flipped a bunch of tables over just to spite them before I left.

NEVER AGAIN!!!



Bangkok Noodles just down the street has higher quality food.
author: Evan W.

description: The best thai food in SF! I love the green curry with rice
author: Donald V.

description: I love this place it was my first time here and it was fantastic. I got the spicy eggplant with chicken and rice it was delicious. It was a little cold not as hot as I expected but the flavor was yummy.
author: Madison W.

description:
This is my go-to place whenever I'm in the Union Square area.  I've eaten here several times with friends and gotten a table by myself once or twice.

I always order the duck noodle soup with egg noodles, so I can't really comment on anything else on the menu.  I love egg noodle soup because it reminds me of a different Vietnamese-Chinese dish, mi vit tiem - although the Thai version has a completely different broth, with a little stronger flavor.

The prices are unbeatable and the portions are perfect.  And hot tea is complimentary, as it should be!  I definitely recommend if you are looking for an inexpensive lunch break while you are in the Powell shopping area.
author: Amanda N.

description:
No matter what hours of the day, this place is always my go-to place. I frequent this place for lunch, dinner, and after bar and drinks. Their pad se ew is always consistently good and their papaya salad is always lite and just right. That may be why there is usually a wait for this place. 

This place has great food but not necessarily a place for a romantic dinner. Having said that, if your date loves food over the ambiance... I say bring the date. Have some Thai food and definitely try their Thai ice tea or ice coffee... with a side of ice water (because it's kinda sweet)
author: Eva Y.

description:
I could have sworn I wrote a review for this place.  Though I probably mistook this one for the other King of Thai on Clement.  With that said, this place is great when you need to take a break from shopping and/or someplace to eat in rainy depressing weather like it has been for the past couple of days.  It can (and does) get busy at any point during the day since it's in a busy area.

The food is pretty decent if you need a quick bite.  In this case, I got some pork noodle soup over rice noodles.  It definitely energized me for the rest of the day.  The other dishes such as the Crab Fried Rice are good and fill you up quite easy.
author: Ren L.

description:
This place looked super busy, and seems like a good place to go since it was busy inside!

They had a lot of waiters and ready to serve.

I've tried this place at their other locations and I tried the Thai Style Fried Rice, so I ordered it again.  It comes with your choice of meat (chicken, pork, beef, prawns, seafood, or roasted duck) with egg, white onions, green onions, tomatoes topped with cucumber.
 
The Fried rice was steaming hot from the wok, and it smelled delicious.  You can see duck meat and duck skin in the fried rice.  It is a bit greasy, but it's delicious.  The only thing I thought was a bit disgusting was that they tossed in a lot of the ducks fat, but I guess they use it for flavor since duck fat is very flavorful.

Overall this place is a quick in / out restaurant, decent Thai food for decent price.  The service of this place is unbelievable, they are very quick and you will get your meal in no time!

-Parking-
This is central downtown and parking will be difficult during the day, but night can be the same since everyone wants to park for free.  There are several parking structures that are near like the O'Farrell St parking lot across the street from Macy's.
author: Kenneth Y.

description:
Where do I eat at in the middle of the night after a drunken night in the city? 

Here. Service is fast. Food is good. I've liked everything on the menu. And the place is bringing purple back.

Always a sobering time here. 
;D
author: John-Michael C.

description:
This place is fast, cheap and tasty! Everytime I come here I'm amazed at the quick turnaround. I never have to wait for more than 5 min whether it's for a table for 2 or a table for 8. And the food -- it's delivered almost as fast as the table wait.
 
Also keep in mind that "mild" spicy is pretty darn spicy here so I usually end up ordering non spicy for my dishes.

I recommend the pad see ewe, papaya salad and the duck fried rice.
author: Helen Y.

description:
What can i say -after a long day of walking around the Union Sq area - you can't go wrong w/ this place
its yummy - its cheap, and the service is pretty quick 

1/2 star minus for not taking cards!! Who doesn't take cards these days?!?!? they have an ATM right out front, but that seems like a $10 charge, and whatever else your Bank takes from you

overall good place to go down there though...
author: Ken T.

description: Food was acceptable but the service was very bad. The main food arrived before the appetizers. When the soup arrived, we had to look at it for a couple of minutes for the bowls to arrive so we can start to eat.
author: O D.

description: Love this place! Their roast duck egg noodle soup was awesome!!
author: Susan D.

description:
Going here makes me feel like I have extremely high healthy food standards.  We ordered two normal noodle dishes: the pad thai with shrimp and pad see ew with chicken.  Oily oily oily!  Fatty doughy noodles.  Our dishes were 90% noodle, 8% veggies, 2% shrimp/chicken.  It was honestly so oily that I could feel my arteries clogging up as I ate it (and this is coming from me who can eat 4 donuts in a day).  

If you want kinda cheap, convenient (since it's located right in the middle of Union Square), and to die of a heart attack, come here.  But, for the price and quality, I will definitely be taking my business elsewhere (edit: even when i'm wasted at 3am).
author: Naomi P.

description: I think I've ordered take out from this place 2 or 3 times now. Their curry is pretty far on the mild side and honestly not that flavorful. The pad thai was pretty meh as well. I liked the pad see ew though.
author: Emily F.

description: Salmon curry! Yum!  I really like this place when I come for a show in the SF downtown area. They are fresh, fast, there's always a table and we can eat and go right before a show. I always order some type of noodle, some type of soup or the salmon curry. Those are safe bets for me when I'm in a hurry. When I come here for a leisurely meal, I always try something new and I haven't been disappointed so far. Servers refill your glass of water and quickly get the bill to you. I like this because I can come and go. This is downtown SF after all. Lots of shopping, so little time.
author: Lizzie B.

description: To me, This is a good place for quick meal. I went there twice whenever I am in the city. The food is decent and service is ok. The location is convenience for me to stop by for a meal while shopping. Will come back
author: Tien C.

description:
Want to experience a place that is similar to the restaurant game Diner Dash? Then here it is. Perfect example of a place that seats you, gives you food right away, then gives you the bill except they have about 8 servers rather than just one. The problem I have with this is the service they give. I know I shouldn't be asking much from a place like this, but this place really gives you that fake smile and welcome look. The funny thing is all the servers stand around together watching everyone talking in Thai. The thing is I am part Thai and understood most of the things they were saying and lets just say they weren't really great comments. 

But yeah as I mentioned earlier the service is like diner dash... due to that they sometimes make mistakes and they did with my girlfriend's food. So yeah we told them about it and they kind of gave us attitude and everything. I felt kind of frustrated because they gave us the image that we were wrong when in reality they wrote it down wrong. Just memorize your own menu. So yeah they gave us looks and didn't even apologize.

Eventually my girlfriend's meal came, but right when my girlfriend put in a scoop she was able to find hair. Like wow seriously? Another fucked up mistake?
author: Sonlay V.

description:
I dragged Brian S. to WonderCon. I used him as a boy prop to make myself appear less geeky and made him skip lunch just so that we could maximize our time at the comic book convention. Yeah... I'm kind of a jerkface. 

So when we finally resurface from the nerd mecca heaven after seeing D & E list stars such as The Soup Nazi, Data - From ST:TNG, Lou Ferrigno, we're starving.

He suggests this place. It was pouring rain, we get in and I'm sopping the water out of my pants with napkins. I have about 45 mins before my Genius appointment at the Apple Store down the street. So I'm hoping this will be fast.

We order right away two plates of noodles. The food was so so. He had the Pad See Ew which was tastier with the sauce than my Seafood noodle, which lacked flavor. The prices were good. It was like any old Thai place I've been to before but fast. Food came out in 15 mins, we scarfed everything down in 10 as well as paying the bill then we were off to the Apple Store.
author: Jessica C.

description: After waiting for quite a while, we had to catch a waitress to get our order. The food was ok, like other typical Thai food. Thing we were disappointed the most was that they kept the change without telling us. We were waiting and waiting. Finally we decided to ask the waitress about the change so we can take care of the tip. She told us that our change was very small, therefore they didn't give it to us. Is it right to keep customer's change??? This is the first time this happens to me, so does to my friend! It's rediculous!! Won't go back for sure!
author: Ravy C.

description:
For the haters: Where else can you get good thai food for under $10 around union square? Answer: Nowhere, except king of thai.

I know this place isn't quite as good on flavor & price as the other King of Thai spots (ex: north beach, etc), but its still the best in the neighborhood and the cheapest around.  I have yet to find Thai food this delicious at their prices in all of San Francisco (and possibly, in all of America).  The pad thai & pineapple fried rice are both excellent, but my favorite is by far the green curry. Thus, this clearly deserves 4 stars.
author: Dan W.

description: Stopped by here with my wife, she was really looking forward to having some good Thai noodle soup.  For the most part, she loves her meal and the wonderfully fresh noodles.  I opted for an order of Thai fried chicken wings.  First couple were good, I enjoyed the the spicy sauce they had on the side.  The five remaining wings had issues, I bit into the first one and I noticed bright red blood dripping form my bite mark.  I could taste the raw chicken in my mouth and was completely disgusted.  I noticed the pool of blood forming at the bottom of my plate.  I just couldn't eat any more.  I mentioned it to one of the employees who immediately left and brought me back a to go container.  I told him no, the food was raw.  He took my remaining food and showed it to a couple of employees.  Our server came back and apologized for the food and gave us our check with a hefty 10% discount that she was so proud to mention.  What a joke.
author: Ron C.

description: First time here, had the pad Thai noodle. It was very good; service was very fast - the place is a bit noisy but definitely will be back.
author: eric h.

description: I've been here a couple of times. Food's good. Prices are average. Service is...odd. Food doesn't come at the same time, they have to come back to confirm orders, they just don't seem happy to work there. I can see why though...please, you need to remodel! Those Barney walls are just so unappetizing.
author: Heidi H.

description: don't order from them via phone/grubhub 11:20pm still waiting for my food.
author: Ellie R.

description: I got the vegetarian noodle bowl. Nothing more but some bland broth, noodles, and vegetables.  I would've been happier with a bowl of ramen. Oh yeah, and there was a bug in my food.
author: Florence C.

description: Always loved this place!  if it weren't such a walk from Beale St, we'd come more often for lunch!  Roast duck fried rice and fried chicken, two favorite dishes!!!  Sad that not everyone agrees :(  Oh well, more for me :)  Even better now that they take cards.
author: Jennifer H.

description: I love this place but they gave me the wrong order to go so make sure you check your food before you leave the restaurant if you're getting take out.  I received a fried rice dish.  Not recommended.
author: Erin J.

description:
I would have liked this place if not for the forced tips. I personally don't agree with the fact that I have to pay a certain amount for tips unless I'm with a big group of people. 

I came here on Friday night with 2 friends for dinner. When it was time for the bill, one of the servers stood at our table and counted the money. She then reminded us that we had to pay an extra $4.62 for tips. I was aware I saw the guide for tips listed below the bill, but I didn't think this was a forced thing. If service was that great, I wouldn't mind but for a mediocre service, I didn't think they deserved it. They even forgot to bring some of our food. I found it weird because I had come a week before and this didn't happen to me. 

--Bottom line, I wouldn't come to this King of Thai location again. Forced tips just isn't cool to me.
author: Audrey M.

description:
I love Thai cuisine. I've worked for one and dined in the upscale Thai restaurants in Fresno, Sacramento, Lincoln, San Jose and even the retired Deputy Permanent Secretary of the Thai Ministry of Commerce's Thai Thani Restaurant in Orlando, FL. 

King of Thai beats them all. It's where quality meets quantity. It's not your typical cozy, romantic, upscale Thai restaurant but it's casual, the price is right, and the proportion is more than fair. Great for family style. The ambiance is off but think of it as a Johnny Rockets/ Mel's kinda place that serves excellent Thai food.  Hey! It's SF! Considering the nature of the dishes, their service is super fast and this place can get pretty packed. 

My sister and I made a stop here this past weekend. To my surprise, the Thai Iced Tea and Thai Iced Coffee were free! I've never seen them offer this in my 4 years of being a regular! LOVE it. Definitely, helps cut the tab down! Oh and it was very freshly brewed.

My favorite dishes: pad thai, beef combo noodle soup, roast duck noodle soup, papaya salad, yellow curry, beef larb, pad see ew, rad na,  And their thai chili peppers are smoking hot..and always hit the spot! Highly recommend if you enjoy authentic Thai cuisine.
author: Miss E.

description: The duck leg oyster sauce soup was pretty good. The 2nd best I've ever had. The 1st being at Phay Ky in OC woot woot
author: Ivan L.

description: Good service and very good veggieterian selection. I had the Yum Tum soup which was great and my wife had the veggie Pad Thai which was also great.
author: Raz L.

description:
King of Sucks.

Two stars for being open really, really late. Otherwise, the bland, lifeless noodles & soup served here by uniformly sullen, surly waitstaff was such a turn off I found myself wishing I had bought food on the airplane.
author: Wesh W.

description:
I often turn to King of Thai for that quick and tasty meal while out in the Union Square area. 

They have many servers, i've never had to wait for a seat and the food comes very quickly. Its saucy and delicious. This is not an exquisite thai dining experience, so leave your fancy pants and food critic hat at home. King of Thai is great at what it does and I will be back often.

NOTE: Friends have had bad experiences with delivery times, however. Beware.
author: Artem A.

description: Peanut sauce with green onions and chicken on egg noodles. You can customize that dish by shoveling jalepenos and chili powder on top.  I hate peanut sauce on anything else  but for that dish I'll absolutely make an exception. Thank You King of Thai for always coming to my rescue when I'm stuck in tourist-ville and Burger King  on Powell or crap diner food are my options. Kudos for convenience, relatively affordable prices and for giving me slightly above average thai food when all I've eaten for the past few nights have been street hot dogs, pizza and super bowl finger foods.
author: Hannah A.

description:
I ate at this restaurant few times and most of them are a disappointment. Today, i ordered to go pad see eww beef with extra egg (which they charged extra $1.00 and i really don't mind at all) and pad kee mao. I was so excited to go home and have my dinner expecting that these food will be as good as the ones in clement. 

I opened the pad see eww the color was so pale and extremely dry all the noodles stick together and tough to eat, i knew that this is not going to be good.. and where is the extra egg?? i don't see any difference between extra egg and regular one.. No taste and so bland, nobody in my house can even eat after few spoons... i just wanted to throw it away.. but my husband insisted to re-cook it again with more spices and more eggs.. how pathetic is that?

Then next the pad kee mao, taste exactly like pad see eww no difference.. no taste, bland and pale.. no basil.. i was double disappointed.. I don't think i would come back again to eat here.. 

If i really crave king of thai, i would just go to the one in clement (the small restaurant), they know how to cook and food are delicious.. I tried their pad kee mao last week and told them exactly what i wanted and they cooked the pad kee mao so good that i craved it again today but i bought it at the Powell location since it is closer to my office.. big mistake!
author: sofie W.

description:
I've been craving soup noodles like crazy lately, maybe because the weather's getting cooler, not so much Chinese soup noodles though, but pho or Thai noodles. 

I usually get the Pad See Ew here but since I had a hankering for soup noodles, I got that instead.

Beef Combination with Thin Vermicelli Noodles. NOM NOM. I love the soup, it's really rich and fragrant. The beef was really good too, I like how they put the beef slices in raw so it doesn't get overcooked by the soup. The noodles I got were similar to the pho noodles, I like those best in these types of soups because they don't get mushy or anything. YUMMY
author: Constance C.

description: King of Thai is awesome for speed, price and reliability. I've been a fan for over 10 years and I appreciate their willingness to make dishes really spicy when you ask for it.
author: Scott S.

description: The food is way too expensive for the quantity that they give. It probably looks crowded and you would think that the restaurant has really good food but it turns out to be what would not expect.
author: Gia P.

description: This is my go-to Thai spot in SF. It does help that it is close to where I live. I'm a huge fan of curry and their Panang curry with chicken is awesome. I've only ever ordered to-go so I can't speak to the eat in service but their take out is super fast. I'm out of there in less than 10 minutes! I highly recommend King of Thai!
author: KC W.

description:
Pretty good Thai food, for cheap prices??? Totally A-Ok in my book!!! The Pad See Ew is yummy, wish I had some now! 

Oh and the fact they stay open late is a plus too!
author: Lauren H.

description:
Oh King of Thai! When I see your purple sign, it is my welcome sign: "Welcome to San Francisco!" As soon as the plane lands, I'm on the BART and heading to Union Square to King of Thai.

I found this place years ago while I was wondering around the city by myself, lost. I went in, was taken care of, had great Thai food that was hot, fast, and well-priced. I've been a fan ever since.

It's cliche, but I always get Pad Thai when I go here. Yes, you always think of Pad Thai when you think of Thai food, but their version is delish! Occasionally I will force myself to order other items and I never regret it. The Duck Fried Rice is tender and moist and full of flavor. The pumpkin curry is sooo good I want to slurp up the liquid (but I don't because I always get it on my jacket).

The price is right! Good portion size for an affordable price. If you're lucky enough to get that tiny table at the window, you can people watch!

Makes me want to fly to San Fran for some Thai food. Right now.
author: Tammy L.

description: I hate the lighting, it's cash only (annoying), their dishes are greasy and leave you feeling bloated,  gross and also thankful for living in such a walkable city. I tried the hot and sour soup with prawns last time and it was too sweet,  oily, had many 3 prawns and an hour or so later I felt sick. I think it's best to pass this place and head over to Boudin instead.
author: Natalie M.

description:
So while Osha on 2nd St. is my spot for duck pad sew ew.. this is my favorite place for duck fried rice!  Whenever my sister comes to visit with her Prada bags and Louboutin shoes.. her request isn't Danko's or Minna.. all she wants is duck fried rice from this cash only uber casual restaurant conveniently located next to the cosmetics entrance of Macy's.

I remember not being impressed with their pad sew ew.. but that their pad kee mao was rather tasty.  

They are my savior when I need comfort food.
author: Beatrice T.

description:
Updating stars because like overpriced Italian food, the prices have changed here to be overpriced Thai food. Authenticity of food have also changed. Food quality and prices are more commercialized. Food now carries the Union Square/San Francisco pricey "price tag".  

Much like Italian food, Thai food is often considered pricey with a fine dining price tag. Like Italian food, the cost to make the food ranges from a few pennies to a few dollars.

Why do people pay $18 for a pasta or curry entree? Beats me! 

[[This place is where you can get quality authentic Thai food (not fusion food) for real prices. What's even better is that they are located in Union Square without the Union Square price tag. You can even request that they make a "Lao-style" papaya salad with crab.]] -- irrelevant now 2014

Thai food is meant for family style dining. I recommend going family style so you can try a bit of everything. The other day, I saw 4 people order themselves each a plate of Pad Thai; their table was full of Pad Thai.    

I hear that all of their Chefs come from Thailand, so you'll definitely get authentic food. 

If you like chili, ask for the chopped Thai Chili... it's sooo good!
author: mary v.

description: Delicious!!! Everything we ordered was amazing! Enjoyed the Larb, pad see ew, and this seafood noodle I ordered. It had flat type of noodles in it, don't quite remember the name of it... But it was delicious... Hot tea was perfect as well. Definitely plan to eat here a again in the future. Worth every penny =)
author: Divinite L.

description: I ordered beef stew noodle, waited for 15 minutes. Where's my noodle? They told me they forgot my order. Waited for another 3-5mins for my order. Good food but not in service.
author: San A.

description:
After walking by Katana-Ya and seeing that the line was long, our grumbling stomachs lead us to King of Thai Noodle House which was also pretty crowded, but had enough space for us to get seated right off.

They were pretty busy that night so the food took a bit of time, which was understandable.  We ordered the Tom Yum soup to share, my friend ordered the Duck Noodle Soup and I ordered one of their specials - the deep fried salmon in red curry sauce with rice.

The Tom Yum soup was good, except I felt as though we didn't get much in terms of mushrooms and chicken but we did get a lot of soup.  It was really tasty and flavorful though, but it really was mostly drinking soup and nothing really in it.

My friend's Duck Noodle Soup came early and he waited for me to get my dish before he ate it so the noodles got a little soggy because of that.  However, he said the broth that night was a lot saltier than he was used to.

The Salmon Red Curry dish I ordered was not good at all.  I did not like the Red Curry at all so I tried hard to shake off the curry sauce on the salmon and then eat it with the rice.  However, the salmon was super dry and very flavor-less.  I did however get full by the end of my meal, but was hungry an hour later since I just filled myself with liquid from the soup.

I'm sure it's just because I ordered the wrong thing, but I was not too fond of the restaurant.  Hopefully, if I do end up eating there again, it'll turn out better.
author: Anna V.

description: The one word to sum up this resturant is... Subpar. My boyfriend wanted to go here for dinner when we were downtown and wanted thai food. Since I have eaten at many other Thai places, I was sure to form an opinion about this place. We ordered papaya salad, pad see eww, and the coconut soup. The food wasn't bad...just subpar. I probably won't be coming back unless it's with a large group and I don't have a say.
author: Cindy L.

description: Food was cold. Food took forever. Bad combination. Long wait plus cold food. Would never come back here unless i was forced.
author: Stephen A.

description:
This is one of my favorite hole in the walls when shopping in Union Square.  My favorite dish is the Pad See Ew, but recently had their beef soup with rice noodles.  Very good, with a flavorful broth - not at all oily.

Service is always friendly and I rarely have problems getting a seat.  Simple and straight forward - perfect in the hustle and bustle of Union Square.
author: Maryrose S.

description:
It is nice that this place is open late, but the food really is nothing to go crazy about. I'm not saying its bad. The food was decently tasty, but the portions were really small for the price. Also, they could work on some of the dish's aesthetics. I ordered a garlic chicken dish and it was probably the most boring and unappealing dish I have ever seen at a restaurant. It was literally just a small pile of chopped chicken, covered in a brown sauce with rice on the side. The whole dish was only 2 colors. 

I also had some pad thai and again, it was decently good but nothing to rave on about. But just like the chicken dish, it was a small portion. But yeah they are open late so thats always a plus. I guess that is the premium you pay for their extra hours.
author: Dustin D.

description: On late nights after work, I'll order the beef panang.
author: Geordie E.

description:
Would I go here for a nice, sit down dinner? No.
Would I go here if I didn't want to feel rushed? No.
Would I go here if I want something quick and easy, didn't feel like cooking, or needed to grab take out? Absolutely.

If you like spicy, try the pad-see-yew and ask for a little kick. There's another dish (#s 15 + 17 I believe) that has asian broccoli and a sweet sauce of some sort that is very good too. (They're actually really nice to share with someone else, so you get sweet and spicy... weird, I know.)

Portions are gigantic so come hungry and leave with left overs. No need for apps or anything! So very, very cheap.

P.S. I read a lot of the reviews about this particular location being skeevy or having a gross "dish closet" but saw nothing weird. I watched the line prep and cook my food in under 5 minutes. It's just a noodle bar, with tacky teenage servers wearing Shape-Ups and braces. Nothing grotesque.
author: christine c.

description:
Pad See Ew is to die for. My party and I ordered two orders (one with chicken and one with beef) and panang curry with chicken to go. The noodles are heavenly. Perfect spice for Thai food. Same goes for the panang curry. 

Arrive well before closing time though. They won't let you dine in after 12:40am. Believe me, we tried.
author: M.J. E.

description: Portions are decent for their price.  The best thing about them is the speed.  We only had one hour to be in the city because a cousin had to go back to the airport and they brought out the food within 5 mins.
author: Leochris R.

description:
Decent, simple, inexpensive food. It was a bit greasy and not quite as flavorful as we'd wanted - but the spice jars on the table helped with that. 
The service was efficient, the atmosphere like a lunch counter, and the clientele seemed to be a mix of locals and tourists.
author: Chandra H.

description: They cheap out on the protein filling your plate full of carbs. What the?!
author: peter c.

description:
I had heard that this place was meant to be authentic Thai cuisine and so i thought why not give it a whirl seeing as it was rather inexpensive. 

I have to say that there were a few dishes that we passable and others that i would not have again. I would not say that this place is great but a good cheap-ish option.

I ordered the green curry with chicken and was over the taste of it by about the fourth mouthful. The pad thai with duck was good but there was hardly any duck. I would suggest adding duck to the majority of your dises and perhaps advise that they add more pieces. It is flavoursome but there just aren't enough of them in the dish.

For some what average food at a decent price give this place a go but don't expect great or even good Thai food
author: Pilar M.

description: We have stomach problem and vommit after the Pad Ee Siew (or something, its a stir fried flat noodle with vegi and meat). Avoid that dish!
author: Stephen O.

description:
After a night drinking at Irish Bank (without dinner), my friends and I decided that we should get some food.  Wandering around union square, we saw that this thai food place was still open.  I asked what was good and was told to order the beef combination noodle dish with thin noodles, my friends got the chicken larb and another got the duck noodles. The beef noodle dish was surprisingly good.  My friend who ordered the larb didn't like that he asked for mild and it was still spicy (He's Indian so he should have been able to handle spicy food but still).  I didn't realize that thai food also had good noodle soups, so finding this place so randomly was a pleasant surprise.

The only downside was how quickly they rushed us out. It was late and they were closing their kitchen 15 minutes after we got there, but they gave us the check while one of my friends was only half way done with his duck noodle soup.
author: Jeff L.

description:
KING OF THAI NOODLE HOUSE

This particular branch of the King of Thai Noodle House franchise claims that it was the first to open in San Francisco and serve customers their delicious Thai dishes. If this is so, I'm proud to have dined here and tasted their wonderful dishes. Located in the heart of Union Square, the King is in prime location to serve delicious food to hungry shoppers who must be starving after a long day of shopping. The pad thai was nice and sweet and the chicken pumpkin curry had a nice spicy kick to it that made its sauce stand out amongst other curries I've tried. Long live the King!
author: Stanley C.

description:
Tyra Banks proclaims that in beauty and fashion, there's a Good Kill and a Bad Kill.

http://i33.tinypic.com/35cr2io.jpg

In the above photo from America's Next Top Model Cycle 13 Episode 6, Rae killed both Jennifer (the Asian chick) and Brittany (the Bride of Frankenstein). But what killed them in a negative way was Jennifer. 

Get it?

No?

Let me further illustrate.

Things That Kill In A Bad Way:

- People Who Wear Transition Lenses (WHY?? The transition from indoor to outdoor is awkward at best, but usually just plain fugly)
- The Aftertaste Of Lamb Meat (I imagine it's like licking a Cable Car Operator's armpit)
- People Singing "Killing Me Softly" At Karaoke (That song has been ruined for me. One time... Two times...)
- The Interminably Long Wait Between Releases For Awesome Book Serieses (Seria? Serii??? WHAT IS THE PLURAL OF "SERIES"????) Such As Harry Potter (RIP) and Wheel of Time (Oh, RIP, too) 


Things That Kill In A Good Way:

- Fierce Drag Queens (Stonewall proved that these Ladies can and will kill if provoked)
- My Photography Skills (I can make you look beautiful, fierce, smize-like, and what's most importantly, skinny)
- The Krumping During The Choreography of Beyonce's "Sweet Dream" video (I WILL throw my back out while reenacting it one of these days)
- The Barbecue Pork & Won Ton Vegetable Soup at King Of Thai (the broth is a myriad of flavors: savory, herbal, salty, sweet, slightly tangy, and rich)

This King Of Thai location is cash-only (this is USEFUL) and as such, is slightly (like $0.25-$1.50) cheaper than other Thai restaurants. 

It's also extremely busy, but I've realized in my numerous visits that it usually takes longer for YOU to decide what to order vs. the time it takes for the food to come out once you've ordered. That's Beauty. That's Power. That's Maybelline.
author: Joshua L.

description: Good thai food at a really good price. I love this place, its a rare cheap place to eat downtown thats not completely touristy. While the food isn't of the same caliber as, for instance, Marnee Thai, for the price it is excellent value.
author: claire l.

description:
Came here with some friends after the Yelp Holiday event since most of them didn't get any food at the event.  

I didn't try any of their dishes they ordered, duck soup, but I did try their drunken noodle. Ground beef with bean sprouts cooked in a spicy soy sauce mixture.  It was an average dish, nothing special, had better. 

Their service wasn't bad, they came to refill drinks and brought things in a timely manner when asked. Food also came out quickly.  This place is more for those late nights Thai cravings, but not your go to place for some good Thai food. Cash Only.
author: Annie D.

description: Not the best of best but if you're looking for a quick thai meal, KOT will suffice.  Food is decent - I'd say some of their noodle dishes are pretty authentic and come close to what you will find in Thailand, but others like the phad see-eew and the som tum (papaya salad) didn't do it for me.  Portions are huge and I'd say food is reasonably priced.  I'd recommend it as a lunch place or take out since there is not much offered in terms of ambiance.  Used to be cash only but now they accept cards.   KOT is always packed - but people are in and out fairly quick.  I usually end up getting take out when I'm lazy to cook and am too hungry to wait for delivery from Thai House Express.
author: Bhavnak K.

description: I stopped in here on a cold San Francisco Saturday. The Pho was amazing and hit the spot.
author: Imoye F.

description:
I went here with Liz Q for a quick lunch. I used to live and work in SF years ago and this was one of my favorite lunch places. I ordered my fave, Pad See Ew with Chicken.
