It was as delicious as I remembered. My friend ordered the duck curry with rice. I'm not a duck fan but the curry was pretty tasty. For dessert we ordered sticky rice with mango. It was pretty sweet but good. 
I would have given them 4 stars but docking a star for service. I'm not sure why but my food took a lot lot longer than my friend's food. C'mon now it's noodles! We were also seated in a weird corner and had a hard time getting service. It also took us forever to get our check and when we did, 2 different people gave us our checks. The staff just seemed young and disorganized. But they got cheap, good noodles so I'll prob still come back.
author: Corene B.

description: Go-to place for hearty fried rice with BBQ pork of course! The pad Thai is also yum-o.
author: Joan K.

description: I love Thai food. And though this may seem like a fast food Thai restaurant...I've always loved it! King of Thai Noodle has several locations in San Francisco. This particular one serves the busy Downtown crowds. Right on O'Farrell in between the shops, hotels, mall, cable car station, etc. this King of Thai Noodle is always busy. And Yes...ALWAYS! In the past during lunch break, I had to settle for either earlier lunches or later ones just to beat the crowds. I did however manage to find one off 5th Street that was walking distance as well. Despite the crowds, the service here is friendly and they bring my food out to me in minutes.
author: Marie T.

description: Amazing!! I'm addicted to their quick service, great food, and Chicken Pumpkin curry. I call in an order and its ready within 10 minutes and its very inexpensive. Quick notes: This place is usually always packed so  don't come here for A star service. When it's cold out, try to sit more towards the back when possible because again, when its busy, the door will consistently be open.
author: Nabrina M.

description:
It's often crowded with European tourists (this not necessarily a bad thing.)
It's a bit noisy, but the service is quick and the food reasonably priced.

They need to sweep the floor more often but the grub is OK.

Honestly though, I would eat here again if I find myself hungry and stranded in Union Sq, but there are other Thai places to which I would make a deliberate bee-line...
author: Ken B.

description: oh man!  This is the spot to go to when you need some good spicy Thai style noodle soup.  This has been my spot everything I come to SF since my friend introduced me to this place.  Highly recommend!  The beef noodles is what I normally order.  I have tried other items on the menu which are good too, but the beef noodle soup is my go to item.  This is place if you haven't yet.  It' just in the Union Square area.
author: James Y.

description: Pad Thai and Pad See Ew are on point compared to Thai restaurants in FL. Quick and cheap for it's portion. The other lunch dishes looked amazing too!
author: Ting W.

description:
Not as cheap as the North Beach location, but it is still very affordable with delicious good-sized portions.  Most of their noodle and rice dishes can be made vegetarian with tofu and mixed vegetables instead of meat.  They also have a much more extensive menu than the other location.  

Only three stars for this location though because it is very cramped and crowded.  Also, it smelled very strongly of fish throughout the entire restaurant the last time I was there, probably because the kitchen area is right there in the middle of the restaurant instead of behind closed doors.
author: Kimberly K.

description: Fantastic! We had the Pad Kee Mao and the Rad Nar,  both with beef.  The Pad Kee Mao was spicy in a very good way and the broth that came with the Rad Nar was very flavorful. Favorite was the Pad Kee Mao as it tasted great with just enough spice. Both dishes came with good sized portions and we're only about $8-9 each. Definitely  want to go back again.  Pretty fast service for to go, despite being packed.
author: Oscar J.

description:
Let me just say that this review is for THIS PARTICULAR LOCATION and is not a representation of any other King of Thai.  

So check this out:  If you are seated on the second floor, there's this room - back left corner.  The waitresses go in and out of this room to put away dishes and also to bring out extra silverware (forks/chopsticks/etc).  Ok standard, right?  WRONG MY FRIENDS!  I unfortunately was seated at the table near this "room".  Being nosy, I peeked in.  And EWW- this wasn't a second kitchen/kitchenette.  It was literally a closet/storage. They had unorganized piles of dirty/used plates on the floor, staggered around.  I didn't even see an inventory of clean utensils/plates which leads me to believe..... (I'm gagging)

Anyways - Love me some King of Thai (pad thai/pad se yew/yellow curry) BUT there is no way in hell that I'm coming back to this location.  No possible way.  Understandably, they're busy and have a quick turn around of customers- but EWW.  GAGG.
author: Deanna A.

description:
I have been going to this place for 2 years now and I NEVER had a bad experience:

This place is conveniently located; right downtown across from H&M on Powell street and the food is cheap, good and served quickly! 
They have 2 floors but usually you will be able to be seated downstairs...even when it is extremely busy they will always try to accomodate you ASAP...the food is good, no frills!

My personal recommendations:

-Panang Curry (peanut coconut flavor)
-Green Curry (spicy)
-and the Seafood Soup (light and high in protein)

these all range between 8 and 10 bucks (tax included) so you can't go wrong there
Another great thing is that this place stays open till 1 AM! you wont find a lot of other restaurant open this late around the union square area.

One pitfall: CASH only (but I think they just changed that recently if you are spending 25 bucks or more) Just to be on the safe side; bring cash! ;-)

However there is an ATM right in front of the restaurant- but be careful..this ATM charges you an arm and a leg for withdrawing money since it is a third party ATM. 
Walk one block down and make a left at body shop and there u will find A Wells Fargo ATM...Save yourself about 4 bucks for literally walking 20 seconds! ;-)

All by all: great cheap Thai Place and I will continue to spend my money there!
author: Achraf S.

description: Good food, good service at a good price. If your looking for a good quick Thai meal it 's a consistent experience. The service is outstanding and they get in in and out quickly.
author: Jeff C.

description: Nothing fancy but it's a good place to get a nice quick meal for a good price.  The service has always been good and the food comes out quick.  This place is no frills but it's quite tasty
author: Steven H.

description: I LOVE this place!  Been here several times and I have never been disappointed.  This place can get very crowded but it's worth the wait.  They also have an upstairs that seats about 10 tables or so and a dedicated waistaff to ensure their speediness is consistent.  Yes, their services are fast, courteous and their food is delicious, not to mention that their prices are very good.   If you love noodles, fried rice and thai food and you're in the area, definitely should check them out!
author: Kacee B.

description: I used to work in the area... this particular location is quick and easy, and SO CHEAP! An order of Thai Fried Rice w/ Beef and a Thai Iced Tea for about $11 is all I need from this place.
author: Jennifer A.

description: I've lost count at how many times I've eaten here in the past 3 months, its one of my favorite places, the lovely ladies are always so quick and greet you with a smile , get you iced water within seconds, come back swiftly to take your order, and before u can check your Facebook newsfeed the fresh hot delicious food is sitting in front of you, surrounded by great condiments, I've tried basically everything on the menu, everything is great, my fav, duck rice, yellow curry, the opening hours are great it doesn't matter what day or time you come here the quality and speed of service seems to be the same. this place is always packed. no wonder I'm sure there are plenty of returning customers. thanks to all the friendly beautiful thai ladies that make my dining experience so great. love it.
author: Jimmy L.

description: I feel like the dish was simplified for the demographics, but still damn good. Sometimes, just because something isn't authentic, doesn't mean it's bad. Recipes evolve. Something authentic wasn't always authentic to begin with. Authentic is a goal that each recipes wishes to be...meaning it's so good that the recipe is well spread and unchanged for many years. That's a good goal to have. I have a feeling their recipe will someday accomplish that. It's good stuff. Definitely ready for seconds and thirds and more!
author: Mr. T.

description: Came here for a team lunch and I ended up getting the Tofu Pra Ram. I guess I just wasn't that impressed by the menu -- nor the vegetarian options. The Tofu Pra Ram was good, a nice serving of tofu in peanut sauce, but that was it. That and a giant mound of rice, which I barely touched. I kind of wished they reduced the amount of rice and just added more tofu. Or veggies. It was okay overall though.
author: Shauna S.

description: This is awesome place and very authentic, good price too. I love the menu b/c it's in Thai also, haha. All the staffs are Thai and everyone is so friendly. Really like this place.
author: Suvida N.

description:
This King of Thai is part of a chain of King of Thai restaurants that serve quick, cheap, and warm Thai food for folks who usually finish off their nights after boozing, watching a movie, or doing something else.

This one is located near the shopping areas near Union Square, so folks who are hungry after shopping can chow down on their Pad Thai or Pad See Ew during lunch or have an early dinner. Since this spot is located near a few lounges and clubs in the area, a 12-1am meal is very convenient for them as well.

I see no issues with this place, though I've heard a few stories that would've surprise me if I ever encountered it myself. Overall, I'll return to this place whenever I'm in the area and in need of an affordable Thai meal.
author: Rob L.

description: Went here for date night with the boyfriend. Ordered the Tom Yum soup with coconut milk and another rice noodle dish. We were seated promptly with water and menus delivered quickly! It was extremely busy around 8pm on a Friday night but the food came to the table extra fast. The Tom Yum soup was really tasty. Tangy but creamy at the same time. I enjoyed the mushrooms and chicken in the simple soup. The noodle dish was really good too. I also ordered a Thai tea that was more on the tea side (I like that). The waitresses were tentative so a big plus with service. Bathroom was a bit dingy though. But otherwise, I really enjoyed my date night here :)
author: Christina N.

description: Horrible, inconsistent service--although their service is fast, the waiters generally lack good manners and communication skills. I think the food is not bad. But the place is crammed and customers gotta share tables or sit at a bar and leave as soon as they finish eating! Hectic and wild!!
author: Raymond F.

description: This was ok, tons of traffic makes it a great place to people watch.  The food is pretty good but not excellent! Had the panang chicken curry.
author: Alex W.

description: Food is good, especially the chicken satay.  The first time we ordered lunch for delivery it showed up after 2 hours.  The second time we ordered lunch for delivery it showed up after 2.5 hours.  It embarrassing when you host a business lunch and your clients leave before the food arrives.
author: Cynthia S.

description:
Nope.

Got seated quickly.  That was the plus.
Took the waitresses about 15 minutes to come and take our order.  It then took another thirty minutes for our order to arrive.  I tried to flag down the waitress, which she just looked at me and kept walking.   I asked another waitress for extra plates, which she returns with 2 bowls...she got it right the second time.  As we are eating, about five minutes in, they drop our bill on the table.  

Go to the other Thai restaurant around the corner.
author: Anthony W.

description:
I came here with two friends, having previously heard glowing reviews back in college.

In short, I was not disappointed in the slightest. It isn't the best Thai food I've had, but for the price ($30 between the three of us) and location (fairly close to Powell), the value is amazing. 

On to the food. I ordered roasted duck fried rice, while my friends ordered pineapple fried rice and roasted duck noodles (with egg noodles). 

The fried rice was competently done, but not a particular standout; the duck was definitely good, though I would've liked it more if the skin were crisper (but that's a specific preference, so easily overlooked).

The real standout of the meal was the roasted duck noodles. Predictably, for a place with 'noodle house' in the name, the noodles were, well, excellent. The broth was salty but not overpowering (and lightly refreshing) and the egg noodles were nice and chewy (as well as being delicious).

Asides from the food, the service was prompt and the server upstairs (where we were seated) was friendly.

All in all, definitely a good experience.
author: Benjamin L.

description:
Came here with a large group (20+) and we were seated upstairs.  This place is not fancy.  They leave all the chopsticks, napkins and peppers at each table (like pho restaurants). 

I ordered my usual pad thai.  This was better than I had expected.  You get a choice of shrimp or chicken and it's the same price.  I only got 3 small shrimp, but at least they didn't try to charge me $1 extra like other places.  What I liked: Noodles were chewy and didn't taste like ketchup.  The dish contains dry shrimp and lime juice (way better than that small lime wedge the give you).  Although not much, peanuts were mixed in there.

Service was friendly and relatively quick considering our large party.

I had to take one star away because one of the waiters was in the kitchen area picking his nose and then flicked it off his finger as we left the restaurant.  Gross.
author: Lorraine G.

description: Always Busy. Straight and simple Thai. Consistent all the time. Been coming here for years.Sorry, it took so long to review. If you are hungry for Comfort Thai your at the place. No Frills. For warned. you might need to wait to get seated. Then again, they are open till 3 AM.
author: J G.

description:
You can't beat this place for some good ol' standards like pad see ew after a few hours of shopping!   

For the portions and the prices, I thoroughly enjoy their pad see ew, thai fried rice, and other Thai standards.  I wouldn't come here for a nice Thai meal, but rather for an afternoon "snack" in between shopping or a late night "snack" after drinking :)
author: Marisa G.

description:
We came here on a whim post-Cherry Blossom Festival parade because we had an out of town friend already bopping around Union Square. Seriously, wow. Happy tummy.

The restaurant is rather narrow, but seats more people than I would expect. The three of us were given a table immediately. Food service also had the same speed, even though this place seemed to be moderately busy for 6pm on a Sunday.

We ordered the Street Noodles, Pumpkin Curry, Tom Yum and three mint lemonades. 

The Street Noodles had the right amount of punch to them, but weren't so hot that they would burn a hole in your mouth. They weren't too greasy either (a common problem with this guilty pleasure of mine). We had originally planned to split the curry and the noodles as two of us were torn, but I found my self zealously defending them after a few bites. 

The Pumpkin Curry had a smooth consistency and intriguing flavor. It didn't have the wow factor of the street noodles, but at this point I think I was biased. It did have a nice balance and was moderately spicy. My friend who ended up with it really enjoyed it and left nothing on her plate (which is a feat for her).

I didn't get to try the Tom Yum, but the bowl was huge! It smelled delicious and J. spent more time eating than talking, so I take this as a positive sign.

The star of the show was the mint lemonade. Think mojitos, but with lemonade instead of white rum. They proved to balance against our entrees perfectly. I will definitely be stealing this one for personal use.
author: Christina L.

description:
Walked up and this place was crazy busy. We put our name down and they said a 10 min wait. I did not believe them because it was so full and people were waiting outside. But to my surprise we only waited 5 minutes and they sat us upstairs. 
I ordered the special, BBQ pork over white rice and some egg rolls. Service was very fast, and the food came out hot. The servings were big and I barely finished my plate. The food was delicious and looking around at everyone else's tables it all looked good. I saw some good stuff to order next time.
The place is pretty small and the tables are close together  and the music they played was new Pop (Lady Gaga) stuff so I would not recommend this place for an intimate setting. But the food was delicous and the prices were a lot cheaper than I was expecting.
author: David G.

description:
I wanted to like King of Thai, I really did, but from a food perspective, it just didn't do it for me. The service was excellent - very attentive! But the beef panang curry was so not good for me, that I stopped eating it after my initial hunger pains were gone. As in, I left half on the plate, and explicitly declined the To-Go container. The sauce was flat, bland, and lacked all spice, in my opinion. Maybe a dull peanut taste? But no hint of any coconut, spice, etc. I much prefer the panang curry of Benjarong Thai (and many other Thai places) to here, as their curries are complex and have lots of flavor. This one at King of Thai was really quite awful. I'm sorry, but I have to be honest since panang curry is one of my staples. Again, great service.

p.s. I also didn't appreciate the "cash only" part. Apparently I didn't see the sign before venturing in. Sure, I had cash on me, but that's not the point. What if I didn't? Be warned.
author: Sally M.

description:
All of my friends have jumped on the Pho Noodle Bowl bandwagon long ago. I always wondered what the hell the fuss was about: big bowls of broth with some noodles, veggies and meat? If I wanted soup I'd go to Safeway and get a can of Campbell's.

I was wrong. WRONG. I tried the wonton and BBQ pork soup at King Thai Noodle House and was instantly a changed woman. The broth was was like nothing I've ever had. It had spices all up in there that I couldn't even identify. Whatever they were it was pure broth-y amazingness. The BBQ pork was an excellent addition and the long flat noodles and Asian broccoli (that I requested) all added to the tantalization of my taste buds.

I'm a believer. I am now officially riding first class on the bandwagon.
author: Julia N.

description:
Convienently located and many delicious dishes. Staff are magnificently attentive and quick. This particular visit was my first time and the waitress/supervisor named Boom was the most helpful and delightful person to discuss the menu. After her recommendations, we will be back several more times and I will bring some others from the office. 
Good value, excellent service and delicious authentic Thai food.
author: Michael A.

description:
The food always hits the spot. The service, considering they are so busy is Amazing!!!! Sometimes I think they know what I am going to order before I get there. It is quick and hot.

Very kid friendly,
author: R K.

description:
Somehow the food we had were just OK.

The papaya salad is great and fresh but somehow it was too spicy.

The pineapple fried rice only came with a few small pieces of pineapple and was plated with regular round shaped flat plate in contract to other more traditional Thai where fried rices was put inside of half pineapple shell.

The mushroom and coconut soup was too sweet to me.
author: Chun L.

description: Was at the apple store around the corner and called on Yelp for some help! Yelp to the rescue again! Love the feel of this place!  I wasn't a Thai food fan, but I might be now! Left my order in the servers hands, and she picked ground chicken with veggies.  I picked the right BART station to get off at!  Don't know this city, and I have hours to spare before my flight to Texas.
author: Chris S.

description:
This place is awesome for a quick meal during the day and not to mention you're getting more for your buck.  Everytime I go it's usually pretty crowded (during the day/weekend) but they always manage to get us seated pretty fast.  My boyfriend and I have been here twice already, it's usually our go-to place before we see a show at the Opera House. Our usual order consists of the pad thai (flat noodles) and the pumpkin curry-- both delicious!  The pad thai is great with chicken and although I'm not a pumpkin afficionado, this curry was amazing and had a spicy kick to it.  

The place is pretty casual and laid back--  everytime I go they have soccer on TV (can't argue with that).  The service is mediocre-- it took forever to get the check the first time we were there and it takes awhile to get your order in but perhaps only because the place can get pretty busy.  

Overall, great for lunch / casual date / rendezvous place and not to mention, walking distance to everything in Union Square.  Good service or not, the food is great and I would definitely go back just for the pad thai and curry!
author: Giselle A.

description:
Pad thai is always a winner, I would highly recommend it. I've never actually finished the entire plate of it. Its yummy and you get alot of it for the price of about $8. A couple times we got free Thai iced tea :]

On the downside, its always busy and a little squished but I've never had to wait too long for my food to arrive. 

King of Thai will always be my choice for some tasty thai food in the downtown area :)
author: Victoria N.

description:
Maybe it was because this was my first time eating Thai food.  Or maybe it was because I hadn't eaten for 8 hours and was starving.  Either way, I loved the food.

My friend and I shared pumpkin chicken curry and their special eggplant/chicken dish and both were delicious.  I couldn't get enough of that pumpkin curry sauce (I'm a sucker for anything with coconut milk in it).  The prices were very reasonable and I will definitely eat there again next time I'm in the city.
author: Misha G.

description:
My expectation was this would be like the one over in North Beach, but it was a tad more expensive and looked pretty plain.

If I were choose between the two, my recommendation is to go to the North Beach one.

Oh, I got the Salmon Curry, it was decently portioned for $9
author: Eric A.

description:
Yesterday, a friend and I were starving, and I suggested we go to this restaurant.
We ordered our food....the server returned and accidentally marked my orange jacket with her permanent black pen.  She said she was sorry.  I said sorry does not remove the mark from my jacket.  I said, I want to speak to the manager....she lied and said she was the manager.  I turned and walked up to the hostess, and told her what happened and would like my meal to be paid for.  She said, "this poor little girl told you she was sorry, and that is the best we can do."  I said, "No...I have worked in the restaurant business many years, and we would pay for people's dry cleaning when drinks were spilled on their clothing, but their meals, offer desserts....whatever it took to make them happy."  She said, I can give you and your friend two thai iced teas and 10 percent off your meal....I told her, I do not like Thai iced tea, (two thai iced teas cost $4...10 percent off would have been $2 more dollars...a total of 6 dolllars....my meal was 8.95.....The manger did not ask me what I had ordered...then got abrupt with me, and told me that that was the best they could do.  I told her, we are not eating her, and I want the owner's phone number.  She told me to call the restaurant number.  I called once...the person hung up on me.  The second time, she said she would give my phone number to the owner.
I will NEVER STEP FOOT IN ANY OF THESE RESTAURANTS AGAIN....this was the WORST management move I have ever heard.
If I do not hear from the owner, I will go to 7 On Your Side!
author: Patrick B.

description: This place is a all right, it's usually quick if you want something to eat and most of the time it's packed. Food is okay, size is like half the plate, price is more priced compared to other King Of Thai spots.
author: Jay K.

description: Awesome!! Open late night (til 3 am!)tasty grub! We were looking for somewhere to eat at 1:00am after a rockin phish show! We had the yellow curry with chx and potatoes (which were underdone) but the sauce was soo good it didn't even matter! We also had  the stir fried noodles, delicious and fast and our bill was $20 for 2 people!
author: Michelle O.

description:
This city is saturated with Thai restaurants. I would not recommend this place. The service wasn't very good and the food was below mediocre. I ordered this crispy noodle dish, but when I got it, it turned out to be like a soup. 

4 STARS for the restaurant: its pretty big and spacious. we liked the set up.

1  1/2 STARS for the food: not a fan. we've had better.
author: Cnn F.

description:
After searching low and high for a restaurant to eat at around the Union Square area, we landed here. The food is pretty oily, but tasty. Then again I could be bias because I was pretty hungry.

Cheap btw.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Meh, given the setting of this place, this is just really for the "quick bite to eat" when you're on the go in downtown SF and you don't necessary want to settle for the typical mall food inside Westfield or at the basement of Macy's.

We came here the other day for a late lunch - ordered roasted duck fried rice and a pad kee mao w/ chicken.  We preferred the fried rice over the pad kee mao.  At least w/ the rice dish, it was tasty with actual pieces of roasted duck.  The pad kee mao w/ chicken did not came with chicken at all, we *think* (or hope) it was ground pork...but regardless, it lacked spice & flavor.  I'd also realized that everytime we've came, their pad kee mao tastes different each time.  Not sure if I'll be coming back here...unless I'm really really desperate for a quick meal in the area...

Btw: they only take cash (which we weren't aware of until AFTER we ordered...) but there is an ATM machine located right outside the restaurant, although its service charge is $3.75.  Boo.  :P
author: Vivian W.

description: The food is always great!  I've had the pad Thai, prawn fried rice and pumpkin curry- all mouthwatering!  The only problem is that it is always crowded, so the service is not the best.  They come to get your order, and you see them again when the food is dropped.  At the end we tried to get someones attention to pay the bill, because no one was coming by.  Great lunch spot as the food comes out quick.
author: Rita W.

description: My favorite lunch spot!  The food is always delicious and the service is exceptional.  My once a week (sometimes twice!) lunch spot whether grab and go or sit and relax.
author: Joanie D.

description: Great spot for noodles, the pad see yew was Great so was Combo Noodle Beef Chicken Soup, Staff was super on top of it and food comes out quick......I will be back.
author: Michael S.

description: Open late, decent portions, good quality, decent prices.  Could sweep a touch more but it's not bad in this regard (it's a busy place).
author: Snow K.

description:
This review is for the UNION SQUARE LOCATION only. 

I went with 2 friends and they loved what they got- fried chicken over fried rice and spicy eggplant. i hated my "Tom Kha Gai" which was just coconut milk, broth, chicken and mushrooms. Nowhere to be found or tasted: kaffir lime leaf, galangal, lemongrass, chilies, or cilantro! Gross. 

Also, their menu is not $5 all the time like the North Beach location. Boooo.
author: Heidi J.

description:
The worst and I mean the worst Thai food I've ever had. Warm beer, and greasy, bland, tasteless food. Unacceptable in San Francisco. 
 I live near Clement Street and over the years have enjoyed eating at both King of Thai Noodle Houses there. I don't know what has happened or if it was an "off" night but I won't risk another try. Just terrible.
author: Ven F.

description: This is Thai, fast food style.  Given that, $9 out the door for a large bowl of roasted duck soup was a really good value. Sure beats the national fast food chains.  If you ambiance and elegance this is not the place.
author: Douglas K.

description: Yum, for a chain restaurant. Had the pumpkin curry, which was amazing. The sauce was creamy, spicy and great with the rice. My friend ordered a kee pao, which was good but there wasn't any meat. We shared everything, and the portions were perfect for two.
author: Eric L.

description:
I really like Thai food and King of Thai is my fave thai restaurant. I been there about 10 times and everytime it has been great! The server knows me and my boyfriend and they always talk to us and know what I order. I always order the same thing, Pad Thai with chicken :] It is pretty big and I am always really full after half of it. The Thai ice tea is my fave too and how can you not have pad thai without thai ice tea?! lol. Boyfriend got the beef stew noodle soup. It was really good too. I really like the soup, it is fill of favor!

It is pretty slow, I never saw it crowded before, so that is good so you do not have to wait in line :]
author: Melissa G.

description:
This is a perfect place to unwind and refuel while shopping in the Union Square area.   We dropped in there during a busy holiday shopping day recently and were quite pleased.

Although full, we waited just a few minutes for a seat. (Note: there is no real waiting area so you're clinging to the doorway.)  The staff (all in purple shirts) was plentiful and helpful.   One of our entrees came out very quickly  and the other 5 minutes later.  The food was good, but not amazing.   We had a Curry dish and a Pad See Ew on that trip.

Prices are very good, especially considering the location.  The purple walls are a pleasant break from the busy shops all around.  We left refreshed.
author: Diane K.

description:
I'm excited that they take credit card if you order $15 or more now!  YAY FINALLY!

This place has the worse service ever.  They try to rush me out of there all the time.  I've  never spent more than 40 minutes eating there I swear!!

Last week, I ordered duck noodles with Chinese broth and asked for flat rice noodles.  It was brought out with those yellow thin noodles so I told them it wasn't what I ordered (in case it was actually someone else's order or something) and the waitress told me that I should have ordered this kind of noodles anyway because it's how it's traditionally made and it tastes better blah blah it's her personal preference.  Thanks for telling me I have bad taste, betch!  The noodles taste better with flat rice noodles by the way.  The waitress was WRONG!!  

But damn it their duck fried rice and duck noodle soup is the best combo after a day shopping in SF.
author: Anna T.

description: Crab fried rice. Larb is refreshing. Close to Union Square. Usually busy on the weekends. They take reservations. We went ice skating, called over, and they were ready for us in 15 minutes.
author: Denise T.

description:
I was in SF for a few days and unsurprisingly enough, it was windy and cold in the evening.  I wanted some hot soup and there it was, a Thai noodle place!

My expectation wasn't high going in but I didn't think it was going to be a total disappointment, because the restaurant was crowded.  I quickly was seated and I ordered a roasted duck noodle soup with flat rice noodle and an order of egg roll.  Add a star here because they let you choose the kind of noodle you want from 4 different types of noodles.

Egg roll was under par.  It was hot and crispy but the stuffing didn't have much flavor.

The noodle soup was exactly what I wanted.  It was steaming hot, the broth was good and the duck was tender and flavorful.  An extra star here.

I went back the next evening and ordered the Kee Mao noodle with ground chicken.  I was disappointed with this dish for several reasons.  

First of all, they only make this noodle with ground meat, that is, if you want meat with it.  I'm not too crazy about ground meat, be it beef, chicken or pork.  I ordered it with chicken and told the waitress to make it "spicy."  She asked me if I really wanted it spicy and I assured her that's what I wanted and...

It wasn't spicy at all.  I mean, it didn't have any flavor at all, I must say.  It looked as if the chef just threw in some small pieces of vegetables like bell peppers and tomatoes with a few basil leaves and stir fried it with noodle.  And the ground chicken was the only ingredient that had any flavor that was 'salty'.

In spite of the disappointment I had with the egg roll and the Kee Mao noodle, I am giving this place a 4 star because they hit the nail on the head with the duck noodle soup.  

The service was friendly and quick.  They do take credit card if the total comes over $10. 

I am definitely going back in one of those chilly nights in San Francisco...
author: Phyllis K.

description: The fried chicken and the Thai iced tea is delicious, I get it every time.
author: Christina L.

description:
I think every King of Thai is different in the city, and trust me they are scattered around. My all time favorite King of Thai is the one on Taraval because their food is always consistent. However, at this location not so much...

I typically over number 30, fried chicken over fried rice, but I wanted to try #37, peanut chicken over steam rice.

My one of my friend did order number 30 and honestly there was a huge nasty amount of breading on the chicken. We ended up peeling the breaded part and just ate the plain chicken instead. The peanut chicken was ok, but the steam rice was under cook. I was very disappointed to be eating crunchy white jasmine rice... really? it's an Asian place, at least cook the rice properly.

The service was ok too. My other friend, the one that was extremely hungry, order the pad thai and it didn't come out until we were almost done eating number 30 and 37.

Plus no roti at this location.. lame~

I would definitely  NOT come back to this location.
author: Tina T.

description: quick service, decently priced. just in love with their pineapple fried rice..! will go again for sure!
author: Prafulla K.

description: Had lunch there today. I had the red curry with chicken. The family had pork fried rice and the pad Thai. Have to say they were all very good. Will def be going back again. Staff was nice and quick. For just stopping by with no plans, this was perfect (but ate too much).
author: Khim Y.

description:
I had to write a review for this one. I totally forgot about this, but I HAD to *this incident happened prior to my becoming a yelper, but its totally necessary to bring this up*

This place has great food. Yum. I mean, grrrreat. Its fast, cheap... why not come in here, right?

WELL. Let me tell you. No matter how freakin delicious that pad thai is/was.... looking down at the plate and seeing a little cockroach that had been sauteed to a crisp staring back at you doesn't do much for your appetite.... especially when it wasn't seen right after your first bite. 

You start wondering if any of his buddies made it in to the heaping forkfulls and perhaps went unnoticed with all the different textures going on in your mouth.

GROSS. I was so shocked. I didn't even make a big deal about it, I should've. I just called the lady over and pointed in disbelief. She told another lady, and of course they get a shocked look in their face and quietly tell me I won't need to pay. NO SHIT! I really deserved more than that, seriously. I'm sorry, eating bugs is cool for some cultures BUT NOT FOR ME, BUDDY. 

If you get one roach that gets noticed in one plate THAT'S ONE TOO MANY. Who knows what else they have going on back there. Its just gross. Needless to say, I've never been back. I DO NOT RECOMMEND EATING THERE, EVER.
author: Marcy F.

description: Based on high reviews from a coworker, I ordered fried chicken over fried rice for pick-up. Service was good but the food was bleh, just okay. The chicken was very dry & tough. Good thing the fried rice was seasoned well. Will give this restaurant another try, but I will definitely not order this again.
author: Rems S.

description: My friend loved the takeout beef noodle soup she got here, so we decided to give it a whirl. I ordered the Pad See Ew, and it was really greasy, bland and average. The chicken satay was ok though, and the $4 beer helped things. All in all, I still won't be back.
author: Orla M.

description:
Very good establishment, tables are tight and restaurant is very busy.  For it being San Francisco I would have expected top notch Thai, however this was just a notch above good. 
None the less, if you are in the area and can score a table I would give it a shot.
author: Thomas S.

description:
Ordered roast duck fried rice based on other people's review.
It tastes good but just doesn't look like the one on their menu picture.
The roast duck is mixed in the fried rice and not load of them.

Also ordered the TomYumGai soup, they were able to make a half order for me which was great, but not spicy or enough of lemon grass taste, you will have to add more by yourself.

Overall is good, they have seat for single person and accept major credit cards.
author: Allen A.

description: I came here with a friend on a week night and it was packed.  We had to share a table with a family.  The table was small and there were barely any room on the table besides two plate.  The portion was decent for the price we paid for because we didn't need a take out box.  They are very busy since the restaurant is right next to the malls and shops.  It can get quite cold if you sit near the door at night.  The waiters tend to be very busy assisting others, so you might need to raise your hands to get there attention.
author: Lee C.

description:
Too oily/heavy for me...

I have been there couple of times, when my friend and I cannot absolutely find anywhere else to go after working out and extremely hungry. 

After finding "Thai House Express" (My favorite Thai restaurant in town), I just don't really find this place very attractive. I mean this place is probably good for tourists, but not for me. Everything is too heavy and large in portion, so it is quite difficult to finish. 

One time they served Thai ice tea for free when the economy was really really bad (still bad, right?), so I thought it was nice. However, just in general, the place is always packed aka not a nice place to really site down and have a nice conversation while eating. 

Definitely, I know much better Thai food elsewhere.
author: Sayaha A.

description: The hostess "P", she wouldn't let me refer to her as anything else, was wearing an all black suit, and was clearly annoyed that my friend was bound to a wheelchair because it took up needed floor space. She didn't even try to fake it, she let a look of disgust overcome her and said anybody taking up space with a wheelchair needed to figure out a better place to put it! She later on I suggested that I couldn't make up my mind. I was dumbfounded. At this point I found myself shocked and my friend Nini, who has cerebral palsy, was livid. The hostess decided that it was time for us to leave once we had paid our bill. Now I have only positive things to say about the owner who was very friendly and put me at ease.
author: Susan O.

description:
This is THE place for lunch when I'm in the Union Square area. The Roast Duck Noodle Soup is my default choice as the broth is flavorful but is not overly MSG heavy. Lots of boneless roast duck and bits of caramelized garlic. I also tried the Rad Nar which was served with Chinese broccoli - Unusual since most Asian restaurants just dump a bunch of regular broccoli. Good but my undisputed champ remains the Roast Duck Noodle Soup.

I hadn't noticed it before but now they're offering FREE Thai iced coffee or tea so remember to get it!

Great food at a low price smack in the middle of Union Square, what's not to like?
author: Norman S.

description: Love the pad kee Mao and the Thai ice tea!!! You won't leave with an empty stomach.
author: Wendy K.

description:
King of Thai,

You are conveniently placed in union square. Other places in union square kinda suck, thank you for not sucking. You have good curries & stir fries. OO yeah.

I'm sorry, but I really don't like your.. soup. It blows, really. Obviously you aren't a good king of noodles. Watch out for the Bolsheviks. 

Thanks for the free ice tea,
Art
author: Artur R.

description:
Meh.  I met up with my friend Miyuki here a while ago.  I came a ways to get to SF and have dinner with someone I haven't seen in a long while, so I guess eating here was a bit of a let down.

The pad thai I had was just okay, but it was all stuck together in large clumps.  I thought it was alot when the plate arrived, but half of it ended up being cabbage and sprouts that took up a lot of space.

Price was reasonable, but they only take cash, so be prepared.  The location's very good if you want some casual sit down food while shopping at Union Square.  I think I would rather go down to the food court in the mall though.

Service was what really set me off on the negative side.  Whenever we asked for something, the girl helping us just kinda had this glaring, unhappy look like we asked her to shoot her dog or something.  We're just asking for a to go box and to refill our drink... I dunno.  A smile or an OK or any positive acknowledgment would have gone a long way.
author: alex C.

description: Their combination noodle soup reminds me of MBK food court in BKK. Yes, it's that authentic!!
author: Albert M.

description: King of Thai is actually my favorite place in Union Square for thai food. Affordable and delicious. The servers are friendly and the service is fast. I recommend the duck over rice if you're a duck fan but if not the traditional pad thai is great too. Most of the pricing is very affordable especially for me being a broke college student and all. It ranges from $6 - $10, depending on your dish. I really enjoy this place and I hope others do too. This is my go-to thai place.
author: Teresa N.

description:
My review as a vegetarian - skip this place if you can.

I have been here in the past  a couple of times before to try their vegetarian red & green curries. Not bad to mediocre for thai food. 

Today I decided to try their stir fried vegetarian noodles. The waitress was kind enough to ask whether I wanted to skip eggs & fish sauce. Great! 

The dish came and apart from the noodles, there was a little bit of tofu, corn & the only green was a sprinkling of basil. I would have enjoyed a few pieces of broccolli or carrot or any other vegetables. And the flavour of the noodles was nothing to write home about either. Anyway, I hardly ate anything, paid my bill and took off. 

There's not going to be a next time for me. But for the owners of this establishment, please put a little more effort into vegetarian requests- a vegetarian meal doesn't only mean the exclusion of meat, but it also involves perhaps an inclusion of a sprinkling of some vegetables like broccoli, carrots, peas, bok choy or whatever your imagination has failed you so far. 

Thanks for the bad experience. There's plenty of other Thai places for me to try in Union square. Time for me to venture out. Hope they're more veggie conscious.
author: Shaun A.

description: The Thai basil beef with egg noodle is the best.  This place rocks great service and very cheap prices.  Will be coming back very soon.
author: George E.

description: DON'T waste your time and money here! I mean it! Terrible service, food was beyond awful! Was so bad that at first me and my husband wasn't believing that they could serve such a bad food for people to eat. The table has everything but salt and napkins. We also noticed the dirty kitchen and dishes. Are you kidding me, put sugar in the table instead of salt or whatever to add more taste to the food? Even water is more flavorful then this, at the end we couldn't eat this, and they gave us the wrong change. Oh man... Never come back again!
author: Suzana B.

description:
Came here during peak lunch hour on a Saturday but we were able to get seated. Sat in the small corner near the front away from all the other tables but nonetheless still received good service.

Shared the Roasted Duck Curry $9.95 (I've been to Shana Thai in Mountain View and wanted to compare :D) and the Pad Kee Mao $7.75. 

Roasted Duck Curry: Wow. This was excellent! Large helping of rice to go along with the curry goodness! Packed with flavor, a little less sweet and a little more spice, but super delicious! Good portions of duck, vegetables, pineapples, bell peppers and sauce. Highly recommended!! It's on the front page of the menu under specials. Go. Get it. Eat it. And be HAPPY! 

Pad Kee Mao: I normally eat the Pad See Ew, but it's almost the same, except with a lot more ingredients. Lots of pieces of beef, vegetables and bell peppers and a large portion of the noodles. Pretty delicious. 

8.25% tax + 3% SF Health tax to bill. Besides that pretty attentive service despite the business of the restaurant. I would go again if I'm downtown :)
author: Wendy T.

description: Just went there to have a bowl of noodle soup.  I ordered the pork and fish balls with vermicelli.   The noodles tasted alright.   The texture was cooked right and the broth was light.  However I saw something gross happened (it's open kitchen).  The food preparer who wears plastic gloves was eating when she was working (handling noodles and food ingredients).  She looked around first and put food in her mouth.  When she did it the second time she caught me watching her and she stopped.  I was thinking about my noodles I just ate that she handle.  Yuck!   Not going back.
author: Sfscubaman T.

description:
It's not Thai food, it's Thai-Chinese food. The curry was okay. I ordered Panag curry, but it came in a huge bowl of curry sauce; Panag is a dry red curry. The beef was questionably thin and grisley. It would be good for a post-bar late night snack. 

Service is super fast, but far from friendly.
author: Shirley L.

description:
Came here for many time and never have time to write anything about their food. So, after the Giants game on Tuesday night against the Dodger. We came out on TOP of 9 with 3-2 LA. Knowingly, they not going to win, so we went to have some noodle before we head back home. 

The food and the service is fast here. I believe it's only took us about 15 mins to finish our late night noodle. They open till late, so if you're hungry, be sure to stop by at the king of Thai noodle house for late night snack or dinner. I have to give this place a 4 star for fast and great food.
author: Chris S.

description:
I asked a Wells Fargo Banker around the corner if he knew of a good Thai place. He recommended this one to me. 

The food came out fast, the service was prompt (sometimes too prompt because I didn't even finish my food yet and they wanted to take my dish away).  I would look up and waitress will be alert and head towards my way.  

I got the half Tom Yum Soup ($4.00). Just ask for it.  Also the Pad Thai (4 pieces of small shrimp).

Across the street from H&M and hidden from tourists.
author: Jboogie L.

description:
This is the fourth "King of Thai" I have been to. All the locations are pretty solid, but they are all a little bit different (menu items seem to change with location). The best part of this location is that the owners are running a recession special where everyone can get a free Thai Iced Tea or hot tea for free! My friend almost jumped out of his chair with glee when he realized this deal. I have a feeling they could have served him a rubber shoe on a plate and he would have loved it because of the free Thai Iced Tea. 

Anyway, aside from the free tea, King of Thai did not disappoint. I had the pad see ew with tofu and it was delicious and huge - I could not finished it. My friend had the yellow curry with special garlic/ginger rice. The food was solid and the portions are giant. Free Thai Iced Tea was the icing on the cake. Great choice when you need a break from shopping around Union Square.  Oh, don't forget these guys are cash only.
author: Dana H.

description: Thai Noodle house is not fancy restaurant, but their food is delicious! You can choose meat for curry. We chose green curry with beef. It is nice place to chat with close female friends.
author: Kyoko T.

description:
I think a lot of people don't know that I really like thai food aside from my vegan indulgences and whatnot. I came here with my friend and luckily they had this special where they gave out free thai milk tea! FREE! As I was looking on the menu, I noticed they had a good amount of vegetarian options! I ended up ordering the vegetarian curry which was really tasty! My friend got fried rice which wasn't too bad either! Another thing is that they get really busy so we ended up sitting all the way in this like secret corner / in the back. It was peaceful though and somewhat less noisy. The customer service was pretty good too, they were also nice which is always a plus. All in all, everything was good. Especially the check, because the prices are pretty reasonable . 

YAY for leaving with money in my wallet! :D
author: Susie N.

description: Restaurant was warm and clean.  Cold day in sf.  Service was fast and friendly.  Crowded.  Good sign.  Extremely fast service.  The panang curry was spicy.  Cooked to perfection.   Veggie tom kha not well balanced.  Needed more ginger and lemon grass
author: Greg K.

description:
After hearing the wait time at the cheesecake factory, me and the GF decided to go out walking to find a place to eat. I know she likes thai food so we stopped into here. This place is pretty big for a hole in the wall. First thing I noticed was that this place was cash only. Good thing I had some, because I normally roll with only my atm card. 

They had signs everywhere noting how bad the economy was. Free thai milk tea for everyone! yay! I was pretty good. I wish I could add some boba pearls into it. I had the beef ball soup. The portion would be described as a large at some pho places. Lots of noodles and broth, not a lot of beef balls. The flavor reminded me of bun bo hue.
author: chris c.

description:
The quality is more suitable for fast food than restaurant.  I was really disappointed and will not eat here again.

Here is what I ordered.

* Fish cake - way too salty 
* Duck in red curry sauce - tastes ok
* Pad thai - the sauce is way to powerful for the dish. 

For over $30 dollars, I rather eat somewhere else.
author: Yvonne L.

description:
After walking around Union Square and SF Center for a few hours, I had built up a huge appetite. My wife and I passed King of Thai a couple times before finally deciding to circle back and give it a try.

I was impressed with the service and the decor of the venue. Very Thai! Lots of purple, including the polo shirts the staff was wearing.

I was surprised to see so many varieties of noodles on the menu. Many of the dishes I had previously thought were strictly Chinese, such as Egg Noodles with Chicken or Duck. I went ahead and ordered the Egg Noodles with BBQ Pork. The noodles were great, fresh, and the service was huge. I was definitely satisfied after this meal. We also ordered some Chicken Satay to start which was honestly the best Satay ever.
author: Eladio S.

description: Can't go wrong with the Phad Thai at this place!  It gets packed for dinner so be patient it's not a big place.  Don't expect 5 star service it is a hole in the wall Thai restaurant which are always the best kinds!
author: Ferdmeister V.

description:
am i really giving out a 5 star? yesssssss!

good location, quick service, GREAT FOOD, inexpensive. 1 star each. and one star for i had fun people watching as we were seated right by the door. lol

i'm a fan of pad see ew, so i always order it every time i try out a new Thai place. and i have to say, the pad see ew here was the best, hands down. i normally can never finish the whole plate by myself, but here i did. it was a big portion too. i was one SATISFIED fatty. no shame.
author: Anh L.

description:
Growing up Asian, my dearest mother had a little glass jar next to her "salt" and other spices that was simply and humbly labeled "MSG."  At home, we do not use it as liberally as the Americans do, thus MSG-poisoning was never something that I feared, experienced, or even really knew about.  

OK, people.  Listen up.  It's not like salt, it should not be used as salt, and MSG related headache reports started when some brilliant scientist in the US cultured bacteria for the requisite composite instead of harvesting it naturally from seaweed.  Natural = good.  Cheap, bacterial substitutes = death.

I ordered the drunken noodles with chicken.  It came out really really quick.  Oh right, there was Free Thai Iced tea that day because the economy is so suck.  Anyways, back to the noodles.  I ate it.  It was really really salty.  I walked to school.  When I get done doing something in the library, I was slammed with the worst MSG headache ever.  EVER.  

Quite literally it went like this: I was typing, i was browsing the web, and WHAM.  My head was down on the table across my splayed arms, my tongue hanging out like some uncultured bull dog, and I was DROOLING on my shirt sleeve.  I woke up 45 mins later, like I had been drugged.  Because i had.  This has never happened before except for one time in Oakland's china town.  And it felt just as alarming to go from Able-Bodied to Passed-out coma.  I didn't even finish the plate of noodles bc it was so salty so i know it was not pure food coma.  

What was it?  A reality check to not eat out Asian food unless you really trust it.  I had to eat 2 cream puffs after this just to feel right again.  heh.  forced to eat.
author: Christina C.

description: The food is ok. But hey, this is a restaurant that serving main dishes first then appetizers. But I love their spaghetti! Bring it back! I bring it back too the free Thai Ice tea!
author: Calvin Nicholei L.

description: Good food, good prices, good location if you work downtown or visiting. Better than most of the other Thai places close by and the staff is friendly!
author: nabil s.

description:
This King of Thai Noodle is the best in town: the portions are bigger and they have way more choice in their menu than e.g. the King of Thai Noodle at Grant Ave, SF.
I love the place because the service is quick, the food is delicious and if you order their soups, you will be amazed by how LARGE the bowl is. It is enough to share for 2-3 people and especially the Chicken Noodle Soup is the ideal hangover cure after some serious party action :)

I have tried so many dishes there already and can't get enough! If you like Asian food, you will like King of Thai Noodle, because it has low prices and you know that you get yummy food!

Also try the Thai Ice Tea, it is super delicious, and unique: but be advised, alone the ice tea is enough to fill your hungry stomach :)
author: Kat G.

description: The food was not bad, once it arrived. I think the issue with this place is logistics, for the most part. Meals seems to come out as they are prepared, with no apparent need to coordinate meals at a single table. The servers don't seem to have assigned sections, so meals may be delivered to one table by two or three different severs. Since no server has ownership over a single table, no one will notice when the kitchen forgets a meal. A little organization would work wonders here.
author: Aline S.

description:
The boy and I come here every time we're in SF, particularly in the Union Square area. Portions are generous in size and low in price. Food is hot, delicious, and it comes quickly. What more could you want? 

(Dishes we normally get: Pad See Ew, Pad Thai, various Fried Rices, Pad Kee Mow. Can't go wrong with any of them. Thai iced tea is good too!)
author: Namita D.

description:
A busy busy place hidden in one of the streets in San Francisco downtown.It almost looks like a diner place.

  It's always buzzing with people and waiter's trying to take the hot plates of food to the tables as soon as possible.The food is fine,ordered some noodles and tofu with vegetables.

  The food definitely needs more spice and flavor.It was kind of bland until i added  a large amount of hot sauce and did burn my tongue after that horrible idea. But if you want some quick decent food,then this is a choice.

 Ahmm.."KING of thai Noodles"??
Maybe this was true in the the 15th Century. I do think the name should reflect the food quality :)

-Smriti
author: Smriti K.

description:
Great food, great selection of meat and veggie dishes. Not as spicy as I would normally like thai food, but it works. I like my food spicy.

For a limited time they offer a free...thats right i said FREE, iced thai tea, iced off, or hot tea. With any dine in order. 

Bring cash, cause you'll need it. CASH ONLY!
author: Al J.

description: Busy little spot. Good food. Eggplant with Chicken is my favorite. Food is a good portion. I'd like to come back and try the noodles. They looked amazing. Service was quick and tidy.
author: Charlene K.

description: Cheap, kinda dingy, pretty good thai noodles.
author: Michael E.

description: the best pad Thai I've tasted in the city. reasonable prices. the waiters are nice but if its busy they tend to forget what you ordered.
author: Antoinette W.

description:
Took my date to this place since I know she likes Thai.

Easy to get a seat on a Thursday at 7pm, BUT, it was like sitting at a table for 4 with 2 other people you don't know.   Way too close to the others.  Plus the table was crowded with utensils and hot sauces.

Ordered our food.  No idea of the name of hte dish we had, but some wide-noodle Thai with chicken and vegetables some beef curry and some chicken and mushroom soup.

The food arrived within 3-4 minutes of ordering it.  No kidding.  It was that quick.  And our already-packed table was now overflowing.  We were trying to figure out how to get things situated so we could actually eat!

Soup came later and the guy made it fit on the table, but we couldn't eat it since there was no room for the bowl.  Eventually we consolidated plates and ate the soup.

Beef curry was just OK.  The soup and the other wide noodle dish was outstanding!

They cleared the plates, the bill came immediately and that was that.  We were on our way by 7:35 or so.

Be sure to bring cash.  No credit cards accepted.  But for a Union Square meal $25 was great!  And very happy with the food.
author: Todd M.

description:
Somewhere in the middle...King of Thai was that place between my friends' office and mine.  

Got there around 12 and it wasn't as crowded as I thought it would be.  It was a normal work day crowd...we ordered Green  Curry w/Chicken, Pad See Ew w/Chicken and Roast Duck Fried Rice - split btwn 3 people.  Meal was decent...and we got FREE Iced Coffee and  Thai Iced Tea...the sign said "Due to the economy..." =)  Which was great...plus it's far enough from work to walk off some of the consumed calories!
author: Christine C.

description:
One myth about the practice of tipping is that it is more than a city in China. This has actually been proven true. Another myth is that the word, the "tip," is an acronym. Tip = To Insure Promptness. This has been largely debunked. As most folks on Yelp can attest, the quickness of service at a restaurant is just one aspect factored into a tip. 

If it was the only one, then King of Thai's servers would deserve 20% tips each time, no question. They are perpetually oiled and charged machines with the power to seat you, plunk your food in front of you, and present you with the bill in under half an hour, not an easy feat in such a high-traffic area as Union Square. You can't expect very much of a machine, right? Certainly not extended eye contact or kindly pleasantries about your general state of being. I can live without those, really. I know the restaurant is busy and will continue to be busy, so there's no time to pamper my tourist-ish ass. But my water glass was touched twice throughout the meal - once when it was filled at the start and again, presumably, when the table was bussed. Add that to the brusque style of service, and I just don't see why anyone would expect any more than a strict 15% tip.

It's a shame since the food is quite good. Fried rice with duck and kee mao were ordered, and both had just the right combinations of grease and flavor. Maybe I shouldn't really disparage one of the few cheap and fast options that isn't Jack in a Box in Union Square, which is not an area traditionally known for exemplary customer service anyway. But I ate here at the end of my stay in San Francheesy, we tipped 20% because we were in a hurry and felt like we had no other choices, and it makes me miss the extra bills floating around my purse.
author: Kimberly V.

description: Ok I admit I was a little drunk coming here, but I didn't black out, so I think it's safe to trust this review. We came in as a party of 6 typical drunk 20-somethings coming from a night of partying at Vessel and the servers were still super nice. That was a pleasant surprise since I'd imagine it takes a whole lot of patience to deal with hungry drunk people all night. The servers were very accommodating-- they seated us at a table as soon as one was ready even though we were getting situated at the counter. Also, our waiter even split our bills without us asking. I never thought the smoothest transaction I experienced would be when everyone was drunk. But anyway, our orders were taken promptly and food came out pretty fast. I enjoyed my pad see ew and I think my friends enjoyed their food too because they finished most if not all of it-- can't really go wrong with Thai food IMO. I would definitely come back here again after a night out since it's open til 3am!
author: Stephanie G.

description: I have been here about 5 or 6 times and this place is always crowded. Its a really small place and some really good thai food. I love their pan fried noodles. They bring the food pretty fast so you wont be waiting for your food. Good place to grab lunch with friends even on a weekday. You can be sure to be out of here in less than an hour.
author: Anand G.

description: This place is always packed, surprisingly I rarely see a very long wait of people at the door.  The turn around is pretty fast. I only have an hour lunch hour and I never am rushed for time when I come here.  I never wait longer than 5 minutes for my food, and I never have to ask for the check.  My favorites are the Pad See Yue with ground pork..I usually add a lot of hot sauce and peanuts to it, but for the most part it is really good.  The service is always fast and friendly, they are very efficient here. My friends always make a face when I say I like King of Thai....I know they have places all over and they are a chain...but unlike Chilis, Chevys, or other Chain restaurants this place has consistently good food, and I think that is why they successfully have so many restaurants.
author: Charla M.

description: The food is good and the service is fast. This is the second king of Thai noodle I've been to in the city and for some reason the north beach location is much cheaper, despite having the same owner. Either way expect the food to be standard fare. Pad Thai, noodle soup, none will leave you with a bad taste or the least bit hungry. Portion sizes are amazing. Good bang for your buck. Never a bad idea. Number 12, the combo seafood noodle soup, with egg noodles, is a good, healthy lunch.
author: Alexander S.

description: It's quick, cheap, and good. It's also oily, heavy, and way too loud. If you want something fast, and you are craving a thai rice dish, and you don't want to walk two or three blocks more then go here.
author: Theresa D.

description: I have not tried the other locations but this is as close as it gets to authentic street Thai food. Their Pad-see-ew and pad-kee-mow are so delish that you feel like you are dining at a street food vendor in Bangkok.
author: Shal S.

description:
Sure King of Thai probably doesn't obey food safety regulations, and they probably annoy many for being cash only.  But, sometimes I just want quick affordable Thai food, without the ambiance and frills. After a long day of shopping, I just want to sit down and eat some noodles smothered in peanut sauce and slices of meat.  That's the only dish I love here. Everything else is so so. The pineapple fried rice, pad Thai and curries are acceptably good but not amazing.  

I enjoy watching tourists walk by/into this haphazard Asian eatery.  Their confused expressions of "why is this dirty little Asian place so crowded?" followed by "what is Thai food?".  Always entertaining.
author: Christine N.

description:
My friend a Borat, he say "Velllllly niiiiice. I liiiiiike."

Um yes. 

I've been here before and had a decent experience. I walk up to the door this time and see a sign. The jist of it: "Save your money. The first thai iced tea, iced coffee or hot tea is on us."

Dude.

That in and of itself deserves a good rating. Good mojo begets good ratings. And the food was good too. Five of us paid $13 each (tax and tip included) to split two orders of rice, penang curry (a tad spicy), pad thai, spicy eggplant (which to my pleasant surprise wasn't spicy at all...I dislike spicy), a pork fried rice and one last noodle dish. Plus thai iced teas all around.

Way to make Thai food cheap and delicious. Now if you can avoid going the route of Osha Thai (charging like $13 for noodles and providing uncomfortable modern furniture) and becoming a pretentious homing beacon for arrogant, rich punks, then you will continue to be THE place for Thai.

p.s. CASH ONLY! Do NOT come in with cards! And the Ellis O'Farrell garage is right across the street. Cheers!
author: Aaron F.

description: Food comes out fast and prices are affordable for Union Square.  Dishes are tasty and never disappoint.
author: Dee H.

description: If you're in a hurry and craving Thai food around union square, then you might like this place. It's quick, good and price is reasonable. Pho soup are better than what I usually get at a pho restaurant. Small place but doable.
author: Elms M.

description: A good place in Union Square that doesn't have inflated tourist prices. The place was packed (a good sign). The Panang Curry is quite good.
author: Paul L.

description: Came in here yesterday with my coworkers. I didn't really like it. They brought everyone's food out at different times which I though was random. The waitstaff was very friendly and helpful but the food was whatever.
author: Nava N.

description:
When nothing else is open and you're craving cheap Asian food late night, this is a good place to go to. Other than that, I would say the food quality is... Meh... not that great... 

We had the tum yum soup which was sour (the way it's suppose to be) with overcooked chicken breast (which made it really dry)... also had the pad thai.. the noodles were pretty soggy... egg rolls which were dry and not much flavor... 

It is super cheap tho... beware of the oily tho.. it's super oily.. eek!
author: Cynthia C.

description: Good, CHEAP food. Conveinent location and fast service.  One of the few places downtown that you can do dinner under $15 in SF.
author: Vanessa Y.

description:
DISCLAIMER: The free ice Thai coffee is only when dining in! I got a pad see ew order to go and was DENIED the free drink! Boo... 

Anyhow, this place is pretty darn good! Yummy and cheap food makes me super happy. This is the perfect location to grab a quick bite to eat if you're shopping in Union Square or satisfy that late night craving after clubbing!  I've been to about 3 other KoTNH locations and this is by far the best one...

CASH MONEY ONLY!
author: Luz D.

description: Love the service.  The food is great, I've been to Bangkok and other places in Thailand and the food is as close as it will ever get to authentic.  It really brings back memory of being back in Bangkok.  You must try the Rad Nar.
author: Bob S.

description: Its just ok, simple place simple food simple price. Good location if you are in city center
author: Patrik D.

description: Been here twice. Service is great even though they brought us the wrong food when I went with my parents; that's why they don't get full stars. :/  It's always really busy but they seated us and gave us our food quickly. My Pad Thai was delicious and my older sister likes their yellow curry. For three people, we spent less than thirty dollars so it's pretty cheap i guess.
author: Kyrstine A.

description:
Given the price and location, the food here is surprisingly good.  I've come here a few times when the noodle-craving kicks in mid-shopping spree.  Their thai noodle dishes and soups are tasty, but there curries are rather unflavorful.

that being said, there are two things I can't get over.  First off, they don't take credit cards.  And the ATM machine outside charges $3.75 for withdraws.  Robbery!

Second, this place is DIRTY.  It's as if they tried to emulate the dirty streets outside.  The floors, the walls, the tables, the bathrooms--- all in need of a good scrub.  And if this is how they keep the areas visible to guests, I can't imagine how they keep the kitchen.
author: Zuzzi E.

description:
Do not consider coming here if you are meeting up with 4 other people - a table for 5 is a huge issue here, and I wish my friends had considered that before one by one we came in to meet.  We would have gone elsewhere but were running late for a show across the street.

I had a vegetarian fried rice noodle plate which killed my stomach later that night - probably due to the heaviness of the sauce and the lack of vegetables on top.

I am giving K o' T 2 stars for being patient with us (while we 5 squeezed into a 4-seat table) and for the speed and service.
author: Karen K.

description:
I must've been Thai in another life because I can't get enough of Thai food--even the just decent stuff! Greasy good Pad Thai, washed down with  a Thai iced tea, is my crack of choice.

My friend and I got that and the Pineapple Fried Rice. The Pad Thai was delicious--sweet, salty, sour, with a hint of spice. It came out piping hot, drowning in sauce, and in literally five minutes or so--just the way I happen to like it. The Pineapple Fried Rice was a big letdown, though. It wasn't fried rice but curried rice with canned pineapples and frozen chicken. Never again.

If it weren't for the fried rice, I would've given this place four stars for the good Pad Thai, great Thai iced tea, and speedy service. I'll be back to stuff myself with other dishes.
author: Liz T.

description:
This is a good place to grab a quick dinner before hitting the town. Inexpensive, fast service, big portions and tasty Thai dishes.

Based on this, they should be getting 3 stars from me. They just had to spoil it by leaving a big piece of egg shell in my roast duck fried rice. ARGH! I didn't make a big deal about it though. I just picked it out and continued eating. At least it wasn't a cockroach or some other nasty object. Luckily, I was looking at each forkful before I put it in my mouth. Otherwise I could have choked on that sucker. Oh well. Just remember to look before you bite!
author: Connie C.

description:
Fast service, super crowded, but super good. 

I come to this location strictly for the bbq pork noodle soup.  I've had it at the bigger, more spacious location on 5th Street and it's just not the same.  There's just something about the broth and the way they season the pork here especially that makes it much more satisfying than the EXACT same dish at the other location.  

So to get my fix, I have to deal with the fact this place is cash only, and it's always packed.  But the service is pretty good for such a busy location, and the food comes out super quick.  

There's also a promotion going on right now that you can get a free thai ice tea, hot tea or another drink (I want to say coffee for some reason) with your meal.  Nice!
author: Charlotte M.

description:
CASH ONLY!!!!!

King of Thai definitely was not what I remembered.  I remember eating here, and thinking, "This is really good..."  Those days are long gone.  I don't know if it's my improved palette (and possibly sober palette), but it's not as outstanding as it once was.  

Don't get me wrong, the food here is still good...but not like what I remembered.  If Yelp was around four yrs ago, I think I would've given all KoT's five stars...but today, I think it only deserves a three.

Had the Pad Thai, and gf, Anhie T., ordered Pad Kee Mow.  Not bad, but again, not outstanding.  The portions were big enough for even me!  The chili's peppers in the vinegar, were not spicy at all.  Weird considering they were teeny (and those are usually the spiciest!).  The Thai Ice Tea is always good.  I don't think I have ever had a bad Thai Ice Tea.  

Service was above average as I never (not once) had to ask for a refill on my water!  They did mess up on my friend Dave Y.'s order...but I think it was him that confused the waitress.  They immediately took the order back and made him the correct one.

If you're looking for a late night meal after X'mas shopping, this one is definitely a good place to stop at.  Good size portions and cheap prices makes it "A-OK" in my book!
author: Daniel M.

description:
King of Thai Noodle house is pretty good food in a very busy atmosphere. The pad thai is very good, incredibly greasy and contains very tasty nuggets of tofu. The Panang Curry is also a good curry sauce, but the chicken was a little overcooked and dry. All I can say about the Spicy Seafood Salad is avoid it at all costs, it tasted awful, that bad fishy taste that makes you worry about food poisoning, and will make you think twice about ordering any seafood in the place. I think I will certainly avoid any seafood in this place, but I will be going back to try some of the amazing looking noodle soups which I saw other patrons had ordered as i left. 

Overall good value for money, good food if it's not fish :-)
author: Karl L.

description:
I hope I can give this place ZERO stars for all the sickness they have brought upon my person as well as my friends. I got sick after eating a vegetarian dish in this joint. Let me put it this way, my stomach started to act up.Heavy gastric Flux, ya know?I didn't think too much about it. I do have the stomach of a goat and consume edible food with all due haste. I figured -'Probably vaccuumed it down too lickety-split.- then she,starts to wimper and moan clutching her belly. I figure Spanish people have no EXP.with the Thai so maybe it's a cultural thing. See how I am? I try to give that place every consideration because they are in my neighborhood. I try to be neighborly... BUT THEY WOULDN'T LET ME! 

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
***********************************************************************
Can you tell I retracted a statement here?  9.5.2007 10:30pm PST
************************************************************************
+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Couple Days later: Rats! Rats running everywhere. Through the walls!
Out of their cellar! The workers of King of Thai Noodle House right here on O'Farrell, were starting to get word of this local outbreak of medical emergencies so they RAT BOMB the joint and then the local hotel industry has to deal with the overflow of rodents. (BTW- do you think they took the time to clean the veggies before you and your visiting family members went to that 'cute little Thai place in Union Square'?)
Think about it
breathe...
Think about it
author: PM P.

description:
Great food, good prices, good atmosphere, and most importantly....
Three of the hottest Thai girls ive seen since ....Ever.. I go there just to watch them  as I eat some warm sexy food and as I watch hot sexy girls running around making me  all... Sheeeeeet.
author: Jimmy K.

description:
I like King of Thai because they're quick and the food is not bad. Food comes out after 5-10 minutes of ordering. However, out of all the KoT's I've been to, this one is my least favorite. Compared to the others, the food here seems like it was cooked in big batches by a machine; i.e., it's sometimes a bit bland. Still, the food is good. And is it just me or is the #1 qualification for getting a waitressing job here to be good looking? :)

Can't ever go wrong with pad see ew. JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description:
I can never remember the name of this place, so I haven't gotten around to reviewing until now. But it's a tradition for my best friend and I to eat here every time we're both in the city. Bottom line is I've been here about a gazillion times.

Apparently all I had to do to find this place on Yelp was to Google "purple Thai restaurant San Francisco." Go figure.

The food is pretty freaking good. I'm not sure if that's because I'm always monstrously hungry when I come here, but I've never left unsatisfied. 

Pad thai tends to be pretty standard from restaurant to restuarant, but this place makes it particularly well. Standard flavoring, but perfectly cooked noodles, and crisp fresh vegetables set it apart from mediocrity.

The curry chicken is delicious too. They use textured vegetable peelers or something, because the potatoes chunks have little stripey patterns on them. I like that because the little groovey grooves pick up more sauce.

Portions are on the larger side of average. The service isn't awesome, but they're always prompt and very efficient. Like... super efficient. As in "place your order and get your food in five minutes or less" efficient. So I feel like that kind of makes up for the not-so-smiley faces.

And the whole damn place is freakin royal purple.
author: Jen W.

description: Yum, pumpkin curry w/tofu. Perfect lunch. Just wish they had brown rice.
author: Amber S.

description: I love love the Thai food here! Definitely the King!!!
author: Tina F.

description:
I don't know if it was just a bad day to go eat at King of Thai (a Saturday night in December)...but I don't think I will ever go back to this location again.

This King of Thai is located in the hustle bustle of Union Square, right by Macy's. My friend and I were seated promptly, but then we were rushed by the servers to get our orders in. With the rushed atmosphere, I would have thought they would have served us our food promptly as well.

No, I was really really wrong. We sat there for quite awhile waiting for our food. Luckily we were in relatively good spirits being fangirls about Dir en grey...but still, we were STARVING, and they didn't bring us our food until a lot later.
