The food = mediocre. Greasy, my vegetables were a bit undercooked, and in general, the atmosphere/bad service ruined the flavors of the meal. It was not worth the $8 at all.

Oh yes, then the servers decided that they would then try to rush us out of the restaurant, even while we were still eating! I think I would have been happier if they had just plain told us, "Please finish eating because we're trying to seat more customers." Instead of course, the servers just beat around the bush and assumed that we would know to hurry up. To make matters worse, there was a group of people hovering over our table that pretty much forced us to get up and go reluctantly.

I will not be back to this location ever. Come here only if you are really desperate for "Thai" food and feel like getting rushed out of the restaurant. Really, though, there are much better places to go to and have your Thai cravings satisfied (i.e., Thai House Express on Geary/Larkin; take that extra 10 minutes to ride the 38 to get good food AND quality service).
author: Helene K.

description:
I love this place!! its cheap, fast service, and the waitresses are so friendly.. It can be a little crowded at times, but, if you are tired walking and hungry to the point of dizziness after shopping and LOVE Asian rice, this is the place to go.. I love their fried chicken over fried rice and have tried other dishes too..they are GOOD...

update 12/4/06:: i have been really disappointed with the quality of the food lately. It seems like they dont really care how to cook the food anymore.The last two times i was there, the fried chicken wasnt crispy and the fried rice was a little soggy.  its not as good anymore. i'm so sad.. :*(
author: Iche S.

description: I'm just getting over a stomach virus...the details of which I will spare you all here. I asked a co-worker where I could get some hot thai soup...and wallah! King of Thai Noodle House was his suggestion. And for only 7 bucks...I ran over there. So many choices, hot and tasty. Thanks Andrew C.! I'm planning on earning a badge or 2 from this place. Yum.
author: Rachel W.

description: Have been here several times. The place is great for quick dinner or lunch but is often packed (good sign I guess). The service is good and very fast. I normally get one of the noodle soups and it come very quickly.
author: Brian S.

description: Nice place when you already drunk after too much drink at the bars around this place, service so fast and the foods are good
author: Marsaulina V.S V.

description: I craved noodles and found this little gem. I had the duck noodle soup, which was excellent: a rich, tasty herbal broth (albeit a little salty for my taste), loaded with duck, noodles and vegetables. And all this for only $8! Service was good and the food arrived very fast. It was a huge portion that kept me going all day. Great place to go ahead of a long day of sightseeing. It has a nice, casual, but artsy atmosphere.
author: Terje D.

description: The fiancee and I went here after we had our haircut done at a nearby salon yesterday.  I felt relieved that we were immediately seated after a few minutes. Since I've eaten here a couple of times ordering the same noodle dish so it wouldn't hurt to try the other food on the menu.  We both ordered rice plates and appetizer.  While waiting, we noticed the award hanging on the wall, as the Best Thai Restaurant in SF. I assumed that their food must be really good.  25 minutes had passed when they served first the order of my fiancee.  Then another 15 minutes waiting time for my rice plate and the appetizer (which came last).  His plate was already cold so he asked if they could reheat it. 10 more minutes waiting time before we finally started eating.  Food isn't really that good.  Their system was a bit messed up.  I can't help but to wonder why they were given an award as the Best Thai Restaurant in SF 2012.  But I assure you, it's not from Yelp. So next time you are in Powell St. and craves for Thai food just head to Bangkok Restaurant instead or go to Westfield Mall food court.
author: Kit P.

description:
It's ok, you can call it the PURPLE PLACE!   :)

Good enough to make it a regular stop during lunch. I don't expect much from this place (or any Thai restaurant for that matter), but sometimes I'm pleasantly surprised by trying something new on the menu. This time in particular, I tried the deep-fried bean curd appetizer, stuffed with pork and shrimp. The side of vegetables is unexpectedly satisfying too. 

Someone's food ALWAYS comes out 10 minutes later than the rest of the gang. They never fail to time one dish wrong.

Sigh... ok 3 stars.
author: Daniel C.

description: Surprisingly good noodle soup for union square!  My go to spot for a quick bite on my way home from work - theres a huge wall facing counter for single seating that makes slurping noodles solo feel less awkward!
author: CC C.

description:
Maybe I haven't eaten enough Thai food to understand why people complain about the food here, but I personally really liked the food.  They give you such generous portions, and there's a lot to choose from the menu! Depending on what you get, usually the prices range from $6-$10.  I can't remember the name of the food I got, it was like the thai version of chow fun, but it was a little too salty, but not so much that I would complain over it.
My friends and I came here for a late night munchie before going clubbing in the Castro.  Actually, this makes a really good late-night/pre-clubbing eatery.  It was still pretty crowded during the late hours.  There are quite a few gay/les who come here too, it seems like.  Anyway.  I would definitely come back to eat again.  I'm really into Thai food lately.
author: Frankie W.

description:
GET IN THE GAME KING OF THAI! I wanted to yell at the restaurant, the waitress, the chair, the last time I came here.

I always recommend this place for a quick, cheap, good thai fix.  I think the pad-see-ew is amazing and once in a while i'll crave the duck noodle soup or the fried chicken over fried rice.

But the last time I came here, we ordered pad kee mao and it was like "bleh".  And then we ordered spicy eggplant and pork (ordered it the time before and it was really tasty with this great sauce) but it was like double "bleh" and superrrrr dry.  I RARELY do this and I asked the waittress if she could have them add some more sauce or spicy to it.  It came out again (the same) and I got really really sad. :(

I'll probably go back next time but I will (and recommend you do the same) stick to the consistently good ones that I mentioned at the beginning :)
author: Kenneth F.

description: Wow...I used to love King of Thai Noodle House....more than 10 years I been a customer...until now....so sad.  Everyone knows that many places hired "day workers" or "cash jobs"  I just found out that many of the waiters and waitresses get paid $20-$50 for working 8-12 hour shifts.  Many of these are international students and need money to support themselves and also for their families in Thailand.  This really upset me when I found out that the owner crusies around with a Lamborghini from the sweat and tears of these abused workers?  That type of high living is because of the cheap labor...all people should get paid a decent amount to survive in San Francisco.  This is not Thailand...can you live off of $20 a day in the Bay Area?  Think twice about supporting restuarants like this.  But if you do...throw down an extra dollar for the wait/ress.
author: Poppy M.

description: I really liked the vibe at this place.  The food was really good and cheap, and left me wanting to try many more items next time, which is always a good thing, wanting to go back.  I played it safe with the Chicken Pad Thai, and it was better than average.  We're out of towners, but apparently there are several locations in SF, so fellow out of towners take note.  I heard the one in North Beach is very good too.
author: Mike K.

description: The food here is yummy and quick. I recommend the Noodle dishes (my favorite is the Pad Se Eaw) as the name of the restaurant implies, they are pretty good at making noodles.
author: Joanne H.

description: Love the Thai fried rice chicken. Food is good and fast.
author: Rogelio V.

description:
I initially came here for a hot noodle soup to chase away the chill of the day, but I got sidetracked by the menu and ordered the chicken pra ram instead.  The pra ram, which is a dish I've never seen at other Thai restaurants, is composed of your choice of meat or seafood, spinach, and Napa cabbage all topped with a thick peanut sauce that is sweet with just the slightest hint ot heat.  That peanut sauce was fabulous, especially with some white rice, though I added some sambal hot sauce to increase the heat.  Its very reminiscent of the sauce that one gets with chicken satays so if you're fan, I'd definitely order this dish. 

The location is very accessible to those who are working in the Union Square/downtown area and to those who are doing their holiday shopping.  The restaurant is fairly busy but turnover is pretty quick considering the efficient staff and the fast kitchen.  I was able to order, eat, and be out of there in about a half hour.  Servings are huge and you will definitely be full on a single order- you may even be able to share an entree if you aren't too hungry.

3.5 stars that I'm dropping to 3 only because half the rice that came with my order was a little old.  One half was nice and fresh while the other was a little hard and dry.  Overall, I enjoyed my experience here at King of Thai Noodle House and I'd definitely be back to try more of the tasty and inexpensive items off their menu.
author: Angela H.

description:
I have been going here for a LONG time... and today when my friend and I ordered our food, everything was just off. My Pad Se Ew (I know I am misspelling it... argh!) was not right... the sauce was bland. 

We finished our meal and I was drinking my tea when about 3 of the server ladies are just staring to see if I had put my money down... I couldn't believe it but every time they walked by they stopped and stared.  At one point they started speaking their language and looked at my wallet .... I was like... WHAT!? I am drinking my tea!!!!  All of the sudden one of the girls comes over and tells me that we need to pay... I ask why? An she says that I need to pay before 6pm WTF?  And I am like... why? She said something about the time and about not being able to take 2 bills or something... I was completely lost... so as they take everything away from my table.. I got the clue... they want us to leave... So we paid the exact amount.. no tip... and goodbye!  I never!  Ewh!
author: Amelia M.

description: A friend and I went to eat here one night after volunteering at a local marketing symposium and I've got to say there was nothing more hunger quenching than hot Thai noodle soup on a cold San Francisco night.
author: Brian T.

description: I've come here several times and I've never been disappointed. Service is quick and all the servers are friendly, but brisk. I've never seen this place less than half full. My favorite so far is the yellow curry with chicken. It's delicious! I've seen so many tasty looking things after I order, though, that I'm trying to branch out. Prices are reasonable, and you definitely leave filled. Because it's always pretty crowded, it's noisy, and the tables are kinda tight, but hey, it's worth it to get cozy if you get great food.
author: Jamie B.

description: This is my favorite King of Thai Noodle next to Macys.  The line is always out the door, the food is amazing!  I always order the Panang Curry & Pad Thai and can't get enough of it.  I even asked my husband to bring this home for my birthday I love it that much! A true hole in the wall gem in a great location.
author: Nazli P.

description: I ate here once in a cramped little room on the second floor when it was still on Powell St. The food was okay but I wouldn't go back. Also, I remember being befuddled at why it received so much love.
author: Kathleen M.

description:
Of the four King of Thai Noodle restaurants that I have visited so far this one was easily the most chaotic in terms of overall service.  Located just doors away from Macy's Union Square this is a very popular restaurant with diners revolving through the doors at all hours.

You can pretty much expect the same quality food that you get at other King of Thai Noodle restaurants, but it is the slightly comical service that I received which I will remember most from my visit.  First of all the tables aren't wiped down very well at this restaurant, and don't bother asking one of the waitresses to wipe it for you because apparently they don't do tables here.  Mine had a sticky residue covering a good third of the tabletop.  

OK.  Sit down.  Open the menu.  The first thing you notice is the spine is broken on the very worn menus, and the laminated but cracked pages are just waiting to fall out.  Study the menu well because the waitress won't be back to take your order for awhile.  During this time another waitress has brought me a cup of cold water, but she ignores my request to put in an order.  I've always liked King of Thai Noodle because I can choose the type of noodle (four types of noodle available) that goes into my noodle soup.  On this visit I ordered the Chicken Noodle Soup which is one of their more simpler selections.  So yet another waitress returns to take my order.  At any other King of Thai Noodle the food comes out of the kitchen exceptionally fast but not here.  My wait was close to fifteen minutes.  That gave me time to look around my surroundings and noticed the disgusting, dirty floor with used napkins, food particles and even chopsticks throughout.

My food arrived.  It's what I expected, a nice portion of noodles swimming in a big bowl with clear chicken broth and freshly chopped cilantro and green onion on top.  There are lots of thinly sliced chicken breast meat surrounding the noodles.  As I reach into the utensil holder to grab a pair of chopsticks and a soup spoon my waitress (same one that took the order) picks up a condiments tray with the five different spicy oils on it from an empty table and puts it on my table.  No sooner than I could pick up a piece of chicken from my soup did another waitress come by and pick up that tray of condiments and move it to yet another occupied table.  My waitress noticed this because she stopped and said something to the other waitress, but I didn't get the condiments tray back.  

The chicken meat was pretty much flavorless.  As much flavor as boiled white meat chicken can have I guess.  The noodles were firm and chewy and the soup was flavorful.  Several minutes later I had already consumed all of the chicken and most of the noodles when my waitress returned with another tray of condiments.  Thanks!
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: I had come here before with a group of friends when I first moved to San Francisco. Unfortunately, I can't remember anything about it but luckily; I went here with my other group of friends today. We had a party of 7 but the lady in the front told us to stand outside in the rain while they get our tables ready. We were seated on the second floor of the restaurant.  We got our waters but we didn't have ice in it, which was weird. I just hate how they don't give you straws because I'm not a big fan of just drinking it straight from the cup. I got the pineapple-fried rice, which I shouldn't have got because it had all the bad stuff I shouldn't be eating but it was good. Lol. My friend got the pad thai but for some reason when she got it, she looked at it with disgust. I think the reason why is because of the peanut sauce that they used, I'm not sure. I just remember a while back she hated Thai food so I guess it was a bad idea to bring her here. Lol. Her boyfriend ended up eating his plate along with the plate he had. On the other hand, my boyfriend did not like their pho. He said Kevin's Noodle House is way better probably because he didn't like the taste of the soup. Overall, it was all right. I would rather go to the one on Sloat where it's smaller and way closer to me.
author: Janice V.

description: This is my favorite place to get Thai food in the city. You can choose what type of noodle you want in any of their dishes, their food is fast, tasty, and fulfilling. All for under $10.
author: Stacy P.

description:
OH! how I love king of thai!

This is one of my main spots to go to if I am hungry and in Union Square.

I always order the ground chicken with rice. I totally forgot what it's called but it has basil in it. You can pick between beef, chicken, and pork but I like the chicken.

I've also gotten their chicken skewers and those are delicious! Especially with the peanut sauce that it comes with.

Their thai tea is also delicious! I wish there was free refills because it's 2.00 for one and I finish it fast!

Their service is always super fast but it's usually crowded in there. 

It sucks that you cant pay with a card but if you're really desperate theres an ATM right outside.
author: Ricialg P.

description: I went here with my best friend, and we had spaggetti noodles with green curry, dont get that shit bro, it hella small but the green curry was good. We had the pad thai, and the thai fried rice. The portion was decent for 5 dollars, almost everything was 5 dollars. i thought the flavors in the pad thai, and thai fried rice was pretty good. It was strong, and you can taste the sweetness in the pad thai, and the thai fried rice had a good flavor, with spicy sauce. Overall i like how it was 5 dollars, but they didn't have a lot of dishes with carbs, you got to orde the rice. NEVEr get the spageti with green curry bro, the portion was hella small. but the pad thai, and thai fried rice was pretty good. Don't expect too much food though, but i thought the quality was good
author: David L.

description: So I was quite intoxicated, which is why I am only giving it a 3. The food tasted amazing though. I had the fried rice and fried chicken which was so good. A friend had something which was extremely spicy (sorry can't remember the name). We were there around midnight and it was pretty packed, but I don't remember waiting long. Great place to go after drinking.
author: Olivia M.

description: I actually love their thai food here for some reason, it just taste fresh all the time and just always yummy! But I just hate waiting. Other then that I like King of Thai here.
author: Tiffany T.

description:
This place was yummylicious! Came here with a party of 8 and we all enjoyed our meal. I'd have to say, their pad see ew was really good. Lots of noodles and perfectly made. The pad thai was great, pork larb, awesome, crab fried rice, too die for. Almost everything we ordered was great. The only thing I didn't care for was the Tom Yum soup. It wasn't all that. They don't use straw mushrooms which is key to the real thing. The broth wasn't sour and spicy as i'm used too. But overall, this place is worth the money spent. 

The service was as you would expected since the place was packed. It was busy but not too bad. The food comes out pretty quickly and it's nice and piping hot! We def will be back if we are ever in the area. Authentic Thai for reasonable prices is a must try.
author: Darla H.

description: Delicious Pumpkin Curry and cold beer; sweet Thai waitresses and a busy, fun, atmosphere. Yes please!
author: Elinore E.

description:
I thought I'd try out this location since it's a couple of blocks closer to my office than the Geary St. location.  It was completely full of people and there were folks waiting outside during lunchtime.  I phoned my order in and picked it up about 15 minutes later.

Let me preface this by saying that I've consistently had what I consider to be the best Pad See Ew anywhere at the Geary/Mason location.  There's some amazing flavor in there that no other place in the area seems to be able to impart in their dishes. 

The overflowing O'Farrell location, on the other hand, served me some foul, nasty Pad See Ew.  It made me pity all those people waiting in line.  The Geary St. location, albeit small, usually has a table available for lunch.  Go there.  Please.

I normally eat at Banana House on Kearny and it's mediocre at best.  Over there, some days are better than others, but my lunch yesterday made Banana House and even the gross, greasy place on the corner near it seem orders of magnitude more satisfying.  

I didn't even finish lunch yesterday... I've had better food out of a cardboard box.  My advice is to walk a couple more blocks across Union Square to the less-fancy, slightly cheaper, and waaaaaaay tastier Geary St. location if you want Thai for lunch near Union Square.

If you're ever down in the OC, check out Thai Nakorn.  They had that special something in their dishes, too.  It must be the well-seasoned pans or something....  Either way, the food is amazing there, too.
author: Darrel F.

description:
The food is okay, but I do not like this location.  The two times I have eaten here, my hair smelled like greasey food.

The City Center location is much nicer.
author: Kathryn F.

description:
I wanted to update my review, because I wanted to warn you that the Pad Thai and the Tom Yum Soup are the ONLY things worth ordering from this place, ever. Every time I have ordered anything else from King of Thai, I have been sorely disappointed. Do not order anything else; you will regret it. But do go to King of Thai for some unforgettable Pad Thai and some decent Tom Yum Soup.

The end.
author: Michelle G.

description:
Guy Tiew Lord is a healthy heap of protein for $7. Not the best Thai food I've ever had. But a great deal and plenty tasty. 

I wish the bar didn't face the wall. Service was super quick, and very attentive.
author: Zoe P.

description: Right downtown, cheap, good, fast-fantastic. Awesome service. Of course, had to get the noodles. Next time trying the pad thai. Yummy thai iced teas.
author: J E.

description: Everything had a funky taste.  Egg rolls tasted like they were fried in old oil and were greasy.  Papaya salad had old wilted lettuce.  Fried chicken was dry and the breaking was weird.  Spicy Eggplant dish had only  2 pieces of egg plant in it- I kid you not.  Curry had good flavor but the potatoes were not cooked.  Service was okay at least.
author: Joey B.

description: I gotta say, I love the purple decor.  It's a little overwhelming, but now that I associate the color with delicious, cheap food where a vegetarian can get good lunchtime grub and super fast service, I really look forward to it.  Two warnings: 1) it's always packed, although the line moves quickly, and 2) you have to bring cash.  I usually get take-out which means you can skip the line AND run over to H&M for a quick browse before grabbing your lunch.  Purple never looked so good.
author: Cassidy P.

description:
Whilst shopping downtown with my best friend from Iowa, I told her she had to have the best fast food in town. I kid you not, we ordered, she went to the restroom and our food was on the table when she came back. And the place was rocking busy. So how come that should be an acceptable excuse in most other restaurants to give disappointing results? Hmmmm.... 
Also, we told our lovely server that we wanted our dishes vegetarian (they gladly offer Tofu in all of their dishes) and she followed up with, "is egg o.k?" Refreshing that servers are not on the verge of a nervous breakdown when you request something so simple. 
Order any of the pan fried flat noodles and you will be thrilled. This is by far in my top five restaurants in the city.
author: lilly s.

description:
We were in sf for vacation the last couple of days and I gotta tell ya, you can't go wrong with Thai in sf or anywhere for that matter. This place in particular was just wonderful. So much flavor and freshly made food! 

The roasted duck over fried rice and pad thai noodles with chicken are a must try! 

The food is incredible!
author: Rin R.

description:
I don't know why I continue to force myself to eat at this place, even while I know it's consistently bad food. It must have to do with their proximity to Macy's and the Ellis O'Farrell parking garage, where I leave my car when shopping in Union Square. 

Today I had a craving for some stir fried noodles....I was actually dreaming about a specific dish my mom makes....so I go into King of Thai trying to satisfy that craving. Bad, bad, bad idea.  It was absolute tasteless crap. And this is not the first time I've had the pleasure of coming to such a conclusion. They continue to serve decidedly bland food at fairly reasonable prices.  However, I do think that the wait staff are very nice and accommodating and the food is prepared fast, so extra stars for those aspects.
author: Suepattra M.

description: WHAAAT great soup dont let these reviewers fool you!
author: Nathan R.

description:
Nothing to complain about here.  I had been craving pad see ew and this place makes a pretty great version of it.  The dish came out fast and piping hot.  I liked how the portion of noodles was generous instead of being overly meaty, although not having enough meat in a dish is probably the more common complaint.  Sometimes pad see ew can be overly garlicky as well, but this place makes it right to my liking.  There were a ton of things on the menu which is very slick and colorful with lots of pictures.  But I made my decision fast since the longer I peruse the options, the more trouble I have deciding what to get.  

The restaurant was fairly crowded for a Wednesday night, but I figured given the location, which is right down the street from Macy's, it probably attracts a lot of shoppers and tourists.  The decor consisted of a LOT of purple and neon.  I appreciated the non-slip floor since greasy places tend to have super slippery floors that make the trek to the bathroom in the back extremely hazardous.  The prices are moderate - I think it was $7.25 for my meal?  These days I tend to go to the newer food court at the mall for food while shopping, but this place is a good secondary option.

The waitresses seemed competent and friendly enough and I will give them credit for filling our water glasses promptly every time they dipped below halfway full.  Originally, we were directed to a table for two that was literally half an inch from the people sitting next to us.  I would have felt like we were intruding on their dinner and I hate having to watch what I say.  Luckily, the waitress was cool with us moving to a larger table by the window.  I like sitting by the window and people watching while I eat and having extra room to spread out my stuff.

They do lose a star for being cash only.  As someone who never carries cash, I had to plan ahead to eat here.
author: Karen K.

description:
If you are looking for greasy, cheap & fast Thai food, this is the place. They have a pretty big menu and everything is vegetarian friendly! I ordered the pad see ew w/tofu & veggies. It was delicious and only $6.50. 

The portions are generous and the service and friendly and quick. 

I love how the entire restaurant is purple. 

***Cash only***
author: Gladys C.

description:
My coworker took me to this place last Friday. It was I believe my third time going here. This place was just okay to me, I still like Bangkok on Powell better. 
The only thing I really liked about this place is their Papaya salad, the other dishes that we ordered Pad See Yew and bbq with Chinese sausage fried rice was alright and the portions weren't what I was used to.
One thing that I really disliked was the body odor of some of the waiters. I'm not trying to be mean and snobby but come on people, can you not smell yourself? I was trying so hard not too lose my appetite...
I'm not sure if I would go back here. Maybe for the papaya salad but to go though.
author: Anna P.

description:
I really just go here for the fab purple color scheme.

I may have seen Purple Rain a few too many times, admittedly. Now where did Apollonia run off too? I gotta go run my bike up to Lake Winnetonka before Morris and Jerome get back!
author: Brock D.

description:
I am a captive customer here since it is the only Thai that is within 2 blocks of my workplace, but the food makes me happy.

The noodles here are tasty, not the best but definitely a good deal and usually enough for leftovers.  They get an extra star for the speed with which they crank out plate after plate of noodley goodness during the lunch rush.  I have been there with a line out the door and waited less and 15 minutes.  At 12 noon on a workday, that is impressive.

The Panang Curry is my favorite dish, along with the Pad Thai that they have perfected so well.
author: Jessica P.

description:
Pretty big portion.
My and hubby weren't that hungry so we decided to split a pad thai.
It was pretty good and the prices for a Union Square restaurant / fast food was decent in my opinion.
Will definitely give a chance again.
Oh BTW a side of rice for over $2.00? That I didn't like that much. It was a big portion but I could have bought a whole bag  of rice.
author: Emy B.

description:
When you're done window shopping at the Louis Vuitton, Tiffany & Co., or any other of the money sucking stores in Union Square or finished teeny bopping at the SF Shopping Center be sure to stop by this purple hole in the wall on O'Farrell. The pad thai is flavorful and the waitresses are really nice and just as hot as the pad thai.

It's a bit busy so if you want to enjoy your thai food quietly and in a more personal atmosphere visit the 2 King of Thai restaurants on Clement, or better yet, Thai Time on 8th street and Clement. (Look it up on yelp buddy!)
author: Albert B.

description: I order roasted duck over rice which cost $8.75. Guess what... When I saw the plate, I thought the portion of the size is for  the 11 years old girl. The portion was very few that I finish eating in 7-8 mins. The taste is good but I'm not totally satisfied with the portion. Next time I'm going to Bangkok restaurant which is only 25-30 footsteps away.
author: Yan L.

description: Food is good but the service is terrible!  The second they seated us I felt rushed, as this normally happens however I've really only been on a weekend so it made some sense but after today I've had enough of it. First my boyfriend asked what type of fish the fish cakes were and the waitress had no idea so she asked the cook and they said they didn't know either! That completely sketched me out, how do you not know what you are giving people to eat! After we ordered we were seated at a large table in the back then 15 minutes later we were asked to move because another family needed to sit there. .. simply unorganized to begin with. Will not be returning I never feel taken care of by the service but more so used for my money. Less is more and there are way too many people working in such a small environment I feel like everyone is hovering waiting for you to finish your food. If you do decide to eat at this place get it to go it's way less bothersome.
author: Brooklyn A.

description:
Good Thai Food :D
the owner was very nice to me when i visited.
I got homesick of my mom's cooking because i was far away from my NYC home. I had a little chit chat with the owner and it was nice.
The food was good, i had this roasted duck with jasmine rice and steamed baby buk choy. everything's fresh there.
I would definitely go back to visit again when i have a chance.
author: Angel O.

description: Can't beat this place. 5$ noodle dishes that are delicious and 3$ beers. Five stars for quality inexpensive food.
author: Grant L.

description:
Are you looking for a fast, delicious lunch on Union Square? Give this place a try! Its tucked away between Macy's and the new Sketchers store- always busy! 
Literally, sit down and order- before you can even think about what you just ordered its sitting in front of you. 
It is a little greasy but very tasty and the portions are huge! Two people can easily share one dish. 
Beware, they only take cash so be sure to come prepared!
author: Janell D.

description: My friend got the pork thai noodle soup, and his was very delish.  I got the beef, and it was definitely TOO beefy, and not in the good way.  The beefy taste was reminiscent of the powdered beef soup base in the beef cup-o-noodles.  I was sick which may have accounted for my loss of appetite, but my friend even said that mine wasn't that great.  I ended up eating only about 10% of it until I gave up because the beefy taste was just so strong.  I'd like to try the pork thai noodle soup next time, since my friend's was pretty tasty.
author: Chich S.

description: The food is rather bland for my taste. The noodles are boring but yes, they draw a huge crowd. Try Bangkok down the road for slightly tastier fare. Prices are similar but you might have to wait as Bangkok is half the size of King of Thai Noodle.
author: Anita L.

description: This place is a great spot on Union Square for a quick praram and panang and a hot tea on a rainy night. Even when it's busy, they accommodate you fast. And, it's tasty and cheap, especially for its super-convenient locale. If you're hungry in the area, and it's a little late can't think of a better alternative to the Cheesecake Factory.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Definitely one of the best Thai foods that I have eaten. Their curries, rice noodles and stir fries are awesome. The specials (ones that you haven't seen in other Thai places) are a little bit of a stretch but the basics are amazing. 

The service is really good. They are trying to get you fed and out pretty quickly but doesn't seem pushy. 

Has quickly become one of my favorite lunch places. The only downside is that it takes cash only.
author: Rohit D.

description:
This is not so much an appraisal of this restaurant as it is a rant over the lack of decent restaurants in Union Square.  While I rarely incorporate location into a rating, this place deserves it for being the beacon of light that it is.  Don't get me wrong, the food really is yummy and reasonably priced, and I must be lucky for always getting good service (seeing the number of rewiews to the contrary).  And the fuchsia shirts are HOT!  I want one.

(And why does everyone call it purple?  It's clearly not purple.  It's FUCHSIA.  Did no one else memorize the color names from Crayola 64-crayon packs in school?)
author: Rego S.

description:
So far, the best Thai place I've tried at lunch time.  Though it's a bit of a walk from the FiDi, it's hard to resist.  It's the most flavorful Thai place I've encountered in the last 9 months!  

I've tried a few dishes (ranked in order of preference, best to worst):  Pad Thai, Pad See Ew, Pineapple Fried Rice, and Fried Chicken, and I liked them all.  If you like your food spicy, make sure to let the wait staff know.  I opted for spice at 7 and I could barely eat my noodles; I had to order two Thai Iced Teas.  My mouth was en fuego!  After the two iced teas, I was also wired.

The wait staff in purple are very accommodating.  For the non-meat eating folk, they serve tofu instead of meat, so you can satiate your palate.

The place is always crowded at lunch, but service is quick and the turnover is pretty fast.  It's a cash only place; there is an ATM outside if you forget to bring your moolah and your friends aren't willing to spot you $10.  The entrees average $7/plate.

I wish this place was open later because it's a good place to hit after a few rounds at the bar.  The food should help to sober you up.

As much as I like the place, I've got a few gripes.  The last couple of times I've been there, they've forgotten to serve us our iced teas before the entrees arrived.  Today, I also found a small strand of hair when I had some of my friend's Pineapple Fried Rice.  We didn't send it back, but before I found the hair, the rice was pretty damn tasty!  Maybe the hair added extra flavor...

I'd rate this place a 4, but because of today's incident, I need to knock off one star.  If I could take off half a star, I would since it was less than half a piece of a strand of hair...  I might change the rating at my next visit because I'm sure I'll be back.
author: Annalynn C.

description: Uncle Anthony knows his business very well.  Great food and love free clear broth soup.   Been going there for almost 10 years and love it.  FAST service and again, good food!!
author: Alex R.

description:
One of the few truly authentic Thai places in the bay area. Serving traditional Thai soupy noodle dishes. This location has no resemblance of the hole in the wall version of this restaurant in Inner Richmond, which has its pluses and minuses. Cleaner, sure, but I feel the food isn't as authentic as those other locations. 
I had the larb here. Tasty, but I would come back to try the real soupy noodle dishes - a true test of how this good this branch is.
author: Danvin R.

description:
Give me some King of Thai goodness!  I love the Pad Kee Mow, Tom Kai Gui, and just about everything else on the menu.  Super flavorful, sweet, spicy, and sour.

The wait staff is super efficient and the prices can't be beat.  Try the King of Thai for informal meetings and dinner with the kids.  

Spicy sweet beef noodle soup makes me happy.
author: Anthony K.

description: I love this particular location and Clement since its always flavorful than the rest of the locations. I dont know why theres a difference but it is what it is! Pad see ewe and crab cakes please and maybe some Beef stew soup with Pad kee mao!
author: Nikka L.

description: I'm totally not a fan of Thai food, but this place exceeded all my expectations.  Although technically I didn't even get very "thai" food- i ordered the duck fried rice- it was hands down the best duck fried rice ever!!!!!!  Craving some now!!!!!
author: Evelyn T.

description: What a pleasant surprise! Given the monotonously lavish fare of the area, we decided to try this place for a change. The atmosphere was better than expected (albeit busy), the staff was generally very helpful and prompt, and most importantly, the food was fantastic. The $12 duck noodle soup was of wonderful quality and very filling. I'll be back...
author: C A.

description:
really tasty affordable thai food. 

my main favorite dishes are the pad thai and the panang curry. this place does not disappoint, especially when food is the only thing you can think about because you've been walking and shopping all day. i also love how they have the spices ready at the table, for individual personal preference of flavor. however crowds are a battle sometimes. therefore, i suggest ordering to go if you have a place elsewhere to eat your meal.

such great win at this place. too bad they dont have any locations in the south bay.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Best cheap green chicken curry I've ever had....
author: Veronika O.

description:
I was (unpleasantly) surprised to learn that not all the King of Thai Noodles carry the same menu. The one on 5th St. has less to choose from and the avg dish is much more expensive. However, I thought I'd check out the 5th St. location today because of its proximity to Metreon, but after looking at the menu, I got up and left to walk the two blocks to King Thai on O'Farrell. (the atrocious live band they had playing made the decision much easier)

At O'Farrell, the food comes out quick, the waitresses are attentive (*boarderline rude*), and the food is good for the price. Groups are a hit and miss depending on when you eat, but the place has a quick turnover time so I'm gonna have to say good enough for groups.
author: Cristofer P.

description:
This place is good. Currently, they're offering free soda, thai tea, or iced tea due to the bad economy which I think is fab.  Granted, only the first one is free.

My friend ordered #16 (Guay Tiaw Lord) and I got #17 (Pad Kee Mao). #16 was really good. It came out fast and wasn't overly oily like my #17. #16 also had LOTS of ingredients in it that made it more worth it! But the #17 was good, still just not something to rave about. 

Anyways, great service, good prices, and free beverage! What could be better? I will definitely be back when I'm shopping in SF.
author: C C.

description: I love their pad see ew.  As I write this review, I'm starting to have a craving for it.  The price is inexpensive, the place is cozy, and the service is fast.  I think I'm gonna come here for a bite whenever I come to sf.
author: Ha Jung K.

description: This place rules, fast, high turn over of tables, friendly numerous staff, love it!  Always go here, totally worth it!!!
author: Lacey P.

description: I got the pumpkin curry with chicken and it was very yummy!
author: Rachel M.

description: Their duck fried rice was disgusting.  The bits of duck was fat and skin looked like someone's already eaten scraps after all the meat has been eaten away mixed in with fried rice.  I actually ordered duck on white rice and not only was I given the wrong take out order but the food was inedible.  I had to throw it out because it literally looked like table scraps from someone else's meal and there was virtually no meat at all.  The restaurant is conveniently located across the street from the o'farrell st garage, but I don't think I've ever purchased a more disgusting order in my life.  I considered calling the health dept or asking my money back because I was pretty appalled at what they are passing for something more than fried rice spiked with fat.
author: W.L. H.

description: Beware if you say you want your papaya salad spicy. Spice wusses like me drank lots of water.
author: Diana C.

description:
Ignore all the bad reviews.

Dinner next to Union Square for under 7 dollars.
What exactly do you expect from the place?

Good and cheap food, expecially for the money.
author: Mike R.

description: The food is really good, but their take-out service needs improvement.  They ran out of an appetizer and didn't bother informing me until I got there.  They're really busy at lunch, so it took about 10 minutes from the time I got there until I could leave - I had phoned in my order 20 minutes prior to arrival and had given them my contact number.
author: Jay S.

description:
Just had lunch here and it was alright. We got there before the lunch crowd and boy did it fill up by the time we left. There were loads of people waiting...well hoovering like vultures waiting for an open table. 

Warning: do not wait at the table while your friend goes to the restroom because you'll get the evil eye from the server who wants to turn over the table for the next customer. 

In any case, we ate the yellow curry with chicken and roast duck over fried rice. Not bad but I've had much better. Normally food is cooked quite quickly and this time not the case. 

As with fried rice, they either have steamed rice to fry or you have to wait. I got the later end of the bargain. My friend almost finished his dish as I waited eagerly for my food to arrive. I would say almost 10 minutes later my food arrived. Service was okay and food is pretty cheap.
author: S L.

description: Great food at great prices. The service is 9 out of 10 times pretty bad, but you get what you're paying for I guess. They're Pad See Eww, Pad Thai and their Chicken noodle soups are highly recommended.
author: Roxie J.

description: I and my friends like to come here for lunch. Great food, good price and great service. We like papaya salad, beef noodles, yen-ta-four and pad-sea-eaw. It was lovely that they give me 10% off. I like it.
author: Natiya N.

description:
so stoked on king of thai.

stumbled into it on a foggy november night with a bad migrane and a lack of sleep with my girlfriend. the roast duck noodle soup cured my shivers and headache and my belly warm. now im a frequent. my baby and i go every month for our anniversary, and i go like twice a week for work in fishermans warf.   i've tried most things on the menu. love the beef noodle stew, spicy eggplant and tofu special, duck pineapple curry. 
YUM!
author: William K.

description: They are extremely rude and im a frequent customer because i work next door! I always order my food to go and take a seat and eat ! Today i did that and on2 of the severs gave my aunt and i waters another lady came back and took the waters and told me i wasn't able to eat here because i ordered to go i told her i always do it and never had a problem before she kept talking over me and walked away.  So i asked another sever for the manager the lady stopped her and she came back to me once again and i tried to explain my frustrations and she still said the same thing and didn't apologize for her bad customer service and walks away again. So at this point im pissed i walk to the back and try and get in contact with somebody higher than her she follows me starts speaking in her language nobody seemed to care about how i felt . She then started talking to a man and he said how xan i help you so i told him my issue all he said was ok sorry i said ok and she was extremely rude she chimes in and says you are rude too[im rude for voicing my frustrations] so i turn back to him and replies "WHATEVER"  food was food though
author: Noonie M.

description:
The purple walls...typical of a Thai restaurant.  The service is simple, to the point and quick.

I ordered the Pad See Ew....one of my eternal favorite Thai noodle dishes and it's quite tasty, portions hearty but less garnished with other ingredients such as mushrooms and other vegies as I have experienced in other thai restaurants for this dish.  For the price of 6 dollar bills, I didn't complain or fret.

Great place for a quick lunch to satisfy your Thai cravings.
author: Wel C.

description: I am probably a bit biased as I love Thai food, but this is a great place to have dinner on budget. This place whips up some delicious Thai dishes in a matter of minutes and it's very inexpensive taking into consideration that they are in the heart of SF. The staff is very young and wonderfully friendly.
author: Karolina W.

description:
this is a reliable spot for thai food when i'm craving it for lunch. the service is always good and quick. the tables also have a container of peanuts and hot sauce so you can add as much as you want :).  

you can have a sit down lunch here as well but it gets crowded and people wait at the door so you shouldn't come here to have a leisurely lunch & long conversation. the owner (i think?) is around and will bring you to your table and upon leaving, ask how everything was and say thank you. for a place that is so busy and constantly on the go-go-go and hoping you will hurry up eat and go-go-go, i still think it's quite nice that he does that. 

i'd definitely come back regularly.
author: Stella C.

description: I love their pad see ew. They had the tastiest I've ever tried. I went during lunch time and it was pretty busy, not surprising since it's in the middle of Downtown SF. The wait wasn't long and the service was alright. The food made up for everything else though.
author: Tiffany P.

description: I came here a couple of times.  The food was great.  I liked the food.  Then they charged my credit card for a meal when the week I wasn't in San Francisco.  I disputed the charge with the credit card company.  After two months, I got the full credit.  Because of that, I stop coming to this restaurant.  Please be aware.
author: Raymond C.

description: This place is like any other Thai fast food place-- inexpensive, filling food in a blinding bright, noisy and busy environment. Food is passable but the location is really convenient post shopping.
author: T L.

description:
No fuss Thai food that's quick and yum.

I've had the 1. Papaya Salad 2. Red Curry w. Beef 3. Pad Thai 4. Roasted Duck Noodle Soup 5. Sliced Beef Noodle Soup 6. Tom Yum Kha 7. Tom Yum whatchamacalit with the coconut milk. Everything I've had has been great, quick service. In response to the "rats" I haven't seen any and good lord, if you've ever worked in a restaurant before, which I have, it kinda adds to the "backstage ambiance". I'm not saying rats are okay, I'm just saying, I haven't had a bad spell......yet. 

They're really friendly, I came here with a Thai friend and her friend actually works here too and the service was WHAM BAM THANK YOU, MAAM! I call in orders all the time and it's always ready when I get there. The food is quick, hot, flavorful and there's a wide selection of items. I love the soups, noodles and red curry. If you love flavor, this is worth coming in for.  Think of this place as an ethnic diner where you get Thai food instead of burgers and fries.

***Look forward to another  new location on the street level right next to SF Centre on 5th. Corner of Jessie and 5th..the walls are already purple so just a while longer!***
author: Jessica C.

description:
if it was possible i would give this place a negative 1000!!!

This place is HORRIBLE! my friend and i came in around 5pm to go grab a something to eat. we looked inside seeing that it wasn't as full as usual so we walked inside. the hostess gave us the seat at the window that's really meant for one person. we asked for a better seat because obvious we weren't going to be comfortable eating at a one seater table. she gave us an attitude and said well you're going to have to wait until someone leaves, we told her there were a few open seats in front of us and she said i can't give you those tables because it;s for 4 people (common! it's called customer service!!) so we waited for another seat. sat down and tried to order.

when ordering our food, the lady kept talking to the other waiters as we were ordering, therefore, making us repeat the order a few times. yet still when the order came out it was WRONG!! even worse was after 5 minutes of serving us the food, she gives us the check!

on top of that i looked down and realized she's wearing open toed high heels which i don't think is very appropriate for a waitress to wear.


worse place on earth to eat!!
author: Jessica T.

description:
I couldn't wait to come back after my first trip here, but after my second try, it's kinda bland.  Considering the limited choices of food in Union Square, It's definitely not a bad spot if you're in a rush and want something with some taste for a reasonable price.

However, if you're looking for tasty, Banana Leaf in Milpitas is way more memorable.

My first trip, I had
1) Tom Yum Koong soup.  It was ok - healthy, hot.  There wasn't any carbs though, like noodles, but you can ask for some for a charge.
2)  I also tried the egg rolls - eh.

Today I tried
3) Larb with ground Chicken - the lettuce was wilted and the ground chicken tasted like something pee off the streets would taste like.  I'm not sure if that's supposed to be the taste??  I was expecting something more like lettuce wraps...

4) Guay Thew Lord - it was ok.  there's more oil than I would expect.  The noodles are not plain-- they have something like a hint of cocunt flavor to them.

It's generous that they have unlimited peanut part of the peanut sauce as a condiment.  Also, I find their staff to be super friendly and wanting to always be efficient.
author: Cathy U.

description:
Everything is PURPLE!

Pretty good and cheap food for lunch. The appetizers are yummy. I like their noodle soups. 

Service is fast, too.
author: LeTran B.

description:
LARGE portions.
DELICIOUS food.
   ...well at least the 1.  Kao Pad Pod (fried rice with duck)
                                   2.  Chicken lettuce wrap
FAST service
   ...literally 2 minutes flat

After a long afternoon of shopping...if you're in need of something LARGE, DELICIOUS, and FAST...

go to the KING =)
author: Gladys D.

description:
Free. Free Thai iced tea of coffee at this location. The sign says it's because of the economy, so patrons get a free glass on the house. Sweet! 

Down to the skinny... last night my BF and I split a Chicken Paneng and a Beef Pad Sew Ew. The Paneng was okay, but it was a little watery... Maybe a little too much coconut milk? Good flavor, but I wish the dish came with its full potential of deliciousness. The Pad Sew Ew was okay. Noodles and eggs were delicious, but the beef was a little dry. The iced tea was incredibly sweet, but hey... can't complain with free! Expect big portions here.

Overall, food was pretty mediocre. I would probably recommend going to the King of Thai on Taraval or the original on Clement for tastier options.
author: Teresa Y.

description:
No nonsense, cheap Thai food. Lots of vegetarian options, and I really love the vegetarian soups. I duck over here on my lunch break at least once a week for veggie, noodly goodness.

Also, this place is the most purple eatery in San Francisco, if not the world. I love purple, so that makes me very happy.
author: Angie R.

description:
Been there once. yup! no seconds. This restaurant doesn't take credit cards so take some cash with you. 
I had pineapple fired rice and was disappointed. Food lacked flavor and was very oily. Service was alright. To my surprise place was busy. i guess location and prices have lot to do with that. It is a centrally located and is a cheap eatery which sells mediocre food. i paid $7 for dinner which is quite reasonable.
author: Hasham Y.

description: Why A-OK?  Because their menu selection is not that huge.  They didn't even have a meat only dish, or somehow we couldn't find it on the menu.  But the food was not too bad, especially the green curry.  All of the girls really enjoyed that.  5 dishes for about $40 is pretty darn good for a random find in downtown SF.  We got to sit upstairs too which was not too cramped and plenty of room to stretch and talk.
author: Chau L.

description: Pretty good. Consistent flavors and preparation. Sampled the food 2 nights in a row and will gladly return. Friendly staff and well priced.
author: J J.

description: The food was not good nor was the service. My "special" was the worst quality of "meat". I ate enough rice to have the energy to walk out and vow to never return.
author: RJ M.

description: This is my least favorite King of Thai location because the service is slow and since it is close to Union Square, it is completely overcrowded. I don't enjoy feeling suffocated while eating and the restaurant is too cramped. The restaurant feels like a bunch of tables and chairs were stuffed in it, leaving little elbow room. As most people know, King of Thai is the fast food of Thai food and it if you want a quick bite then yeah it is convenient, but if you care about the quality of food and service then go somewhere else.
author: Surge C.

description: I wish they had places like this in the South Bay.  This is one of my favorite locations because they know how to "WOK HAY" with the best of them.  I like the Pad See Ew and Pad Kee Mao and the Fried Chicken over Fried Rice.
author: Miss Bonnie B.

description:
I love the fried rice from this place. And I like the quick, fast service. 
Also, very easy to get to if you're in the Union Square area.
author: Henry P.

description:
On May 21, we wanted to have a good meal before dying. We walked into the bustling resturant with high hopes of satisfying our last hunger. The tables were all full, so we were seated at the bar. There was a TV playing soccer and the radio was playing. The walls, menus, and waiters were all in purple and we were immediately given iced water. We then ordered pad thai, pineapple fried rice, and Thai iced teas. Our Thai iced teas arrived soon. They seemed overpriced for their size and the amount of ice they were filled with.
Then we sat and sat and sat  and sat some more for what seemed like a trillion years. It took close to half an hour for our food to arrive and we were getting pretty restless. We asked a waiter about our food and she left for a while before the pineapple fried rice arrived. It was garnished with lettuce, tomato, and cucumber. The pad thai came next, with bean sprouts and shrimp. The pad thai was quite wet and by the end of the meal it was slimy. The noodles that they used were very thin, unlike the numerous other pad thai that we tried at other places. The thin noodles stuck together and there was no texture when eating it. There was a hint of spiciness and that was about it. The dish was not very flavorful overall. The pineapple fried rice was very savory, with a hint of coriander. The dish came out hot and the pineapple gave just the right balance of sweetness.
author: Lesley T.

description:
Completely packed on a Sunday afternoon, raining. The place is somewhat of a mess and the employees are unorganized and somewhat scattered. There were SO many female employees there with their purple shirts, but the service was shitty and informal. But then again, can I really expect too much from King of Thai? 
The food however, was good. So I'm guessing it is normal to have raw bean sprouts with pad thai, cause its the second time I noticed. All I have to do is put the noodles over the bean sprouts and let it cook a bit. The #17 was quite delicious, better than Chinese chow fun!
author: Elaine H.

description: Good, quick and reasonable Thai food.  Everything is made fresh.  It's great they have various locations in SF and I gave them an extra star because they are coming to Alameda!!!
author: Josh L.

description: Come on. It's King of Thai. It's everywhere. It opens til the wee hours of the night. It's cheap. There's decent food and thai iced tea. What else can you ask for? :)
author: Wendy L.

description: The pad thai was nothing to write home about. But fast & cheap. I would give 2.5 stars if I could. And who knows, other dishes may be better.
author: Sari H.

description:
King of Thai (or KOT as we like to call it) is like the equivalent of McDonald. It's a chain, cheap, good, fast food..not junk food..but good food-fast. It's everywhere in the city now. I remember 10 yrs ago when I first lived in SF, there's only 1 KOT on Clement street. And now I'm sure there's like KOT#100 or something. They even have one (or two) in Jakarta, Indonesia; how cool is that?
Basically everything on the menu is good. My favourite is the number 22; ground meat with basil & pepper over rice...yum! It's spicy, savory & plain comforting. The fried chicken over fried rice is also very good. 
Service is quick & friendly; no frill but good enough. 
KOT, open one in Honolulu soon...!!
author: Levy O.

description: A high school favorite! Pineapple fried rice, pad see ew, pad thai, green thai curry (spicy), and tom yum soup. All delicious.
author: Samantha Sydnie S.

description:
Prices have gone up in recent years, but it's worth it because the food comes out SO FAST.  This place is great place to go to when you have a short lunch break.  

The pad see ew has Chinese broccoli... as opposed to regular broccoli at other places.  The soups are satisfying.  The noodle dishes are satisfying.

I will continue to come here for my Thai fix... give it a try and see if you like it or not.  I now live in NY... and I make it a point to go here whenever I have the chance to (about once every 3 months).
author: Derrick D.

description: I got food poisoning after eating take out from this restaurant.  I was ill for days.  I ordered the pork noodle soup and the eggrolls.  I do not recommend eating here.
author: Mairead O.

description: Nice Thai food with acceptable service.
author: Yan L.

description:
I'm going to start on the good and work my way down, down, down.


The Good:

-Free 1st cup of Thai iced tea. There's nothing better than a cup of thai iced tea, except when it's free of course.
-Even though there's a billion people waiting for a seat, my group of 3 (yeah i know you waitresses hate this) got seated in 7 minutes.
-This KoT location doesn't stand out from the other locales.


The Bad

-Bitchy waitress. As luck would have it, I had the WORST waitress in all of San Francisco that night. (this is going to turn into a waitress review...in 3, 2, 1)

-Didn't smile ONCE at us. 
-Didn't acknowledge the million of flyers advertising free drink until I repeated myself a total of five times. Then she grudgingly went "HOW MANY?!"
-Didn't offer to give ANY explanation why she served another table that sat down half an hour into my visit MY FOOD. 
-Didn't bother to look like she gave a shit when I asked her to check up on my pad thai.
-Came back with my food 35 minutes into my dinner with a plate of pad thai that I'm afraid she spat into just by looking at her demeanor.  To top it off, she basically threw my food towards me. Maybe if you didn't serve the other table MY pad thai, you wouldn't have to be so fing pissed off.

-You know, if you just apologized for the mix-up, I would've happily waited for a new plate. 




I think they made it up by giving me a larger plate of food. My friend's pad thai was definitely half the size. Way to go consistency. The food was okay, definitely a little too much sesame oil but it's pretty solid. 







because of that woman, 10% tip for dinner. This is a FU for the way you FU'd my dinner experience. Can they fire her ass yet? This is why I go to the ones on Clement.
author: tammy m.

description:
I used to live right by the King of Thai Noodle House in the Richmond, but no longer -- this one is right smack in the middle of downtown, so if you're chillin' down with the tourists and shoppers and itchin' for some tasty Thai, you gotta visit the King.

Decor-wise, it's just as a Thai Noodle House should be.. plain and spartan.  Chopsticks and spices adorn the table-cloth-less tables, and you're greeted by the super friendly waitstaff as you enter.  

My favorites are the pad thai and the pad see you -- I always get it with an extra fried egg on top, cuz I like egg.  Dishes come hot and fast, and the check is always reasonable..

Good food, friendly staff, and reasonable prices.. sounds solid to me.  I'll be back.. again and again and again.
author: Dennis Y.

description:
Before I found King of Thai Noodle, I really didn't like eating in Union Square.  It's touristy...it's crowded...
KoTN is also crowded, but not touristy!  And not expensive!  I am a poor grad student, and this appeals to me.

The Pad See Ew and the Pad Thai are both awesome here!  Their thai iced tea is also delicious...can't get enough of it.  And the portions are ginormous.  Both times I've been here I was ravenously hungry....and both times I ended up with one of those little takeout containers to bring half my meal home.  I'm a tiny Asian girl but sometimes I eat as much as a large Asian man.

Service is not bad for a hole in the wall kind of place.  They get you in and out and happily full in a decent amount of time.  Good enough for me!
author: Alison S.

description:
I hate the one in Union Square.  Too crowded.  Service sucked (well, that one time I went there)  Table was dirty after the waitress wiped it with a smelly rag.  Can't believe folks raving about this one.

The one on Taraval is better.  The deep fried chicken breast over fried rice is a great deal. Used to be better and cheaper a few years ago. Oh well.  

The veggie soup is much better and had more flavor than I thought.  Can't go wrong w/ any of the Tom yum yummies at any Thai rest.
author: greg e.

description:
My review is based solely on phoned-in take-out.  I've never eaten in the actual restaurant.  I used to work around the block and would call in my lunch order.  By the time I had walked over my food would be hot and ready to go.  The girls who handle the to-go orders in the front were always super friendly.  If on the off chance my order wasn't ready by the time I got there, they would quickly get me a glass of ice water to sip and offer me a seat while I waited.

As for the food, I think I've only had 3 or 4 different dishes from there.  Of course I've tried the Pad Thai, which was decent.  It wasn't bad by any means, but it didn't stand out from other Thai restaurants.  I've also tried their chicken/ red curry, which I enjoyed a lot.  The only thing is I wish it was spicier, much spicier.  But the one thing that got me coming back over and over again was the crispy noodles w/ seafood veggies & gravy.  I'm pretty sure that's not what it's called on the menu, but that's exactly what it is.  The noodles are crunchy and crispy.  There's a ton of seafood in it, a ton of veggies, and the gravy/sauce is not overpowering or anything like that.  

And don't go thinking that all King of Thai restaurants are the same, cause they aren't.  The one off 19th is pretty bad.  Service sucks and crispy noodle dish was always super salty.

This location doesn't get 5 stars cause it isn't anything like fine dining Thai.  It's fast food Thai.  And for being what it is... it's good.
author: Jasmine D.

description:
Not my first pick for good Thai in SF, but for being so close to work in Union Square, not bad.  Food is decent (but stick to the noodle dishes only... everything else is pretty mediocre if not flat out greasy and yucky), ambiance is really busy and noisy but they still manage to seat you as quick as possible (and rush you outta there as quick as possible once you're done), staff is usually pretty Thai girls that flirt with you (one pinched my ass when she saw that  I left her a nice tip ^0^)  

Nothing outstanding, but definitely good cheap eats that's a nice change from sandwiches and fast food when you're in the Union Square area.
author: Catherine C.

description: Hot tasty food served quickly and the price was affordable.  Very impressed!
author: Michael S.

description: I prefer Bangkok noodle around  the corner on Powell (which I rate at 4 stars). The food there is tastier and the service is much more prompt.
author: David P.

description: I come here each time I visit SF. While the language barrier can be a small issue, the food is excellent. I have had a few of their dishes and have never been disappointed. My favorite is the Pad See Ew (with chicken). Pair it up with some Anchor Steam and I am all set!
author: John P.

description:
Awesome Thai food, and at a $7 a plate price. Loved that it was open late. We loved the food, but always end up going to one of the other two locations in the area because the one time we went, one of the servers apparently dropped our order sheet or something and we didn't end up getting served until like an hour later. Sure, we prob would have said something if we weren't caught up in conversation, but hell no one expects to pay for their food after a mistake like that.

Still good food, just expected more from the servers. 

Also, agreed--small tables are prob bad for large groups.
author: Kyle S.

description:
I love thai food, and this is my favorite thai restaurant.  This place has the best pad thai EVER!  I come here for that every time I come back home to SF from school.  It's a must-go place for me.

The fish cake appetizer is very tasty too.  I love that side of cucumber salad that comes with it.  
This place is always crowded during lunch hours, because a lot of people working in downtown come here during their lunch break.  They offer a discount if you work in certain stores in downtown.  

One important thing to know:  IT'S CASH ONLY!!!
author: Lisa Z.

description:
This is the only place I in the city I eat Thai food. I ALWAYS buy the Pad See Ew (or however it's spelled). Perfect place to sit down and eat, and perfect place to go.

But they're cash only, I don't really carry much cash with me.
author: Sophia G.

description: Decent food for decent price.  We split pad thai, yellow curry, an eggplant rice dish.  The eggplant dish was by far the best.   It wasn't expensive, and we did finish all of the food.  I will come back, but it is not a place I will have cravings to go eat at.
author: Chris B.

description:
Kind of a cross between a nicer bus station and a Southeast Asian cafeteria. The curry was okay, nothing great.  My main complaint was the Tom Yum Goong soup, floating in grease. There were plenty of shrimp in there, but they were butterflied, as any good restaurant is pretty much required to do, but instead of deviening the shrimp, (the purpose of butterflying in the first place??!!) they left the little strands of poo still dangling off them all. 
Greasy, poo soup.

***UPDATE: 3 hours later***

Okay, I do not feel well, and I noticed that someone else on here also had a craptacular queasefest in this place this week. 
Would you really want to even try?
author: S. M.

description:
King of Thai is my usual Sunday lunch spot.  I always get the same dish no matter which location I go to.  If you can help it, go to the Clement St. restaurants.  This one is dirty, crowded, stinky and Steamy.  Oh, I forgot slow!

My friend and I share the won-ton soup.  One order will feed two and it's only $5.20, can you believe it?!!!  CHEAP!
author: Jeanne C.

description:
I have been here twice.
Once with a mediocre date and the food was mediocrely fine.
The next time during the world cup upstairs with a good friend.
Yick.
Teenagers screaming, food coming late, food served bland, staff uninterested.
It's location keeps it packed but it wouldn't survive if it wasn't for that.
author: Sean S.

description:
Alright, here is the review base on a Taiwanese and Japanese... 
And..  IT IS ABSOLUTELY........ WONDERFUL!!

I had only gave out two PERFECT FIVE score reports on restaurants..... 
and this place, certainly deserve such great remarks. 

Two orders of Noodle Soups arrive on table in no time, despite the place was overly packed (the turn-over rate for each table is amazing!) ... and I could see the ordering slips were flying around.... 
and IT WAS 2:30PM in the afternoon! 

The soup broth is perfectly done.
The noodle is tender and very FULFILLING. 
The ingredients make up a rich display right in the bowl... 
All that, served up a great combination of a noodle meal. 

The services was great... and the personnel.... were very cute.  LOL
Anyways, the experience was sooooooo good
This meal completed my day...  

(and no, i have no relationship with any Thai people.. but if you are a cute Thai girl, I would love to know ya!!)
author: Andrew W.

description: We happened upon King of Thai Noodle House when we were a hair beyond hungry and the expectation for satisfaction was great. It all got a bit sketchy as we waited in the give-me-your-name line along with several other famished-looking people. The ladies ahead of us seemed to get passed over in the confusion of it all, while a couple other ladies managed to walk in off the street and get their name on the list immediately (at which time the ladies ahead of us left in a huff). It wasn't looking good, but we were seated moments later; and moments after that gave our order. Some absolutely delicious Pad See Ew and Panang curry with fried tofu were placed on our tiny table in no time. Super-duper ending to this could-be disaster of a lunch. If you have space issues, this may not be the place for you, but otherwise, it's cheap and fantastic.
author: michelle l.

description: They now accept credit cards with a $10 mininum. This location is always great for some cheap, quick and comforting Thai food after some retail therapy. I can never go wrong with the #17 vegetarian. I always have enough leftovers for another meal.
author: Joshua C.

description:
OMG DO NOT GO HERE. I had the worst food experience ever. I admit I never had their food, but trust me I have a legitimate reason:

After shopping around on my friend's birthday we stumbled into this place because it looked good. We ordered alot of dishes including a soup. We started eating and just as my friend was about to ladel the soup I said "What's that?". It turned out that there was a giant (about the size of... a walnut?) cockroach/moth bug in our soup. We almost yakked. We showed the server the creature and he STUPIDLY said "oh... do you want another?" (Because I'm sure that soup was from the same pot, which means everyone else in that restaurant was eating soup brewed with a cockroach in it). They even expected us to pay for the food!! We walked out and didn't even eat that night. Gross.
author: Lillian P.

description:
Three stars from me because I truly was not impressed with this joint. I got a beef noodle dish that had peppers, basil, and all kinds of other greens and I felt the heartburn coming on as I swallowed each bite, not cool. I have heard great things about their pad thai, which maybe I would consider if I was in a hurry (which incidentally, was how I ended up there) for the hypothetical next time, but otherwise I think I would honestly pass. 
I will say that I got great, prompt service, but for the food alone...I wasn't thrilled. Oh, and downfall: cash only, which is such an annoyance for someone like me, who usually sticks to her debit card.
author: Danielle D.

description:
Always love fueling up at this place before hitting the streets to do some shopping. Our staples are: crab fried rice (they use real crab), pad thai, and larb. All delish filling and a great price!! 

The only thing I really get turned off by is the hideous lavendar uniform shirts the waitresses have to wear!! Gross! But other than that, they are very fast, efficient, and friendly!!

And don't forget its CASH ONLY!!
author: Maritel C.

description:
3.5 stars. 
Cheap, fast and good food. However, it is greasy and yes they do rush you during lunch or dinner time. But don't they do that at most Asian restaurants? My Asian friends all like this one much better than the one around the corner on Powell Street (Bangkok). 
Most of the time the staff is friendly, however, when they are busy they sometimes forget they are in the "service" industry and can be pretty rude. 

I'd recommend, especially after a hard day of shopping :) or late at night...
Be aware though, whenever you go, make sure you have cash. Cause they accept CASH ONLY!
author: Helen D.

description: Speed masters! Good for lunch or a quick shopping break. This is nothing to write home about but nothing to sneeze at either. The food is good, the prices are CHEAP and the service is QUICK. Don't hesitate to stop in if  you are hungry without a lot of time, just keep away from the crap and know the duck is very fatty.
author: Natasha M.

description: Four stars for the food, but two for the service. Had a great, very flavorful and generously portioned fried noodles and seafood dish, but then faced an interminable wait for a bill, culminating in me finally having to get up and fetch it.
author: Adam Z.

description: This place is filthy but painted in pretty colors (i.e. purple and pink).  If you like the taste of sub-standard shopping mall  food-court  cuisine in a brightly painted but poorly kept establishment that is noisy,  over crowded, and filthy,  then rush to King of Thai on O'Farrell St. and your needs will be met.  Otherwise, stay far away and spend your money and moments elsewhere. One star for friendly staff. One star that I wasn't food poisoned.
author: Baby J.

description:
Here's the restaurant I go to when I want a quick bite that is satisfying, tasty, and cheap!

This place gets pretty packed...but service is fast and you can always enjoy some shopping in Union Square afterwards!

Go with the Pad Thai and Pad Se Ewe.  Yummy....
author: Jennie L.

description:
So good, it reminded me how Thai noodle really is. WOW, the noodle is very great, authentic, and comes with tasty soup. 

The prices and services were so great, the servers were very helpful, the meal came quick with great portion.
author: Chin C.

description:
Well, the food at King of Thai is...fine.  It's basically fine.  A bit mediocre, but cheap and filling and usually pretty tasty. And the purple space full of darting waitresses and chatter is oddly relaxing--I like eating there alone between shopping stops. 

However, I must share a fascinating tidbit.  The city of San Francisco gives out those ratings for food service practices--you know, the ones on a 1-100 scale.  It looks like restaurants are required to post them where they can be seen. Well, a few months ago, I noticed that very piece of paper.  And it had a number in the 50s on it--I want to say 56, but I don't remember exactly.  Do you have any idea how low that is?  The next lowest number I've seen in a restaurant was probably in the 80s.  I didn't get a chance to scrutinize the paper more to find out the reason for such an abysmal score.

Because I take risks and don't think much about germs, I went back.  The next time, I noticed that the paper with the score on it was covered by a large plant, so that no one could read it without thrusting the plant aside.

Because I am a glutton for punishment, I went back again. This time, the paper was gone, and about a dozen plaques made from every positive review or commendation the restaurant had received were there instead.

I guess if I went back again and got food poisoning, there would be no one to blame but myself.
author: Linda J.

description:
YAY! My friend and I call this the "cheapie purple thai place" because it's too difficult to specify which King of Thai Noodle we want to meet at.

The beef pad see-yew is wonderful with some of the dry red chilli pepper. Hickory smoked pepper goodness!
author: dj z.

description:
One of the best things about King of Thai (KoT) is that it's just a cut above the rest of the late night dining scene. Better than fast food and something a little different than late night diners, KoT gives you a different option in the heart of San Francisco not far from Union Square.

Now I'm not a fan of Thai food, but this is Thai fast food we're talking about so it's a little different. Their menu is pretty extensive. What I decided on was the fried chicken with fried rice. There were six of us in our party and all of our food came fairly quickly. The fried chicken I had tasted pretty good, especially with the sweet dipping sauce. The fried rice, I was not a big fan of. It had a bunch of vegetables in it. I do not like vegetables in my fried rice. However, it was late and I was a little hungry so I sucked it up and kind of ate around the vegetables. The fried chicken is what really made this dish as the fried rice was just ok. 

For the price and how late they're open KoT can be great late night place to eat, but the food is just ok. For me it's not a destination (somewhere I'd travel to to have a meal), rather a late night alternative to In-N-Out or Jack in the Box. Be forewarned, they only take cash. Just ok.
author: Mark S.

description:
Setting:  Right in the busy area of San Francisco, which can be good and bad.  It can get packed at times.  The place is nice, clean.  Dim lighting a nice touch.

Food:  It was quite good.  I just had their basic beef noodle.  It says "spicy beef broth" but it wasn't spicy at all, which was a minus to me.  I expected to be downing my Coke everytime I took a sip of the soup.  But it wasn't to be.  Pricing is very decent, you can easily get full for less than $10.

Service:  Very nice folks.  No complaints here.
author: Jon D.

description:
I stopped in for a late night bite with Ed on a recent trip to San Francisco and was so satisfied with the meal that we came back for lunch another day on the same trip.
The fare is pretty traditional Thai fast food, but in each case the dishes are quite above the usual. We tried a half dozen dishes over the course of our two visits. Of these, the crab roll,  yen-ta-fo, and papaya salad with crab were all outstanding.
