The make up of the dishes is the same as at many other Thai places, but the ingredients were fresh and tasty and the preparations excellent.
The service was friendly and exceptional, helped perhaps because my companion was Thai, but outstanding nonetheless. The only drawbacks are the lack of parking (less an issue for some locals in S.F. who get around without a car) and the fact that the dining room is a bit garish and noisy, but don't let those stop you. If you are craving Thai in the Union Square area of S.F., this is definitely a place to check out.
author: Jeffrey R.

description:
Visited recently and was pretty impressed on most counts.  We were visiting from London, England where Thai restaurants are not so numerous and tend to be more expensive than in San Francisco.

First visit I had Thai Fishcakes to start followed by pad see ew with chicken and broccoli.  The fishcakes were pretty good with well-balanced flavours.  The pad see ew was also delicious.  Both dishes came in generous portions - the fish cakes would have been sufficient for lunch on their own.  The bill for two of us - two starters, two mains and two cups of tea came to around $30 which we thought was outstanding value.  The service was friendly and attentive without being intrusive.

So impressed were we that we visited again a couple of nights later.  Again I had the fishcakes but followed it this time with the steamed chicken over rice with garlic and ginger sauce.  The latter was fantastic.

Finally we popped in for a lunch before our flight back to England yesterday.  This time I had the crab fried rice which was great.

I wish we had such a Thai restaurant here in London; quick and friendly service, generous portions and reasonable prices.  What's not too like?

Recommended!
author: Mike S.

description: One sentence review: This is not the best Thai place but it's cheap, fast, and tastes better if you're drunk.
author: Kevin W.

description: Very impressed with how freaking good the food was, even though i later found out it's a chain. Just visiting a friend in SF, we were on the lookout for great Asian food, and we literally stumbled upon King of Thai for dinner. My boyfriend ordered the roasted duck noodle soup and he still cannot stop talking about how great it was. Our friend ordered pumpkin curry and he also rated his dish a 10. I had some sort of yellow curry with duck, and it was absolutely melt-in-your-mouth fantastic. Plus our food came out faster than expected, the interior nice with the aroma of curry filling the place, and the staff was more than friendly.
author: Chelsea L.

description: Rad na, pad Thai, chicken & basil is good. I was already done  but I really didn't like the fact that a CACAROACH came out of the chop stick bin. I didn't pay em shit!!
author: Mark H.

description:
nothing to write home about. 

good in a pinch......i came here because it was inexpensive and close to work.

have had better and with more flavor.
author: Samantha S.

description: went here before a Giants game and man it reminded me of a TK noodle joint but with Thai food.  It was quick food, fairly priced and the service was pretty darn good.  I would definitely come back here or any of their other locations in SF
author: Grant L.

description: They are always busy and fast.  The lines are long and they go by fast b/c they want the dining customers to eat and get the hell out ASAP!  Portions are fairly reasonable and the noodle choices are too.  Waiting may take a while but food gets to the table piping hot.  No cards accepted as a precaution b/c my pal had to go to an ATM!
author: R C.

description:
You can't go wrong when you visit King of Thai, the great selection, the prices, and the quick service.  I love this place for several reasons:

1.  Good hearty portions - Certain days I can't even finish the whole thing in one sitting, now that's a lot of food.

2.  Quick service - The food is delivered to your table in about 10 minutes, even on busy days.

3.  Location - I usually pop in on this spot next to Macy's whenever I'm in the area shopping.  Perfect for lunch, or an early dinner.

4.  Prices - Pad Thai for $6.95?  Yes!  Green Curry with Chicken and rice for $7.25!  Oh my!  Fried Chicken over fried rice for $7.25!  Score another one for King of Thai.

5.  Cute waitresses - I know that doesn't matter to most people but hey, they're cute, friendly and they recognize you and say hi.  

6.  Open late - I've popped in here around 10:30 PM on a Monday night to pick some food up on the way home.

7.  Noodles - I'm not a big noodle eater but when I've ordered their noodles they were tasty and a little heavy on the vegetables.  Wish they added more meat.

The only negatives:

1.  No delivery!  If these guys delivered I would be eating Thai food 2-3 times a week.

2.  Long waits for seats on the weekends and during peak hours.  

This place rocks!  I can always count on King of Thai to come through for me whenever I need a fix.  

On a side note, the location on 5th and Mission raises their rates for dinner and doesn't provide rice with certain dishes, you need to order it separately.
author: Dennis M.

description:
Ate here on the suggestion of a cashier at a neighboring store.  Glad i listened!

Although i found it crowded inside and tables were very near other tables the food was good, flavorful and fast!  Very impressed with a staff that can keep up with the busy downtown crowd.
author: H.F. B.

description:
This place has always been awesome.  I've been to the ones in the Richmond as well.  I've never not been satisfied coming here.  I just wish they would put even more duck in the Roast Duck Fried Rice.  Great food for the price especially with a Singha beer.

Now that I work in the city I come here the most.  Its much more crowded and chaotic but I think the staff does a good job.

They need to start accepting credit cards.
author: Diego C.

description:
4 stars for satisfying thai fast food. Not good if you're looking for a nice long sit down dinner for authentic thai, but awesome if you're looking for a panda express version of thai food. actually that's kinda mean, it's a lot better than panda express.

the service is extremely quick, they bring you your food within like 5-10 minutes of ordering. the food hits the spot, especially the pad ke mow with seafood YUM. all the flavors you expect - sweet, a little spicy, a little greasy, mild peanuty flavor, glutenous flat noodles, etc. extremely cheap too.
author: Ema H.

description: I come here whenever I'm in the Richmond district area. I usually get the Seafood Noodle soup, but the Pad Kee Mow, Pineapple Fried Rice, and Pad Thai are also very good. The chefs cook in the front so you can watch them cook your meal if you really want to. The service is really quick and the store opens until late at night. I remember coming here at like 12am in the night after watching the movies with my friends. Overall a pretty good place to get some fast Thai food.
author: William C.

description:
The food here is fantastic. It's one of my favorite places for lunch, so as much as it pains me to say....the service here sucks. 
There is always a new crop of tiny little Asian girls running around to take orders, and none of them speak English. When you come in, they look around and just put you at whatever table they see first, with no real order to the situation. Sometimes the service is fast, but sometimes they will serve 3 of the 5 people at a table and wait 10 minutes to serve the other two. 
It's just mass chaos. 
I have a pretty regular to-go order when I come in on a work day. Pad see Ew, with carrots added. It is often a struggle to get them to understand that I want carrots, and they usually don't seem to understand why. 
Today, I ordered my usual, and two others came in after me. Both people behind me left with their orders first, and when I finally got mine, I was relieved. Back at the office, what I am eating is delish, but most certainly not pad see ew. 
Of couse, no one else has such fantastic noodles, so I'll probably be back.
author: Shavon B.

description: food is soooo good, can't beat their prices considering the area that it's in (Union Sqare) service is welll... check out my review of Alameda's king of thai... I'll just say it's typical. But whatevs, my food was on the table and in my belly faster then I could press "check in" on my phone... That makes up for the fact that i had to ask for water. twice. Just go, seriously.
author: Norma O.

description: Great prices, open late and decent Thai.  Beef noodle soup was not the best ever but hit the spot.
author: Jason O.

description: BBQ pork special on rice with an egg.... oh... the egg... highlight of the meal if not the night. Note: you will be herded like cattle to your table, but the egg is well worth it.
author: Jasen M.

description: When I'm in Union Square I always eat at Bangkok Noodles which is just a few streets away. I thought I'd change it up and try this place out. We ordered the roast duck noodle soup, pad thai and pineapple fried rice. The roast duck noodle soup was good with the right portion of noodles and meat. The pad thai was a little too sweet and the pineapple fried rice had curry powder in it. I hate that. And my lil bro wasn't thrilled about that either.
author: liz s.

description:
Hard to believe there is good Thai food in the middle of the chaos that is Union Square but...

Delicious. And very purple (the walls, menu, floor, waitstaff...).

Even in the peak of Black Friday shopping (my buddy Nick and I were biking through and forgot what day it was) we were seated in 5 minutes. The food took 10 minutes to find me. 10 minutes! And it was very very good...
author: Trey F.

description:
I liked the convenience of the location in Union Sq but the food quality has GOT to be better. There wasn't anything terribly wrong, but I wouldn't go back and that's why I went with 2 stars.

#17 Pad Kee Mao (around $8.25) - this is usually a really good dish, but here it was just lacking in flavor. they used ground chicken which is fine but you don't get the meat flavor. and it was missing basil. there were only a few overcooked leaves. and certainly not enough red or green bell peppers. the noodles also arrived clumped up. looks like it'd been sitting awhile.
#42 Tom Yum Goong (around $7.25) - bleh. tasted like they dumper some tomato juice in chicken broth and tossed some button mushrooms in for show. i've had WAY better elsewhere. at least they tossed in 8 shrimp. but that was the only thing good about it.
#48 Spicy Eggplants w/ Beef on Rice (around $7.50) - this was the best dish of the 3 which isn't saying much and sadly this was a little disappointing too. my eggplant pieces were lukewarm to cold, rather than piping hot. that meant my eggplant was not really soft enough. certain pieces of beef were over cooked too. the sauce was good though it could have used more basil.

the random gnat flies or whatever they were didn't help the situation.

otherwise, i liked the fast service, availability of seating and tamarind candy at the end of the meal.
author: Cindy W.

description:
My favorite late night Thai. I remember that when I use to live nearby, it was the place to go late nights. You can't beat the price/good food ratio of this place. The prices are higher now, but still pretty cheap. 

Try the seafood soup with flat noodles for soup, pad-se-ew with beef for fried noodles, and the minced chicken with basil and green beans over rice for a rice dish. where else can you get good food at midnight? in union square? best bargain in the city.
author: John L.

description:
I eat here way too often. I'm talking "often" to the point where if I'm not there for a week, the staff asks me where I've been.

But I can't help it. I'm addicted to the Pad See Ew with seafood, but no calamari. Or a Pad Thai but without the icky raw bean sprouts. Or the Hoi Jor...

What do you mean you've never had Hoi Jor? Absolute blasphemy! Hoi Jor (aka number 47) is undoubtedly one of my favorite appetizers there. The official word is that it contains "deep fried bean curd paper stuffed with ground pork, crab meat, ground shrimps, ground water chestnuts and served with sweet plum sauce" but you and I know that's just so much BS. In reality, it's a piece of culinary heaven that the chefs in King of Thai stole from the gods...

So why 4 stars? Well, it's downright freakin' IMPOSSIBLE to find parking at the Union Square location. And it's always overflowing with people who wander in after an afternoon of shopping, armed to the teeth with too much stuff crammed into shopping bags that were meant to hold half that capacity.
author: Derek L.

description: This place is open early and very late, which is so helpful. Every time I passed by the restaurant it was packed, but I was seated within 2 minutes and my food came out within 10 minutes. I was very impressed with the efficiency and the food was delicious. The staff was courteous as well, but I can't help but wonder why the food comes out so fast! Do they re-heat the food they cooked the night before? I'm not sure if I want to find out, but I would come here again, regardless.
author: C L.

description: I've been here twice, and crave the beef noodle soup for days after each trip. A lot of vegetarian options which is nice. Service is very efficient, and the waitresses are helpful about ordering. Prices are good, for 3 meals, with Thai Iced Tea and Thai beers it was around $36 with tip. I'll be back.
author: Sandy R.

description: Ok I visit this place almost every week. Great food, fast service & so affordable. You seriously cannot ask for more when it comes to Thai quality fast food. Great for vegetarians. Lots of options. Also try their soups during cold days in the city.
author: Jays D.

description: Not the best and not the worst.  We were seated right away considering it was a busy saturday afternoon.
author: Erby V.

description: Decent fast food noodle house. Service good and quick. The place fills up quickly though and the food is also decent. Good enough for the speed at which it is prepared. Good thai iced teas as well. Spicy is pretty hot though so tread carefully.
author: Raji P.

description: Tastes okay but will not knock your socks off.  I have the pad se ew with tofu.  The veggies were crunchy (good!), but the dish lacked the broccoli which is sort of the point of pad se ew (sad).  Also, it was quite oily.  If I wanted fast and inexpensive Thai, I would choose Bangkok (on the next block) over King of Thai Noodle.
author: Elli F.

description: Affordable Thai food of the stick-to-your-ribs nature. The menu is pretty substantial, and they can make anything vegeterian if you so desire. Papaya salad was definitely spicy enough to clear up the nostrils, yumm. Beef noodle soup was hearty and flavorful but almost a little too sweet. I got it with flat rice noodles.. I love how you can choose what type of noodle you want with your noodle dish. The beef was tender, as it should be. Good to eat on a cold windy San Francisco night. The boyfriend got a noodle soup with pork; the broth was much clearer and lighter than my beef noodle soup. Both soups warmed us to the bone. If I lived in the area I would definitely be a regular.
author: Diana L.

description: Don't go here. Had the most disappointing experience and horrible food. Had the pad see ew on the advice of other reviewers. Were we even in the same place?  Just stand on O'Farrell street and burn your money. Less time wasted.
author: Debra A.

description: I am a vegatarian and my partner and I went to eat here having enjoyed it south the several other times we've eaten here! Both of our orders we messed up! I was served chicken instead of prawns and his special instructions for his food was 100% disregarded and served to our table 10 minutes after my meal had come! The plates were literally just dropped off at the table and then we were ignored! After ten minutes of irritation because neither of us could eat our meals we. Stopped a server to tell him we were leaving because we couldn't eat our food and had been ignored! The male server then proceeded to yell at us and tell us to get out in front of a packed restaurant! Management did nothing about any of it!!!!!
author: William W.

description: Yelp App to the rescue. We wanted something light and end up finding this place on Yelp. I order the Fish ball noodle soup with pork with Fat noodles. It was not bad but I just liked the noodles and broth. The fish ball tasted fine but the fish cake I think was not to fresh. The garlic chicken with rice was to salty. Okay place to sober up and grab something to eat. Yeah saw a guy throw up at the table that was not a good site.
author: Donna Y.

description: This Thai restaurant is just mediocre. It really depends on where you sit - if you're in the front, 4 star experience. if back or upstairs, 2-3 star experience. The bottom level back is so crowded because it's near the kitchen and it is next to the bathroom AND mop closet. So despite the delicious food, with the constantly changing scents you get in the air, you feel like you're eating inside a restroom. Upstairs is a little better, but the whole place is just very cramped. I have the greatest phobia of germs, so this is not the best place for me. However, the Thai ice tea and the food are decent. I really like the satay chicken with the dip. And the pineapple fried rice. But tastes just like any other Thai restaurant to me!
author: Cindy S.

description:
Oh, King of Thai, why won't you deliver??

I heart this place because it's damn good and way cheap.  

It's some what a hole-in-the-wall, but it's consistently deeeelicious, far surpasses any other fancy decor which doesn't do much for my tummy.
author: sandy c.

description:
Yikes, cash only shop!  I normally stray away from cash only shops especially since visiting San Fransisco.  

Well, I was looking for good food and I had already eaten Indian food recently and haven't had Thai food in the longest.  They didn't have this one specific dish I was looking for Kow Mun Kai but I suppose its normally a stretch to look for such a unique dish only few serve.  

First impression of the restaurant was a bit off as it had purple interior and the place looked like some kind of somewhat tourist trap.  The floor was sticky a bit much and almost felt like a movie theater stickiness to it almost like it would rip your shoes off if you didn't have it tied.  

The staff was helpful but a bit disorganized though to a forgivable level.  The order was taken and moved quite quickly.

The food now, I was a bit disheartened at the quantity they had given me even though it was take out.  So since they didn't go much on the quantity, they now had to back it up with quality.  The quality was fair to good but didn't leave me feeling short changed.  

The taste was pretty good with a nice spice to it with a balance of flavor to it.  I, however, wished there were more but supposing that only shows that it is perhaps a good sign.  The rice that came with the dish was of good quality cooked to a nice consistency and took in the sauce from the dish perfectly.  I enjoyed the meal and if presented with an option, I would consider going another round especially at night time.
author: Dominic C.

description:
Simple, quick, and cheap.

The food is good, but not the absolute best Thai. The place is clean, but not trendy. The service isn't amazing, but the food comes quickly.

For just getting something to eat quickly this is a great choice.
author: Tom H.

description:
Great thai food, really. Let's see here...I've been here more than a coupla times and would definitely return for more. I've always had the pad thai, which is very yummy and it comes in a nice portion as well. The price is about average, I'd say...although I don't go to a whole lot of thai restaurants in my day, heh. 

I'd say this place is nice for lunch (which is the time I usually go here with my lovely girlfriend :D)
author: Steven T.

description: Quick service. Convenient location.  Hearty portions but quality has gone down.
author: Bayarea K.

description: This is by far the best branch of the King of Thai franchise!   Great neighborhood, always delicious food served fast, and they manage to get you seated fairly quickly, considering how much business they get every day.  Seriously, I have never had a bad meal here.  Waaay better than the one on Sloat, or Clement for that matter.
author: Allison B.

description: After a full day of walking around the city, it was getting pretty late in the evening and all I was craving was a good bowl of soup. I came across King of Thai Noodle House on my walk back from sitting in Union Square. I was promptly seated and I began to peruse the menu and decided on the pork noodle soup bowl. It came with sliced pork, ground pork, sliced fish cakes, fish balls, bean sprouts in a chicken broth and I opted for the small rice noodles. When it arrived, I knew that this was exactly what I wanted to eat for dinner. The toppings complemented the soup accordingly (although I didn't care too much for the ground pork), the chicken broth had a clean taste and the noodles were done just right. To give it a little kick, I added a little chili sauce. I'd definitely go back for another bowl.
author: Mark Y.

description: I love this place.  Fast service, cute & kind waitresses, always great food.  It can get crowded, but it seems a charming sort of crowded instead of an annoying sort of crowded which is sort of rare in that area.  I'd eaten there a dozen times before I was seated in the upstairs, which I think is a little nicer area to sit in than the front room.
author: danica d.

description: This is one of my favorite places in the city. Roasted Duck Soup is awesome. Basil Chicken over noodles is second favorite. Good, cheap, fresh food. I could eat here every day. Somebody is going to have to explain to me how the whole Asian continent has figured out how to make good, fresh, flavorful fast food, and American's still serves crap for fast food.
author: Gary W.

description: It's definitely not the best thai food you'll ever have, but it's a great place to eat.  It's a quick and inexpensive place to get a bite to eat.  I love the pad see ew with chicken.  The other things I've tried are ok.  They're open really late, which is nice too.
author: Aaron L.

description:
I really love the food.. but the service is terrible.

Thai Ice Tea is very sweet.. I need to add water.

One time my friends came from out of the city.. and of course they were poor college students. When we were paying they gave one of my friend a face... excepting us to tip a lot. 

The hurry you to order and when they are done, they go back and just stand and talk.
author: Wen T.

description: So, I really truly think that the majority of all of the K.O.T.N.H's are good, minus this one! The service is prompt as to be expected from these SF Thai joints...I went for dinner after working up an appetite, I was in eager anticipation to get my hot plate of fried chicken over rice...I received mine, about 7 minutes after my friend received his curry, and I jumped right in, to my disappointment, it was terrible. I have never tasted anything so bad, coming from a restaurant, not even IHOP! There was this lingering taste, maybe the oil was being reused from frying up a batch of stinky fish, I have no idea, whatever it was, I will NEVER go back!
author: Jay K.

description: Conveniently located near Union Square, I stopped in to have a quick bite to eat one night after shopping. The combination beef noodle soup was pretty tasty -- sliced beef and meatballs in a sweet and slightly spicy beef stew broth. It hits the spot on a chilly night. Not exactly fine dining, but it's good enough to get your grub on and go.
author: Joel A.

description:
The best pad thai I've ever had.  Saucy enough (so many others are too dry), heavy on the tofu, with just the right flavor.  A huge amount of noodles for the price - $6.80 bought me more than I could ever finish.

The service in this place is FAST.  In, out, full in less than 30 minutes.

Once I went four times in a week.  Always for the pad thai! :)
author: Kelly A.

description:
You pay for what you get... cheap thai food, tasty, & so-so service.  I compare these type of noodle places to fast food style restaurants where patrons can order, eat, and leave as soon as the last bite of food is placed in their mouths.  So, I would not expect too much in terms of service, but the food was good (not great) and inexpensive. 

The bad thing about this place is CASH ONLY... its 2008, get with the times! Even McDonald's & KFC take debit cards... Geez?!?
author: Cathy P.

description:
every time i have a sub par food experience in a city far away from home i can't help but to think of all the awesome places back in LA county that would totally dominate on places like king of thai noodle house. i know that's not very nice, but i couldn't seem to keep my thoughts from going in that direction every time i ate at a mediocre food place that had rave reviews this past weekend. the service was cool, the food came out quick, and the portions were alright, but when it came to the food itself, something felt way off.

moving on to my foods...i had the duck noodle soup; had to have noodles in the noodle house, after all. the soup was dark and full of flavor...but wayyy too salty! i chose the egg noodles, and they were just ok. the bowl was averaged size and contained a fair amount of duck chunks.

boyfriend got the bbq pork and chinese sausage over rice. this dish was so strange and they totally skimped on the meats. i hated it ~ he enjoyed it, but agreed they skimped on the meats. esp. the chinese sausage, which he informed me, is so cheap to begin with. my gays ordered the coconut soup and pad thai, vegetarian. both were unexciting and had half the flavor of what i'm used to...even being vegetarian versions of these dishes i expected some of those awesome thai flavors to come thru...but alas, they were pretty forgettable. 

i really wanted to like this place because it seemed so promising based on most of the reviews. oh, and the thai iced coffee wasn't all that, either! 

wah D:
author: Jeni C.

description: We try to get take-out here during lunch, after shopping!  :-)  The #15 (pad see ew) is DEEEEEEEEEEEELISH!!  It's definitely the best pad see ew I've ever had!!  The wait staff is always friendly, although super busy.  The restaurant is pretty crowded, but good enough if you're just looking to grab a quick bite.  I would recommend calling ahead for take-out, especially during busy meal times.  We just went back today and the #15 was as yummy as ever!!!
author: Monica P.

description:
This place is always so packed but service is also fast. It never takes long for the food to get on the table.
We really like the Pad See Ew. Their other noodle dishes like Pad Thai and Rad na are also very flavorful. But their fried rice dishes aren't as tasty... We've had better.

Portions are okay and reasonably priced.

The downside is that sometimes it gets really loud and hot downstairs and the fans barely make a difference. Plus,  they only accept cash. It's a little inconvenient, but it's worth it if we can get a taste of their Pad See Ew  ~.^
author: Roland R.

description: This place is great. Incredibly fast service and super cheap considering its location!! I had the special pumpkin curry, delicious. Just found my new go-to cheap downtown Thai restaurant.
author: Joe S.

description: Well, the food is pretty good and the portions are big, but what is up with that loud mouth employee that loves to yell at the other staff. EVERY time I go there for lunch, I gotta listen to that same lady shouting in Thai about God knows what. The rest of the workers there are great. Always smiling and friendly. But the skinny woman with the crooked face is getting to be too much to take. If not for her, the place would be great. I deducted one star just for her!
author: Pat B.

description: Good service and good food.  It's always jammed packed and that should tell you something about this place.
author: Chris R.

description: The food is good, if not great. It's open late, and it's not expensive. Portions are ginormous, but nobody gets bent out of shape if you ask to share a plate.
author: Richard S.

description:
A good choice for quick, but good Thai right near union square.  The building has a surprising amount of seating, but also managed to keep the service brisk.

Everyone at our table was quite happy with their meals and the prices, from the duck and pineapple in red curry to the beef noodle soup to the chicken fried rice, portions were generous and price was quite reasonable.  

Even without reservations at 7:45 on a friday night we got right in and were served quickly.
author: Steve F.

description:
I stumbled on King of Thai noodle in the middle of the night once, when I was starving and unimpressed with the neighboring food options. I saw that most of the clientele was Asian, and I figured that was a good sign, and indeed it was. 

I am a huge pan of the pra ram and pad thai, but pretty much everything on the menu is awesome, and the thai tea is really food. The service is friendly, although a little cool, and very fast. It's a good place to get in and get out of quickly, and a convenient stop if you're in Union Square seeking food. 

Not a great place for groups, since it is always crowded, although you can usually find space for four without too much trouble.
author: s.e. s.

description: Was pleasantly surprised with this location, because the one nearby Westfield Mall is not as good.  I like the food and low prices at this location, and the service was not bad.  Good choice of noodles and rice plates.  Especially the noodle soup, and decent portions.  A little too much on the salty/msg side though.  There was a pretty Thai lady sitting next to me and she put a ton of sugar and peppers into her noodle soup, I thought that was a bit strange and excessive.  Sugar in your noodle soup???  The free ice tea/coffee was cool.  I would return here if I were in the area looking for a place to eat.
author: Snoopy D.

description: This is my favorite Thai place in the city to get beef pad see ew.  It doesn't look as fancy as OSHA Thai but it definitely tastes waaaaaaay better.  I almost never have to wait for a table but this place is usually pretty full.  Someone told me they only hire workers that are of a certain attractiveness level but hey, I'll take the occassional eye candy while I enjoy my delicious meal.
author: Patrick T.

description: I have eaten here many times.  I usually order togo because I work down the street.  The food is good but they get my order correct about 1 out of 5 times.  Yet I get charged for what I order its just missing parts of it.
author: D S.

description: Been here a few times and it's a cute little place. No credit card though so it sucks if you don't have cash. They have an ATM machine outside which steals your money with it's fees! Other than that, food is great!
author: Janice F.

description: My friend and I had talked about going out for lunch one day when we both had time off school and work.  And that day finally came. It was a nice sunny day only problem was where should we eat? Being that we meet up outside h&m we noticed this place. So we decided to give it a try. And we don't regret we did! This place was a great experience! I even tried one of their chefs special... It was their pineapple fried rice! YUMMY! :^P that's me licking my lips... Lol. along with that I ordered a Thai ice tea. point is it was good! But a nice tip I that they gave me te Thai ice tea for FREE!!!!!  I recommand this place not because of the free Thai ice tea but for their service but also because try get u ur food fast! And I'm glad cause I was starving!
author: Silvia C.

description:
Very friendly staff, fast and reliable and, most importantly, delicious stuff.

May not be the most trendy and fashion spot to fall in, but definitely one of the best Thai restaurants in town.
author: Oruga P.

description: I'll make this review quick... Excellent Thai Food, Good Location, Reasonable Prices, Very Fast Service, Open Late. My Favorite two dishes here are Pad See Ew and Larb Salad. The only thing that is disappointing here is that the place is now looking very run down... especially the floors. They desperately need a renovation.
author: Scott S.

description:
Ok this is based on my experience today - Usually I'm ok with this place hoever went there today and wow how different it was.  so we got the crab fried rice and a noodle dish with sweet soy sauce.  The latter was pretty good .. the first was bland, and had one peice of canned crab on it.   think of taking rice - put some egg in it and onions and forgetting any salt, soysauce or whatever.. wow horrible.

that wasn't what threw me off.  it was when the lady dropped a serving spoon on the floor.. then picked it back up and used probably a dirty towl.. crap man throw that spoon back in the dish washer...  i guess its better than putting it directly back.    in any case. nasty
author: Joey N.

description: I come here from time to time for some cheap quick eats in the area and I usually go for the fried chicken over fried rice with an occasional thai iced tea.  It's been a while since I ate here, but today I had my usual dish and it was horrible. The chicken was not too bad with the sauce, but the rice was soo bland (not just in my opinion, but both my sisters as well).  I just ended up eating the chicken.
author: Jen P.

description: i gotta give it up to them, one think i will say wow! EXTREMELY FAST SERVICE! faster than a drive through! the place was packed when in a Monday night, nice waitress, however food did not deliver, order the spicy chicken basil curry, very small, had more sauce and scant pieces of chicken, am a small petite girl and was still searching for my chicken pieces in the mist of all that thick curry broth, disappointing,although pretty tasty, nonetheless who can go wrong with curry?you would have to be a total idiot chef to get that sauce completly out of wack! very simple dish to make, chicken satay was good, not fulfilling once again, very small portions, what was very very bad, STAY AWAY FROM PAPAYA SALAD will leave confused and wasting your money! over drenched in this sweet semi tangy sauce, not delectable at all, nor healthy because of sooo much sauce, oh and because its in Union square parking is a beeeeep! (you know what i mean)
author: cristina s.

description: Fri 8/1 - I had the worse experience ever with the acting Mgr Isis. We ordered two Pad See-Ew with chicken & it came back overcooked. One order was return too disgusting to eat it was mushy. The bill came to be split by 2 parties when we noticed we didn't receive a discount or a reversal of the disgusting order. We approach Isis she stated the Chef mixed both orders together as one therefore no discount or removal will be taken and we are required to pay NOW. Isis decided she wasn't going to provide any type of customer service until we requested to speak to someone above her then did she decide to remove the item from the bill.  Matters got worse, the waitress decided to slam the bill tray on our table angry at us when we had no interaction with her about the bill. I just don't get it, we had a difference of opinion with the Acting Mgr Isis and we're under attack by the staff as well.  Poor service with bad attitude over a mushy meal, maybe they should have eaten it.
author: Jacque F.

description: Good late night grub when you're out in the city till 2am downtown.  However, my favorite late night King of Thai location is probably the one on Clement.  They serve all the typical items such as curry, pad thai, soups, etc.  at all locations.
author: Cathy L.

description: yumm! this place is good! the service the first time i went was great! the second time i went, the service wasnt as good but still okay. i tried the pad sew ew and the pad thai here, its good!
author: Bailey L.

description: This place was a joke. When we got in me and fiancee put the small tables together so we can sit next to each other...that wasn't  good idea. A waitress with big nostrils, wish I remembered her name, came to us and screamed that we couldn't do that. What was such a big deal? Its funny cus moments later a couple did the same thing and nostril girl screamed at them, but the girl screamed back. Anyways the food was ok. I had the usual pad thai, obviously had better food and service. I gave no tip of course. :)
author: Pamela ..

description:
Sawadee....

Roast duck noodle soup - 4 stars (1 less than Thai Noodle over at Berkerley)

Hoi Jor - this isnt really thai....but it is 5 stars (pricey though - (almost 9 $ for 8 small pieces) 

All the Pads....(Fried noodles....too much salt)

Thai ice tea - ever heard of anyone saying it is ok?it is not overly sweeten ? I guess not......it is premixed syrup
author: N N.

description: I eat at this KOT when I need a fix of thai boat noodle soup when i'm at work. This place does get really busy during the lunch hours (due to shoppers and normal work folks). They have quick service and the food comes out pretty quickly as well. This is a cash only place.
author: Julie F.

description: Vegan and vegetarian friendly (ask for no fish sauce).  I've eaten take out from here a few times recently.  The portions are enormous for the price.  I would not recommend a curry dish for the office as the container is mostly liquid, but it is quite delicious.  #17 highly recommended.
author: Joshua S.

description: When you're done shoving tourists who've apparently never seen The Body Shop, The Gap, Burger King, Starbucks, and  T-Mobile store before  out of your way come to King of Thai Noodle for nourishment. Everything I've ever had is stellar, the prices are awesome and the service is fast so you can get back to hating tourists and buying more stuff!
author: Maria D.

description: I happen upon this place. I had the best Noodle Bowl I've ever had in my life!! I eat eat here every day once I move to SF.
author: Stephen H.

description:
I miss this place so much!!!
I worked at the Macy's right next door for almost a year, and King of Thai was the only place I ventured to outside of the building (which has a food court and and employee cafeteria) 
For $5.95 I got a GINOURMOUS bowl of ultra hot, savory, loaded-with-veggies-and-beef noodle soup. And I mean hot as in temperature not flavor, I cant handle the spicy stuff!!! But for those of you with steel stomachs, you can pile on the spicy stuff because every table has these nifty little condiment spinners!! And by ginourmous I mean enough to eat your fill and still take a LOT home to eat later, or donate to hungry roomates/boyfriends. Which i did, often. But I'll be totally honest, the soup is the only thing I've eaten there, so I have no idea how the rest of the food is. But hey, it must be good if its so crazy busy all the time. Yeah, it may look like there are 549857395 people ahead of you, but wait it out, the line moves SUPER fast. Those girls sure know how get people in and out, but always with a smile. Its kinda amazing how tasty and fresh it is, considering how quickly they get your order to you. They have tables for large groups, and side counters with stools for the business lunch and retail crowd. Fabulous service, tasty soup and so affordable. What more could i want. I make it a point to stop there any time I'm in SF.
author: Elise M.

description:
Wow. After reading some reviews on here, I am no longer surprised that my dish came out RAW. I mean, really... chefs that serve wires and cockroaches in their food and now something raw??? 

I went here for the first time after my cousin told me that they're pretty good. We ordered three dishes: pad thai, bbq pork fried rice, and something that looked like pad see ew (#16, I believe). When my dish came out (#16), I gave it a check over and noticed that the noodles were rather brown, just thinking it was the sauce and that's how it's supposed to look because of the sauce. As I was putting the noodles on my plate, I grabbed the shrimp and quickly noticed how grey and LIMP it was! To my disbelief, the shrimp was completely uncooked.. no pink whatsoever. After pointing this out to the waitress, she took the plate away. I scanned over my noodles that I already had on my plate and bit into the imitation crab meat. It was COLD! Oh my god, how could anyone.. ANYONE send out a dish like this???? Of course, they cancelled our order and we didn't have to pay for it, but in the end I was too disgusted to eat any of their other food. Should have taken a picture...

I would never go here again. Their cooks obviously put no notice to their food and think it is OK to send out food with wires, cockroaches and raw food out to their customers. This place def. does NOT deserve 3.5 stars. If I could give them 0 I would.  

*GAG*!
author: Sandra T.

description:
My fav Thai place for a quick bite. Note that this is not a fancy place, and the service can feel quite rush... but that's how I love. I like getting my food in my tummy within 5 mins of it being ordered.
I generally get the duck noodle soup and the wife gets the beef stew. 

It's five stars cause if we are hungry in Union square, we eat here with no hesitation.
author: Chanh N.

description: Used to work in the area and would eat here often. The service is definitely quick--how can it not be with 20 servers standing by to deal with the lunch rush. I usually enjoy the noodle soup with BBQ pork and wontons when it got cold in the office, but the rest of the dishes were not consistently as good. I think the sister restaurant on Clement St in Inner Richmond is better.
author: Nancy B.

description: Decent thai at prices that won't break the bank. Watch out for the lines at lunchtime.
author: Bee H.

description: I agree with Jane's review, I was excited because King of Thai was so busy but the food itself was relatively average once we finally got seated and tried it out. Good for a quick lunch, but nothing to get thai'd up about.  They also have a tendency to bring out one person's food about five to ten minutes after everyone else, and this time that person was me. King of Thai? Nah, maybe a baron or duke.
author: Nish N.

description: Meh, good chill place for afternoon drinks, but the food really isn't very good. The last time I went there I had the vegetarian spring rolls and the wrap was dry and they were overall pretty tasteless.  The other dishes I've had have been average, and the service isn't anything to write home about either.  But it's a chill place to hang out, good location, etc.
author: Emma A.

description: Service was great but...we sat upstairs, large roach was climbing up the wall and jumped on our table...kind of lost my appetite - clean it up guys
author: Ben S.

description:
We've seen the lineup at this place all the time but at 7:30 tonight, there was no line and we were seated in 30 seconds. Must be the Emporium at the new mall attracting all the diners? :) We had initially wanted to try Buckhorn Grill but to no avail, there were at least 15 ppl in line. 
Anyhow, I ordered the wonton soup and bf ordered the fried chicken over fried rice and we were just noticing how the servers were all in purple and the wall to ceiling were also painted in purple. I assume it's the King's trademark as I've noticed other outlets in Clement painted purple too.
Before long, my wonton soup was served before me in mere minutes. Bf was busy text messaging our friend for the evening's plans and before long, his chicken fried rice also turned up with a side of sweet chilli sauce. We liked our dishes, quick turnaround, good meal, worth noting this joint down. Huge portions for a decent price. We couldn't even finish the fried rice and took it home. Will definitely try the papaya salad and duck fried rice the next time.
author: Yan M.

description:
This is fast food Thai in US, with food arriving at your table about 2 minutes after you order....  It's a positive, don't get me wrong, especially when its a late night.   The fast food atmosphere and the late hours is what gives King of Thai an A-OK rating in my book.  

The food is average, my guess is because its mass produced for the large crowd that is consistent around this place.  I do think the crowd, speed, and hours reduce the quality and taste.  My pad kee mao lacked flavor and was heavy on oil, but for 8 bucks at midnight, its A-OK.
author: Yulia G.

description: not the average pad thai noodles here...the variety of noodle soup dishes i found very tasty and satisfying after a long day of walking around union square....
author: Hen A.

description: IF I COULD GIVE THIS PLACE A ZERO I WOULD!!!  THE FOOD WAS HORRIBLE,BLAND, AND I FELT LIKE I WASNT EATING THAI FOOD (more like grease and oil) we actually had to call the waitress for her to get our order and the service was horrible after leaving the resteraunt  i started having cramps in my stomach and felt very sick ...... was not a delight .... wont be coming back anytime soon.
author: neil z.

description: fast and cheap! but this time their duck soup was not as sweet. maybe they threw out the original soup.
author: kim w.

description: I usually get their food to go when im in downtown SF working.  i pretty much stick to what's safe: crab fried rice.  my friend got a piece of questionable chicken meat in her dish once. seafood noodle soup is also good. great prices. ambiance not so much.  there used to be a really hot waiter working there, too, but dunno if he's still there :P
author: Peggy W.

description: King of Thai is like comfort food for me when I go to the city. I know exactly what I'm going to get and how good it will be. The flat noodles are my favorite with beef and my gf always gets one of their noodles. Good stuff...really fast..really fregggin good!
author: Jhoe G.

description: i went here recently because of the awesome gopago app deal. yup, that's right.. $10 worth of free food. king of thai noodle house on o'farrell was one of the places on the app. never been there before so why not, especially when i'm going to get it for free. i got the spicy eggplant with chicken over rice. i must say of all the thai spicy eggplant dishes i've had in the past, this place is pretty good. definitely satisfying and plenty of food for one. actually, you can split that into two meals or share it with someone if you like. overall, i'd definitely go back here again for their spicy eggplant. i've yet to try anything else on their menu. until i do, i'll be sure to update this review! :)
author: mai c.

description: Love the service they have, fast good affordable.. Pad see eww and roast duck fried rice was the best I love!
author: Max C.

description:
three words: chicken fried rice

don't forget it.
author: ashley a.

description:
very solid thai food.  that's because they don't serve soup.

hahahahah!  sorry, i had to

seriously.  i've eaten about 30 things on the menu and they range from good to "i'll kill someone and their household pets to get another bowl".  

*And just for you naysayers, here are my thai credentials.*

1. been to thailand 5 times.

there you go.  so i'm right and you're obviously wrong.  and you have a small penis.
author: Huyness D.

description:
i love love love this place. i came here almost every single time i went to sf. the food was cheap, authentic, and tasty. their beef noodle soup was really good and tastes almost the same as the one i had in thailand, which is where i'm from. their papaya salad and padthai were really good too there was one time i went there for dinner. they served free thai iced tea. i still don't know why they did. but it was great. 
i ordered the curry once. and it wasn't that good. but this is a noodle place. i should order noodle. :) 
i heart this place.
author: Te R.

description: i've had way better thai food.  but i guess in such a busy place in sf (powell), king of thai does offer a great alternative to other more pricey restaurants in the area.  had the duck fried rice, which was quite good actually, and a papaya salad, which was horrible.  the restaurant is quite large so seating was not a problem and with the amount of waiters they have you can wave down one with ease.  my water, however, wasnt filled when i finished it.
author: Alex W.

description:
you get for what you pay for, so don't expect to be treated like a King despite it's name!

it's cheap and good. 

no frills. 

best noodle soup. which is why they call it king of thai noodle. 

a couple of tips: wipe your chopsticks and spoon before using them for consumption, don't be afraid to ask for a table upstairs for a more peaceful meal, and come hungry - the portions are solid and they emerge in front of you before you can take your first sip of water.
author: Diana L.

description: Awesome. I'm totally up for schlepping all the way over here from my office on Montgomery when I have the time. My favorite Thai lunch item is rad na (wide rice noodles in a black bean gravy with egg, Chinese broccoli, and tofu), and they do a good job here. The pad see ew (wide rice noodles with a soy sauce) is good, too. Service is often efficient but occasionally erratic. The place is pretty clean for a semi-divey joint. Reasonable prices. Mmm, Thai food.
author: Tara M.

description: Closes at 12:40 on Saturdays despite their sign saying 1am. Got there at 12:40 and they were closing according to "their clocks" so I never got to try their food  (We wanted to place an order to go). 1 star for misrepresentation.
author: Andi M.

description: Went there with Thai friends, I let them order, everything we got on our table was delicious.  I highly recommend the softshell crab appetizer and the roti with coconut ice cream for dessert.  Everything we got was delicious.
author: Andee T.

description: Its ok as a quick cheap break from shopping, but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat there.  It seems like everything is made with fish sauce and the decor is too purple.  Is the color purple supposed to make you want to order more food or something?  Is it something subliminal?
author: Starla D.

description: Cheap and good. Always a favorite when hanging out in Union Square.
author: choad x.

description: Great place to go when you're famished after shopping all day :D Short lines, awesome service, food comes out relatively quick while still tasting pretty darn good. Way better than eating at the Westfield food court!
author: R.B. P.

description: Wow! It's rare to have a restaurant experience that is truly exceptional. Ok, let me qualify that: the food here is beyond exceptional, the service was adequate, and the atmosphere was likewise just ok. It was busy and we were seated quickly. Our order came FAST, and a few bites later I proclaimed that they should install a plaque on the wall commemorating my delicious experience. Wifey and I shared chicken Panang Curry and Pineapple Fried Rice. Cheap, quick, and beyond delicious, plus enough leftovers for an afternoon snack later on. An army of employees whisk patrons in and out, and I left floating on a cloud of contentment. I couldn't ask for a better lunch experience.
author: C F.

description: I tried this King of Thai for the first time today and it was rather good.  I had the wonton soup - it came piled with bbq pork which I wasn't too crazy about but the wontons were delicious!  The broth was flavorful and hot.  My only gripe is that there were only 5 tiny wontons in the soup - I could have used 5 more.
author: mia s.

description: Good, cheap and fast. Perfect place to grab a bite to eat if you're out shopping or as I usually am, rushing to rehearsal, audition, appointment, etc. I like the duck soups and the noodle dishes. If you don't like thai iced tea because of all the milk and cream in it, request plain hot tea. It's just as yummy. It also has a long bar along the wall so you don't have to feel self-concious if you're eating alone.
author: Farah S.

description: I was not impressed nor have I had bad thai food before here. How do you mess up pad thai? Well the waitress and my thai iced tea get 1 whole star.
author: Christina B.

description: Been a few times and always left satisfied. Busy place, quick service, good food, good portions, and great price ! One of my favorite places around Union Square.
author: Saul A.

description: Very pleasantly surprised here.  I always think about King of Thai as a 3am-and-drunk-as-hell place.  For that, its worth 5 stars - the Pineapple Fried Rice is the bomb!  But we went for a normal dinner here on Sunday, and it was good, even when sober :-)  I really liked the green curry with chicken - very fragrant - and the pad see kraw was delish.
author: Serena Y.

description: good thai food , Pad thai excellent, fast service good place to go when you need to eat fast. Really enjoyed the sticky rice and Mango:)
author: Dottia B.

description: Good food.  The only problem I consistently have is that if I go with more than just myself, each person's food comes out at different times.  the last time I ate there with 4-5 people, all but one person's food arrived within 2-3 minutes of the other, then that last person had to wait ten minutes before getting theirs.  By that time, the others were nearly half done.  LAME!
author: Matthew W.

description:
gurgle guurgle gurrgle.
rumble grrrrr rummmbleeee.

That is the noise my belly started making shortly after leaving King of Thai Noodle House. Sure, I really enjoyed all the purple throughout the place, but man that Pad Thai was heavy. The service was nice, but a bit pushy. After stating that we were not done eating and wanted to keep our plates, one of the waitresses decided we had had enough and proceeded to take our plates away to the kitchen.

Hours later, my belly was still suffering from the grrrgleee-gooos.

I did not like that. Not one bit.
author: Syd V.

description: Fast, consistent, cheap, good Thai food.  Great place for a quick bowl of noodle soup (about 10 different kinds to choose from) or a good sit down family style dinner.  One item I always order and sort of gauge Thai restaurants by is the Som Tum (papaya salad).  This place makes a pretty decent Som Tum salad!  Everytime I go to Thailand I eat Som Tum like 3 times a day there b/c it's soooo good and spicy!  I haven't really found any place in SF that makes it as "authentic" as the ones I've had in Thailand.  KOT comes pretty close tho!
author: Rick P.

description: Greasy food. Grumpy service. Flavor ok, but I have had better.
author: Alethea O.

description: They have the best Thai food ever, it's cheap and the wait is very short.  I always get the number 16, it's my favorite out of the whole menu besides the papaya salad, which is also very good.  But the only bad thing is that they only accept cash and I never carry cash with me.
author: Mayer V.

description: When I visited SFC, I always have dinner here. Their foods are such very good prices in this area and tastes are very authentic Thai...I would recommend this place especially Thai people. yum!
author: Bee B.

description: Decent thai restaurant but difficult for lunch since it can get pretty crowded in the main room. Pad thai was good but nothing special. Also they don't really serve things in any kind of order--just whenever something's ready it's delivered--so one person at our table didn't get their food for 10 minutes after the rest of us had started to eat. Oh well, it's cheap!
author: Jane K.

description: There's a reason why this place is always busy. The food is good and the service is fast. The atmosphere ain't bad either.
author: Brian L.

description: Best service. Friendly and smiling waiters. Duck stew noodle and papaya salad are my favorites. The price is very reasonable compared to other S.F restaurants. Wait time for the food is about 7 minutes. Always crowded.
author: Dennis W.

description: Wonderful Thai food with a cheap price. Me and my husband made it a point to not eat anywhere twice while staying in downtown SF and I so wanted to go back!
author: Lindsey S.

description: Worth every penny...it will take more pennies than most!  High price with matching quality minus the linen and crystal!
author: SGT Z.

description: Been here a few times for a quick bite of pad thai. The pad thai is the best dish here and always savory. What makes it unique are the little cubes of tofu on top. I wouldn't recommend the thai style fried rice; it's really bland unless you add chili to it. The thai tea is pretty good as well. You get a lot of food and the price isn't that bad. 26 bucks for 2 pad thais and 1 fried rice dish. I always end up taking extra food home.
author: Kat K.

description: I like this location better than the one on Geary a few blocks away.  It's not amazing Thai food, but it's cheap and your food comes out unbelievably fast.  The pineapple fried rice is good, so is the pad see-ew.  Cash only is a bummer, but hey when you want a quick greasy Thai meal, you'll find this place pretty satisfying.
author: Joseph N.

description: Yum! Curry was good, and something from the front page (spicy chicken thing) was super tasty. Egg rolls were smaller than I expected but good, not greasy. Kind of a bummer about the cash only thing and the ATM outside will rob you of almost $4 to access your own hard-earned dollars. Open late, very crowded and loud but good food at a good price!
author: Sarcastic T.

description: mediocre..good size portions for lunch!  But I have definitely had better.  I would opt for this over Coriander Gourmet Thai in the future just because you get a lot more for your buck here.  Pretty standard.
author: ELIZABETH W.

description: This place may be in the busiest area of all in San Francisco. But, it was definitely worth the wait and definitely the eating! Their food pricing are reasonable and their service is great. OMG! Their papaya salad is to die for, also their panang curry... they keeping it real :)
author: Sandy X.

description: This is a tiny space near the major theaters in the area, the Curran and ACT. It's good for a quick bite and only that. They can dish it out in under five minutes, if you're lucky. I had a noodle bowl with sliced beef. Very reasonably priced. Sit, Eat, Go.
author: R K.

description: Love this place for a good thai green curry!!!! they bring it with a plate of rice, which goes perfectly! and a great amount. ALSO at a good price!
author: Ria J.

description: After walking around MoMA...we got hungry. This spot seemed to be chill so we stopped in for a bowl of noodles before heading back to our hotel rooms to rest for the craygee debaucherous nite to come. Some of the stuff on the menu reminded me of pho made me feel all icky inside. In case y'all don't know...I do not like pho. Eww. Anyway...I had a chicken noodle soup thingee of some sort and it wasn't half bad. It cured my slight hangover from the nite before actually. And as you all know...it's always kinda cold in SF and being the brilliant lady that I am...I was wearing a mini skirt that day...yup the warm soup helped...BIG TIME. Thank you warm soup...
author: Caroline Y.

description: This is part of my 3-star standard.  With so few decently priced places to eat in the Union Sq area- this is a safe bet.  It's even safer to order noodle soup if you want prompt service.  Rice noodle soup ALWAYS arrives before any stir-fry dish at a table.  The stir fry dishes are typically oily, but that's Thai food in general, don't kid yourself.  The upside is that the Noodle Soup broth is decent, which is what matters and the meats-- beef, pork, duck are tender and delicate-- haven't tried the chicken yet.  I always check the condiments at Asian restaurants-- red peppers, chili sauce, chopped green pepper, etc-- and these were fresh with no sticky crusts around the containers; a very good sign.  Stop in, everyone is wearing purple!
author: E L.

description: I don't understand why this chain is so popular.  The food is so greasy!  Yes, it comes out fast but... it reminds me of a Thai version of Panda Express.  The Thai iced coffee isn't very good, either.
author: Lynn O.

description:
I've been to this location a few times in the past and the food  and service is usually pretty good. Things must have changed a lot since the last time I've gone. The server girl mixed up our order even though we all said our order clearly and even pointed to our item on the menu to show her since we couldn't pronounce it. It should have been simple, it should have been a no brainer. NOPE. A dish comes out a few minutes after we order and we're all a bit confused on how quickly it came out and how it didn't look anything like what we ordered. The server keeps pushing the dish to us, insisting this is what we got, even though we told her THREE TIMES straight that that's NOT WHAT WE ORDERED. I'm pretty sure the word "no" is the most simplest thing to learn in the English language.

 I'm not a huge stickler for service in hole in the wall restaurants like King of Thai so I'm fine with order mix ups as long as its handled with politeness. Not here, not today. The server kept pushing the dish at us despite our protests and even brought out the menu to show this was what we ordered. She might as well call us liars right out and tell us we don't know what we're talking about because that's definitely the feeling we all got from her. My friend had pointed to her order on the menu when we first ordered to avoid confusion but that sure as hell didn't do anything. I watched that server girl pass on the dish to another server who then proceeded to take it over to a table who nodded that it was theirs. I was steaming at this point because she didn't even come over to apologize. In fact, it was another girl who apologized. To make things even more ridiculous, that same rude server came back and repeated my other friend's order in a huffy commanding voice. That order came much later than all our dishes, which makes me think that rude server didn't get that order right either. So stupid. 

We left a 12% tip (GENEROUS in my opinion) and left with bad feelings. Do the basics in serving (get our order in good time, bring out the right orders, refill our water if need) and I leave at LEAST 15% if not usually more. I'm not coming back to this place and I sure as hell am not going to recommend it to the NUMEROUS people I know who often ask me where they should eat. A restaurant who can't get basic serving down is crap.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Casual, quick, and tasty. We were at the Union Square location for dinner around 5pm on a weeknight. I had the seafood soup with red broth, and it was as good or better than any Thai seafood soup I've had anywhere else in the country (I'm a soup fanatic). My wife had the seafood pad see-ew and loved it. It's the first Thai place I've been that let you pick what style noodles you want in your dish.

The night we were there they were serving Thai iced tea for free, so I tried one. Yum! By the time we left there was a line starting to form, so you might want to go early to avoid the crowd.
author: Laura C.

description: Duck soup was pretty good and yellow curry was about average. I will definately eat here again, but it wasnt anything to write home about.
author: Jamie K.

description: We had a nice little lunch. We were a little worried with it being there in Union Square that it might be too generic and not much flavor. We were pleasently surprised. It was not great, but really pretty good. We had a noodle dish and a fried rice dish and both were good. Service was not great, but adequate enough. We were just hanging out and it was just the two of us so we did not require much.
author: Chris C.

description: I like this place if I want something quick and cheap while shopping in the Union Square area.  I've never had a problem with waiting for a table, maybe I'm eating after the rush?  I always order the papaya salad, pad see ew, or fried chicken with fried rice.  Of course, I'm not eating all of that at one sitting for they have huge portions!  Simple and quick...you're back out the door shopping some more!
author: Irene C.

description: Very much into the Pad Thai with Tofu. It's the only thing I get every time I do go. It's open pretty late which makes it an even better spot. Service is always friendly and quick. I portion size is also plenty! Enjoy it! yum yum
author: Mish M.

description: After eating "mall food" so often, I decided to go for something outside the mall for once, and I was definitely not disappointed. Though the restaurant was packed, they found my group a seat very quickly--upstairs and away from the loud crowds. There was a flat screen TV and air con upstairs, compared to the ceiling fans downstairs. Service was decently quick; I felt sorry for the waiter having to carry food from the kitchen downstairs for the 8 or so tables on the second level. Some days though, service can be pretty slow, but luckily due to the purple polos that they wear, you can easily spot one of the 12+ waiters/waitresses frantically running around to try and help you. Their policy, however, is nice: to apologize for an inconvenience, they offer a drink on the house. Many of their tables are four-seaters, so if you are only a group of two, on a busy day, you may be asked to relocate seats due to a larger group coming in and the need to combine tables. If you can stand a busy lunch crowd and somewhat slow service, I recommend this restaurant.
author: Brittany L.

description:
I was so disappointed by the service when I visited last weekend I have to express my anger somewhere. This was not the first time I have been to the King of Thai chain and particularly to this location. It is just next to Macy's and is always my preference of dinning choice if I am shopping in downtown. I am not disappointed by the food. My one star is plainly for the services and hygiene situation of this restaurant.

I went there Friday night at 9pm. It was always crowded in this restaurant and my friend had a table under the stairs in the back end of their restaurant. The air circulation in that particular area was extremely bad. Seeing a lot of people walking up and down the stairs always made me want to change table. 

Since there was a couple sitting in the four-people table behind ours, I decided to take on the empty four-people table next to ours. I was spotted by a waitress who was walking down the stairs and was told that this is a "busy" hour and the table was reserved for four. As nice customers, we stayed at our table. But in the middle of my meal, another couple was allowed to sit in that reserved for four table.

I could not let my expensive purse plus my big brown bag on the dirty and sticky floor. I took an empty chair to put my stuff on it. Another waitress walking up the stairs rudely told us move the chair not to block the way, and then there she goes, she used her leg to push it to the spot blocking my friend's chair from exiting. Her rude attitude caught attention of the couple who was originally sitting in the four-people table.

I was looking around for still better table to sit at, and my seat was facing particularly the guy who pour water and make drink. If I had taken out my phone fast enough, I should have taken pictures so I have prove to tell everyone I am not lying about what I saw this day.

Here are the RED FLAGS:

**************************************************************************
1) The guy was making two Thai Ice tea when I first notice him in action. I don't understand why he was using his raw finger to dip into the ice (like playing the ice...?)
2) Then, he was pouring ice water into like 8 cups and let them stand in the counter. He literally used his finger to blush the edge of the almost every cup!! I was wondering why he had such action and then realized maybe to blush away lipsticks on the cups!!!
3) A white uniform person came out from the kitchen to go to the restroom, seeing me wide open my eyes looking shocked to the guy, informed the guy I am looking at what he is doing. (Because it was quite clear I am not checking him out) The guy stopped all his weird behavior after this. 
4) Our waitress was taking our order at the time and I already asked for straw to drink water (which is my usual habit). This guy brought me my straw after I spotted his actions and it feels weird. I regret I am in a Thai restaurant (having spicy food) and did not bring my own beverage!!

****************************************************************************

At the end, our meals sum up to $16.5. Even though I already told my friend I am not leaving tips (have not done that in more than 5 years), my lazy friend just leave $20 without getting any change back. I was so angry at my friend it makes me go back to High-school. I told her exact words, "I am going to be mad at you right now." 

I do not agree you should always leave tips at a certain percentage because tips should reflect your opinion on each and every service. Later on, I decided that I cannot let King of Thai not only ruined my dinner but my friendship. I called my friend and we are okay now. I would just never go back to this location and would go to this Thai place a little bit down on Powell if I want Thai food in this area.
author: Angel K.

description: This is a good lunch spot for downtown. It's not cosy or pretty but clean and the food tastes good. Good prices too.
author: Alexandra D.

description: I tried their veggie pad thai and it was pretty darn spicy! =/ Which sucks big time for a weak sauce like me... but thank goodness for that free cup of Thai ice tea or they would need to call the freakin SF fire dept! The portion size was good, but I wish there were more cubes of tofu in there and maybe if it wasn't that dry... Pretty crowded on a Saturday afternoon for a tiny little place, the service was quick... but not like super attentive or anything which I don't really blame them for it, it was pretty crazy busy.
author: Irene L.

description:
This one's better than the one on Geary just a few blocks west. The Pad Thai's usually pretty good. Heck, most of the noodle dishes are pretty good. 

It's a bit loud during the rush, but service is fast. They're like Thai nijas in refilling your beverage. One minute there's no one, and then wa-pa! there's someone refilling your glass.
author: William S.

description:
i would give zero stars if possible.  i went there with a group of friends from out of town........we were just walking around Union Square and one of them had a sister in SF, so we called her to ask her for some recs.  Surprisingly, she recommended King of Thai.

At first, it didn't look too bad because it was full of people and the prices were very reasonable.  however, when the food came out, everyone was totally disappointed.  the fish cakes were below average, my curry (forgot which one) was horrible, other people's noodle dishes were disgusting, etc etc.

i will never ever go there again.
author: Jay M.

description: i was just here for Saturday night. First, I was shocked by how small my plate was compared to last time. The portions are just too small compared to the price they charge. maybe tonight was an off night or they have turned very stingy and the quality has gotten lowered.
author: Erik L.

description: I went there a 2nd time with a friend and it was terrible. It seems that this place is errratic. I had pad see euw which was disgusting. It was oily, the noodles stuck together and they skimped on the other ingredients. My friend introduced me to this place and has had other good meals here. Her dish was bad as well. I'm hoping that was just an off day and I'll give it 1 more chance before I write this place off.
author: pj n.

description: I work part time next door to this restaurant.  My favorite item is the 'Pineapple Fried Rice'.  You get good size pieces of shrimp and pineapple.  I always request double portions of hot sauce to go with this.  Maybe the combination of hot sauce and pineapple is addicting.  My other favorite is 'Beef Pad See-Yew'.  I've tried the crispy fried chicken with fried rice but found the chicken to be a bit dry.   This place is not too big and thus cannot accommodate huge parties.  I usually take my order to go.
author: Nanette L.

description: My friend and I call this place purple Thai because everything in here is painted purple.  It is a good place to get noodles.  The soup I had here was a bit bland, but I like the dry noodle dishes.  The Pad See Ew is yummy as is the Ba Mee with pork.  Ty it with a Sprite, the world's best drink.  It really hits the spot.
author: apple r.

description: King of Thai is always fast and relatively cheap.  Had dinner here last night with a non-yelper friend when we met up to hang out after work.  I had the boneless sliced roasted duck soup with vermicelli noodles.  Very tasty.  I was sooo full afterward though.  My friend had the combination soup with flat rice noodles, which she completely finished.  This isn't the best place to go for Thai food, but it's pretty consistent.  It's almost always full and the service is definitely quick.
author: Kris L.

description: This is certainly not top-o'-the-line Thai food, but it's quick, reasonably priced (cash only), relatively tasty (I got an eggplant dish last time and was very happy with it, but my friend ordered a noodle dish that didn't have nearly as much in the way of vegetables as she wanted and was somewhat greasy); and--what makes it a 4-star review instead of 3 stars--is their accommodation of my no fish sauce request. I wouldn't travel to come here, but when in Union Square and needing a quick, cheap place to pop in and grab some B-grade Thai, this fulfills the need quite nicely.
author: Shomriel S.

description:
honestly, i can eat king of thai everyday, and twice on sunday. i absolutely love and crave this place!!

i usually frequent clement location, but was rushing out of bloomie's when i realized this was a new location. sweet. i can shop and get cheap eatz. life is good

this location is great; however my #15 dish took way way longer than it should have (over 20 minutes) at 4pm.  i also want to say it was more expensive than the clement locations??? nevertheless, it was just as yummy :)
author: joyce l.

description: so disappointing! my friends and i usually go to the one on clement after a night of festivities and have never been disappointed. however, this one was terrible! first the portions were a lot smaller, the pad kee mao was tasteless, the pork larb was blarb, and the duck pineapple fried rice was like a curry fried rice. weird....
author: Jennifer C.

description:
good place for fast food thai while shopping in union square...
quite a large menu... 
i like their fried noodle dishes and also their fried rice dishes as well... thai iced coffee... yumm
good prices, but bring cash, cus that's all they take... :)
author: charlotte s.

description: Everyone in our group was pleased with the quality of food, they even had enough to offer for our veggie and vegan friend.  Thai soccer was playing on their flatscreen TV's...totally cool.  Would've gotten 5 stars from me, but the service was so-so.  I had some hot tea with my order, and it took forever for them to get me a refill (after multiple requests).  They have such small tea cups, they'd probably benefit from bigger ones...too bad they didn't have a suggestion box.  Seems petty, but don't get in the way of me and my tea!  The fact that they forgot my last request for tea would've given them three stars, but one of the servers came back mid-way during the meal to make sure that our order was completely delivered and everything was okay.  Yeah that's standard for most restaurants, but for some reason it gained them another star since it seemed sincere.
author: Mark D.

description: I love Thai Food, I usually go to the King of Thai Noodle in the Richmond  area, but I was Downtown one day and i wanted Thai so I went to the King of Thai in the Downtown area and ordered my usual, Pad Thai, when I ate it, it was super spicy! I do not know why! It was my first Pad Thai ever being so spicy! It was unbelievable retarded and so uncalled for! I do not know why it was so spicy!
author: Janet Z.

description: Fried chicken over fried rice! Simple, yet effective. I still like Sanamluang's version better (it's in SoCal) . But hey, I'm not hatin', I still love this place. I also love that there are a bunch of these in the city.
author: LM M.

description: I resisted getting one of my favorite meals, Tom Yum soup, and decided to be adventurous and try something new. The menu is extensive, from soups that allow you to choose your ingredients and even your noodles, to entree plates with rice. I ordered a dish with mushrooms and shrimp in a garlic sauce with rice, the name of which fails my Caucasian American mind, which was really good. The portions are large and the service was good, the prices are decent. It was good, but not great, I was not blown away or anything. I would be willing to give it another try, go again, but with so many fantastic restaurants in this city, I would probably walk right by for one of the better places.
author: Tim J.

description: Discovered this little jewel during one of our many San Francisco getaways from Los Angeles. Most of the times we travel on a budget, but like to find or frequent places that will give you a bang for your buck, this place my friends is one of them. Friendly service and the food was out in no time; I will visit when in town again.
author: Max K.

description: I work very close by and eat here often. I love it, they are great for carry out or dining in. Super inexpensive and quick. While they bill themselves as a "noodle house" their fried rice dishes are far superior, although all their food is great. I've probably tried about half their menu by now.
author: Ryne E.

description: This place is an affordable refueling stop for your Union Square area shopping sprees. Some of the entrees are memorable but in general its the location and the prices that keep me coming.
author: Andrew W.

description:
it always seems to be pretty crackin' since its in a good location (right near all the shopping.. and of course, shopping can totally starve a woman!) from looking on the outside, it can appear small but there's a stairway in the back that goes up to the other floors.. so if you went and it looked full, don't be immediately discouraged! they probably have more seating upstairs :) --  this place is fairly cheap and has really good thai food. i tried their red curry, asked for spicy and they made it to exactly how i liked it.. service was quick and portions were generous. 

bottom line, lots of good tasty food + cheap + fast = happy me and taste buds! :D
author: Jennie L.

description:
i've eaten here three times and i've pretty much ordered the same thing.  roast duck fried rice.  and i gotta say, i love it!  i'm a huge fried rice fan and whenever i eat at an asian place, i ALWAYS have fried rice.  their other items are pretty good too although i haven't really had the chance to try too many other items.  had some pad thai last time i was here, it was so-so, i've had better.  

service is pretty fast, we got our food really quickly which was great cos we were cold, soaked from the rain and starving!
author: Jon R.
