description: King of Thai is my safe haven. Its my relief when I'm wandering around Union Square, hungry, lost and confused. The food is good and decently priced; the restaurant itself is covered in one of my most favorite girly colors; and when they give you water, there's a little bit of lemon squeezed into it that makes you smile. This place makes me a happy camper.
author: Candy C.

description: Tried this location of King of Thai Noodles and find that the flavor with the one I am used to going to is a tad bit different. The flavors were similar but not as strong as the one on Taraval on SF.  The noodles were a little soggy as it seemed to be overcooked. For the price and location though, its okay.  I will stick to the one on Taraval as it is closer to my home and more convenient for us all.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Food is ok plus free thai tea drink but restaurant was so hot and I can't breath Iike AC broken. I m not feel comfortable this time. The restaurant floor was dirty. They need to clean their floor. I like thai ppl always serve with smile, quick ,and friendly.
author: Naomi h.

description: I loved this place....then I took a good friend there for lunch.  Just as we were finishing a huge COCKROACH ran across the floor and under our table.    Gotta tell ya, not going back.
author: Mark W.

description: If you're shopping downtown and want something good to refuel with, this is the place to go.  Even though it's crowded, the wait is never that long.  You get your food fairly quickly and everything is reasonably priced for a Thai food chain.
author: Christie X.

description: Good spot to have a food break while shopping amidst the tourists in Union Square. The food is average, and I've had better Thai food elsewhere, BUT there is a lack of eateries (excluding fast food) in the downtown shopping area, so this would probably be my best choice when I don't have time to eat before I go shopping. I usually order the fried chicken over fried rice, which never disappoints.  Service can be slow during peak hours.
author: Zell C.

description: Fairly inexpensive and the service wasn't too awful (although the Thai tea wasn't the best I've had). All in all, the food came out super fast which was great considering I was STARVING. I think it took longer waiting for a waitress to take our order than for our food to come out. HUGE portions which is always appreciated. I'd recommend this place and I will probably eat here again when I am craving Thai food.
author: Christy H.

description: Good Thai food, and cheap.  The wait staff is very attractive.
author: Tinou B.

description: I discovered this place when my Thai friend was in town for business.  It was our first time.  The moment we walked into the restaurant, my friend said it smelled like restaurant in Thailand and he thought the food was gonna be really good.  He was right.  The food was great, so was the price.  The service was good.  Thai food isn't hard to cook and the ingredients aren't expensive.  I'd rather go here than to the fancy and overrated Thai restaurant in the city.  The food at King of Thai noodle house is quite authentic, almost as good as in Thailand.  I never thought I could find a restaurant outside of Thailand can be this good.
author: Lan P.

description: I've been to many thai restaurants, but this is probably my favorite one!  Everything I've ordered has been great, so I don't think you can go wrong with anything.  One of my favorite dishes there is the beef noodle soup with the flat rice noodles.  I don't know of any other place that has thai beef noodle as good as King of Thai, or "the purple place" as i like to call it, especially when its kinda rare to find this dish on the menu at most thai restaurants in the bay.  I was surprised to find this dish at a thai place in Maryland, but as I thought it would turn out...its not that great.
author: Melanie T.

description:
How much tip should you tip the waitress if......
1. You ordered small rice noodles with your noodle soup and they give you vermicelli
2. Once they delivered the wrong noodles to your table, and you tell the waitress that the order is wrong she says: "No, this is small noodles." And I correct her and tell her exactly which one I wanted (takes the bowl away). Then the waitress we ordered from comes 2 minutes later and says: "excuse me, you ordered vermecelli." in an extremely harsh tone. And I say: "No, I ordered small rice noodles." She walks away mumbling to herself in some language I could not understand.
3. We ordered thai ice tea, but never got our order.
4. Not only did the thai ice tea not get to our table, they charged us for it. Wouldn't they be smart enough to check to see if we got it? AND they crossed out everything else (the 2 entree items we ordered) on the list, EXCEPT for the thai ice tea meaning they never delivered it.
5. When we told them that we're not paying for that cause we never got it, and we don't want it at the very end of our meal anyway, she glared and snatched the bill away to do the corrections.

Really, how much tip do they really deserve???

I have to say, the food is great here. If I crave for some thai food, I would just come here if I'm in the middle of shopping. Usually the service is never exceptional, it's always just average. I atleast get my correct order. But for some reason, this time I went, the service was extremeley horrible. It made me want to just hurry up and finish my food and just get the hell outta there!
The only reason they even got the 2 stars was for the food. They got negative 5 stars for the poor poor service.
author: Fanny C.

description: Not the best Thai food I've had, but really good enough for the speed and prices. This place seems really busy and packed, but we only had to wait about 10 minutes or so for our group of seven. If you're out with a group, starving late at night, this is the place I would recommend.
author: Jenny W.

description:
Great Pad Thai, and Beef Noodle Soup, but haven't tried any other Thai places in the area yet.

Super fast service and great prices.
author: Emily H.

description: Their rice was total crap. It was hard and kinda cold, so that just really ruined my meal. Although that might be because I went at like 10:30pm.
author: Anna Y.

description: Four stars for their tasty Tom Yum :) I consider myself 5% Siamese since I spent my last six years in a high school with Thai students as majority. I still could not find good Green Curry, They are just too sweet :( I'm glad that the Tom Yum is good. Their fried rice are good too, duck fried rice! The service is so-so~ fast enough. The place is nice. Too bad I had Tom Yum most of the time lols so that's it!
author: Marlis T.

description: I come here, at least, twice a week and order the same food  to go.  The servers' shirts and surrounding walls are colored purple,  so it's kinda hard to see the servers 'cause they're, basically, in camouflage. And if u holler, they most likely wouldnt hear u 'cause the place is too loud. At times, I would wave my hand , but usually  that doesn't work either. One time, I felt like making a scene just to get their attention. If it wasn't for the good food, I wouldn't come here at all. Anyway, one of the servers gave me a genuine smile yesterday and it made me feel good. I think they're starting to get to know me.
author: Rick B.

description: i am only giving two stars because its the only place that catches my eye downtown when im hungry. I came here tonight with my boyfriend to eat dinner since i havent seen him for a while because of his work and me going to school elsewhere. It was packed but we did not expect to be seated inbetween the bathroom and staircase in leather jackets. Nobody should be seated there. So my boyfriend got fed up with the service after nobody stopped to listen and moved ourselves to the bar. We ordered our food which took forever to reach my table. I ordered the spicy eggplant with bell peppers basil and beef. I asked for extra basil but instead had about 3 leaves (literally), with hard dry meat and it wasnt even spicy. I really hated the food there tonight and would be hesitant to go back after this experience.
author: Bonnie Z.

description: Cheap food that doesn't taste like paper? Really? Yes, it does exist.  But only if you're patient enough to wait to be seated in this UBER popular restaurant. I admit that I looked at the line to get into this place, and kept walking. The food is good, but when you're ravenous, sometimes 10 minutes is too long to wait.  Once you're in, the service is pretty fast, and the food is tasty.
author: brenda b.

description: Need a quick noodle fix? This is the place. Whenever I'm in the area and need a quick meal (usually to catch a movie or shopping), this is the place I duck into. Service IS quick.... pictures on the menu makes it idiot proof. Food is always good. Not the best Thai noodle I've had but its definitely gets an extra star for being clean and no frills.
author: Richard K.

description: While not as good as Basil Thai on Folsom Street, this is the place to go for cheap thai that is open late!  Try the pad see ew, it is good.
author: Matt N.

description: good food but make sure to specify how hot you like it. I apparently ordered it as hot as hell. it was hot all around!!!! good food for late nite and great service!!
author: Jennifer O.

description: King of Thai Noodle near Union Square is my "go-to" for cheap noodles during the occasional downtown shopping run. Fast service and good noodles. Order the Combination Beef Noodle Soup with a Thai Iced Tea; it's as simple as that.
author: Steven S.

description: Pad See Euw with duck is all you need!  Delicious and relatively cheap!  I love this place for a quick meal on my way back home.
author: Josh V.

description:
if you ever want to sit, order, eat, and pay within 20 minutes, and have good food, this is your place.  simple, non date-ey place, and always reliable.  if you know what you want, your food will be on your plate within 3 minutes, i'm not kidding.  

yes, there ARE better places, but if you're on a time crunch downtown, come here, always seating, nothing fancy, just simple reliable thai food.
author: Jason J.

description: This place is located right across the street from my job so I don't have to walk far which is wayy convenient for me. I have the chicken soup with small rice noodle which costs me about $6.80. The portion is good but the chicken seems to be a bit on the freezer burn side. Kinda dry and a little hard. They do not offer oyster sauce which is my favorite with rice noodle and kinda leaves me looking for more.
author: Falana H.

description: This place is delicious!! First of all the service is quick, efficient and friendly. We have tried a lot of the menu and the quality is very very consistent. The soups are flavorful and large. The pineapple rice is very special. The pad gra praw is great too. My favorite are the curries especially the pumpkin with chicken from the special menu. The thai style tea is well worth a try too. Bottom line is this is the best and most consistent thai food I've had in the city.
author: Irewan M.

description: The location is just fantastic. However prices have been going up and up. Service is good and fast, and the food still taste great. :)
author: Catherine T.

description: this place is beyond overated ... I went on a Thursday at noon... took about 30 min to get service, and food was not good...
author: Sung B.

description:
I love this place!  Everytime I am in the area I try to make a special stop.  

Cheap, fast, GOOOOOOD food!
author: Tony C.

description: One of my best friends is Thai AND one of the biggest food critics I know, and even she bows down to the King of Thai.  I've been here several times to eat in or take out, and I've always been happy.....their roasted duck over rice is my comfort food.....It's the sweet and spicy sauce they serve on the side that takes it over the edge.  See: my last meal.  I have yet to find Thai food nearly as good in San Diego.
author: Nicole L.

description: This place is almost always crowded but the wait is not usually very long.  It's cheap, fast, and yummy.  They don't take credit cards so bring cash!!
author: Hey La P.

description: MMMmm, quick and fast and painless. That's how I like my Thai. Well, it's not always painless, because this spot can get pretty jumping. But the turnaround is so fast, you barely notice. They put yummy food on your table so fast, you wonder if it's instant. Great place for a quick bite to eat.
author: Matt L.

description: I recommend this place if you're looking for good (not excellent) cheap food. This place is also good for some late night drunkin munchies. I enjoy the yellow curry, as well as the chicken pad see-yew, the tom ka is ok too. I do wish they took credit credit card card but unfortunately that's not the case. The service is quick. I also wish they had fresh spring rolls (they only offer fried...).
author: Cameron R.

description: I have only been to this KoT once, but the standard great fast cheap food.    Despite it being noon on a Sunday when everyone seemed to be out shopping, got in right away,. and the food was up to the standards I expect from the King.  I have designated it my place to get food if I have to be out shopping in this part of the city.
author: Alured P.

description: This is another one of Thai restaurants we like to go when we're in downtown.  Everything on the menu is good and their service is always fast!  So if you're on the go and just want to grab something easy/good/fast and cheap then I would recommend coming to this place.
author: JenJen W.

description: Love the food, only thing is it gets crowded on the weekends!  Service also could use improvement.
author: Syonora A.

description: This is my after shopping restaurant stop for the past 5 years. Its good, and its cheap! The only thing is: you need CASH. The servers are very friendly too.
author: Josephine D.

description: Good Thai food, unbelievably fast service, and relatively cheap prices.  And yes, they like the to turn the tables over fast so get used to it.
author: Rene M.

description: The three of us were stalking the City, looking for a decent Thai restaurant.  Some were too empty, others too dirty; then we passed King of Thai.  The place was packed, and everyone was eating and smiling; looked like the perfect joint for a bowl of tom yum goong and some pad Thai.  First note, we ordered WAY too much.  The portions are huge, so order less than you think you'll need.  Second, they bring the food FAST - almost too fast. This is not the place for a relaxing, long meal.  The first dish came out less than five minutes after we placed the order.  The noodles were all tasty, but not superior.  The vegetables were crisp and fresh, and the broth piping hot.  The masaman curry was too thick, more like peanut butter than a real curry.  Overall, it's a three star place; decent if average Thai food, with quick and polite service.  If you need a quick, cheap hit of Thai food, this will do just fine.
author: Alex G.

description: Great, cheap food and really fast service!
author: Byron V.

description: the second worst Pad See-Ewe I've ever had.  Bland bland bland.  They used the wrong soy sauce for this dish and ruined the dish.
author: Richard G.

description: Service is ridiculously fast...which is nice...but you feel rushed.  I went a few times and I love it but I've only been during lunch rush hour.
author: Tala L.

description: So you are a cheap date who wants to order some great take out and rent a chick flick on a foggy summer evening deep in the heart of our lovely city  (Clement St.) all for under 20 smackaroos and not feel like you are eating cardboard or industrial carpeting... this is the place for you!  #15 rocks (with chicken) the food was made so fast I barely had time to get my straw in the Thai iced tea.... not even a sip and the nice lady handed me my bag (complete with food, chopsticks, fork and napkins without having to ask for them!!)... delish.
author: Luke P.

description: This is an absolute horrible place.  The service was terrible and the food was not that great.  DOn't know what the hype was all about.  The waitress charged the table tax that came out to be 50% of the tab.  What they are doign is illegal.  Both my friend and I ordered $7 each worth of food which should have came out to around $14.  The bill came out to be $21.  We didn't not order anything extra.  I willnever eaver eat here again and will be telling all my friends and family to avoid this place.  The waitress even threatened to call the cops if I didn't pay the bill. Please avoid this place.  Not worth the grief.
author: Nancy K.

description: This location used to be my favorite - but last year, they seemed to change the wait staff and policies. I used to ask for a 4 seat table (when I was with a friend) since the two seat tables never had enough room for the 4-5 dishes I would order (and take the leftovers home for the next day). Before they would always oblige, now they refuse even when I explain. Sorry, I will only go there when they're not busy (which is hardly ever?). That said, the food is really great. Well perhaps if I get those pork things in tofu skin deep fried with plum sauce I will put up with a smaller table....
author: Dave P.

description:
I worked at Macy's a few years back and love King of Thai.  Whenever I'm in the area shopping, I usually bring an order of take out home.  

You can't go wrong with the fried chicken over fried rice.  But everything I've had there is great.  The owner is really nice too.  

Only issue is that it is cash only, but it's not so bad when Walgreens is right down the block on Powell, just get a stick of gum and get some cash back.
author: mary c.

description: Cheap and decent place to eat in downtown. I had vegetarian noodle soup which was very good. The portion was perfect and it had a lot of vegetables, tofu and mushrooms. The place could be cleaner, though.
author: Mia D.

description: Good place for Thai Food. I like the great service and tasty food. Not sure what dish they consider the signature dish but I enjoy their som tam, basil chicken, and my favorite is the pad kee mao (in English this translates to drunken noodle). Pad Kee Mao is similar to a chow fun if you've been to a Chinese restaurant.
author: Keith H.

description: The food here is even blander than taste of thai which i didn't think was possible. The busy atmoshpere and pretty waitresses draw you in at first, but once you hit the food its a different story. the service is below average (maybe its cause its busy, or all the pretty went to the waitresses heads) and the food takes a a long time to come out which is good if you're on a date, bad if you're not.
author: Tae K.

description: Great cheap place for decent fast Thai ! If your low on funds and time stop by here. They only take cash and the service is super fast. I've had a few of there soups and dishes and never been disappointed. Plus the the little Thai girls are very cute to look at!!
author: John N.

description:
I had the thinly sliced beef noodle soup (...basically pho?) with vermicelli. The beef was tough and there were barely any vegetables in the soup...just a bunch of noodles and some overcooked meat for $6.25. The service was sparse, and our meals arrived separately, about 5 minutes apart.

I was told to try the roasted duck soup, so they'll get one more shot. some time. eventually. Anyway, there are far better options a only few blocks up Geary or O'Farrell (Sai Jai, Thai House Express, maybe the old Mekong/new Bang San, or, hell, even Osha on Geary since you're already getting shit service at King of Thai).
author: Fire P.

description:
I like to go this place  when I'm super hungry,
and when it's really cold out.

The food comes very fast and their spicy noodle soup make me feel so warm...:) YUMMY! ;9
author: Ritsmomo L.

description: i ordered a pad thai, which only had one shrimp in it.  i also had to wait 20 minutes for my take out at 3pm, when no one else eats lunch.  the waitress took my $20 and didn't give me back my change and leaves to the kitchen.  5 minutes go by and she walks by me (ignoring me), and i ask her, "where's my change?"  she responds, "in a minute."  10 minutes passes by, i ask for my change, and again it's "in a minute."  finally when i get my food, i had to ask her one last time before she gave me back my damn change.
author: H. L.

description: ok, why was there a soup dish in the "rice plate" portion of the menu? if i wanted soup, i would have gotten a chicken noodle one of some sorts. instead i got a bowl of hot and sour soup, with chicken and veggies(ewww veggies). luckily my mom's pad thai was too much for her so i was somewhat satisfied. except the pad thai sucked, and the noodles were so thin. angel hair pad thai?!? i guess i should have just stuck to the yellow curry like a good boy. next time, dont make us sit next to another family. i dont know them and dont want to have dinner with them. why dont you seperate the tables you idiots. instead we had to sit at a bar, staring at the wall. oh, and thanks for forgetting about our drinks. a soda and a coffee are just too much to remember, i know... hope you enjoyed your 22 cent tip. suck it
author: Andrew T.

description: The food and service are always good. The prices are cheap and the portions are big. The pra-ram is really yummy. They're very vegetarian friendly and open late. It's definitely not the most elegant decor, but it's perfect for a quick, good meal.
author: Laurie A.

description:
The worst Thai food I have had so far.  The menu seems to be similar to most Thai food restaurants.  I went there during lunch time and the crowd was decent sized and mostly Asian.  The waiters were very young looking and seemed happy.  But it took a while to get their attention and to get a seating.

Once I ordered the vegetarian fried rice, I got it within a minute or two.  The Thai Iced tea was mediocre and the fried rice was warm.  Moderate sized portions of food but quality sucks.  The broccoli seems to have gone through couple of cycles of 'freeze /thaw' and looked pathetically withered.  I ordered medium hot and the rice tasted a bit sour (??).
author: Saamaanyan R.

description: Great-tasting Thai food at great prices.  Service is very fast but the staff are not the most enthusiastic.  The purple decor theme is nice but the place could be a little cleaner and the furniture more comfortable.  Cash only!
author: K K.

description: I go the location on Geary often.  I went to this one and ordered duck over rice to go. The price was higher than the other location, and when I opened it, there was so LITTLE duck there that I had to get another lunch.  And it was cold! YUCH!!
author: Lalo R.

description: I like going to KOT because it is fast, somewhat cheap, and good.  I don't like my food all "fancied" up.  I like my food just made with enough taste (sauces and spices) and this is KOT.  I usually rotate on getting the Pork Pad See Ew, Duck Fried Rice, and Hoi Jor.  I add tons of peanuts and peppers on my food (not to say I'm taking away from the original taste though - just a preference).  Too bad I don't work in the Financial District anymore or else I would be visiting every other day for lunch.
author: chester c.

description:
now get this.

i used to frequent this joint way back when there were only two or three of the purple outlets - pre-split to the yellow thai joint that's now on powell and even before they shut it down for a while. this was back when i walked five miles to school barefoot in the snow. but i digress.

back then it was the thai place to go to. cheap noodle soups, friendly and fast wait staff, consistent food any time of day (except in the mornings, but i think that's when they have to dig up the cow parts to toss into the base of the noodle soups - so it's a bit light then).

i used to tell me friends the following: "friend, check out king of thai nex to macy's. cheap thai food. yum." and they'd check it out and report back with the following: "yeah, pretty good stuff and cheap! wow!". happy camper here. happy camper there. happy campers everywhere.

had i known of yelp (hey i just got on this internet thing - it was broken for a while) back then, i would have given the place 5 stars. no doubt.

now, after the past string of visits when the wait staff was a bit off in their waitstaffing kung-fu, the noodle soups off-flavored (mostly lighter in taste, not the thick, rich soups i'd enjoyed in the past), and their broad noodles sticking to each other so as to avoid ample exposure to the "sauce", i'd have to downgrade my recommendation to an "underperform". they've even raised their prices to the point where i have to think twice before going. back when noodle soups were only $4.75, you could hardly complain, even if the soup flavor was "off" or whatever. with the addition of plenty of fish-sauce-drowned thai chilis (you have to ask for that - then and now) and the various other condiments, you'd have yourself a fine meal, sweating yourself silly.

if this somewhat downgraded review has you going to the competition - the yellow-awninged place on powell (next to the money exchange place) or even more upscale to the overrated and lunch-time-trendy osha on second (oh yeah, i've got to opine on this place too), don't! king of thai is the original local chain of cheap thai eats. i still go there and favor that to the aforementioned places.

maybe i just miss the old crew that used to work there. like co-workers who leave for that better paying and exciting new job, leaving you inside your cubicle to fend off the aging stink of the mundane, the old crew - the guys and gals who used to serve me up the fastest-prepped and cheap thai eats west of the mississippi (that had a restaurant with at least a "b" rating) left for the other thai eateries. but that's part of the dining experience. the ambiance of the joint only channels the vibe of the people working there. when the vibes gone, the food goes with it. and the soup gets cold.
author: dave tastic fantasmo x.

description: This is more like a Thai version of McDonald's which has its place in the gastronomic universe somewhere - its good in a pinch I suppose - definitely not the type of place I'd ever go out of my way for though...
author: Quartknee K.

description: pretty good, a little bit on the salty side but still tasty
author: Peter W.

description: food is disgusting!! over priced! employees are rude! portions are small!!!!
author: Jennifer D.

description: I come here when i go shopping in sf.  It's right across the street from the parking lot.  The food is good and the price is great also.  They are really busy there, so sometimes the service is not the best, but then it's understandable.
author: Annimated L.

description: We were at a show at the Curran, didn't get dinner before, and severally underestimated the length of the show (3 1/2 hours)! So, getting out at 11:30PM, not too many options. Since this place was open late, and only a few blocks away, we decided to check it out. It was pretty busy for so late at nigh - always good sign. Waitress came by to take our order (I had the duck over rice and husband ordered the pad kee mao). My duck was delivered (pretty tasty, but the sauce on top of it took away the crispy texture that I love) and I started eating while waiting for my husband's dish. We waited while the tables around us got their noodle orders. We waited while I fished my dish. Waited while trying to make eye contact with the wait staff. No such luck. We waited as they came by and picked up my empty plate. Husband had given up by then and decided he wasn't that hungry anyway. When they dropped off the check, there was an "oh, did you order pad kee mao too??!!" Nevermind.
author: Eme L.

description: So cheggit out. Last Friday, me and my boy Aris walked passed this joint at like 1:37am in the Moe Ning. I originally wanted Pizza to absorb the alcohol that was consumed in my Stew Match, so this king of thai was right next door to a pizza joint. We walkin into the pizza joint and stand in line. Aris was like.."dude...King of Thai sounds really good right now." so i was like.."ya. what in the flying hell are we thinking standing in line for some bunk ass pizza. what are we stupid? (then it dawned upon my knuckleheadness of half a brain i got left that i was severely intoxicated) Lets get up out this joint" so 37 seconds later, we walk next door to this King of Thai. I check my cell phone and i swear it was exactly  your daylightsavings time of 1:37am and 37 seconds. Beeep! (P.O.P.C.O.R.N.) so we get seated, and Aris goes "DAMMNN...this IS gonna be GOOD!" the waitress was supposed to give us a menu...and i throw the palm in the air. i was like.."hold on baby...no need to bother with the menu. I would like to order the Beef Thai Lahd Nah and Chicken Fried Rice". i knewed that we were limited with time because they were nice enough to serve us since they were ready to close shop. Anyways...it prolly only took them 5 minutes and 37 seconds to bring out our food. Me and Aris were hungry as hell so we scarfed those plates. so exactly 37 degrees to our left, there were these 3 asian girls and two white dudes. all of a sudden, one of the asian girls completely went MAD! she started Yelling at juan of the other asian girls and used some vulgar language and unacceptaple broken english that offended me. I was just like...O gorts. me and aris were crackin up. and aris was like..NO NEED TO BE MAD...THE FOOD IS REALLY GOOD HERE! i agreed with aris and i replied..."YA...HOW CAN YOU BE UPSET AT A PLACE LIKE THIS. THE FOOD IS HEY-BEN TO ME" i meant to said "heaven" but since i was around fobs, the hey-bee accent came out of me. So right before the Angry Asian chick walked out, she was like.."I HATE SPICEY FOOD! I FORCED MYSELF TO EAT THIS BECAUSE OF YOU!" i was like...that is the reason you blew up? i thought that in my head of course cuz i was scared she might sock me in the face. So when she left and walked out, i mentioned to the Waitress that I LOVE THEIR FOOD! SO WHAT! GO WARRIORS! then i also mentioned that I completely walked out of the Pizza joint next door because I WANTED KING OF THAI! KING OF THAI! i then said, "when im feeling down or depressed...this is the place to make me happy. I LOVE THIS FOOD! I REALLY REALLY APPRECIATE THIS FOOD" the cooks were around and they laughed but im sure they really appreciated my words and said thank you. then right before me and aris cut out of that joint, i bowed down to the cooks and waitressess like "we're not worthy! we're not worthy" anyways..what a long ass review. couldnt i just have said..this place is good check out the stars i provided? *shakes head*  did u guys fall asleep too while i was telling this story? zzzzzzzzzzzZZzzzzzz
author: Romes K.

description: was shopping around the area, was hungry so i thought id get some thai tom yum soup. but then all the portions were like huuuuuuuuuge and it was like 8 bucks. i wanted something small so i asked the waiter if there was anything smaller .....they gave me a half portion of the tom yum gong...it was LEGIT! I really wanna go back and try their food....
author: Cindy L.

description: i've only had one thing here...seafood rice noodles.  not the best but reliable and tasty enuf.  also, service is fast, which is great when it's late night, and you are hungry.  cash only, which sucks.
author: Helen T.

description:
ill say right off the only reason i wont give this place 5 stars is that i live in berkeley & im rather cranky about the fact they force me to cross the bridge just to get a taste of that sweet sweet buttery crack they serve cleverly disguised as Tom Kha Gai soup.

i first came upon king of thai noodle during last year's love festival when i was still living in LA at the time & my boyfriend & i had a room at the Hotel Union Square, just down Powell. 
We had just woken up from a nap around midnite-ish after stumbling back to the room from a long wine soaked day and didnt quite feel like going out for more partying, instead we were STARVING.
We hit the streets walking, realizing the sidewalks around here were practically rolled up in every direction & we were not about to go hit up carls jr...so we walked up powell & turned the corner & there it was in its purpley neon glory.. "open"  hell. yes.
the staff was friendly & attentive for a little late night thai joint. we were pleased that the menu was crazy affordable & expansive to no end, complete with pretty pictures.
i loooove pho & i know that pho is not a thai dish, but i wanted noodles & i basically got beef pho, thai style, no cilantro (the devils weed) upon request. the boy ordered the Tom Kha Gai soup. in less than 5 minutes we were served our tasty ginormous bowls of soup.
oh so tasty.
oh so good.
and in that fateful moment when the boy said "youve gotta try this" i took my first spoonful into slavery of  Tom Kha Gai heaven.
i dont care where you go, i dont care how much it costs, ive eaten at copious thai spots across california both carry out & high brow & ive never had a soup as creamy & buttery /spicy as the elixir they serve here. my beef soup w/ thai noodles was amazing too, ill add.

ive been back about 5 times since moving to the bay, and always make it a point to try a different dish each time and have never been the least disappointed. pad thai, pad se ew, pad woon sen, pineapple fried rice, yellow curry, all of it is a healthy portion, served hot & fresh and terribly tasty.  sometimes the service slacks when they get busy, but they are always friendly & even when showing up with more than 4 people, do their best to accommodate with seating re-arrangements.

ps. get the Tom Kha Gai.
author: Gabby K.

description: two of my favorite things: cheap and delicious.  not haute cuisine, but it is cheap and delicious, so it doesn't have to be.  consistency really isn't there- some days are better than others, but it has never been really bad.  basically it is thai fast food.  i heart thai fast food.
author: Samantha W.

description: food is pretty good and consistent and prices are decent...so why four stars? because it's one of the only good places to eat around here...I'm serious!  ok so the mall is right there, but it can get a little pricy and really noisy. Besides that and some little indian places where are you going to go?  Blondies?  yeah right-their pizza tastes like shit.  PLus this place is really quant and the portions are big...if you're around the neighborhood and need some quick eats this is a good bang for our buck.
author: Kat D.

description: I'm Thai, and I can say to you all that this is soooooo not authentic. The Pad-see-ew was way to oily, and has no taste it's supposed to have.
author: warakant j.

description: This place is good for breaking in someone to the wonders of Thai food. It's not too "authentic" if you catch my drift (i.e. you can read the descriptions on the menu in English). You can take a meat and potatoes man and tell him "trust me you'll find something here you'll like" and chances are he will! However although service here is quick, it is forgetful---as in the last three times I've been here they've forgotten my drink order! I am two steps away from wearing a shirt saying "Don't forget my dietCoke!" but (a) I don't think that anyone working their or not, would get it. and (b) even if anyone noticed my shirt in the first place, it would be my friend Dani who would steal said shirt and wear it with pride anywhere BUT King Of Thai Noodle House (because it's SO much easier to listen to a petite female than a mini tree like myself-yeah right). Oh well, despite muttering to themselves in a foreign language under their breath (major major turnoff by the way-regardless of what language you speak) they get a bonus point just for being quick and cheap (2 people, 2 bowls of soup plus reasonable tip less than $20=hells yea!!). Great if you need a meal type diversion while shopping in Union Square
author: Veronica G.

description: Was introduced tot this restaurant a few weeks ago. I had fried chicken over fried rice, simply delicious! This will be my new "cheap eats" in Union Square.
author: Soutbay G.

description: I love this place.  The chicken saute is fantastic.  The egg noodle is great.  The prices are fantastic.   And the Thai waitresses are easy on the eyes.
author: Roby R.

description:
we went in for a quick bite to eat and it was really packed. we got put in the back near the bathrooms and sort of hung out with the staff that chatted away in thai as they pounded starbucks coffee drinks. some of the staff were really nice and others were sort of indifferent, of the "ugh-another-customer" ilk. 

i guess i wouldn't have minded that sort of off-putting behavior had the food been tasty. no such luck. the green curry was really bland. a pool of coconut milk and lackluster veggies. the pad see-ew was ok but really not up to snuff. i had heard great things about this restaurant but am sorely disappointed. i would rather go to the quickie "bangkok" down the street or one of the many, far better places, on post...
author: joseph j.

description: This restaurant was very good, especially the food was really exellent. And also the service was O.K. But I want to point out its strange ambience. The place is big, and the restaurant has two floors. So there are so many tables and chairs. But there are too many tables for the area!! Even in front of the door of the restroom, there are tables and chairs. Actually, I was shocked after looking at it. I don't like that. Who wants to eat in front of the restroom??
author: JA K.

description: might not be authentic but it satisfied me perfectly! i ordered the thick noodles with peppers and chicken, extra spicy=)  the food came out really quickly! my bf and i had a hot sauce eating contest which left us really thirsty and they refilled our water without us even asking! great service. will definitely be back whenever i crave spicy noodles, and the meal was cheap too. around 14 dollars for 2 people.
author: christy w.

description: The other night, our attempts to go to a couple clubs failed, so we ended up at King of thai. This chain restaurant has a few locations, we went to the one over by Mezzanine.  The good thing about this place is that it is open late.  You can go here after a club or if you just feel hungry late at night.  Other than that, there's no reason to go here.  Go to a real Thai place.  We had thai iced tea (of course) which was ok, and then i had some chicken noodle dish.  It was slightly greasy and fast food tasting, and i couldn't finish it.  Not bad, but definitely not good.  One friend had the spring rolls, which she liked.  Another had a dish that was supposed to be a chicken curryish thing but was really just a large bowl of orange sauce.  The sauce was ok, but it wasn't a meal.  Our other friend had a bowl of soup, which was again, just ok.  The restaurant itself had no ambiance, i felt like i was in a hotel - you even needed a card to go to the bathroom.  So, skip the chains, go to the real places.
author: Merredith L.

description: One of my favorite thai in SF.  Reasonable pricing and great taste.  I love the pad thai here a lot and one plate can fill you up.  Well this restaurant is pretty small so the seats are kind of squishy.
author: YELP U.

description: well... not sure how to rate this.  the food was pretty decent.  yummy.  until i noticed a hair.  not such a huge deal because hair always winds up in food.  but then i noticed another hair, and then a small clump of hair.  i almost gagged on my food.
author: cary s.

description: So... the food was good, and everything looked fine and fresh, but within a half hour of leaving, I was sick as a dog. I just talked to my friend who ate there with me (she had a completely different entre) and it turns out she was sick, too! Something bad there...
author: Sharon B.

description: My mother, daughter and I stumbled upon this bustling restaurant after a day of shopping and decided to check it out. It was very crowded which is usually a good sign the food is good. Well, as Thai goes, it was just "ok" and the biggest issue I have is that the portions were EXTREMELY small and NOT family style suitable for sharing as most Thai restaurants are. The meat was scarce and it was just mostly a plate piled high with white rice. For the price, I feel you should get a lot bigger portion and more meat. My mother lives in North Beach and says Tuk Tuk is FAR better and much bigger family style portions and a better value for your $$. Will not be returning to this place.
author: SD d.

description: Pretty good, and very fast.  The billion waitresses in the lavender uniforms make it look kind of like a factory.  Just don't look at the back open kitchen area, unless you enjoy seeing all kinds of raw meat and seafood mixing together on the counter and marinating in huge vats.
author: Emma H.

description: always a quick, cheap bite to eat. been to most of the locations and the staff is quick and friendly. the soups are amazing and the rice plates kick ass.i also recommend the pad kee mao. good stuff!
author: Bryan Y.

description: Meh,  kinda cheepo thai food.  Decent flavor but cheap ingredients.  The portions are huuuuuuuge. If you want a lot of mediocre food at a cheap price go for it.  If you are looking for something higher quality I would stear clear of this joint.
author: Chris M.

description: if you are in San Fracisco, YOU NEED TO BE HERE!! AMAZING FOOD, AMAIZING PRICE. we discover this place by accident as we where walking to a different thai place and let me tell you, what a great choice!
author: charlie g.

description: i am not a fan of king of thai however i've came here many times with my friends. it's located at dtown so obviously theres no parking unless you park your car in the garage or bus it here. my experience at this place is pretty packed during lunch or dinner. they have two floors, the  second floor has two tables? i believe. their tables, plates, folks, spoons, and knifes are a bit sticky. their pretty constant about coming to our tables to refill water so thats good. their food are okay.  their customer service isn't so bad either.
author: Valerie N.

description: They almost always make my pad kee mao too dry. Flavorless rice noodles... Go to the one on Clement or Sloat or any where but this one. This King of Thai makes me want to bus all way to Clement instead because I've had better experiences there.
author: Anita T.

description:
cliffnotes of a review:

- HORRIBLE service - the waiter did not give us any time to read over the menu, was irritated and gave me an evil stare when I asked for more time, gave us the wrong plate and snatched the plate away like it was my fault, and finally never checked in with us.

- BAD pad see ew - tasted like it has been sitting for a while, warm but not hot, noodles were stuck together, hardly any flavor, and found bits of plain white noodles on the side.

the only good thing about this place is that it's less than ten dollars a plate and its location right under macy*s.  it's decent for a quick meal, but if you're wanting to sit down, havea good meal, and chat with some friends, find somewhere else!!
author: S c.

description: Great food, great service, very reasonable prices. The pad thai is excellent...had it many times. But a cook was eating in the kitchen, picking her nose with her gloved finger, and still serving up food to customers. And the manager told her to stop but didn't get that it was a real problem. Gross. So I haven't been back since.
author: The M.

description: I agree with Kelly L., the pad thai here is a little more delicious than other spots I have been too..the coordinated dances of the spices and ingredients in my tongue were amazing....it actually made me say,"Mmmm".  I ordered a soup for my main dish because I was feeling a little on the sick side and my throught felt like the tin man in the wizard of OZ and was rusting up.  You could never go wrong with soup from the king of thai noodle...whatever you get...always delicious.  I think they sprinkle some crack or something in it because I have been addicted to them since I was first introduced to king of thai back in college years ago in my USF days.  I was full and happy after my filling of pad thai and soup...but I felt like I was missing something....I looked at my finger and there wasn't a bow on it, so I didn't forget anything....than it dawned on me.   DESSERT....even better....FRIED BANNANAS w/COCONUT ICE CREAM....can everybody scream with me:)  Hallelujah...I have crowned the king of thai noodle on O'Farrel the emperor of fried banannas and ice cream.  I won't do it justice by describing to you the bliss I experienced with this tasty and sweet piece of heaven....but, I walked out with the biggest smile on my face...I would have smoked a cigarette, but I don't smoke....AMAZING.
author: Te R.

description: great food, fast service and not too mention reasonable prices...
author: Kevin M.
